review: Apr\u00e8s une d\u00e9sastreuse aventure au Bois franc, quel plaisir de retourner au lac d\'Ailette..en plus les cottages ont \u00e9t\u00e9 r\u00e9nov\u00e9s avec go\u00fbt, Partis d\u00e9but ao\u00fbt sous la canicule, nous avons appr\u00e9ci\u00e9 les plaisirs de l\'aquamondo malgr\u00e9 l\u2019affluence,(peut \u00eatre faudrait-il que les personnes ne s\u00e9journant pas dans le parc n\'aient plus acc\u00e8s aux installations quand celui-ci est d\u00e9j\u00e0 complet - 1700 personnes dans la piscine c\'est vraiment beaucoup trop)Nous avons lou\u00e9 un cottage premium bord de lac . Nous avons aim\u00e9s nos soir\u00e9es tranquilles sur la terrasse; beaucoup moins la chaleur dans le cottage (ventilation \u00e0 pr\u00e9voir)  celui-ci \u00e9tait tr\u00e8s propre \u00e0 notre arriv\u00e9e et les quelques soucis rencontr\u00e9s (pas de pile dans la t\u00e9l\u00e9commande, s\u00e8che-linge cass\u00e9) ont \u00e9t\u00e9 tr\u00e8s vite r\u00e9gl\u00e9s par un personnel comp\u00e9tant  De quoi bien commencer notre s\u00e9jour. Un bel endroit o\u00f9 nous reviendrons certainement l\'\u00e9t\u00e9 prochain
title: tr\u00e8s bon week end
price_range: 115€ - 267€  (Selon les tarifs moyens d'une chambre standard)

review: Ambiance d\u00e9tendue , une vraie d\u00e9connexion.  Le logement est propre. L Aqua Mundo est super,il y fait tr\u00e8s bon.les enfants s \u00e9clatent. Si enfants en poussette je d\u00e9conseille car pas de r\u00e9els emplacements pour ranger la poussette. Les restos sont plut\u00f4t bons et abordables.Le personnel est aimable et avenant.
title: S\u00e9jour agr\u00e9able comme toujours ,une vraie d\u00e9connexion
price_range: 115€ - 267€  (Selon les tarifs moyens d'une chambre standard)

review: Premi\u00e8re fois que nous allions \u00e0 center Parcs Ailette! Premi\u00e8rement, une file d\u2019attente le jour d\u2019arriv\u00e9e qui est d\u2019une looooongueur monotone...Le personnel est toujours aimable. Que dire des prix pratiqu\u00e9s sur le site..Veillez \u00e0 prendre un PEL avec vous si vous voulez vous promener en petite voiturette de golf..Nous \u00e9tions situ\u00e9s \u00e0 1,5km des parkings et donc de la piscine..On a donc 3km dans les pieds si on veut aller barboter ;-) La propret\u00e9 rien \u00e0 direLe logement \u00e9tait bien. Nous avons \u00e9t\u00e9 contraints d appeler le service de soir\u00e9e/nuit car nos badges avaient \u00e9t\u00e9 d\u00e9magn\u00e9tis\u00e9s..Ensuite, canalisations qui \u00e9tait bouch\u00e9es \u00e0 notre arriv\u00e9e. Il aura fallu appeler 3 jours de suite pour voir quelqu\u2019un s\u2019en occuper en 5 secondes..Sans parler des t\u00e9l\u00e9s qui ne fonctionnaient plus en p\u00e9riode de coupe du monde..mais bon nous n\u2019\u00e9tions pas venus pour la teloche :-)Nous avons \u00e9t\u00e9 quelque peu d\u00e9\u00e7us de la distance entre le logement et les animations, mais aussi de ces quelques d\u00e9sagr\u00e9ments qui sont venus ternir notre s\u00e9jour..
title: 3,5 serait plus juste
price_range: 115€ - 267€  (Selon les tarifs moyens d'une chambre standard)

review: G\u00e9nial pour les enfants petits et grands ! Pleins d\'activit\u00e9s \u00e0 faire. Beaucoup sont payantes mais on peut aussi y trouver son compte sans ces activit\u00e9s payantes. Les cottages sont tr\u00e8s sympas. Le plan d\'eau est habit\u00e9 par toute une faune \u00e0 plumes et quelques ratons laveurs...
title: Endroit sympathique
price_range: 115€ - 267€  (Selon les tarifs moyens d'une chambre standard)

review: Nous avons fait une r\u00e9servation avec notre CE le 03 novembre 2018,pour un cottage de 6 personnes avec option emplacement,prix 1079 euros r\u00e9duction Comite d\'entreprise 215,80 soit: 926 euros \u00e0 payer.La publicit\u00e9 de center parc annonce : plus vous r\u00e9servez t\u00f4t moins vous payez, Et bien voila le r\u00e9sultat un mois plus tard, avec le site direct de center parc soit pour la m\u00eame p\u00e9riode la somme de 799 moins leur remise 240 plus emplacement 43 soit 657.90 Soit une diff\u00e9rence de 268 euros et encore moins si on r\u00e9serve aujourd\'hui.Une vraie arnaque, en principe passer par son comit\u00e9 d\'entreprise suppose de payer moins cher que sur le site, centre parc.Nous avons donc fait une r\u00e9clamation, en r\u00e9ponse nous avons eu : c est comme ca et on ne peut rien faire pour vous.Je peux vous dire qu\'avec 260 euros de plus, le cottage \u00e0 int\u00e9r\u00eat d\'\u00eatre irr\u00e9prochable, ce qui n\'\u00e9tait pas le cas lors de notre dernier s\u00e9jour \u00e0 center parc de Normandie en d\u00e9cembre 2018. M\u00e9nage laissant \u00e0 desirer, grille pain en panne, coupure d\'\u00e9lectricit\u00e9 \u00e0 r\u00e9p\u00e9tition.Nous serons donc intransigeant en f\u00e9vrier 2019.De plus votre service r\u00e9clamation qui doit r\u00e9pondre en 48h \u00e0 mis,15 jours \u00e0 r\u00e9pondre...... nous conseillons aux personnes de r\u00e9server de derni\u00e8re minute pour profiter de bons tarifs.Dommage car apr\u00e8s ce s\u00e9jour, vous aurez perdu un client.
title: R\u00e9servation f\u00e9vrier 2019
price_range: 115€ - 267€  (Selon les tarifs moyens d'une chambre standard)

review: This was the third European CP we\'ve visited, and it met our expectations.   We were in a refurbished basic cottage.  I\'m sure there would have been cobwebs had we looked hard enough, based on other reviews, but certainly we found the house to be hygienically clean with no issues that we noticed.On arrival we realised that a bathroom lock didn\'t work.  We went straight to reception (no queue) to report it, and within 20 minutes a man turned up at the door with a drill and fixed it.  Very impressed!We thought the pool was great, and we saw the changing and other areas being cleaned regularly.  Although health and safety is generally more lax abroad, the lifeguards were very good at stopping young children to check they were with adults etc.  As others have said, be aware that this is a very hilly site.  I hadn\'t appreciated the extent to which this would be an issue for us.  It meant that bike rides weren\'t really enjoyable, and it was a pain travelling back and forth to the shop etc., where usually we\'ve found that part of the charm of a CP holiday.My only real gripe was the number of cars on site every day of the holiday.  Each time we cycled to/from our cottage we had to give way to at least 5 cars, which to my mind defeats one of the main points of CP.  All we can think is that it was people going out for the day, and because of the hills they were collecting family members in the car to save them a walk to/from the car park. Unless disabled I personally don\'t think this is fair on fellow holidaymakers.Overall another great CP stay.
title: Great holiday, but too many cars on site
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I have to admit after reading so many negative reviews I had my reservations. Fortunately the moment we arrived those fears were alleviated. We were greeted by a very smiley member of staff that spoke perfect English who directed us to our house. We opted for the referbished VIP house and we weren\'t disappointed. Beautifully decorated, well equipped with exceptionally comfortable sofa and beds. Our interactions with other members of staff were good, everyone was friendly and there was always someone on reception that spoke English. We bought our dog and were a little worried about finding a local vets before returning home but we were given details or an English speaking vet to contact and it couldn\'t have gone smoother.The surrounding area was great, Laon is a beautiful city and there is a lot of WW1 sites to visit close by.In all we had a fantastic week and would definitely come back again. For the quality of accommodation we got is was fantastic value for money compared to the UK.
title: Supassed expectations
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: they have good amenities but the cottages are not clean .bring your towels they do not have it and when i order them i never got any towels.when i asked customer service to send somebody to clean , they said they will send somebody in the afternoon but they never did so i had to clean myself because i have two babies and floor and stairs were gull of spiderwebs and so everywhere so dusty. i felt like it has been months since somebody cleaned the cottage. could not even go to balcony even once, full of bird poop everywhere.
title: good amenities but the cottages are not clean
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Pool was fun but there was overcrowding at times, so a little unclean. Facilities were a bit run down especially sports hall and bikes. Accommodation was clean and comfy. Overall, it doesn\'t rate nearly as high as its English counterparts.
title: Not enamoured with Le Lac D\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Our third European Centre Parcs.  The location is very rural, lake nice and woodland pleasant.  Good base to explore surrounding towns and markets.A few things we did not like.  Site feels a little run down, in need of some investment.  We had two problems with the cottage, broken window and toilet.  Both fixed on the day, but should probably have been picked up by cleaning and routine maintenance.  There was an old swallows nest at the front, window covered in bird mess, should have been cleaned away.The wild cats on the site are a real nuisance.  Sat at the patio window waiting for food.  We couldn\u2019t open the doors as they tried to enter the cottage.  This was a real pain on a warm evening.  At least 6 scrawny cats milling around.The on site activities are basic and a bit tired.  The aqua dome feels its age.The real shock was the huge number of non residents who came into the park at the weekend, on day passes.  Lots of groups of teenagers and young people, rough on the slides and lazy river with little ones around.  The aqua dome felt uncomfortably busy at the weekend.  Mid week was in fairness better.Site was clean with regular litter picking evident.Forget the breakfast buffet, \u20ac41 for grey eggs, limited selection of poor quality food, and a dodgy tummy for a couple of days.We enjoyed the holiday, easy to get to from Calais, and a good base to explore.  But the     cumulative niggles made this a bit of a disappointment, hence the rating.
title: Family holiday - children 10 and 7
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Hi- we are on our way home following a week at Centre Parcs. Whilst we had a good family holiday, we were very disappointed with the resort. First issue is the cleanliness- it\u2019s really dirty. We booked two cottages with one a premium lakeside house. Whilst some of the furnishings were new, the kitchen was filthy with ingrained dirt. The house looked like it hadn\u2019t been properly cleaned in years. All cooking equipment was also very old and crappy- It put us off cooking inside. Outside we had a great view but it was also filthy. Thick cobwebs and dirt all over the verander and decking. Decking was also very dangerous as it was obviously not maintained and there were huge gaps where the chairs fell down resulting in numerous injuries over the week. Our children had a great time in he pool but it was so old and In terrible condition. Nothing like the parcs at Woburn and Elvden.The maintaince, health and safety and cleanliness were really poor at the resort. However the location was beautiful and in spite of all of it we made sure we had a good time and used many of the facilities on offer.
title: Very tired and dirty resort
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: the place is nice, looks good.BUT we arrived to a dirty cottage and after asking twice for another clean - it was still dirty...had to clean it myself and start my vacation with cleaning toilet and sinks and empty trash cans.talked to the reception twice - no one cared... looked at me surprised i\'m asking them to solve this issue, the phone do not work so i had to actually GO there each time.i did try to tell them we are not happy - they just did not care for it.unfortunately - only the week before the trip we read the TripAdvisor comments on the place - it was just t like we read - bad service bit nice atmosphere...next time ill make sure to read before i book!
title: Nice place, super disappointing service
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Journey from folkestone was easy it took approx 3 hours from calais with a toilet stop. Arrival and check was a lot quicker and easier than the UK. We were in 13 and 14 which was zone 0. I would definitely recomend the lower number cottages if you want to be walking distance to the centre.There is a microwave but No oven only a hob which Is ludicrous. We took a small bbq which we bought for \u00a310 from Amazon which was perfect.Accommodation was very clean with garden and decking area. Supermarket in Laon Carrefour is the best and biggest stocks everything. We arrived unloaded and then went to the supermarket no questions asked and was allowed back to our cottage to unload shopping we just showed out car ticket on arrival again. Hardly any shops, as a business consultant I really feel CP missed a few tricks and with careful consideration could of made a lot more money from us as a family. The lake was lovely but no shade at all and no umbrellas to hire or buyAqua park was good lots to do with outside space and sun loungersThe shops and restaurants are open and closed at really silly times and no coffee shop the UK have Starbucks??Maintenance team were fantastic and attended every issue immediately.I would recommend you take;BbqFly sprayDish clothsBin bagsFairy liquidFansDishwasher tabletsSauces, salt, pepper, tea, coffee, jamsToilet roll, towels, bath matAll in all a relaxing week although hard pushed to find extra things to do if you were staying For longer than a week.
title: Annual holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just had a fab family holiday plenty to do and really relaxing . Lovely WALKS in woodland surroundings.There was a sauna and whirlpool bath in our lovely accommodation. Plenty of things to do to suit all ages
title: Fantastic
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our third stay in a Center Parcs\' village (in different locations) so we were familiar with the concept and knew what to expect  - but La Lac d\'Ailette didn\'t meat the standards we were used to in other Center Parcs\' villages, and was a big disappointment:We stayed in a VIP cottage described (and accordingly priced) "renewed". well - at most it was repainted and surely didn\'t give any new, renewed or VIP sensation. like many others have described here, we spent the first hours of our holiday cleaning the cottage which was dirty. This is totally unacceptable and I really don\'t get it - for more than 2000 euro a weak they cannot get the cottages properly cleaned????The public areas were OK and the Aquamundo was nice. But - getting around in the village\'s roads was like a Russian Roulette: many cars, golf cars (sometimes driven by children!), bikes and pedestrians - all together on the same narrow, busy roads. That was really unpleasant and more seriously -  unsafe, and I don\'t get how the village\'s management allowed it. The staff wasn\'t very friendly. Some of them (like the lady introduced herself as the shift manager) were almost hostile and very unwilling to help.We will not come back to this village!
title: Not good
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed 24th Aug to 27th Aug. Very easy to get to from Calais like others have said 2:5 hours and 17 euros (tolls do take credit cards).When we arrived we were greeted well, they spoke fairly good English and we tried our best to talk in French. We have only two negatives about the holiday. Firstly we were told 384 cottage not 284 not a problem as key/fob had 284 but we was not told what zone so ended up looping around a few times as we were over in the furthest point. We was going to do VIP but opted for the premier lake and the extra money put towards Half board. The cottage we had was really nice and great view, kids loved it and very comfy beds..Breakfast served between 8 and 10:30am and for value very good. Friendly French guy with orange sided glasses so welcoming but obviously didn\'t speak English but just genuine nice, all staff were, even the omelette making woman eventually smiled as our French got better!Ate in the Italian twice and buffet once on reflection would of done other way around.Only activity was the indoor mini golf (second moan) 9 Euros each for 11 holes bit pricey but fun to do, just play several rounds.Swimming was great plenty slides.Some people have mentioned poor maintenance on site, personally we didn\'t see it and site was immaculate. The cottage could of been slightly cleaner and birds nesting Dam! third moan... The site is long so get bikes or the little golf buggy.
title: \'A surprise\'
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: So getting here was easy just 2.5 hours from Calais straight down one motorway at \u20ac17 toll. The site is signposted from Laon.We stayed for 11 nights in a 4 person VIP Lakeside villa which was wonderful. It was well presented and had everything we needed although note there is only a hob and a microwave so like us you may want to bring your own BBQ. We found booking activities was easy through either of the booking points, they all spoke good English. The kids enjoyed all the things we booked for them.We also used the bowling alley (\u20ac32 for 50 minutes) and the large soft play area (free).We hired bikes for 7 days of our stay which you do directly at the cycle centre (they spoke good English again), bikes were about \u20ac120 for 2 adults and 2 kids which seemed good value.Supermarket on site is small but adequate albeit very expensive. We drove the 20 minutes to the Carrefour at Laon to do a big shop.We ate out a few times at the buffet restaurant which had a reasonable selection however this was also expensive at \u20ac27 per adult.The real gem however is the swimming pool which was much better than any of the Center Parcs we have visited in the Uk.It is huge and has loads of slides including rapids and a lazy river. We found going late evening to be the quietest times. There are quite a lot of day visitors and so it can get really busy earlier in the day.The only real negative I would say is that the site is poorly maintained. There are lots of broken windows around the centre entrance and most of the play equipment at the parks was broken which was a real shame.Just to add, we did Disney for a day which is definitely within striking distance and took 1 3/4 hours from the site.As you would expect the majority of visitors are French, I would say only about 1 in 10 are English however English is spoken  at most places you need to speak to someone. Overall we had a brilliant holiday, would definitely recommend and can\u2019t wait to come back again.
title: Brilliant Holiday - Here\u2019s some tips
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a nice family weekend here. It is a very easy drive from Calais. We stopped off at a Carrefour on the way down to do a food shop which was just off the motorway and easy to find. This is a good idea as the restaurants and shop on site are generally a bit pricey (as in all Centre Parcs) Having said that, we went out to one restaurant, L\'Embarcad\u00e8re, and found the quality better than in UK Centre Parcs. The best thing about this parc was the Aqua area and the kids loved it. The activities were also good although it isn\'t very clear that you can\'t book all of them online before going and even if you do book online, you have to go to pick up the tickets before you can do the activities. The staff were generally helpful and spoke English although it does help to speak some French and not assume they will speak English as the majority of customers are French and to be fair you are in France! The main negative is that the site is generally not very well maintained and even the house we stayed in which was supposed to be renovated , didn\'t feel very new or clean. Having said that, I have just seen that the site is due to be closed for renovation so this may all  change. Another negative is that the health & safety is not ideal.My kids had to put their own clips on for the zip wire on the High Adventure Trail and there were no staff there to do it for them or check they had done it correctly. Luckily they are good climbers and my husband was with them but he had to help another English boy in front of him who was up their on his own and found it too hard. I would recommend an adult accompanying the child unless they are very good climbers. The lift was also out of action for several days so my dad (who is in a wheelchair) could not get around the main reception area easily) I would also recommend going out for  French meal outside the park. We went to a local restaurant called l\'Assiette du terroir which was only abut 5 minds drive away and we had a lovely simple French meal there. We had a nice time but not an amazing time. I wouldn\'t hurry back there although it should probably improve after renovations.
title: Fun weekend but not the best centre parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a fantastic 7 night stay at the start of August. We loved our VIP lakeside cottage with a great view over the lake which helped us all to relax and with plenty of space for the children to play inside. The pizza restaurant and creperie were great although a bit expensive, the patisserie was good and the supermarket useful although expensive too.The activities were really good, the kids loved them and they were at a reasonable cost, especially if you compare with the UK.The aqua mundo was fab and we spent several hours there, at least 2 hours a day! We found the staff to be friendly and helpful, being able to speak some French helped - but that\'s to be expected as you\'re in France!Overall, fantastic - we can\'t wait to come back again!
title: Fantastic stay for the whole family
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed in premium 4 bed house 401! Not a fault to be found as it had just been refurbished, it overlooked the lake and has a large veranda to enjoy ( safe for kids too)! It\u2019s almost 2 houses put together which was ideal as we travelled 4 adults and 3 kids. The place is very hilly and with small kids we ditched the bikes and hired the golf buggy which is just as much fun! The water park was the highlight and we stayed at least 3 hours a day! Lots of activities to choose from, the donkeys are a little wild but fun! All the normal overpriced restaurants and a supermarket, but we took the essentials with us and stopped off at local supermarket just before the Parc, we used the bakery on site daily!
title: Best Centre Parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: What a great place to stay! Lovely peaceful, great weather and excellent accomodation. We had a simple 4p comfort cottage. It was nicely renovated and had all comfort we needed.Was great: the space as such, lovely garden, and plenty of silence (we didn\u2019t even hear the neighbourgs).Could be better: kitchen equipment (one pan was not enough, dishwasher didn\u2019t wash that well, plates and glasses were greasy, ...) and the fact it is simply not foreseen for little babies (eg there was no linnen for the baby bed, place to change the baby was also missing so we changed het on the sofa, ...) Must say that there were a few minor issues but when we called they immediately took action. Eg a chair was broken, they immediately came by to replace it. The parc itself is really nice. Many hills though which is not always easy with a baby and a toddler. You must be equipped for it.  The lake is stunning, it\u2019s peaceful everywhere!The activities: we had a 1-year-old and a 3-year-old with us and the activities they could do were limited. I think bigger kids had much more to do.Were great: the swimming pool of course! Foreseen for all ages, nice infrastructure. The animal parc was nice too, although careful when entering with bread as all goats will attack you :-)Could be better: the playgrounds were really outdated. Broken bits and pieces made it even dangerous from time to time. No swing to be found anywhere in the parc... our daughter enjoyed herself though, which is the most important! The swimming pool also needs a thorough renovation. Mouldy parts, tiles that have broken off. All acceptable for me but needs action soon.I\u2019m looking forward to returning next year, curious what will be renewed. With some small changes I would give a higher score.
title: Great place, will definitely come back!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I am writing this on my last day sitting on a lounger on the balcony overlooking the lake and boatyard opposite. We are in a VIP lake view cottage number 416. Firstly I would point out that there is water in front of me! The level is low as there has been a heatwave but it has not detracted in any way from the beauty of the park.There are some inland property\u2019s that would be on river/ canal offshoots where there is no water but there\u2019s not much that can be done!The properties are not brand new or without problems however the issues that we had were dealt with swiftly, efficiently and with a smile, when you think about the use these places get and their turnaround times things get missed.. my advice is talk to or email the centre and they deal with it. I should point out that our party have very little French in our vocabulary but we found google translate worked miracles with maintenance issues and 90% of the staff that we spoke to were trying extremely hard with English so we muddled through quite comfortably.The staff generally were great, they are happy and extremely placating, 2 of us fell off our bikes at one time or another and the first time a restaurant patched us up whilst the second crash caused a flat tyre and a very nice member of staff passing picked us up with the bike and took us to get it changed. This staff member was housekeeping, did not speak English but was absolutely fantastic with the help she gave.We looked at a few restaurants, I wasn\u2019t impressed with the Italian one as we sat without even having a drink order taken for 20 minutes before walking out, we ended up in a nice place that was expensive but not to the point that you felt it extortionate.We did a few of the activities, a word of advice do not take a child on to the high ropes and zip wire one, it can become quite traumatic for everyone!I would suggest that a \u201cbail out\u201d would be a good idea for any that do not want to go for the final slide!I am glad to have tried Center Parcs this year as it is different to the usual med Villa / pool holiday we have and I was pleasantly surprised to find the fears created by the negative reviews for us at least were unfounded.There are a few niggles and there is room for improvement such as instructions on the use of the cooker and sauna but all in all a great experience enjoyed by all.
title: Don\u2019t believe the hype!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have just returned from a trip to this Centre Parcs with comments as follows;POSITIVES -Trip/Access - Very easy to access, just under 2.5 hours from Callais, 20 minutes from the main A26 motorway. Make sure you stop at the large Carrefour hypermarket at the South of Laon before you arrive, great for stocking up for your trip. Layout - Modern park laid out as a long and narrow plot with the majority of houses close to or over looking the lake. Accommodation - We stayed in a Premium Refurbished 4 person house, it was very pleasant and well stocked (exceeded expectations). It was a little unclean but fine.Staff - Despite some of the comments, we found the staff friendly and had a good enough grasp of English if needed.Activities - A good wide range of activities for our 6 and 3 year old, the slides in the Aqua Mundo don\'t really have age limits which means younger children can go on much better rides than the UK. Go Ape, Pony Rides, Quad Bikes, Trampolines, Mini Golf - all good but booked a week or two on line before arrival. Food - We ate in the Pizza/Pasta restaurant, Creperie and Grill restaurant. All the food was fine as you\'d expect for somewhere like this. On the expensive side of acceptable but not excessively expensive.  NEGATIVESDrinks - All drinks are excessively expensive in my view, 6.5 Euros for a entry level beer.Non Exclusive - It is clear that local French people are aloud to use the Aqua Mundo which, whilst I appreciate it is peak summer, felt dangerously over crowded at times and uncomfortable. I would expect for a resort like this only to be used for people staying there. Restaurant Variety - I appreciate it is aimed at kids but the variety of cuisine is limited and very beige. On site shop - Whilst well stocked the prices are crazy, 6 eggs - 4.5 Euros for example.
title: Works well - kids loved - easy travels - comfortable stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Aqua mundo was the highlight- whole family loved it- cottage was smaller than in pictures and no outdoor area that was safe as decking all broken with nails hanging out- great park though- shame it had no English entertainment at all so not a lot in evenings for the children a part from the indoor soft play
title: Centre parcs fun!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We spent 4 nights recently and had a good time. Overall the park is lovely and very kid friendly. We came with a 4 year old and 1 year old and our oldest loved everything, the pool especially. What I wish we would have known beforehand---1. We stayed in a two bedroom comfort cottage in zone 4, the walk to the center where everything was is about 20-25min, so we ended up renting bikes with baby seats for the week to get around. If you have your own you can bring them, but it seemed they had unlimited availability for all bike options including trailers, small bikes, etc. 2. Our cottage had a baby cot and high chair, but no changing table and no kid\'s plates or cups, etc. Luckily we had a few of our own as we had most meals in our cabin for the flexibility. 3. When we did eat out, we found that they had free food for littles under 3 years, and reduced price meals for kids age 4-10, so that was a nice perk if they can handle the wait (not very long, and the two restaurants we went into had little play corners). However, the free food is really baby food, so good for babies, but our 1.5year old only ate the compote. The crepe place offered him a free crepe though, so for those in the 1-3 age range, that was the best. (We ended up going back because of that). 4. If you want to have some meals in your cabin, definitely stock up at the Carrfour near Laon beforehand as the store on site is small and higher priced. The cabin will not have any seasonings, olive oil or anything, it\'s simply pans and dishes. We brought extra dishwasher pods as well since we had milk bottles and you\'re given exactly 3 pods for the week. 5. They deliver meals to your door! And delivery was free, at least for what we got. Wish we had discovered this the first day, but this was a huge bonus to be able to eat nice after the kids were in bed and they included equipment (like a wok!) and picked it up from outside your door in the morning. 6. If your kid wants to do the pony ride, as mine did, they have to have closed toed shoes. We did not, as it was the middle of summer, so missed that one...7. Go to the aqua mundo first thing in the morning at 10am if you can. It starts to get crowded by 11am, so we had a good while to enjoy before it got busy and we headed out for lunch. I would go again when the kids are a bit older and most of the activities were geared for the 5-10 age range. They had a good time though!
title: Overall great stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed in a Premium 4 bedroom cottage, loads of space. We stayed in no. 762, very clean and clearly recently refurbished.  Loads of activities to do, like any Center Parcs everything apart from swimming costs money. Swimming pool is good fun, loads of slides and lazy river, kids loved it, ours were from  ages 11 to 16. Bike hire is highly recommend to make the most of the holiday. Would highly recommend installing the app but it needs to be the European one so you have to change your iTunes region to France which is a bit complicated. All in all a very enjoyable stay, would definitely recommend.
title: Great stay!!! Good family fun!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Our family visited this parc last week. Premium lodge.Nice lodge, quite large, fairly clean, well equipped. Decking could do with some maintenance.Drive from UK was a piece of cake.Pool very good, absolutely packed but it seemed to cope ok with the large numbers.Mini golf, quads and farm all good.Too many cars and golf buggies on site. This really unnerved us and especially our young son when out walking and cycling. I am not sure why they allow so many cars and have so many buggies on site. This defeats the objective of the parc and is quite a negative.Middle of heat wave but fans in restaurants were all off, apparently broken!Boats not operating as low water level. Fair enough.Sports hall quite dated.Restaurant staff friendly but got everything wrong and seemed to not know what was happening most of the time. Took ages to get served, even when the numbers were low. I think the parc could be really good if they improved some areas. We like CP and think the parc should look at how the Belgian parcs are run. Very efficient and cheaper. We will probably go back to Belgium next year.
title: Things could be really good.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I was really torn when it came to booking this holiday. Half of the reviews are terrible and others seem to have had a good time. Luckily we found it ok. There were a few niggles, like the cost of eating out and the quality of the food when you did. Thankfully, it was possible to cook in our cottage. We hired bikes for our stay and found them to be really tired and some of them were unsafe (my son cut his leg on a bit of his bike that was broken- it was exchanged). Our cottage was fine; comfortable and clean (ish). I was a bit disappointed to see dog poo in the small garden at the back: As well as cleaning the inside the maintenance teams should check the back if they are to allow dogs. I thought the shop and restaurants pricey but I expected that of Center Parcs. Don\'t do what I did and forget your swimming gear as you\'ll be forking out way over the odds for a new costume (ouch!).My kids loved the water park and would have spent all of their time there which was great. We also enjoyed getting around by bike. Once people were checked in and cars were parked in the car park it felt much safer and easier to navigate. I was impressed with the response time from the maintenance team when I had a problem with our fridge - they turned up about 15 minutes after I emailed and they couldn\'t have been more helpful or kind. We made a couple of trips out to Reims which wasn\'t far away and there\'s an amazing supermarket (Carrefour) in Laon which is much cheaper than the on-site shop.
title: Enjoyable but not sure we would return
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a great holiday at Le Lac there were plenty of activities for the children to do. Some of these were quite reasonable and some did seem quite expensive. It was clean and well looked after in a beautiful surrounding. I would take some food with you as the supermarket is quite expensive.
title: Aug Fun
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Please don\u2019t be put off by some of the reviews. We loved our holiday here - so much that this is our third visit! It\u2019s so pretty here. Lots of little town houses surrounding a beautiful lake. It\u2019s lovely and relaxed and the people were friendly.And easy 2 1/2 hour straight route from Calais. The swimming pool is probably the best of any Centre Parc I\u2019ve visited (I\u2019ve visited 6!) and my 11, 8 and 3 year old would have spent all day every day there! The beach is a lovely bonus. We opted for half board all you can eat buffet and the food was good - if slightly expensive for what you pay for. For us it was the bonus of not having to worry about breakfast or tea for a week! The on-site supermarket was expensive but the supermarket in Laon was huge and worth a visit to stock up.We stayed in a comfort cottage. It was super clean and tidy with comfortable beds. The outside area was a bit scruffy but I think this is par for the course in centre parcs. We hired bikes for the week which is part of the Center Parcs experience and our kids love it! The (free) soft play was amazing and again our kids spent a lot of time there!Our 3 also enjoyed the free kids entertainment every night - even though it was in French!Our only criticism was that is was very very hot the week we visited and we desperately needed a fan in the cottage.Thank you Centre Parcs for a lovely holiday making lovely memories. And a special mention to Daniel in the bars and restaurants who was lovely and friendly and a credit to the company.
title: Brilliant holiday!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We booked a VIP house. When we arrived the check-in guy looked puzzled when I asked if I needed to check in. Anyway after repeating it and showing the booking we drove to the vip cottage at the lake. The surroundings are beautiful but there is a drought and the lake is covered with algae and spinach. The house is nicely decorated and the beds we\'re good. The park itself is far stretched but we didn\'t mind the walk. The restaurants we\'re okay, not special, the staff didn\'t speak any foreign languages. We loved the swimming pools and the beach at the lake. All and all we had a good stay, but it lacked any personal touch that is very important for us in a holiday.
title: We had a good time.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I\u2019m unsure as to weather 2 stars is me being generous but I felt that one star is rude... the swimming pool is great and so are the picturesque surroundings but that\u2019s just about where it ends.The lodge we had was 973, it was a premium 4 bed villa on a corner plot that on the first day we were very excited about, the outside area was ok but the inside was very dated and dirty... we complained about the fridge freezer never being cold and got some maintenance men come out but couldn\u2019t tell us what was wrong because they didn\u2019t speak a word of English, which seemed to be a constant in the park. The activities were overpriced and underwhelming, health and safety seemed to be non existent.There is no welcome pack or information in any languages other than French so don\u2019t expect to know anything that\u2019s going on. We ate in every restaurant and they were all fine, clean and tidy but basic and expensive, most of the staff are rude.Great for families with pets and I\u2019m sure if you don\u2019t mind being eaten alive by bugs all hours of the day and night you will have a great time.Love Center Parcs UK and will give the French ones a miss from now on :)
title: Family and friends holiday.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: First time we had used Center Parcs abroad.Very easy to get to from Calais via a toll road (approx \u20ac17) and a lovely setting. First thing we noticed is Park is big. Seemed more spread out than UK parks and we were a long way from center by foot. The numbering of the houses was also a bit quirky with odd little spurs off here and there. Accomodation very pretty spread over 2 floors and seemed a bit more cramped than UK. We went Premier. Standard basically good but outside decking was very wobbly and broken in some places. Oddly a hob but no oven and grill was supposed to be with microwave but we could not make it work. We tried to use whirlpool bath. OMG that was a mistake as it chucked out black mould and a small akin to Satan\'s armpit! Worse still it turned itself on in the middle of the night filling the house with a foul stench. When we were there it was hot, up to 37c this made doing much hard but the stuff we did was great but pool got v busy. Had a restaurant BBQ one night. Good Food and good value. Supermarket on site expensive but big Carrefour in Laon an easy drive. Security at the park seemed a little panicked while we were there. Sniffer dog and delays at gate twice after we went out for the day.Best way to get around park is by bike or golf buggy.Had a lovely break and would go back again. Shame it was just too hot but that is not Centre Parcs fault
title: Relaxing stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: My family have been to several of the UK Centreparcs and de kempervennen in Holland - all locations that we\'ve enjoyed.  Le Lac d\'Ailette looked a bit more special - Centre parcs accommodation does tend to look like toilet blocks from the outside, however we had high hopes from the brochure.  We paid for a VIP lakeside - we didn\'t choose a location as we didn\'t know the park layout so I was happy to leave to chance.  Our villa was almost at the farthest most point away from the main dome area.  All fine for us as we had our bikes but might not be great for walkers.  On the plus side it\'s all very flat to quite easy to cycle around for people of all abilities.  Good points:The accommodation was big - a lot bigger than any other park I\'ve stayed in and we always upgrade to VIP or equivalent.  The sauna was huge - just a shame we were there in the heat wave so couldn\'t really use it. Park is flat so easy to cycle.Aqua mondo is big - an excellent outside area, plenty to do.Beach area and marina area is lovely.Not so goodNo kettle or water bucket for the sauna - we did get delivered to us but only after several days of asking. Lakeside view wasn\'t - I know the lake was low due to the heathwave but there were bushes between the villa and the lake so it was pointless paying for this. Supermarket outrageously expensive - which I did expect - however the choice was very poor, the worst in any Center parc we\'ve stayed in. Not a good choice of activities, boats out of action, adult paintball equipment had been stolen!! Sports hall felt neglected.No wave machine in the pool (not sure if it was broken?)All in all a nice holiday - just a shame about a few of the points above - we would go again though.
title: Lovely holiday with good accommodation
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: So we went to the beach. Which was lovely, until you are told your not able to eat an ice cream on the beach??? Then we were told no playing with buckets and spades? Also no drinking from bottled water? And also no tshirts on the kids only swimming tops. Which is fine but they don\u2019t stock them at the local swim shop! So the beach was an odd experience!! The pool: metal steps on the kids slides!! So next thing we know a trip to hospital and three stitches later! On a plus note we had to drive our selfs so at least we had air conditioning on the way there. The shop is a wonderful experience and you can stand for 20mins plus to buy anything! Hot tub: again an odd experience as it\u2019s actually colder than the pool?! No one under ten or 1.50m high? Or at least that\u2019s what we think as it seems to change by the lifeguard and what day of the week it is? Also tiles are coming up all over the floor so watch your step! Having said all that it\u2019s been nice and could be an amazing place if they got some consistency! The only place which is air conditioned is the staff areas! That really sums this place up!
title: What you can\u2019t do! Please read as it will make you laugh.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a great time here, normally French centre Parcs are much higher priced than the Belgium or Dutch ones, but this was about the same. Good points, Nice refurbished houses, lots to do and in a nice part of France with lots of history and only a short drive to Champagne. Bad points, some times the pool got busy and there was no where to sit, the bikes are expensive to rent and not serviced to a good standard. House 180 had no garden to speak of.
title: Nice relaxing stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This our fourth time at Lac d\'Ailette. The setting is beautiful with an opportunity to visit Laon, a few medieval and WW1 sites. The park itself has fewer activities for older children than other centreparcs (e.g no climbing, waterskiing etc). The cottages themselves are comfortable and have been recently renovated. However, overall standard of maintenance is not high. The cottage was missing some equipment, including the chopping board.Aquamundo is as good here as it gets, though it can become rather busy on certain days (probably because of additional day visitors). I can\'t comment on restaurants much as we only ate out twice (creperie and pizza/pasta restaurants, which were completely adequate if a little expensive). Wifi is expensive and slow (when I am paying twice the price of my monthly fibre connecton for one week access, I expect to be able to stream, which was not the case here). This time I decided to cut my losses and took with me from the UK 12GB Three data simcard and portable wifi router, which was cheaper and faster).
title: Excellent facility with a few reservations
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Beware! If you book a Premium Lakeview cottage do NOT expect to be able to see the lake!! It\'s just a name and does NOT include a lakeview! If you want to see the lake you\'ll need to take a chainsaw to cut down the forest between your cottage and the lake
title: Take a chainsaw!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We went with the family, 3 kids. Really perfect place to relax, nice cottages and a big waterpark. Dinner delivery at the door is a nice extra, and the fresh bread they have in the morning is super. Only outside the park,  not really much to do for kids at a short distance drive
title: Great park
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our first trip to a European CP having been to the UK ones about 8 times, Woburn, Elveden but mainly Sherwood. The location was really good. We had a lakeside cottage with a very nice view. The style of the accommodation is much more attractive than the UK ones we\'ve been to.It was significantly cheaper than the equivalent time at UK sites, and actually cheaper including Eurotunnel, petrol and a night near Calais on the way. Drive there was really good, but got timing wrong on the way back and had nightmare round Dartford and M25...Most staff had good English. All signage in French and English.Pool and slides really good. The sportshall was a bit like a big tent, nothing like the quality of the UK ones. Nice size of beach. Lots of playgrounds.The ParcMarket has a decent selection but as expected v expensive (like in UK), so it\'s worth a drive to Laon to the Carrefour.Overall really enjoyed it and well worth the drive from UK.
title: Great Location
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I\'ve just listed some of the problems we had.  If you want activities and aren\'t bothered about the standard of the accommodation or produce on offer, then the pool is great, however if you are bothered about these things; here are some of the problems we had - Smell from the toiletOvergrown terraceBroken outside tableOutside furniture falling to piecesDecking not child friendly - we got many splinters from thisOutside table dirty and had been badly burntBedroom shower blockedHairdryer didn\u2019t workInsufficient kitchen utensils i.e no chopping board, wooden spoons, spatula, cheese graiter etcAll knives bluntNO AIR CONDITIONINGAll terrace doors had to be propped open with chairs - again not child friendlyNo housekeeping or laundry for a whole week!No spare bedsheetsCobwebs everywhere including all over the cotFly\'s and cobwebs all over the front doorNo internet for the first 3 daysIt took 3 days for our complaints to dealt with after queueing up to complain 3 times.
title: Avoid
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Booked a premium cottage in order to make sure my kids also have a space to play in-door when needed. However, coming into the cottage there was no downstairs stairway security, no electricity security and all the floors where dirty including the balcony with bird a lot of bird feces. The was no working vacuum cleaner, no mop and when i tried to call the front desk, no-one answered after 5 times calling. Walked to the front-desk where they helped me in with with providing the requested cleaning supplies after 24hrs, so i cleaned it myself. To me there\'s a very low services level and therefore a lack of hospitality when you\'re inviting people with children! All other facilities seem to be in good shape, so perhaps we where unlucky.....
title: Not really a family place
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a 2 bed premium cottage, no 804 overlooking a small lake. It was very well kept and had everything we needed. The balcony and outside seating area was lovely. It was a further walk to the centre than I have had at other Center Parcs. The beach area (the beach bar and any seating on  beach) was closed which seemed odd as the weather was so good. We had just driven from one of the Sun Parks in Belgium and it was horrendous so this felt a million times better. The pizzeria surprised us and we enjoyed our meal there. The creperie less so, and staff did seem a bit reluctant to serve us (the only Brits and I can get by with my GCSE French). The only paid activity we did was mini golf which was good but slightly unkempt and overgrown. The rotisserie chicken we ordered from the patisserie was very good. The park as a whole had a nice feel about it and we enjoyed the swimming pool even as a couple, it didn\'t feel like a kids club. There was at least one large conference when we were there which seems to be a common occurrence and not one I have come across at other Center Parcs, but it didn\'t cause us any inconvenience.
title: Lovely accommodation!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: How are you I was visit restNice rest in the Europe Clean villa 2 bedroom And2 bathroom 1 living room Resort has many facilities including swimming pools, center reception , supermarket, many restaurants and children facilitate
title: Rest top in france
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After reading previous reviews we were a bit concerned as to what we would find but needn\u2019t have worried - we had a brilliant week. Our boys aged 12 and 16 hired bikes for the week, did paintball, archery, Segway and high adventure. Instructions mostly given in French which was a bit confusing at times & I was a little concerned on the high adventure regarding the risk element but as they went around it was fine. Cottage no. 9 - close to centre, very roomy and clean. A decking board did collapse however as it was stepped on which could\u2019ve been dangerous but it was fixed within a short time as was a faulty shower head. Kitchen ok but no chopping board. Main shopping at Carrefour in Laon - not far at all and an English speaking tour of the Caverne de dragon on the Chemin des Dames -excellent. (The English tour is everyday at noon except Tuesdays but I would email them before u go in case this changes). We took a cheap bbq with us which did the trick for the week as they don\u2019t supply this. Also the massage and facial package at the spa was great as was the pool and beach area. Overall a great success - preferred it to Het Meerdal in Holland and we will return.
title: Excellent!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After reading reviews of Le Lac d\u2019Ailette Center Parcs, I have to confess, my family (2 boys aged 13 and 11) were nervous about going. We have been to other Center Parcs is France as well as the UK. We went in May half term. French children are at school so not too busy for the week.ArrivalWe arrived well before check in due to the ferry timings from the UK. This didn\u2019t cause any problems, staff friendly, provided our pack and keys, which allowed us to park up and use the pool (aqua mundo). We knew we couldn\u2019t go to lodge before 3pm.Pre booked activities Once parked up and before going to the pool, we collected our tickets for the pre booked activities and booked / paid for the others that couldn\u2019t be pre booked online. We did not have to queue like other reviews mention. I think it could however be made clearer that despite booking online, you are still required to collect tickets for activities.Aqua MundoThis is the best pool we have been to at a Center Parcs. Large indoor and outdoor areas, clean and well maintained. More slides than the other Parcs we have stayed at.The lodgeWe opted for a vip two bedroom which was on the lake and island, newly decorated. This came with sauna and whirlpool bath. The building was clean, modern. Only one thing I would say that the bedroom wall mounted lamp shade was hanging off and could not be easily fixed. The outside decking looked onto lake with table, chairs and two loungers. We did get a few mosquito bites over our week but not overrun by them. The park is well spaced out and by foot from our location would take 15 to 20 minutes to get to the main complex. We enjoyed the exercise. The only other thing I would mention about the lodges is lack of bike parking at the front. We had to rest our bike on each other against a log fence. The supermarket I have read reviews indicating limited stock. I would disagree. We found the shop had a really good selection of fresh and frozen foods etc. Yes the prices are at a premium which you come to live with. Doesn\u2019t help with the strength of the euro against sterling.The on-site restaurantsAt best, they were average with a low level of service due to limited staff. The staff however were all friendly. My views on the restaurants apply to all Center Parcs we have stayed at. You do have the option to collect your car and take a short drive to a local restaurant or use the supermarket just down the road.SpaMy wife and I used the spa. This consisted of a sauna, steam room and hot tub. Suggest save your money and not bother, especially if you have vip lodge like we did. Compared to Nottingham Center Parcs, this spa is a poor. CyclingWe took our own bikes. Onsite people can hire golf buggies which are generally not a problem until you get close to the main complex. Minor hills onsite and being well spread out is great for biking. Also, roads offsite of quite with plenty of cycle tracks as you leave the Center Parcs site. Summary We really enjoyed our week stay. Would go back. Food onsite is expensive. Accommodation is great. We had great weather which helped. Plenty of parking onsite. The site has plenty to do for all children including a electronic football shootout wall, skate park and dj mixing station which are included in the price of the stay. You also get credits to use against certain other activities when booking your holiday. We used ours on bowling. Great fun but a little difficult adding names to computer. Staff are always happy to help out.
title: Great experience
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have been twice now and have had a great time on both occasions.It\u2019s easy to get to from the UK in just under two hours from the tunnel exit. We stayed in a renewed premium comfort cottage which the first time we had a view of the Lake second time not such a great view but we were not that worried as we don\u2019t spend much time in our cottage.The activities are good with all the usual  mini golf, zip wire, tree top walk etc but still fairly expensive. Although you can buy a family ticket for 3 activities which makes it a bit more reasonable. It\u2019s worth noting as the French schools are back when we have our school May half term the Park is quiet but it also seems to be a bit short on staff meaning sometimes you have to wait longer to be served food and drinks or for your activities to start. However this did not spoil our trips and was not too bad. The best thing about it being quiet is the swimming pool never feels busy and we didn\u2019t have to que to go on any of the slides. All of the slides are brilliant and my boys aged 10 and 6 went in all of them. The rapids was really the only one my 6 yr old needed a bit of help. The place is set in a lovely part of France around a lake with a man made beech. We have been lucky the last two yrs and the weather in the May half term has been beautiful. The medieval village of Laon near by is worth a visit too.Overall for what you pay here versus the UK we will only now go to Center Parcs in Europe much better value for money and no where near as busy.
title: A much better value for money offering than the UK options
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The booking process was riddled with problems - I had to phone countless times to sort out inaccuracies. Booking activities onsite took hours and activities were cancelled with no warning and no alternatives offered, much to our children\'s disappointment. However, when they did take place, activities were good fun for the children, the range was good, cottages were clean and bright, and the location lovely.
title: A good holiday if you can survive the booking ordeal
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Our family ranged from age 8 to 72. Always something to do. Everyone was catered for.  Everything you need under one roof . Fabulous bakery , excellent supermarket and lots of great choice for places to eat .
title: Fabulous holiday.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Especially in May half term is nice and quiet. Has all the usual Centre Parcs water facilities with an above average number of slides. Is a great base to see the sites along the Chemin des Dames (make sure you see the viewing platform) and also Laon. There are also numerous cycle rides from the site. Restaurant selection is limited, but a trip to Laon for the supermarket (also some nice looking restaurants near the Cathedral) sorts that. The pizzeria on site is OK, but nothing special.
title: Easy to get to from UK and a good base to see the surrounding area
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The VIP cottage was not as VIP as expected. Not really clean, closet door hanging loose and vegetation around the cottage could have used some trimming.The food was REALLY disappointing. To be honest, I think we has the worst experience here in a really long time regarding quality of food. For example, our 2 year old son didn\'t eat his FRIES..... And he LOVES fries.
title: Didn\'t met expectations
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Have been previously during the Whitsun half term week as it a great site and great location.  This year however unlike previously we feel that the site seemed unprepared for a large influx of visitors from the UK.  We had bought meal vouchers for each night there and found that due to a business conference taking place that there were only two food outlets / restaurants open for the first two nights and one of those was unable to accommodate us when we arrived at 19.30 as they were too busy; we were informed we could not wait and therefore had dinner at the only other food outlet, the Creperie.  Had we known this was the case for the first two nights we would have shopped at the nearest Carrefour and saved the money.  The reason why restaurants were closed is that they were being using by corporate conference guests.Raised this with their customer service centre and received a reply \u201cAs stated in our general conditions, Center Parcs maintains the right to change the setup and opening hours of facilities or central facilities in the villages. In exceptional circumstances, we reserve the right to temporarily close the village or rent it out entirely to a third party. This does not entitle you to a refund of any other expenses incurred.\u201d  Since when does a conference booking constitute exceptional circumstances!There generally seemed a shortage of staff around compared to previous years, queuing at the front desk took over 90 minutes.  Activities on the lakes were reduced again because staff were working on the conference events and not available.  Being by a lake will mean you are likely to find mosquitoes in your accommodation, also lots of wild cats.  We had a cat that had just given birth to three kittens underneath our patio.  We bought cat food for the young mother, though perhaps they might want to do something about the rampant expansion of domesticated cats on site.   Very unsure whether we would return.
title: 5th return visit - not sure if we will go again
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Six of us stayed in a lakeside cottage, which allegedly had been refurbished recently. I think they meant redecorated rather than refurbished. Upstairs there was a double and twin bedroom overlooking the lake; a twin room and bathroom at the back. Bedrooms were adequate size. Downstairs was a shower room and separate toilet. A reasonable size living/dining room with windows and French-style doors that overlooked the lake gave us superb views, as did the veranda, which was a good size and stretched to the edge of the water. The kitchen was tiny - only room for one person at a time; the sink leaked and water dripped through to the cupboard below and across the floor. Skirting boards in the kitchen looked like they had suffered damp and certainly weren\'t changed recently. There was very little space to prepare meals for 6 and we had to remove some of the kitchen equipment like the toaster. There was a ceramic hob, which worked well, and a microwave (that we didn\'t use) - no oven which limited what meals we could cook. Our main problem with the cottage was that it needed a good clean - it was adequate, but insects everywhere (probably because of the lake) and cobwebs around. We paid for a towel package as these are not provided...this was expensive and we could have bought a cheap pack of towels and thrown them away. No teas/coffees were provided either. I\'ve given a positive review mainly due to the stunning views over the lake. While we were there, it was decided to shut the sports hall for 3 days without any warning - we were not pleased! The pools were warm and reasonably clean...there\'s an infinity outdoor pool, jaccuzzis, slides, rapids (that weren\'t), and a lazy river. Plenty of places to sit and relax around the pool. The food shop was not very big and overpriced as all Center Parcs. In the patisserie we were overcharged - beware! Overall, it had its good points, but I wouldn\'t go back.
title: Wouldn\'t go back
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed from Friday evening to the following Friday - this is now our favourite European Centre Parcs! Really easy to get to, great facilities, beautiful scenery and plenty to do at all times. We shopped at the big supermarket in Laon rather than the site shop. Apart from shopping we stayed on site for the full week - there was plenty to do and the weather was great. We will be heading back there!Positive - Easy to drive to, beautiful lake scenery, renewed cottages, plenty of activites on offer, everything you need on site, great pools, beachNegative - Upstairs in cottages can be very hot, LOTS of mosquitos (go prepared), barriers can be difficult to get through with cars (although this does mean that the park really is car free)
title: Great half-term break with the kids
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Good family break, location and pool were excellent but if you want to do extra sport activities you could be disappointed due to lack of staff and activities which were only running at weekends not midweek! We had lakeside cottage and it was great to watch the wildlife.
title: Great location- sport activities on offer was poor
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just came back from a week here during half-term. So much to say, so I\'ve narrowed it down to a few points to make the review more bearable!Pros:-Attractive, well-maintained site with lots of trees and green spaces.-Great pool with rapids, lots of water slides, wave pool, etc. (although the chemicals in the water were very strong and wrecked our swimming costumes).-Beach was much nicer than I expected, with soft sand and clear water in the lake.Cons:-We got a lot of flea bites when we were in our villa. I presume these came from the stray cats that are all over the site, and who like to sit on the patio furniture. Between the fleas and the mosquitoes, we pretty much got eaten alive.-The level of supervision with some of the children\'s activities left a lot to be desired. We were particularly concerned about our children being left to fasten themselves to the zip wires without a member of staff checking that they were attached securely.-As with all Centerparcs villages, the on-site food shop is an absolute rip-off. There\'s a large Carrefour supermaket in Laon, which is 15 minutes by car and well sign-posted. Perfect if you\'ve got a big family to feed.Although we enjoyed our week here, we all agree that it didn\'t feel quite like a Centerparcs. Unlike the villages we\'ve been to in Belgium and Holland, this one doesn\'t have a Market Dome with flamingos and stepping stones in a stream, and there is no Grand Cafe where you can sit and have a quiet drink. It\'s still a lovely place for a holiday, but next year we\'ll be going back to De Vossemeren.
title: Good holiday at a great price
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Take bikes, it\u2019s lovely to cycle around the parc, although it is fairly hilly. You can hire bikes there (my husband did but it was poor quality). My boys enjoyed high ropes but book in advance as only do them a couple of days a week.Book activities in advance as they are very limited. We booked most of ours which worked well. When we tried to do crazy golf on the hoof we had to wait 90 minutes in the queue. No bbqs - we took disposable ones but if possible take a couple of bricks as nowhere to rest them on. There is no oven.... think they\u2019d like you to use the restaurants on site.The majority of the staff were miserable. The waitresse/waiters, people on reception, ladies in bakery, there were a couple of exceptions (lovely man on high ropes/free fall jump and waiter in buffet restaurant but some staff clearly didn\u2019t want to be there.I speak French and many of staff don\u2019t speak English. On high ropes I asked staff to explain to my boys the health and safety talk in English.... they weren\u2019t exactly forthcoming!We had a basic accommodation (162) - it was ok but smelt damp and limited garden space. Beds very small. We headed out to Laon one eve (beautiful cathedral).Mosquitos are bad. Take plenty of precautions. Our boys got ticks on them too (probably from playing in the woods) so once again be prepared.My boys loved the skatepark, football board and football pitch, crazy golf and games/arcades bar (tokens cost one euro 50) where you can play pool, table football, air hockey etc. Restaurants on site are distinctively average but cater well for young families. Pool complex is great, my boys loved it - so many slides (probably ten) and they loved rapids. Not really an opportunity for parents to sunbathe outside though whilst watching kids swim. Most of it is indoors. Caters well for large numbers.Friday to Sunday was good, Monday site was empty then by Monday eve it was heaving.... until we left on Thursday mirning.
title: May half term break with two 8 year old boys
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Currently staying at Center Paris at Le Lac d\u2019Ailette for half term week, Monday to Friday.Thought we\u2019d give the French Center Parcs a go having stayed at a few in the UK, albeit several years ago.First impressions are the site is set in a lovely location. Access was fairly easy and quick and our accommodation is adequate and fairly spacious.What really lets this place down is the lack of activities that are open / available, and most of the restaurants are closed.Having tried to book up activities part way through the week, the choice was limited. Had the choice of tennis and a pedalo. Nothing else available. Really wanted to take a powered boat out, but not available. Walking around the site, most things are closed.Even the sports hall appears out of action. It seems they have a business conference booked in for the week and the area normally allocated to badminton, table tennis and karting, is being used for \u2018team building\u2019 exercises by those on the conference.Not very impressed.
title: Limited activities
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Overall a good holiday, I wouldn\u2019t worry too much about the bad reviews.The good;- spacious accommodation and in good condition, stayed in 153- activities are good- good connection with the outdoorsThe bad;- golf buggies and bikes everywhere, a health hazard- the app for booking activities doesn\u2019t work in the Uk, be ready to queue to book activities Tips;- be ready to walk around a bit- no cars near the rooms, bike and golf buggy hire is very expensive so maybe take bikes, be ready to walk or take a few gold bars- electrical bbq from intermarche in Laon served is very well- do your good shop on the way in to the park- Laon cathedral is nice
title: Not a bad holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Booked this last minute after failing to find something suitable in the UK. Had read mixed reviews but went with an open mind. The journey from Dover was easy, just 2.5 hour drive from calais on straight road. The site itself was really nice with cottages set around lakes. We had a premium cottage apparently renovated but parts of it could still do with some repairs, blocked sink, dodgy dishwasher and underfloor heating which was on constantly. Overall though accommodation was fine, spacious with comfortable beds. My top tips for anyone visiting would be to be organised, book your activities before you arrive and bring food with you. We stayed Monday to Friday and there seemed to be fewer activities than at the weekends and they all got booked up very quickly. The restaurants were expensive and seemed to have very odd opening times. On the positive side the pool was fantastic, clean and with plenty of slides etc. The lifeguards here were also very good. Taking all the pros and cons into account we did have a really great week and I would happily go back and I do recommend it. In a nutshell, it\'s not as slick as the UK centre parcs but it\'s also not as expensive which makes it well worth a visit.
title: Great half term
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Our stay was ok until we found out, on site,  that the booking done on the phone by Center Parcs call center didn\'t book as many breakfast as the number of days we were staying (2 nights but 1 breakfast). And once on site, impossible to change it. You have to pay full price or nothing. No excuse, no customer consideration, no commercial gesture at all for the mistake they made. Really too bad. Not client focus at all.Food on site at the restaurants is ok but if you are looking for organic or balanced eating, you won\'t find it anywhere. Desserts for kids are all sponsored by sugar friendly companies with registered trademarks written on the menu (coulis fraise Tagada(R), sauce Carambar(R), coulis de Carambar(R), etc.). Too bad.
title: Not as customer centric as advertised
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Dirty cottage, hardly any activities running in busy Easter holiday, queues for everything even just to speak to reception about any kind of problem. Additional charges for virtually everything, everything expensive, not enough staff. Just a whole lot of work really. Not my cup of tea.We liked the beach and Aqua Mundo, and the natural location was lovely.
title: Not for me
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I have seen better centerparcs ,the first time I really got disappointed. The service was really poor and we used a normal bed for our baby which was really uncomfortable.The location of the cottage was really unsatisfactory,the quality of the bicycle was poor .Need to improve this Parc because the location is great and the stuff need to smile and say hi to guests
title: Minimum services
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a premium cottage but I could not really tell what was premium about it. The countertop next to the sink was broken, the dishwasher was placed in a way that it stuck out and the dashboard underneath the dishwasher fell off when we first opened the dishwasher. Furthermore the terrace had a few broken boards and the houses looked run down from the outside as well. The beds in the children\'s room were very narrow (I guess no more than 70 cm wide) and one night one of our children actually fell out of his bed. Our bed started creaking badly after the first night and we only had one large comforter. Two would have been nicer.When we arrived (after 10 p.m.) the door of our cottage was open which got our kids very scared as they thought that someone would maybe hide somewhere in the house. We got someone from the reception who checked the whole house but our younger son still did not feel safe in the house for the rest of the week. The door sometimes did not open and one had to swipe the card 20 times before it did.The park is very large. Our cottage was 1,5 km away from the swimming pool. The parking lot was extremely full on some days so that we had to park about 2 km away from the house.The Aqua Mundo is very nice with lots of slides but it is missing a pool in which one can really swim.Quite some activities are offered at the park but they are very pricey so that hardly did anything in the end. The day that we wanted to rent a boat it was not possible due to a rowing regatta on the lake.Center Parcs is very expensive and I would not have booked this house if it had not been on offer. In hindsight I think that even with a 30% discount it was too expensive for what we got.
title: Premium? Not really
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: At first holiday was good however you soon notice the restaurants are barely open the takeaway service you have to walk to the main building (30 mins) then they will deliver you can\u2019t pay on delivery, it was very late after paying, they do not allow you to drive in to drop things off the security is very rude I believe they do this to try and force you to hire a buggy at an extortionate price , I don\u2019t know why they worry about cars when the cyclists drive like animals, all staff do not speak English  which ok we are in France but this is a resort crawling with English people, why daughter was hit by a cyclist I think they should do some bike lanes etc,Not a good holiday bad choice
title: Center Parcs Le Lac d\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Standard of accommodation was better than other centre parcs. Enjoyed our stay but disappointed with the lack of activities on offer - those that were available were already fully booked when we arrived and others were not even running during our 4 day break. There was a lack of hand washing facilities at the farm and the nearest toilets were locked. However in a lovely area of France and it was nice to venture into the nearest towns.
title: Easter at center parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Lovely venue but the absolute bare minimum of staff so don\u2019t expect any level of service at all. Queue for tickets only to find out there is a window of 1-2 hours for the event over 3 days. Most of the activities are shut for 80% of the time. The swimming facilities are great though
title: Lack of staff
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed here Tuesday to Friday, just after the Easter weekend, the usual Monday to Friday wasn\u2019t available at time of booking, switching the weekend stay to 4 nights.Having had a successful CP break in Elvenden Forrest the previous Easter, we were intrigued to try a French resort. The drive was by easy from Calais (2.5 hrs) and the kids loved the Euro Tunnel.The village was nice, but felt quite quiet, roads were used by cycles and golf buggies here.
