We booked a renovated premium cottage for 2x adults and 2x kids. While it had clearly had a lick of paint, there were certainly some original features like the kitchen cupboards. The kitchen was well equipped, but only had a microwave rather than an oven, the patio on waterfront was large, but sadly not used as much as we planned due to the weather. The beds had foam mattresses, so more suited to those that sleep on their backs.If you only require the subtropical paradise swimming facilities and a self catering lodge in a Forrest, it is totally comparable with the uk and at a good price. There is a beach on the lake, a (tired) playground, a huge soft play with an arcade, a French kids show and mini disco and a very small farm (all for free/included).Extras however really lacked in comparison - it was like they were running an off peak timetable. During our time there, ALL the activities we would have booked, occurred on Thursday PM. My husband had cleverly got round the issue with the French app, by entering a French address, and we had assumed that they only released a number of activities in advance (to book), and there would be more once we got there. There wasn\u2019t! So we managed a electric boat ride Wednesday and seperated on Thursday, my son and husband attending the Buggy Tour, while I took my daughter for a pony ride. Missing out on go ape equivalent and quad bikes. The buggy tour was great and good fun. The pony ride however was shambolic. The poor things paddock was completely waterlogged, a couple of horses were sick so there were too many children booked, the rest were reasonably reluctant to go for a walk. The parents had to lead the horses by the head reins, without a lead, which given the height of the ponies (small) was quite difficult and the walk was only up the road and then back again, nothing in the Forrest. The horses were desperate to stop and graze on the grass they passed, resulting in one child falling off!Other activities that were available were mini golf (indoor and outdoor) and bowling, which were as expected and available all the time.The aqua Munro (subtropical paradise), was fabulous and met all our expectations, we spent a lot of time in there. A Splash park with several slides, jets and a huge bucket tipping every 5 minutes. Waves in the main pool every half an hour, I believe, a lazy river and rapids outdoor, and 7 further slides. The temperature is good, as was the water and there is a cafe on site too.The supermarket was well stocked, we ate in the Italian a couple of nights which delivered on our pizza and pasta orders, and we tried the grill. It was dissapointing there wasn\u2019t a French option.All in all we had a great time, we won\u2019t be back because we like to continue to try new places, but we would not be deterred from trying another CP abroad.
title: Easter midweek stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our first Center Parcs visit and we did have a lovely time. Would definitely recommend this place to other families. ProsLocation is so easy to get to from Calais! Only 2.5 hours. Beautiful calm setting by a lovely lake. When sun is shining it\u2019s magnificent! Loads of wildlife/ fresh air. Great for cycling. We had a renovated lake side VIP cottage which was very nice. But we were missing a kettle and cheese grater ! Near medieval town of Laon which is very pretty but a little quiet in April. Staff are polite and friendly but not that many people around to help if you need it. ( except in Aqua Mundo). There is a what\u2019s app number you can message if you have a non urgent query. Great Aqua Mundo ! Nice and warm and Loads to do but did get a little busy at times... Nice spa. I had a facial which was very pleasant. Restaurants were what you\u2019d expect but a little limited on choice and more for mass catering rather than true French cuisine. We ate in the pizza/ pasta and the grill only. There is a free under 4 menu which was perfect for our little boy. I wanted a local cuisine restaurant nearby that we could visit. Perhaps there would have been some better choice in Laon but they didn\u2019t seem to open until 7 pm and it was a bit too late for the children.  If we went again we\u2019d consider bringing a little BBQ. Cons Queue for reception can be annoying to book activities... because UK phones don\u2019t connect to their app. Lack of extra activities ( aside from Aqua Mundo). we booked the \u2018 go ape\u2019 type climbing for our 5 year old and a 3 year old. I also booked a ticket for my husband. It was over 30\u20ac in total and in the end only my 5 year old did it because it was too high for the 3 year old. I felt this was not explained very well when I booked it so I queried this back at Reception and they offered us a voucher to use instead which we thought was a good gesture. Kids Play parks are looking a little dated now but kids didn\u2019t mind too much. Farm was a little small smelly and no hand washing facilities. Put shoes on Before going out on decking at the cottage as ours gave our kids loads of splinters. Had to remind staff on the happy hour prices in the bowling bar. Drinks were pretty expensive in general. Especially if you like a beer or 2 and a couple of soft drinks for the kids. I read on the website that this CP will be closed from sept 18 til Feb 19 for renovation so it would be good to know what they are planning to renovate? Thanks you CP for a nice break !
title: Nice break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were allocated cottage 567 which proved to be pretty close (10-15 mins walk) from the central \'hub\'.  MY daughter is in a wheelchair and most places - including the beach - were very accessible. My only complaints were that (1) a lot of activities were unavailable for 2 out of 3 days and so fully booked on day 3. In hindsight, i\'d have booked pony club in advance; and (2) it\'s a very hands off approach to guest management - I could have done with someone to proactively offer assistance from time to time (or even just with checking in and out), given I was alone with two small kids. Bed linen was not correctly provided, and security/facilities guy delivered some (also wrong size) - ideally he\'d have stuck around to check
title: A simple set up but did the job - and very easy to get to
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed here on our way back from Disney and loved it - we\'ll definitely be back.We had a refurbished chalet and it was fab, with plenty of space and a nice view over the lake.  The chalet was spotless and well equipped.  The chalets are not your usual centre parcs set up, and are apparently in a Canadian town style.The swimming pool was great with lots to do and as it was February, it was nice to be in the warm, however the grounds of the park were lovely to walk around, especially around the lake.  There is a little farm, and children\'s play area.  It\'s quite hilly and our children may have struggled on their bikes, if we had brought them with us, as they are used to flatter Centre Parcs villages.
title: Great half-term visit
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our first experience of a Euro Center Parcs, the UK version having priced itself out of the game during school holidays.It is very easily reached from Calais, taking about 2.5 hours.It is in a lovely setting which is fairly flat so good for the bike hire.We had comfort accommodation which had been refurbished and represented good value for money although take note there is a hob and microwave but no oven.The pool complex is clean and well kept, lots of cleaning staff and lifeguards around.There is the usual supermarket and restaurants which serve a good selection of food and drinks.The bike hire is excellent, good choice of bikes and a broken brake cable was repaired instantly.Our only complaint would be the sparse activities and lack of availability to book. Things like paint balling and archery we\u2019re only running for one or two x 1 hour sessions during our stay and were all fully booked.The local town of Laon is also worth a visit to experience a little bit of France.
title: A good value break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a lovely week at this center parcs.  We\'ve previously been to longleat and der kempervennen, and I\'d say this park compares very well. It\'s certainly a beautiful setting by the lake, and the swimming pool was fantastic - lovely and warm water and air temperature,  and great slides.  Spacious shower area and plenty of cubicles. Never too busy. We travelled with 2 6-year old boys and both were very frightened by the monster themed mini golf, so I\'d recommend just doing the outside one! Lovely soft play. Il giardino restaurant did great pizzas.  coupons for activities was a nice touch we haven\'t had elsewhere,  and we used for bowling.  Couple of problems with the hairdryer and whirlpool bath not working,  but promptly fixed (within 2 hours) when reported to reception.  Definitely worth paying extra for lakeside view.  Only 2.5 hours from Calais down a toll route (\u00a330return). Laon is beautiful and worth a visit.  Would recommend,  and would definitely return.
title: Great place
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I was there with my wife and young daughter. We took the VIP accomodation to reduce the amount of stuff we had to take with us. But in the end it was probably worth paying less and just taking the stuff. The apartment was clean but rather dated. I would have expected more from the \'top end\'. The sauna was also very old and the water bucket had a hole in it so wasn\'t usable. We used it once. Not really worth the extra cost. It was nice to be \'next\' to the lake though and have a view. I say \'next\' because there was quite a distance of bush before the actual lake began. Must have been a dry season thing so shouldn\'t complain!The park itself is huge and it\'s rather nice in general. The facilities are extremely good if you have young active kids. If you have a young baby like we did, the choice it a bit limited. All there really was that aimed at babies was the \'baby swimming\' and that was fun but it does get oversubscribed so some families with babies were left unhappy. Book ahead!Overall, this isn\'t a bad place. I\'d certainly go back, especially when the baby gets a bit older.
title: Nice place but accomodation could be better
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our first Center Parcs visit, having never been in the UK. This meant we weren\'t comparing with the UK ones, as many other visitors do.The positives were: Aqua Mundo (great pool!); location is beautiful, with lakes and woodland all around; the sports centre was very accessible with badminton, table tennis and tennis; decent fireworks at New Year; good \'Want to be a chef\' activity for the under 10s.Accommodation: very comfortable, good beds and quiet and peaceful. Lovely terrace area. Downsides: slightly poor maintenance and cleaning; had to switch off for the fuse for the whirlpool bath because it kept starting off independently! Kitchen is a bit poorly equipped, but we had read about the lack of oven on TA and took along a raclette set which was our new year meal. Thank you to the reviewers who mentioned that! Also thank you to reviewers warning about lack of towels - I would have taken swimming ones but assumed that hand and bath towels were included.BBC channels was a bonus for us as we are living abroad and could catch up on Match of the Day other English telly.Activities were not too enticing for the over 10s, but the chef activity was fine for the younger ones, with excellent and enthusiastic staff.The fitness path is good fun and great for all ages. Restaurants not very exciting, but the crepe place is good if a little pricey. We chose the buffet for the children only (bargain at 8.50), and adults just had a drink and cooked at home.Shop is expensive, but useful, and the bakery was surprisingly good. All staff were very friendly.Local area has a lot to offer, especially Reims, which is about 45 minutes away. Laon has a beautiful cathedral and a couple of restaurants (we tried Le Parvis, opposite the cathedral, that was good) but otherwise the city is very deserted.
title: Center Parcs with benefits
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We arrived yesterday... to a vip cottage. Totally renewed: that is true, but the smell of cheap painting is making me sick. I am trying to reach out to someone that can help me and is impossible to get reach to help (is people really working in this place?) it is all kind of self-service, no phone in the rooms to call reception, no one answering the phone of the party either, the line in the reception is of 2 hours. We ordered towels that didn\u2019t come, we ordered morning basket that never arrived and no one would let us know  where to get it. Is 9:30 am and I am already fed up and I have to choose if I loose my 2500 \u20ac and leave this place before I have to go to the hospital for the asthma or if I stay here until the 5th ..  I will never repeat such a terrible Experience in my whole Life. These people are not prepared for customer service.
title: A nightmare come true
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We ordered catering with festivities special dinner menu to be delivered to cottage. Everything was delivered on time. I took out prierrage (heated stone cooker) out of the box and tried to connect it to the grid. Surprisingly electrical fuse went off. I tried several times with cooker switch on/off, but the result was the same - electrical grid fuse off. I took out stone from heating elements and discovered that bare wires were visible and touching aluminium base of cooker. It is really dangerous and I can not imagine how such faulty device could be given to the customers. We tried to call to reception for half an hour. Phone was constantly busy, so we cooked our dinner on pan (instead of having nice family event).
title: Don\'t use catering service with pierrage - it is dangerous!!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Centerparks is like you would expect.  In balance with nature, peacefull and fun.  The cottages are well equipped but could use more luxury.  Free WiFi would be a very good plus point when comparing the park to Hotels.  Christmas dinner was ok but the organisation of BIG dinnerparties needs work.  The main courses were served in too little pans that caused a lot of waiting time.
title: Nice park, good facilities
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: To be fair I\u2019m probably not the right demographic for the average Centre Parcs customer but came as part of a larger family group.The cottage was ok, nice lake view with some visiting wildlife. Activities are more for the kids but I did play some tennis, bowling and mini golf.  However all the extras are very expensive e.g. mini golf \u20ac9 per person, bowling about \u20ac30 for the lane, so not a cheap option if just 2 people wanted to play. This probably explains why the pool, being free, was always crazy busy. We\u2019d pre purchased some wi-if only to discover on arrival that it only covers 4 devices, which in a cottage with 8 people just isn\u2019t enough. Wasn\u2019t much evidence of staff available to help with anything. I liked the supermarket with it\u2019s s little bakery, although as to be expected, it was pricer than going offsite to the big Carrefour near Laon. I also enjoyed my food in the creperie and the pizza place but surprised at how few restaurant options there were and how quiet everywhere was in the evenings.Others in our group tried the delivery option one night, which really only consists of pizzas or chicken, only to be told there were no pizzas, was told it be 30-40 mins but took over an hour to arrive.Having previously been on a similar family holiday to a UK Centre Parc, I can see why this one was cheaper, needs a bit of sprucing up, more organisation, more staff and less expensive activities/add ons.
title: OK but not my kind of thing
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The place is beautiful. It really is. But the maintenance is terrible. We had a cottage on the lake side and there were tons of spiders in the room. I mean everywhere and by the hundreds. arachnophobia nightmare. Aquamundu is so packed in august that the smell in the entrance made us turn back and leave. But no doubt the place is beautiful that is where it starts and that is where it ends. Restaurants look nice but the food is average minus. Language barrier for thous who don\u2019t speak french. I would only recommend going there if it is not full and you don\u2019t care that much about spiders.
title: Nice view, terrible maintenance, arachnophobia
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Lovely views over the lake, lots of slides in the pool, great pool for the kids (big and small). Comfy beds, kitchen complete with everything you need. The towels on site were not great would reccomend bringing your own. The pizza place served amazing pizzas and the creparie Suzette was good. Facilities, bowling and outside areas were looking very tired and updating
title: Great pool facility with lots for the kids.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: It is pretty, clean, relaxed, friendly. We had a great chance to rewind and make the most of the facilities. The park was quite empty so we had plenty of opportunities to book activities whenever we wanted.
title: Wonderful rest
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The center parcs are brilliant  family holiday.We took our  17 months old and she loved it.The apartment  was spacious and newly refurbished. The walk to dome was about  20 minutes  which wouldn\'t  be bad but unfortunately  it rained most of the time.The shops and restaurants were expensive but we drove to carefure few times. Will be returning again  hopefully next year
title: Family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Far too expensive for the quality that is delivered. Old worn-out cottages, relatively dirty and dusty.  Extra fees charged for the slightest extra service or activity, although basic stay is already quite expensive. Not to be repeated for me.
title: Seriously Overpriced
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just got back from 4 nights midweek break with husband, 5 year old and 1 year old. We had such a great time here. We stayed in a refurbished comfort cottage and it was lovely. Plenty of room. Could have done with a stair gate downstairs. We heeded the advice of other reviewers and took our own pillows and towels. We also took teatowels, which are needed. The park is set on a beautiful natural lake - this centre Parcs feels much more natural than, say, Woburn, which feels like a bit of a housing estate in comparison. There is so much to do - the aqua dome is awesome (and empty if your half term does not correspond with with everyone else\u2019s, like Brighton\u2019s). So many slides, something for everyone. There is a lovely sandy beach on the lake, a mini \u201cfarm\u201dwith goats and sheep, a free indoor soft play/climbing area, a great huge big playground. For kids aged 1 and 5 it was perfect. We hired bikes, one with a trailer to get around for about \u00a345 for 5 days. We mostly ate at home - the on site boulangerie/patisserie does great bread and pastries, and rotisserie chickens, which are great as the comfort cottages don\u2019t have ovens. We only tried the pizza place once, which was nice. Under 2s get a good free meal. On site shop is eye wateringly expensive (\u00a32.50 for a cucumber??) but we paid for the convenience of not having to leave the park, and as we mostly ate at home we justified it. We loved this centre Parcs so much we\u2019re going back next year. At less than \u00a3500 including crossings from the UK it was definitely worth it when you see how much UK parks are for similar dates.
title: Fab - so much for a young family to do
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I was disappointed with the size of the property, we booked a premium lodge which was too small for a family of 5 (2 Adults 3 Children) there was not enough hanging space for clothes no cupboards for suitcases so spent the week living out of a case.They do not supply towels, so we had to buy beach towels from on location shop.We were quite a walk from the main part of the park (20 minutes) so requested a golf buggy but there were none available.  Whilst we were there, there were a group of 200 approx. people on a company function that swamped the area as they were taking part in activities. At one point they all ascended near to the beach. It changed the dynamics of the park as it is meant for families not business functions.  They should not allow them at peak time.It was difficult at times to get simple things like a boat, half the time they were tied up not being used so that was really frustrating.  The paintballing was only 15minutes as they only provide you with 50 paint balls ! The quad biking was 15 minutes only so by the time they warm up and get used to it, its time to come off. The reception staff were helpful and speak English, but staff in the restaurants struggle to understand and with my lack of French it made ordering food difficult at times.  They seem to have limited patience as well.  Talking of food there are basically 2 restuarants to choose from and a buffet.  The pizza and pasta place is definitely the best place to eat.  Do not bother with the other place it is full of spiders, cobwebs, when I went to pay the additional bill for our drinks I was horrified to look up to the ceiling and see holes and damp spots and spiders it put me off eating there again. The crepery is nice but only as a snack option. We ate at the buffet once and it literally turned by stomach, the prawns smelt awful, the carved ham was left with a knife sticking out of it, nobody to carve it off for you. The curry type thing the meat looked raw.  I ended up eating bread and butter and a few things off the salad bar.  The chocolate fountain was a nice touch, but nothing but cereal or ice cream to put with it ! I wished I had catered myself but wanted a break from cooking so went for the half board option.  We managed a day out to Euro Disney which I highly recommend its quite straight forward to get to.  The aqua mundo pool is amazing, the children spent most of there time going down the various slides, it does get extremely busy.  The highest number of people we saw on the people counter was 1200, the lowest 300.  They allow too many people down the rapid river at once so you end up with feet and god knows what in your face ! And if you have little ones it is quite worrying to have a grown man going full speed towards them.  We did end up with a few bruises and grazes.Overall, the children loved it simply for the aqua mundo and the activities.  But I do not think I would return,  The whole place needs a good clean up, it looks tired and uncared for in parts.  Its such a shame, it could be amazing and be a 5 star park but I feel it has a long way to go. My suggestion would be a Chinese, Mexican, American type eating place to give people choice, possibly a sushi or noodle type place.  A good tidying up and staff around to help or advise would be nice.  I didn\'t see 1 person cleaning the whole of my visit. Or any staff around helping, you had to queue in reception for 30 minutes to ask anything.  There are too many cars parked and driving around which is annoying as its meant to be a car free park, some cars had parking type tickets on them but they were there for days so were just ignored.Easy to get too from Folkestone - Calais - by car.
title: Great activities, but 3 star accomodation - disappointing
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have recently returned from a seven night stay at Le Lac d\'Ailette resort. Several matters of concern need drawing to people\'s attention which we feel should and could have been avoided. Firstly, I emailed the reception staff 2 months before the start of our holiday asking what the process was for reserving a golf buggy (4 person type). I was told it was not necessary to reserve a golf buggy in advance but to just visit the hire centre when we arrived. I was quoted a cost of \u20ac215 for a 4 person buggy. On arrival at the hire centre I was told because we had not reserved a 4 person buggy in advance we could only hire a 6 person buggy at a cost of \u20ac270 a difference of \u20ac55. Our second complaint was the state of the garden area to cottage 551. We let our five year old grand daughter play in the garden whilst we unloaded the car. When she came into the cottage her shoes were covered in dog poo. It took up one hour of our holiday time to pick up various piles of dog poo and remove them from the garden and a further hour to clean and disinfect the cottage floor.Our third and most serious and concerning matter was that while our two grand children, 5 years and 4 years old, were playing in front of the cottage the five year old said she had something stuck into her shoe. Imagine our shock, horror and concern when she pulled out a syringe that was embedded in the side of her shoe and handed it to us. She obviously had no idea what it was but we did! We went to the reception desk and asked Cl\u00e9mont if we could speak to the duty manager about the incident. Even though we made this reasonable request to Cl\u00e9mont several times he would not contact the duty manager. He took a brief note of the details of the incident and arranged for a gardener to come and collect the discarded syringe. Fearing that the syringe could have contained contaminated blood, we disposed of the shoes in the bulk waste bin. How could Center Parc allow this to happen? Reading other negative reviews, I suggest others think twice about staying here.
title: Think twice before staying here
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Our cottage was filthy, with empty beer cans outside the front door, glass missing from the roof of the veranda, full ashtrays, mound in the bathrooms and neighbours that partied until 2am every night! We called security, they visited the other guests, no impact, had to move cottages for our last night...not even an apology! Very little to do in the surrounding area if you want to get away from CP. Avoid.
title: Dirty, expensive and the food was terrible!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have just returned from a stay in a budget 2 bedroom cottage at Le Lac d\'Ailette. The journey from Calais was very easy if you follow the satnav. First impressions of the cottage were great - before we got in, they are all very pretty from the outside. Unfortunately things were not so great inside - the first thing that hit us was the musty smell in the kitchen, it really was quite strong and we could smell in the open plan living room downstairs and on the stair case. The cleaning really was not up to standard, there were cobwebs all over the place, and I was horrified when my 9 month old managed to pull a load of old fluff and hair from the gap between the laminate floorboard and the breakfast bar. The smell was remedied by bleach being put down the sink and an air freshener from Carrefour at Laon (worth a visit for shopping, not too far and a good range and much better value than the onsite shop). We got used to the cottage after the underwhelming first few hours but after a few nights found the sofa quite uncomfortable and the mattresses very uncomfortable - sore backs all round.We quickly unloaded and packed, very impressed with the wardrobe space. There was a built in stair-gate, which was a fantastic idea, but was let down by a shoddy repair job where a block of wood and been half-heartedly screwed over the split wood of the original gate.Oh dear, things were not going to plan. Then we went to the pool and suddenly all seemed well again - it really was fantastic. The play-area for children, la maison d\'eau, was brilliant on its own, add large pool with waves, numerous slides, a lazy river and a "savage" river (the rapids), all under a glass dome, and you realise Center Parcs really have aced the pool. I couldn\'t decide if the lifeguard\'s "hands-off" approach was good or not - it meant I got to go down slides with my 7 year old which is something that you tend not to be allowed to do at home - but on the flip side it got my wondering if they were paying attention - maybe I am just used to the constant whistles of the lifeguards in the UK. We ate at the Jardin on the first night - the on site pizza and pasta restaurant. The chap who served us - who we suspected might be a manager or supervisor, was brilliant and the food was surprisingly good for the budget option. We ate again just before we left - literally just before we hit the road - but unfortunately the service was not as good this time. I was particularly annoyed to be told with a gallic shrug that there was no high chair available. I got one myself from the closed breakfast cafe - we were also ignored when requesting the bill and attempting to pay.The kids activities were all fantastic - the chef and secret agent experiences were staffed by enthusiastic staff,and despite my 7 year old not speaking french he was looked after well and put with other British children. He also had a go on the enfant quad bikes and had a great time - again staff were brilliant. There is a small outdoor water play area in this area which is great and a nice touch. My better half took the kids to the indoor soft play which was good - especially considering it was free.I also took the 7 year old on the offroad buggy experience - guide was good, buggys were well maintained and fun but I did feel like we spent a lot of time on tarmac rather than dirt track.We also ate at the lakeside grill restaurant - it was a saturday night and the usual menu had been replaced by a Barbecue. This sounded - and smelt - superb but we were extremely disappointed with the food. I really would avoid the saturday barbecue but couldn\'t comment on the other menu (looked good though). Service was good.To summarise, the cottages are quite cute but are in need of a spruce - I think they are just tired and well used. As with Center Parcs in the UK, you\'re really paying for the pool and other activities which were excellent. If you\'re first concern in a family holiday is entertaining the kids then Le Lac d\'ailette is a smart choice - but consider paying for premium accommodation.
title: Poor accommodation, fantastic pool, occasionally service was "french"
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Set in very attractive surroundings, this is a beautiful place to spend some time. The lakeside property we stayed in was well appointed, apart from the lack of an oven. The park itself is quite widely spread out, so we needed bicycles to get around (quite a challenge as we had not ridden a bike for around 60 years!). The on-site restaurants were OK, albeit quite expensive. Lots of wildlife to see, including coypu, but primarily a bird watcher\'s paradise.
title: Lovely place to stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After being let down by booking the Paris site, paying and then finding out it would not be finished in time 2 weeks before we were due to go we decided to try another site! Even after poor trip adviser reviews we took a chance. Pleasantly surprised with this one - though some cottages were dated and older the peaceful and picturesque setting was great and all the facilities were what you would expect. Very quiet Too! Def recommend a lakeside cottage and would go again!
title: Better than expected
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We booked this holiday as a last minute thing on a friends recommendation. Easy 2 1/2 drive from Calais. Stop in laon to get supplies in the carrafour there. 20 mins later drove into centre parts. Easy check in. Straight to our cottage, 265 which is a bit of a trek but we hired bikes. Refurbished cottage. All ok as not in it much. However small niggles, no oven. Not much cutlery, fan not working, sink plug does not fit, only 2 rubbish bags, no big mugs, front door needs to slam to shut, fridge interior damaged,floor quite dirty. However we found the cottage comfy and cool as it was quite warm sometimes outside. We could not book activitys at home so had pot luck when we got there. There is an app to download but you can\'t if your from outside France which is quite annoying as you can book everything on that instead of queuing. We done the indoor golf, don\'t bother! Electric boat which was good as the lake is massive and you can go and see a bit more, but the life vests were damp and very smelly. My son done the donkey ride, 8 donkeys with 1 member of staff walking around the complex made for interesting watching as she walked off with the first two and left all us quite some way behind as the donkeys just kept wanting to stop and eat!! I done the aerial adventure. Got harnessed up, walked over to the tree, shown how to keep safe and off I went. No one to make sure or even up there to check. A mum was letting her two daughters go and she was not to impressed. I never spoke to anyone after either. Had to take my harness off myself and hang it up. Whilst watching the zip wire people were left hanging if they had not made the end as no one was there. Shocking state of safety I believe.  Swimming is great tho.a massive complex with loads of flumes. Our four year old done the rapids which I at first thought he is to young but 1- he was really good 2-he was not the youngest. Babies going down on there parents lap and stopping it or going slow causing accidents happened all the time. It\'s a quick water rapid not a lazy river! It is always busy but lots to go on. Lots of leaves in the water from the trees growing in there which could do with cleaning out. We ate in the Italian which was good and use the parc market for a lunch and cake which was very nice. I am saying all the bad parts. Would I go again , probably but maybe another one in France. As I have only ever been to elveden I only have that to compare it to. We believe it\'s to understaffed here and if that sorted some little issues out it could be a wonderful place.
title: Could be really good!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Cottage was in a beautiful location on the lake but a bit small for our liking. The kitchen was tiny, no oven and no washing machine facility.  The bathroom didn\'t have a separate shower room. The stairs were quite dangerous
title: Center parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having looked at Center Parcs in the UK as an option, and found it way too expensive, we decided on Lac D\'ailiette. I always read all the trip advisor reviews so was a little nervous about what to expect given some of the more unfavourable comments posted. In reality we were delighted with what we found and had a brilliant week with our two girls aged 7 and 10. The accommodation was absolutely fine and fit for purpose and we were in Zone 1 which was a manageable walk to all the facilities- go for zero or 1 for the shortest distance if you don\'t choose a cottage on the lakeside. We went for a refurbished cottage and it was clean and well kept. Nothing to complain about and the fact that on an activity holiday you shouldn\'t really be spending any significant time in the house else what is the point??The location of the resort is beautiful and the views over the lake are awesome- especially at sunset. The children did the following activities- pedalo, pony riding, cool jump, high adventure, bungee trampoline, aqua speed, mini golf indoor and outdoor and spent many happy hours in the arcade haemorrhaging money whilst we enjoyed late afternoon beers overlooking the lake. All the staff running the activities were brilliant. Very friendly and a special mention to the guys who did the aqua speed- they were fantastic!!!!The Aqua Mundo was the highlight of the week. Amazing pools, lazy river and plenty of choice of different slides plus the River Sauvage which ours absolutely loved even though it\'s not as \'wild\' as the name might suggest. The only one bad experience was the meal on our last night in the Italian which was absolutely shocking- and we are not the type of people to complain about anything so that should indicate how bad it had to be for us to refuse to pay! All in all we had a fabulous time here and would definitely return to European Center Parcs. Very sad to leave today! Don\'t believe the terrible reviews- if you are up for a laugh and don\'t get too hung up on minor irrelevant negatives it\'s definitely the place for you!
title: A fun and enjoyable family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Surpassed my expectations with spotless accommodation and beautiful setting. We enjoyed the Aqua Mundo, which was excellent, and the high ropes activity. One slight area to be improved was the outdoor mini golf but that\'s the only slight fault I could find. Went to Kempervennen last year but would say this was better and would definitely recommend.
title: Family break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed in villa 626 after a few days at Disney so we\'re looking forward to a slow relaxing 4 days.+ very peaceful location, by lake. V little noise from neighbours, maybe we were lucky+ great Aqua Munro swimming pool. Loads of slides, albeit very tame compared with uk, fine for the younger kids though+ cheap Italian restaurant with tasty pasta (although risotto v bland)+ comfy beds+ so much wildlife - bats, geese, swans, ducks, nutria (like beavers) and even a cat who had her kittens during our stay (great for us, she used us as a base, but not so good if you don\'t like cats)+ we actually didn\'t find the language barrier an issue. Just tried as much as we could in French and then they take pity on you and speak English! + well stocked on site shop. Yes a little more Pricey but the convenience of that vs driving to the local Carrefour, 20 mins away, we actually decided to stay on site. Just the faff of getting the car, driving 20 mins, trudging around a supermarket , 20 mins back, finding a space (v busy) and bringing the bags back to the villa put me off vs walking to the local shop and paying perhaps \u00a310 - \u00a320 more. + dolce gusto coffe machine in kitchen + a filter coffee remember to bring coffee pods and filters/ground coffee if you like coffee!+ the baths has hot tub setting which our kids loved - adding bubbles is extra fun if you\'re prepared to clean up the mess!!- lakeside next to our villa a bit dirty and one daughter got stuck in the muddy \'quicksand\' so paddling not an option, the nearby beach area good though.- villa in need of renovating. All a bit shabby. Good enough but not great.- not even a hand towel is provided so we had to use our constantly wet swimming towels for hands. - only a combi microwave oven is provided so when we bought pizza from the shop for the first evening we could only cook 1 at a time and ruined the first 2 as they wouldn\'t cook properly. A set of instructions would have been great because I had no idea how to work this thing. it gives you 3 automatic options but who knows what each one is. What I would bring next time? Extra hand towels, a couple of things to cook on the hob for the first evening. Maybe some dettol wipes!!Overall, this is a nice centres arcs but is a bit grubby around the edges. Shame as those details are easily fixed.
title: Some good and bad bits but overall a good holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We very much liked our cottage at Centerparcs. It is compact but cosy. The kitchen is well equipped. The wifi (which is at a premium cost) was very good. The cottages could be improved with airconditioning, the rooms were very hot on summer nights.On the third day of our stay, our 10yo developed an otitis (middle ear infection). On the fourth day, I developed an inflammation on a little elbow wound I got in the pool. We spent a whole day in Laon looking for doctors and pharmacists. The doctor at the Centre Hospitalier of Laon noted that the pool at Centerparcs is infested with bacteria and viruses. We are currently undergoing an antibiotics treatment and the doctor advised us not to visit the pool for the rest of our stay. We are officially disgusted with the hygiene in the swimming pool and ended our holiday two days early. We will definitely not return to this Centerparcs.
title: The pool is infested with disease
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I used to be an F&B manager and never in my dreams that I will meet a Reception Manager like her. No plans for whatever problems,  all she can is "we just have to wait and see" she\'s referring to the rain that came into our fireplace. No action will be done until it happens again, not even check if there\'s something wrong. Need some more training if I will be asked.
title: Reception manager is very unprofessional and rude.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had no problem with communicating with staff. Some don\'t speak English in the restaurants but you get by fine and you are in France! Just learn some basic French before you go. Staff were friendly and really nice, kids activities are mainly in French but the staff made sure they came and explained everything to any English children. My kids loved it all! No oven in the kitchen but that\'s to get you to eat out, but I didn\'t find it too expensive to eat out. BBQ\'s were a good option for eating in, we took some small disposable ones with us. Opening times for restaurant and bars is limited so take drink with you everywhere. Beach bar was shut on a boiling hot day until 3pm so it was hard to access water. Arcade is expensive compared to here so be prepared. Soft play area is really good. Stop in a supermarket in Laon  before you get there, on site supermarket is more pricey but not too bad. We went to a local market and tried champagne cheese and meats it was amazing, really good prices for it all too.
title: Lovely holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: A dirty cottageSpider webs everywhereA balcony with pigeon dirtThere is no air conditioning in the rooms, a sense of suffocationWhen a window opens spiders fall into the roomlake view is swamp view
title: A dirty cottage
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Myself, my husband and our 23 month old daughter have just returned from 4 nights here. We were originally booked for the brand new park and weren\'t thrilled about being moved here just a couple of weeks before our holiday (especially since it took 5 days from receiving an email saying the park wouldn\'t be ready and actually speaking to someone about our options). I then read reviews on here and got worried about some of the comments.In the end, we had a great time. We had never done this type of holiday before, so had to make an educated guess as to what to bring. We stayed in a lake view premium cottage in section 4, which was a 15 minute walk from the centre of the park.The kitchen had all the pots and pans necessary for cooking (As noted by many others, there is no oven.) It was fully stocked with cutlery and cooking utensils, plates, bowls, cups, mugs etc. There was a basic kitchen pack with 2 bin bags, 3 dishwasher tabs, a sponge and a couple of cleaning cloths. In the cupboards we found brooms, a vacuum, clothes airer and plenty of hangers. There were only 2 loo rolls, so were glad we brought some and also extra bin bags for our daughter\'s nappies.The cottage was clean and tidy with good wardrobe space in each bedroom. The beds were comfortable and shower had very good water pressure.The facilities at the park were great for keeping our toddler happy and exhausting her so she slept better than at home!We spent a couple of hours each day in the Aqua Mundo- our toddler loved the lazy river and the mini water slides in the baby pool. We found the best time to go was first thing when it opened at 10am. The river was definitely too busy for me to feel safe with our toddler when it was crowded with older kids and teens the day we went in the afternoon. Our daughter also had a great time on the playgrounds and visiting the goats and sheep. The only way the playground could haven even better for her would have been if there were some swings.We had 2 lunches at the restaurants. At the fast food place I had a very sad looking chicken wrap which looked so unlike the photo on their display it was actually funny. We also ate at the crepe restaurant and had a lovely meal of both savoury and sweet crepes. The shop has essentials, but of course you pay a bit of a premium for it being on-site. We stopped at the hypermarket 20 minutes away and stocked up before we arrived, which worked well.The staff have been criticised in some reviews but we found them fine- especially in the crepe place and the bike hire office. We would definitely consider another Centre Parcs holiday with our family!
title: Good holiday for a young family
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews once we had booked our first Center Parcs holiday here.  However, we were very pleasantly surprised.  The booking in system was slick by doing it on-line which meant we were met with our Center Parcs pack at the gate and went straight to our cottage.  Our cottage on the lake was recently renovated and very clean.  You have to be prepared to walk to the Centre which took us about 15 minutes but was part of our daily exercize.  We were 3 adults and 2 teenagers who loved the Aqua Mundo which was the best attraction for us.  It would have been good to have more challenging sports for the teenagers but they experienced the boating and pedalo\'s on the lake.  We found the restaurant prices similar to the UK as was the supermarket.  The deli counter for snacks and cakes was a hit with all of us.  We were told we did not have to book for the restaurants by restaurant staff but this turned out not to be the case, and we should have booked these in advance!  The staff were extremely customer friendly and made us feel very welcome in the Parc.  You never get everything right on a holiday such as this but our overall impression was that we had an excellent, quiet, calm holiday in a very supportive atmosphere that we thoroughly enjoyed.
title: Excellent experience in France
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great variety of activities, the swimming pool is particularly good! Lots of restaurants in a fab location, made even better by the low cost. Would definitely go back, a very family friendly break, something to suit everyone.
title: Great value for money
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: First time at center parcs in France- cheaper than uk! This place is beautiful. Highly recommend spending a bit more to get a lakeside cottage as the view is spectacular with lots of nature to view - swans, ducks, coypu, herons. We stayed 606 which hasn\'t be updated yet but was still fine. It has a deck and little garden right to lake where the kids skimmed stones and fed the wildlife. It also has the enviable position of only being 5 mins walk to centre yet still peaceful. Aqua Mundo was excellent - so many slides but is very busy. Great service in the Italian, the grill restaurant service was slow but food ok. So much for kids to do. Also drove to Disneyland Paris which takes 1hr 45 mins. Brilliant holiday.
title: Lac d\'ailette - highly recommend
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: While staying at this location ( after 4 great visits to other center parcs) we encountered the worst ever customer service. Leave the fact that the Wifi did not work for the all stay, my daughter ( 7 years old) locked us by mistake out of the room all family members at 21:00. We were waiting for almost one hour until someone was "kind" enough to come and help us.During that time my wife and me tried calling number of times to the service line. No one answered or if answered disconnected. On my second visit to the security booth I saw that this is the standard way to take care of things, people call and probably the phone does not work, so he just hangs up.Needles to say that no one speaks english in a tourist site.I never wrote such a bad review but this is really unheard of
title: Worst customer service ever
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Our experience was far below our expectations, the Centre Parcs concept as we know this in NL is totally not there in France, language barrier is massive, it\'s French or nothing, those who supposed to speak English barely do...
title: Never again Center Parcs France
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was my first time at a Center Parcs, so I can\'t make any comparisons to the UK, but we really enjoyed our holiday and it lived up to our expectations. Our kids (13 and 10) loved it, particularly the freedom we were able to give them in this safe environment. Our refurbished villa was in excellent condition, very clean, wifi worked fine, comfortable, and we were pleased with the location in zone 3 by the lake, which was about 8 mins (mainly flat) walk from the centre. We had to report a problem with the coffee machine and the toilet and they were very promptly fixed. Not all the instructors on the activities speak English. In most cases this didn\'t matter. It just got a bit stressful when my daughter did the treetop adventure because there was no one around to explain the safety procedures in English. This was our only negative experience. We ate at the buffet and the Italian restaurant. The food was not outstanding but perfectly fine for the price and definitely not as bad in our opinion as some reviewers have made out.We would come back, as we did not know how much Center Parcs has to offer for  children that are a bit older until we tried it. It was ideal for them!
title: Good holiday, kids loved it
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Overall a good trip, easy drive from Calais.  Kids loved the activities but the outdoor tennis courts were not in a great condition.  Food and drinks all ok and managed to get by with the little French that we spoke.  The only down side was the amount of cars on site, made cycling a bit more challenging.
title: Good value short break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed here with our 2 little children (1 and 3 years) and a niece (14 years). We had the most fun in Aqua Mundo, for sure the highlight of the park.+ Aqua Mundo!!!+ Food delivery at your cottage+ Very nice location+ Indoor Playground was decent+ The colored houses are beautiful, but some could use some paint+ You receive vouchers for free activities + Good TV channel selection, with the option to play MKV movies from USB (with subtitles!)- The park often felt dirty: smell of mold in our toilet, smell of vomit+s**t in the Aqua Mundo changing room.- Lack of temperature controlling options in house: No insect screen, no airco and no fans, which meant sweaty nights, low sleep quality and little ventilation during the day. We were actually glad that we had lower temperatures (20 to 25 C max during the days). No changing of the sheets, so they must have smelled lovely after a week.- Hot water in the bathroom is extremely hot. Cold water had very little pressure. Because of this, you had to be very careful when using the faucet. The difference between way too hot and way too cold were only a few millimeters apart. - Very expensive for what you get, we expected more. We paid close to 1800 EUR to a week in a 4 person cottage.- Even the simple things cost money or are set up in a way to squeeze more money out of you. Like access to the bouncing castle (5 EUR per child per 30 minutes). Or the kitchen kit which gives you things like dishwasher tablets: You get 3 of those with a 7 days stay. Want more? Buy it in the shop. - We rented a stone grill for one night (10 EUR). It was delivered to us in a box. In the box, we found 2 slimy snails crawling around. Don\'t they check these things?- Animal farm was rather limited.
title: Lots of fun, but expensive and dirty
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were relocated here from the delayed Villages Nature project with a couple of days notice, so not a great start! Overall we had a nice week, good location and park is generally clean and a nice environment. Mostly on the flat so it is easy to cycle (we are used to Longleat in UK, where cycling is very hard work!) Our villa was clean and as described, although the lake view of a half empty lake with empty paint tins floating in it wasn\'t quite what we had expected!Lack of air con made the bedrooms really warm at night. Poor service in some of the very expensive restaurants was not good - waiting 15 minutes to be seated in a half empty Suzette\'s (pancakes), and then watch other be seated and served before us. Waiters wandering around with food not knowing which table it belonged too. The grill restaurant was probably our best experience.Aqua Mundo was great and our 4 year old really enjoyed it the swimming, slides etc.Booking activities you can do at the reception - Center Parcs makes a big deal of encouraging use of their app, but this is not available for UK customers so you have to do in person on site. They are not as clear on keeping cars off the village, so there were quite a few cars around throughout our week and 2 parked outside our villa for the whole week - they need to be stronger on the \'no cars\' policy.Overall we had a nice week but we wouldn\'t probably choose to go back to Lac D\'Aillette, compared to our experiences of CP\'s in the UK and Europe this one was below normal standards.
title: August 2017 - fun but expensive and below expectations
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This is our 19th Center Parcs holiday. We love connecting as a family and enjoy all of the activities that you just don\'t get with a beach holiday.However, four hours into our trip and our daughter was hospitalised after an accident in the Aqua Mundo, requiring stitches to a head wound. These things happen I guess, but it set off our realisation that this is not a Center Parcs where guests are put first. The first lifeguard was not qualified to deal with the injury. (The next three who attended were all very good, however). Most disappointingly is that nobody followed up on the condition of my daughter for the remainder of the holiday, despite the recording of the accident. I even struggled to have her pre-booked activities reimbursed. As I speak fluent French this was not a language problem, but an attitude issue.Food is ok, but choice is limited. Avoid l\'Embarcadere restaurant as it is a disappointment. The standard of food choice and quality of cooking is below par, and the service is poor. Il Giardino is the best value all round, but there is only so much pizza and pasta you can eat! The market dome buffet is not well attended, and \'hot\' food soon becomes cold. The breakfast buffet range is limited. The entertainment staff are a little jaded.The Nature spa is excellent and well recommended.Overall, if you\'re planning a Center Parcs holiday abroad, it has to be Holland or Belgium. They just do it better.
title: Average. Management Absent
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great location and all the usual CP activities. Good pool - kids loved it.Our \'refurbished\' premier lodge was \'OK\' - quite small and kitchen was very old and not updated at all. Microwave only, no oven. Decent TV, but no DVD player.Lovely outside deck by the lake, so we lazed there a lot reading and watching the wildlife (swallows, swans, dragonflies - even a beaver!)
title: Center Parcs Le Lac D\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Good and Bad.Good - children love the pools at Center Parcs which is why we go.  Bakery was good and beds very comfortable.  Warmer and cheaper than England.Bad -  Slides in pool very tame cf to England. Tiny kitchen. No oven. Sofa v, uncomfortable.  Garden tiny.  WiFi weak and limited to 4 devices. Shop v expensive and limited.  Restaurants overpriced and shut a lot.  No coffee shops for a pit-stop.  Very understaffed - slides on timers in the pool, never saw a manager or cleaner all weak.
title: Okay but flawed for family of 6
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Had high expectations as been to all the others in England. Very rude staff very small. Everything shuts at 19:00. Does not open till 10:00. Found the language barrier very hard not a lot of the staff spoke English.  Would not return
title: Disappointing
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The original cottage I booked proved not to be what was shown in the brochure.  It took a bit of time to reallocate us but we were eventually very satisfied with the new cottage.  The activities we pre booked were fine but more for younger children would be good.  We ( ages four to 66!) used the indoor/ outdoor Aqua Mundo swimming complex every day and loved it.
title: Aqua Mundo is the star of the Parc
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Bad experience, we saw the pictures of new cottages, then we booked at the internet. But it was dirty and old and a lot of things were broken in kitchen and toilets. Dirty walls. Cobweb and spiders inside and dirt from birds outside the cottage. We couldn\'t sit out b\u00e9cause of the swallows. Broken furniture in the old cottage and hair from a cat inside at the floor in the living room.
title: Dirty and old cottages
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: A lovely relaxing holiday although everything was very expensive and could do with an oven in the apartment. Hiring a golf buggy was a good idea as depending on where you are on site it is a long walk to the central location of activities. Upon arrival the welcoming party had very little English, although my French isn\'t too bad I felt the language barrier.
title: Family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: the general impression was that there was not a real balance between price and quality. it was too expensive for the quality offered. what most impacted me was the lack of cleanness in the cottage...really uncomfortable....and additionally, the prices for the activities were really expensive..everything is very expensive there..prepare your wallet!
title: been there last week (17-21 July)
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: On first appearances everything was more crammed together than other parts we\'ve been to.Houses very close together and most of the houses including ours (3 Bed ) were in dire need of maintenance, even if only a lick of paint. Our house left a lot to be desired, even the kids were disappointed. The house appeared tired and untidy on the outside the white patio furniture was weathered and grey. Inside the house smelled of stale smoke(tobacco) all the walls need washing or preferably painting. There was mould on the bathroom ceiling and bedroom walls. Not a good start!!!The main harbour focal point as seen on the advertising looked drab and tired, as if no effort had been made to make it look attractive for the start of the season.The two activities that my children were booked onto were not as advertised. sorbing was advertised as being outside on the beach but was inside the sports hall in a dark corner ( although they still enjoyed themselves )Then the high adventure and zipwire was under staffed and poorly managed to the point of being unsafe. Small children were left dangling on the cable with no idea what to do !!!!Although we were disappointed with the park the surrounding area was lovely and very interesting. We made the most of the cycle paths outside the park and visited WW1 sites which are well worth the visit.We found the nearest supermarket ( Carrefour ) was at Laon which offered everything at probably half the price of the market back at Centre Parcs, the medieval city and Cathedral are also worth a look around too.To conclude the park is in a lovely location but drastically needs some money and time spent on it to bring it back up to the required standard.
title: Not up to usual Centre Parcs  5 star standard
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: As an avid Trip Advisor researcher, we booked a holiday at Centre Parcs Le Lac D\u2019Ailette despite the very varied and mixed reviews, all trepidation dissipated when we arrived, what a wonderful and beautifully laid out Centre Parcs.  This was our second European Centre Parcs and we quickly got into the swing of things, check in was seamless as we had checked in online our keys and information pack were waiting at the gatehouse when we arrived.  We had to drive the long way round to our cottage due to the one way system for cars which gave us plenty of time to see all the different styles and colours of all the cottages, which gives this Centre Parcs a very unique look.As we had booked our holiday back in January we had our pick of cottages, having carefully reviewed the map we went for a Premium (546) as it was right on the lake and a short walk to the hub of restaurants and Aqua Mundo. The site is very long, with some cottages quite a considerable distance from the main activity hub, so choose your cottage wisely or you may end up walking/cycling a very long way!  And not all cottages are situated on the main lake, there are smaller ponds etc which are not right on the water\u2019s edge.The cottage itself was a two story, three bedroom premium, whilst we had not booked a renovated cottage it had clearly just been painted which was a nice surprise. The only niggle was that some of the bedroom doors did not shut properly because the rubber seals had been painted over, but a small niggle.  We were also fortunate to have several House Martin nesting and watched several babies take their first tentative flight during the week we were there, admittedly they did produce a lot of poo and you had to be careful where you hung your towels to dry, but given the choice of poo over pets we were glad we had the pets!The living space was good with new furniture.  The lounge area had a TV which had several English Channels (BBC1, BBC2 and CBeebies).  At previous Centre Parcs we had been provided with a DVD player so had brought plenty of films to watch to wind down at the end of our active days, but unfortunately there was none provided here and there were not ones available to hire, so we ended buying a cheap one in town, had we known we could have easily brought one from home.The kitchen was however tiny and only had room for one person at a time.  As the weather was so nice we managed to BBQ several times so were not so reliant on the tiny kitchen.  To keep the cost of the holiday down we ate at our cottage most days but had been organised and had come prepared with potential meal options and sauces etc that can easily be made on a hob.  The onsite shop is very very expensive, OK for the odd essential but you really don\u2019t want to stock up for the week there.  The Carrefour in nearby Laon is a 15 to 20 minute drive and is massive, most staples were about half the price of the onsite shop and we only needed to do one supermarket run for week.  Beer and Wine were about a third of the price if you purchased a special offer.We did eat out once at Centre Parcs.  The pizza and pasta restaurant had the best reviews, but unfortunately they offered little for gluten intolerance so we ended up at the L\u2019Embarcad\u00e8re Grill restaurant and kind of wished we hadn\u2019t bothered.  The food was mediocre at best and the service was spectacularly slow.  Either save your money and eat at your cottage or go into nearby Laon to eat.Some previous reviewers have mentioned language problems, but we didn\u2019t have any problems.  A well-placed bonjour works wonders, but lots of staff speak passable English and it was a great opportunity for the kids to learn some basic French words.There are lots and lots of activities for offer, and the temptation is to book them all when you book your holiday (there is certainly lots of encouragement to do so on the website) however I would advise that you wait until you arrive and check out of the activities first as some of them looked a little disappointing when seen \u201cin the flesh\u201d (big jumping pillow and zip wire are good examples).  There is no problem to book when you are here, the information desk is manned by English speaking staff who are very helpful.  We chose not to do too many activities and just did Family Paintball, Pony Rides, Outdoor Mini Golf and Bowling but the rest of the time was spent in the Aqua Mundo or on the beach.  There is also an indoor play centre (a soft play / ball pool type set up) which was OK and always virtually empty so ours could just charge about in total freedom.So to the star of the show, the Aqua Mundo!  We were there virtually every day for a good few hours.  It does get busy at peak times (around midday) but it is open late and on a few occasions we went after an early dinner as evenings are quite.  There is LOADS of water slides and it\u2019s all self-regulated with a traffic light system, we liked the lazy river and the rapids (even though they were not so rapid!) and the outdoor pool.  The Water House is good, but the water tidal wave that dumps on your head every 10 minutes or so was icy cold so it didn\u2019t take long before we scurried back to the warmth of the main pool.  Whilst there are lifeguards stationed there is a more relaxed approach to health and safety which leaves you free to actually enjoy the pool and we did not observe any dangerous or anti social behaviour, even at busy times. For day trips we spent an afternoon in nearby Laon, a lovely medieval walled town.  We also splashed out on a day trip to Disneyland Paris, it took about 90 minutes to drive there on fairly simple dual carriageway type roads and this treat really helped to make out holiday special.In summary, I would strongly encourage you to give this Centre Parcs a try.  The cost alone makes this location attractive, at about half the cost of holidaying at a UK Centre Parc, even when factoring in the Eurotunnel.  The cottages are very attractively laid out (if you pick carefully) and the weather is often more reliable than in the UK.  If I am honest the only thing that really lets this Parc down is the poor restaurant options, in a country renowned for its food and drink it\u2019s shameful that it cannot provide a better choice than it does.
title: Lovely Parc but pick your cottage carefully or risk disappointment
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Like others we looked at Center Parcs in the UK for May half term and couldn\'t justify the price so came to Le Lac d\'Ailette. The pools are brilliant and the activity vouchers you receive on arrival mean we didn\'t spend anything else on extra activities. We didn\'t eat in any of the restaurants except for the ice cream parlour where the staff couldn\'t have been friendlier. Yes, the shop is expensive but what campsite shop isn\'t?! And we stocked up in the excellent Carrefour in Laon before we arrived. The accommodation is lovely and was clean. Just be warned that the cottages don\'t have a proper oven, just a microwave with a grill as well as a hob. We brought disposable bbqs which we were very pleased about as our cooking options would have been limited otherwise. We will be back - if only as our elder daughter will never stop asking!
title: Fabulous first Center Parcs experience
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We wanted to have a short break over the spring half term with some friends and thought Center Parcs might be a good option. We looked firstly at Center Parcs in the UK but it seemed expensive so looked at options in France and the Netherlands, which was so much cheaper. We travelled as two families but booked together so we could get apartments next to each other and where allocated apartments on the lake itself. On arrival the first evening we had an explore of the huge location and unloaded the car, this was off peak so there was still a lot of work going on and our apartment smelt as if had been freshly painted, which on a hot day was a little over powering but the apartment was clean and tidy. The onsite supermarket was closed just after 1900 when it was scheduled to be open until 2000 on our day arrival which meant a mad dash to the local carrefour to get some supplies. It is essential that you have some bikes but these are well catered for through onsite hire if you cannot bring your own. We bought bikes for the kids but not us so we hired some. The kids spent loads of time in the swimming pool everyday and we are in a combination of the apartment and restaurants. The options are pretty diverse and we tried the pizza restaurant, the fast food burger restaurant, the crepe restaurant and the slightly posher burger place. All of which catered well to families. There are plenty of activities as you would expect and having prebooked some (which is essential, as booking activities on site seemed a little limited) we had something to do each day. Segway for the dad\'s which was fun, spa for the Mum\'s which they appeared to enjoy and quad bikes for the kids (6,7 and 10 year olds) was more successful for the older kids. On the whole we would probably look to go back in the future and would be open to try other locations in France or the Netherlands, as the cost was so much lower than the U.K.  It was just over a 2 hour drive once we got off the EuroTunnel but it was pretty easy.
title: A great location for a spring break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: rooms need to clean and infested for cobwebs.  homes need to be larger in size , international tourist need english speaking staff. Last there are issues you need to solve and there is no contact details for the same .
title: vacation gone awry
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Beautiful location, lovely decor (both externally and inside the cottages), pretty surroundings.Not many activities (we are used to the activity programmes of CP in the U.K.), garden areas overgrown with weeds (esp around playpark areas), poor opening hours of shops and restaurants, some hygiene issues in the pool (poo-related!!!!!!!), unwelcoming staff in some restaurants (Bar Bowling, I\'m talking to you! We walked out twice because of lack of service), unpleasant smell from drain in kitchen
title: Some great points but some improvement required
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were a family of three, 2 adults with a baby of 6 months.Very easy to get to from Calais and well sign posted.  I recommend the local Carrefour in Laon to stock up on supplies as the onsite shop is quite expensive, which isn\'t surprising.We picked one of the VIP villas (no 347) which had recently been refurbished and it was done to a nice standard.  Ours didn\'t come with any sort of guest guide or instruction manuals so we had lots of trial and error.  However my friends who were staying did have one in theirs, so perhaps ours had got stolen.  The cleaners should check this though! There are plenty of bathrooms plus a sauna.  All was very clean despite other comments I read before arrival.The kitchen is quite small with an electric hob, nescafe dulce gusto, orange juice  maker,microwave oven/grill but no normal oven so pizzas are out! Unless you spend 30EUR for a pizza to be delivered to your room (which my friend advised was cold).  Obviously they want you to eat in the resort which I get however with a baby this can be tricky! The food options aren\'t amazing onsite either.There is also nowhere to put a charcoal BBQ so we just put on the ground which wasnt ideal.  A bricked area like they have in the UK would be better.The lounge has a smart TV where you can plug in usbs great for entertainment.  There are also a few English channels like BBC.There is no air con but despite the heat the villa didn\'t get too hot which was great.  As others have said there are a lot of bugs but that\'s to be expected for a rural location. Just don\'t leave your doors open in the evening  I and you\'ll be fine.  I I took a plug in mossie repellant which seemed to do the job. They also had lovely stray cats who were really cute and looked very well fed!  My husband also spotted a beaver!We hired bikes and a trailer to get around.  It\'s quite a small resort which is perfect for families with small kids as you can get them about easily. Our villa (non lake facing) was only 5 mins ride from the aqua Mondo and main centre which was perfect. My only gripe was they seemed quite lax in letting cars drive around with many parked outside their villas no on arrival day.  I usually love the car free riding at centre parks so they need to clamp down on this, plus it\'s dangerous for children.Aqua Mondo is good, remember a 1 euro coin for the locker. It\'s not a proper swimming pool so you can\'t do lengths or much with a small baby, but they have a toddler pool if they can walk with a sand pit.  Take a sun hat for small babies as the roof lets in a lot of sunlight.We tried the buffet on the last night.  It\'s ok, and quick and easy for families.  The food isnt the best quality but it\'s edible.  My vegetarian friend managed to find a few things to eat despite the language barrier.  I would say it\'s helpful to know some french as English didn\'t seem to be that well spoken.  There also weren\'t many Brits there (a good thing!).With a baby we couldn\'t really do activities but we tried the soft play which was ok.  They could do with a ball pit and air con though.  Somewhere to get drinks too would be good like a cafe, as the bar downstairs was very busy and there are no staff supervising the children.Overall, the cost is much less compared to the UK, however you have a longer drive, potential language issues and fewer activities to do.  For us that was fine as we couldn\'t do a lot with the baby anyway and it was easy to get around.  For older kids or groups of adults it may get a bit boring though.I probably wouldn\'t come again and would stick to the UK sites.
title: Nice villas (VIP) but other activities could be better
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Last year we stayed at Les Bains-Frans, everything was horrible - the staff, the accommodation, the restaurants & even the weather limited the available activities. This year we decided to give Centerparcs one more chance. Glad we chose this park, nice easy route from Calais to Laon. Layout of park is easy to navigate. Staff were a lot more polite and professional. Supermarket closed at 7pm on 1st day so get in early.
title: Pleasantly surprised
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I would definitely recommend this, especially if you can go when French schools are not on holiday. It was not as big as Center Parcs in UK and had more for younger children than older ones, but the price difference was definitely worth the extra travelling. I am not sure I would want to be there in August.
title: Great family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Lac D\'Ailette. We found the staff pleasant and the kids loved their stay. Slightly frustrated to find that no swimming, boating or fishing is allowed on the lake given that our house backed onto it though.Biggest disappointment however is once again, as we found at Trois Forets, the catering is poor value and sloooooow. The Grill restaurant had no steak on day 1 and we gave up on dessert as we had waited so long for the rest, the Italian had no spaghetti on day 2 and was slow, the buffet chef told us they had ice cream but the next day when we went, had none. The food is, in my opinion average, but expensive and takes and age to get hold of (despite affable service). The supermarket is ridiculously overpriced - over 7 euros for Nescafe Dolco Gusto pods that cost 3.5 euros in Carrefour (as an example).In my view, the place is great to go to in spite of the poor catering. The kids loved the pool and we enjoyed ourselves. Great value for money given the facilities and the house.
title: Lovely location, good aqua park but poor catering lets it down.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have just returned from a half term break to this Center Parcs. It was actually cheaper for us to pay the ferry fare and travel from England to stay here, than it would have been for an outrageous price at the English Center Parcs during school half term.The accommodation was far superior, for the price, compared to the English villas.
