The children\'s area in the Aqua Mundo is excellent, but if you are taking a crawling baby, the toddler section has quite a rough floor, so you may need swim shoes and long swimwear for babies. The slides are really good and because there are so many of them, we never had to queue. We all enjoyed the lazy river. My husband said that the rapids are not as good as the English ones, but our little 3 year old grandchild was allowed on, so that was a bonus. The shops seemed to spend a lot of time closed, but the bakery was good. There is a Carrefour about 20 minutes away in Laon. We had a great time here and will probably return if the prices stay favourable.
title: Great accommodation. Brilliant children\'s area in Aqua Mundo, we all loved the slides.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Absolutely top draw! Well appointed accommodation complete with ensuite jacuzzi bath and sauna, Good sized decking area. Have visited several european Centre Parcs, this one has the best villas so far. My twin girls loved it and are looking forward to next year already!
title: Le Lac d\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We came back to Le Lac d\'Ailette for our second year and were not disappointed. We had a renovated cottage which looked brighter and less tired than the cottage we had last year. Our only problem was the bed was a bit hard & there was no drying rack. We learnt from last year there is no oven so took appropriate food. Again we found the staff generally were welcoming & warm & the activities for the children great. Our disappointment again was staff in the restaurants took some time to acknowledge you before coming over. We found all the activities we did great fun and really enjoyed our time here. It\'s easy to get to and a lovely atmosphere.
title: Great place to visit again
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Spent a great four days at this center parcs. Had read some of the negative comments about the staff but found them all to be welcoming and accepting my broken French! Aqua Mundo is excellent and the facilities and activities we did were all very good, in particular the pedalo on the lake.Only downside is the food which is expensive and quite average which is a shame (and the same as the other center parcs) we have stayed at. Although the bakery was very good and it\'s possible to live on bread and cheese alone!!
title: Great half term break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: A little further to travel than the UK parks but excellent value for money and the weather was better! Beautiful scenery and lots to do for the children. Back to basics and back to nature. Used the tunnel to travel to France so a stress free trip.
title: Perfect short break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: First time at this Centreparcs and had a great time, the only issue we had was leaving the family of kittens that we found living under the decking of our cottage, wish we could have brought them home with us. If anyone visits please make sure to take cat food as these kittens were starving and they were so friendly & playful and need looking after
title: Great Time
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We booked a 4 night trip, 29 may - 2 June 2017 at the last minute and were pleasantly surprised at the very reasonable rate (in comparison with U.K. equivalent Center Parcs over half term).The check in was straightforward and we hired bikes and found our lodge without difficulty. The lodges are fairly basic but have everything you need and ours was clean. Beds are comfortable. (If you get a lake/water lodge, be sure to pack mosquito repellents and creams etc). There is no aircon but we weren\'t expecting that, so if you can manage to take fans that would help you during the warmer months.Lots of great activities for children and adults. Aqua Munro excellent, plus the children loved the donkey rides, the cooking and the little animal farm. The pedalos get booked up a long time in advance.Shop has all the basics you need, restaurants are ok if slightly lacking in variety after a while.It\'s an extremely safe and pleasant environment. Staff are helpful although many don\'t speak much English (not a criticism per se).I would recommend this for English travellers over the ones in England. And we shall return.
title: This Center Parcs comes well refommended
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: My family and I stayed here for Easter.  We stayed in a newly renovated comfort cottage which was clean.  The site is hilly in parts but our cottage (245) was not in the hilly area.  The pool area is amazing, it gets busy, but at the busy times we never queued more than five minutes.  We ate in the buffet restaurant one evening and we disappointed with the food choice, too much \u2018childrens\' food.  We are also ate in the Pizza restaurant another night which was fine but nothing special.  The majority of staff spoke English (except the kids club).  There is a supermarket on site but it is very expensive.  The soft play area is fantastic for children.  The market dome lacked atmosphere and was very quiet at night, we had previously been to center parcs de kempervennen which has a lively market dome all day and evening but the market dome at Le Lac d\'Ailette was just too quiet.  There is a kids club but we were told they only speak French so we didn\u2019t use it.
title: Lovely stay and fantastic pool
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our second time to the French Center Parc and we really enjoyed ourselves and perfect for our 3 year old. Whether travelling in a group which we did our first time or as a family on the second visit we found plenty of free activities to do. Off course you can book activities but it wasn\'t needed for our long weekends. The Carrefour at Laon is easy to find and you can stock up in a 20 min drive or buy bread and essentials on site whichever you prefer. Weather was much better than expected but that is the beauty of Center Parcs it didn\'t matter when raining as you just go swimming or chill out in your cottage. Have tried both premium renewed and comfort renewed cottages and really enjoyed both. Near to Reims -50 mins by car so you can pop a champagne tour in as well. Great relaxing holiday-we will definitely be back
title: Had a great time at Le Lac d\'ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: In what is becoming a family tradition, we went for an Easter trip to another European Centreparcs.  We\'ve previously been to De Eemhof and De Kempervennen in The Netherlands, and to Sherwood and Whinfell in the UK: this was our first French Centerparcs.  We really looked forward to this, but became concerned after we read the previous Tripadvisor reviews, some of which were far from complementary.  Fortunately there was nothing to be concerned about - I thought this place was outstanding.We arrived to a very cheerful welcome, and were spoken to in French and in English, and asked which was our preference.  Although I\'m keen to practice my French, I bottled out and allowed the representative to give us a quick induction in English.  This theme continued for the whole trip: I spoke as much French as I could, but if there was ever any difficulty, the staff supported my French learning and always offered to speak English.  All staff were friendly, helpful and approachable.The park is as pleasant and well-maintained as any other centreparcs I\'ve been to, and was in better condition than either of the two Dutch ones I\'d previously visited.  The restaurants are limited, but I can recommend the Italian restaurant and the Grill, both of which were really pleasant.  The Italian offers very good value.  The Aqua Mundo is the best I\'ve been to.The kids (2 boys, aged 10 and 8) tried a variety of activities.  One note of caution regarding the high-ropes course and zip wire: the kids are on their own up there, there are no instructors up in the course.  This often led to confusion, especially for the English kids, but for everyone on occasions.  The zip wire frequently leaves people stranded and dangling, some distance from the end of the wire.  It\'s not much of a problem, once you know what to do, but it takes the fun out of it somewhat.  My kids still went back and did it again the next day.The shop is, as has been previously mentioned, expensive. Try not to compare prices with your local Tesco, instead think about how much money you\'re saving by not going to a restaurant.  You can go to a hypermarket (e.g. in Laon) before you arrive, and you\'ll minimise your expenditure in Centerparcs.All cottages are being refurbished.  We had a choice when booking of paying extra for one which has already been refurbished, or one which had a lake view.  We opted for the lake view (553) and we were happy with our choice.  It was a short walk to the centre, was very close to the football pitch.  If you\'re able to tolerate a bit of paint peeling off the walls, then you\'ll be fine with this.  If not, then choose an upgraded one.  It was small by comparison to other ones I\'ve stayed in, but good enough.  We took a couple of trips out, to Laon and to Reims.  Their both easy to get to, and worth a look around.  There are some nice cycle paths immediately outside the resort, which I took the kids out on each day.I\'ve seen one or two reviews commenting that the staff were unfriendly/hostile to non-French speakers.  I saw none of that.  I tried to speak as much French as I could, and accompanied it with an apologetic smile when I was struggling.  I think making an effort with locals is always important, and this place is no different.  Everyone was friendly.  If you\'re game for a different Centreparcs experience, rather than a run-of-the mill one, then this place will not disappoint.  We loved it!
title: Outstanding
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The location of the cottages at this parc is amazing. Almost on the lake with a beautiful view of the golf course. A wide range of animals (including Beavers!) visited our terrace and garden every day.The AquaMundo is one of the best ones we visited and there are a lot of activities on site. Points to improve (as in all Center Parcs): quality of cleanliness in the cottage, quality of the kitchen equipment, quality of the beds, quality of the food in the restaurants and quality of staff.
title: Nice location for a short holiday break!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We are just on the last night of our stay at this center parcs site. After reading reviews on here we were a bit worried about our decision to visit but we needn\'t have been concerned. We stayed in a refurbished lake view cottage which was both modern and clean. The position overlooking the lake couldn\'t have been beaten especially as we were fortunate enough to have good weather. The cottage was well equipped although the kitchen was small & didn\'t have an oven so you had to be imaginative with what you cooked. The shop on site was well stocked and actually very reasonably priced when compared to the Carrefour in Laon which is the neatest place to shop off site. The bakery on site did great baguettes and croissants. The aqua mundo was much bigger than the pools at the UK sites we have visited. There were lots of slides & plenty to keep my nephew and niece aged 8 and 4 occupied for hours. We got three free activity tokens with our booking, and so tried bowling, badminton and pedals which were all very good. There is a lovely beach area, a children\'s farm, a few playparks and plenty of organised activities. We felt it was better than the UK sites as there was plenty to do without having to spend a fortune on activities. We ate out one evening at the Italian which was very nice, and we felt reasonably priced. A pizza was 10-13 euro each which we felt seemed about the same as you would pay in England. There are a few restaurants to choose from which are all located near the lake and have outside seating, which again we felt was better than the UK sites we had visited. The bar was pretty expensive so this could be improved. There is some entertainment but it is mainly in French so we didn\'t go along to it. All in all, at the end of our trip we feel that we would recommend this site to others & that we would consider visiting again ourselves. We felt it was better value for money than the UK sites we have been to at Elvedon and longleat, and at only a two hour drive from Calais just as accessible. The location around the lake can\'t be beaten & we would highly recommend the lakeview cottages. From this site it looks like there are varying viewpoints but we would say go along and see for yourself.
title: Much better than expected
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed at Center Parcs Lac D\'Ailette in France for a week in the May half term. I have to say it was less than half the price of the UK Parcs and that included the Fuel and Eurotunnel. Prior to arrival I had been trying to get prices for the activities, High Ropes Course, Archery, Quad Biking etc. We called, several times, I emailed, several times, but got no reply. I resorted to Facebook and a cleaner who works at the site emailed me back with some ideas of prices. Never had any contact back from the park. On arrival, all was well, we got our keys, drove to the cottage and unloaded the car, no more than 10 mins later I had a warning posted on my car that it needed to be moved as no cars were allowed in the parc. We had barley unpacked the car. Nether less I moved it, however it was a 20 minute walk back from the very nearest car park space to our cottage, a real shame considering I knew I was going to make a Intermarche (Supermarket) run later that day. Every time we went out of the park to go shopping etc we had to negotiate with the security guys to get back in with the car. On a couple of occasions, we were told no, one occasion saw us carrying several bags of food shopping the 20 mins back to the cottage. The car park really was badly placed and when the 00\u2019ss of day visitors arrived the car park got full quick. Of course we could have hired a golf buggy, but these were 220 Euros for the week!Our cottage was 580, a Premium Cottage for 5/6 people, we travelled with my mum, my wife and our two teenage daughters. The cottage could have done with a clean, floor was gritty and the walls had marks on them, generally it was OK though. We learnt the hard way on the first night not to leave any of the lights on when you go out. We left the landing light on and came back to thousands of midges and flies in the bedrooms, which we spent 1.5hours hoovering up! The cottage was big enough, more than. The kitchen was small and has no Oven, so cooking is limited to the Hob and Microwave. Most people had their own gas BBQ or disposable ones. Its was comfy well laid out, but as I mentioned, could have done with a refurb. We found out in the week that a large number have been refurbed. Our friends went in the summer and had a VIP cottage, aside from free WiFi they got rolls delivered, although they said not enough. They also had a Sauna in the cottage, but only used it once.The parc was great, nice lakes, despite been 20 mins each way the walk to the center of the parc was nice, all landscaped and lots of wildlife. The golf buggies ruined it a bit as they seem to buzz around everywhere and you had to avoid them. The Pool was brilliant, although if you have young kids watch out as the lifeguards seemed disinterested in the groups of teenage lads throwing themselves several at a time down the water flumes or stopping in the middle of them. There were several water slides and a rapid river. The pool generally was quiet about 1.5 hours before closing time. Lunchtimes was almost full to capacity every day.Food wise, we cooked and eat out, can highly recommend the Buffalo Grill in Laon, like a harvester, but much better and such friendly staff, despite my daughter doing A levels I French they all spoke English, we actually had to ask them to speak French to let her practice. There is two big supermarkets in Laon. There\u2019s also an amazing Cathedral, not that we planned it or that we are religious, but its incredibly impressive. The Italian Restaurant was the best we found, service was painfully slow, 1 hour wait for food, but it was fresh and nice. The Grill was a rip off, very expensive and we had a very rude and unhelpful Italian Waiter, working in a French Centre parcs, who spoke very little French and no English, we struggled to order Steak and Chips, I\u2019m pretty sure he was coming to the end of a shift, a bad one, and we got the bac end of it! The All you can eat buffet was pricey, 21 Euros for adults and the food looked like Hospital food on hot plates, we avoided eating here. Drink Wise I was massively disappointed. I bought in the supermarket a 5Litre Keg of Desperados Beer for 12 Euros and a box of Red Wine for 6 Euros. The wine I the bars was around 5 Euros a glass and the Desperados Beer was 7 Euros! Even Heineken was 5.50 Euros, equivalent of about \u00a34.50 at the time! Shocking. On the Tueday night I was thankful of our stash of booze as the bar ran out off all alchaholic drink with the exception of Sparkling Rose and Local Cider! We took our own beer and wine into the bar and no one said a word. We did not advertise it, but we did not hide it either. For a quieter time in the evening sit in the Tropical Dome or upstairs in the kids play area, its huge and was quieter than the bar that seemed to have either Football or Tennis on permanently. The activities were all good, if you hold a driving license I recommend the off road buggy driving, 45kmh 4x4 off Road buggies, really god fun, but you will get dirty. High Ropes was OK, we climb at home so not too exciting for us and the instructors seemed to be letting kids on that clearly did not meet the minimum height, only a problem when they could not reach the next bit!Paintballing was a joke, although it was real Gas powered paintballing guns, I had asked prior as I did not want to do it with my 13 yr old daughter if it was real paintballing. No one told us. It was basically me, my 13yr old, two girls fresh from the gym in gym clothing and two 10ish year old lads, we got put in a team against 7 20 odd year olds on a Rugby tour. After been shot in the head 3 times we quit! I did not get a refund despite complaining as we signed up for Kids paintballing.The Segway tour was great, never done it before, took to it easy, as did everyone else. Just under 1 hour tour of the parc, little bit of off road. Really good fun. We found most of the activities to be pretty pricing for what they were. You may be better off booking in advance was what we were told, but I did not do this as we did not know what we may want to do on any given day, we kind of thought we would wait to see what the weather was like. In comparison Belgium Centre Parcs De Vossemeren seems to be half the price for the same things?VERDICT:All in all, had a good holiday, but would not go back to this Parc. We have booked Belgium for 2017 as friends have been a few times and always rave about it. As a side line I emailed Centre Parcs De Vossemeren, Belgium and have had prices for the activities, all of which are around half the price of France. They also gave me loads of details about the park and accommodation and even recommended various cottages.  TOP TIP: Ask for a Recently Refurbished Cottage. Book your activities on the arrival day, otherwise, as with us, you may find that they are full when you go to book. Stop at the Supermarkets in Laon on the way there to buy food and drink. We snuck a peak into Comfort accommodation and it really was no different, although apparently you had to take your own bedding or pay for it.
title: May 1 Week Family Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We wanted to try something new and we decided to go to Center Parcs in France. We have been many times in Center Parcs in UK. We are not coming again it is just awful. The staff is so rude and not welcoming. They don\'t speak English and they get angry if we ask them something in English. One lady asked me why I couldn\'t speak France. The activities are not good. My daughters went to high ropes and there were no one to help them. My older daughter was left hanging on the zip wire for 5 minutes while we were looking for someone to help her. The cottage is very dirty and the parcs as well. The facility are poor and dirty. Cant wait to go home. The Center Parcs in UK are so much better and so much more organised. The staff there is so polite and helpful. It made me appreciate it more. I wouldn\'t recommend it to anyone.
title: Awful Center Parcs in France
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: First visit to the Domaine du Lac s\'Ailette after a couple of visits to Bois aux Daims.The lakeside location is great, especially if you have a lake-side cottage. Ours was about an 800m walk to Aquamundo along the lake-front and the back of the beach so we didn\'t need bikes or a golf cart but the place is big and the farthest cottages are a long way out.Cottage:We had a 4 person lakeside VIP cottage but not one of the new design versions. Reading some of the other reviews this had me nervous but although the paint on the balustrade was peeling, and there were some wobbly doorhandles and creaky hinges, most of the interior and furnishings were in good shape for a rental. Beds and bedding were comfortable.Our veranda was right on the lake with a coot\'s nest a few meters out. Ducks, including a dozen tiny ducklings, swans, and a large coypu (rangondin in French) were regular visitors, and there were swallows overhead, and grebes further out in the lake.A word of warning - the cottage can get hot pretty quickly and being on the lake there are plenty of insects about. If you\'re going to open things up to cool down you\'ll probably need some kind of anti-mosquito plug-in (which they don\'t sell in the shop).Aquamundo:Aquamundo was excellent. Lazy river is long and tranquil. Outdoor pool section a bit small but nice and sunny and with extra-warm water. The indoor pool is standard Center-Parcs with waves on the hour (for a couple of minutes). The crazy river is great fun as long as it\'s not too crowded.There are around 8 slides in the main section - 3 reached by dedicated steps, three going from a pool just below the crazy river, one starting beside the crazy river entrance and one half way down the crazy river. None are extreme - all rated either over 6 or over 8 years old - so kids can have great fun on these. Maybe a little tame for thrill-seekers but good fun still. There is a dedicated section of the dome for toddlers with more slides.In terms of crowding things can get pretty busy but not unbearable. During the local school holidays families arrive en-masse from the 10am opening. Lunchtime can get a bit quieter and an hour or so before closing seemed to be a good time as by then many families on day trips had burnt-out and left for the day. Lots of locals visit Aquamundo at the weekends and during the local school holidays. If you can avoid the local school holidays it will be less crowded, at least on weekdays.NB: You need 1 Euro coins for the lockers. The biggest lockers are only big enough for maybe two people\'s stuff.Facilities:Service at the main desk (to book activities) was very quick. On our previous Center Parcs visits in summer the queues were enormous for this but in the Easter Holiday here there never seemed to be queues to book activities. Whether this is due to the time of year or the site staffing levels I don\'t know, but it was a pleasant surprise.The on-site shop has a pretty good range of stuff but prices are around double the going rate.The Italian restaurant has plenty of choice. Service when we were there (Easter school holidays) was friendly and lightning fast lunchtime and evenings. No shortage of tables.Smaller kids can enjoy the artificial sand beach by the lake. The sand is fine and clean and there\'s plenty of room. There\'s an little place at the top of the beach for drinks and ice creams. Only complaint was that this closed too early (it\'s a beautiful spot to be at sunset) and was closed all Sunday afternoon.
title: Easter holiday visit

review: After many good times in the UK we tried this Location and whilst it has the potential to great and the lake is fab it\'s really let down by ancient cottages and facilities that need replacing (i.e. The swimming pool has some outside doors where the handles have rusted off).
title: Overtraded and in need of updating!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: the cottage VIP is impressive with everything you can imagine for all family memebers even the young one. all the activity are attractive and there are nice water slide to try. in spring the activities are maybe less numerous due to constant bad weather but except for monday (where the staff probably rest) there is an activity to do (party, karaok\u00e9, quizz etc..). it\'s perfect to cut from reality and have nice holydays.
title: home sweet home
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: In my opinion much better than our previous U.K. Experience of Centre Parcs and if you live in Kent it\'s just 2 hours 15 mins from Calais. We went as a family group: grandparents,grandchild and parents and the accommodation was clean, lovely and warm and felt quite spacious. The check in was outstanding on a terrible wet evening and cottages were well signposted. Hope to go again next year as swimming outside in January and feeling warm whilst doing so definitely made me smile. Only 45 mins from Reims so fitted a champagne tour in as well and very good supermarket at Laos. Suited the needs of our toddler well.
title: Very pleasant time at Center Parcs Le Lac d\'Aillette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I had good memories about center parc but this time...Cottages were dirty and smelled like cigarettes. The oven was not working (but they changed it quite quickly, which was a good point).We rented 2 cottages, the size of the both were not comparable. There was1.5km between the 2 cottages (because I forgot to tick the 40 euros box to be beside).The manager was really rude when we asked her to help to figure it out some solution.After 2 days of negociation, they finally allowed us to use the car. But unfortunately when my friends came back to take back the car, 2 wheels were deflated. The security guy already knew it and didn\'t help. By magic the next day wheels were inflated. I think this is irresponsible and dangerous behavior from the park to do that. Fortunately no harm was done.
title: Very disappointing
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I have spent three days at this center parc during Christmas. Cottage (Premium 8 persons) was good, but a new mattress would be great. The lake is beautiful, and I have appreciated the Aqua mundo. At 2 hours of Paris, it is a good destination for a Family\'s week end..
title: Good but some improvements would be great...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Nice place to go but a little expensiveGreat time with kids they were very happy I recommend u to take some towels with u because there isnt any even  for shower The nature is astonishing u will love it Take extra money with u everything is expensive and be careful no cars are allowed inside the village so u have to walk or rent a golf cart for 90\u20ac per day
title: Good trip
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have had a great stay, but the maintenance of the cottages and the cleanliness of the cottage are very poor. The cottages are very nice! We had a VIP-cottage, but we have had issues with the kitchen (the dishwasser was full of DIRTY dishes of the previous renters and the dishwasher was loose in the cupboard - the control panel of the extracor was hanging looser, lights were not working), the bathrooms (1 shower didn\'t have the holer to hold the showerhead, the other contained hairs in the bath tub), the bedrooms .... again hairs on our clean sheets and webs of dust at the ceilings. And the living room ... Again these webs of dust, broken doorposts all over the cottage, the tv falling out in the middle of films/programs/shows ...
title: Great Park ... but the maintenance is low ...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We paid for a Premium Lodge next to the water. The access to the water was via brambles and the waters edge was full of scum and smelt. No animals came anywhere near the lodge probably because of that! The lodge was dirty, stained walls and desperately needed a new coat of paint and some filler on the cracks in the walls and ceilings. Rooms very basic, but beds seemed clean. Bathroom was dirty and I ended up cleaning it. Bugs round all the windows, cobwebs in every room. our package included towels and kitchen pack - no towels and kitchen pack was 3 dishwasher cubes and a tea towel. Wifi however was strong and thank god we had that as 90% of the village was closed. No indoor sports available all weekend, bowling very busy as one of the only things open. Caf\u00e9 never opened. Buffet and Italian restaurant only ones open all weekend - these were good but very busy and slow service (max 3 waiting staff per place) Aqua area nice but again very busy as nothing else really to do. Not like the other CP trips we have had in Belgium, France and UK... I would suggest going to a different park.
title: Untidy, Unkept and not up for the UK Standard
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We\'ve stayed at most of the uk Center Parcs and 2 in holland. One De Eemhoff, our favourite, we love! However this is by far the best European CP yet in our opinion! 2.5 hours drive from Dunkirk. Much nicer experience than Calais. And DFDS nicer ferries with huge kids areas!! We read other reviews before our trip, and were worried about the chalets being scruffy and dirty etc so we booked a newly refurbished one. Number 208! We were pleasantly surprised with our chalet upon arrival. Modern and clean. There was lots of dust however behind the doors of every room, didn\'t cause us a problem, but it was nice. Had a new feeling to it! The kitchen area was very small but adequate. There was loads of glasses and cups and plates etc. But only 2 cereal bowls. 4 knives and forks and 6 teaspoons!! 3 steak knives were the only chopping knives plus a bread knife. So cutting potatoes and carrots was tricky! We hired a golf buggy which was pricey but huge fun, our kids loved it! It\'s quite hilly so we didn\'t miss the bikes. The dome is very modern compared to other European Parcs we\'ve been to. And whilst not quite up there with uk standards it\'s the best we\'ve experienced in Europe by far! We didn\'t eat out there so can\'t comment on their restaurants. The aqua mundo is fantastic. The best yet! Great lazy river that goes on for miles and outside! Rapids were quite tame but also very rapid like!! With sections going off in different directions and slides too. Which brings me to the subject of slides. There must be about 10! All brilliant and for all the family. The French are more relaxed and families of 5-6 were all going down at once. Lots of happy laughing people landing in heaps in the pool! So nice to see! The showers are hit and miss as some freezing and they all need descaling as they shoot out all over the place! Yet again never enough family cubicles! Park supermarket is great. Some things overpriced but to be expected. The rotisserie seemed very popular so we got a chicken on the last night but our 5 resident cats got most of it as it was VERY under cooked and pink! \u20ac12.50 each but we didn\'t fancy taking it back! Plus it was raining! We stopped at a supermarket Grand Frais in Laon on the way. It was the best supermarket we\'ve ever been to. If they had it in the uk I\'d shop there everyday!!! There are loads of activities to do for kids. Horse riding, bungee trampoline, paint balling, quad biking, geo cashing, zip wires, climbing, a huge jump, mini golf plus more. Our son chose to do a bungee trampoline. Upon arrival we were ignored for sometime. 20 minutes in fact while we watched loads of people getting on and off. Supposed to be a 10 minute slot but it seemed like a particular few were on for 20 minutes. By which time we were told by the extremely rude member of staff that we were too late. The seemed in our eyes to get pleasure in letting others in and looking at us like \'hahaaaaa losers\' if it was for me I wouldn\'t have minded but my 7 year old son was very upset. When the next person finished I barged my way onto a trampoline and she stood in front of us shouting NO NO NO!!!! The people around weren\'t helpful at all either as their kids bounced for 30 minutes. This awful woman was called Charline. (We\'ve since noticed that she\'s normally with the horses. Watch out for her!) We complained to the outdoor activity desk and the very nice chap gave us a refund. My son was too upset to go back. Not what you expect on holiday. And he let us play mini golf for free and we had huge fun! He also agreed with us that she was very rude but what can he do?! I hope her managers see this. I treated myself to a massage! It was wonderful in the spa by a lovely girl called Rebecca. I could have stayed all day! The girl on the spa desk called Lucie was lovely and very helpful finding me the right treatment!! It wasn\'t cheap though \u20ac148! But I deserved it! My son and husband used the spa on Sunday morning. Between 10-12 when kids over 8 are allowed in they loved it! We can\'t wait to go back!!
title: Best centre Parcs yet!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We\'ve stayed at a number of Center Parcs villages before, the styling of the cottages at Le Lac d\'Ailette made this a little different. and will allow the holiday to stand out in our memories. The Aquamundo pool complex was excellent with a large number of water slides. Even when the pool area was very busy waiting times for slides was only short.
title: Autumn half term holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Our second stay here. Easiest was to review this is probably pros and tips to avoid the cons:Pros:1.\tYounger kids will love the pools, slides, beach and the numerous activities (pony rides, bowling etc). I suggest adults release their inner child and enjoy it too2.\tThe resort has not felt that busy when we have visited, we have always done the Mon \u2013 Fri in the last week of August; minimal queues for slides and no sense of crowding3.\tAccommodation is functional and comfortable. We have stayed in the basic units both times and found them perfectly adequate. The TV has an SD card slot in it, so you can take movies for the kids to watch in the evening. There are also UK TV channels this year.Tips (to avoid the cons):1.\tThe resort is quite spread out, look for the resort map online before you book and then reserve the chalet that suits your mood for walking, costs a bit extra but well worthwhile \u2013 it can be quite hilly for the little ones2.\tRe the hills, the roads are a little bumpy, so watch your little ones on bikes and scooters3.\tThe supermarket in resort is brutally expensive, so drive through Laon on your way and stock up, that way you can drive your groceries to your doorstep on arrival rather than carrying them back from the resort supermarket every day4.\tProvision of equipment in the chalets can be variable. You should be provided with everything you require to prepare and serve a family meal. If you can\u2019t then things are missing, report it and it gets sorted pretty quickly.
title: The kids will love it
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Came back here 7 years later with the children now 10 and 8 years age.Most of the place has been well looked after and looked the same. Lots more activities now than before,maybe noticeable because the children are now older.Plenty to keep all ages entertained,people and staff were very friendly creating a nice atmosphere. Many places to eat,especially recommend the pizza place were the service was outstanding and friendly.Fire work display which is held weekly was fabulous and the games room had plenty to do,only concern was there was no air conditioning to stay cool.There are plenty of places to get snacks,ice creams and drinks.Accommodation was nice and clean,with plenty of space.Supermarket was well stocked up always,with plenty of fresh fruit.Only bit not to boast about was the farm,could do with more animals.
title: Summer holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Had a lovely week here at the end of August. Beautiful setting. A very relaxing time. We had a lakeside cottage and it made our holiday. Enjoyed the wildlife and the peacfull views. Tried to eat once in the Italian restaurant..had to wait ages to be seated and then no one came to take our order so we left after 25 mins sitting. The only other gripe we had was that the cottage could do with an update. We chose to eat out in Laon and use the cheaper  supermarkets there which are better stocked and much cheaper.
title: Better than expected
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Very dated accommodation and despite paying a lot extra for a lake view, it was completely hidden by trees and hedging which also meant the patio and garden area didn\'t get any sunshine. Good swimming pool complex.
title: Very dated accommodation and no lake view !
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed in this park for a week in September. 3 children ages 11/10 and 8. We had a fantastic time. The aqua mundo is amazing and the park is beautifully maintained. Shops and restaurants are expensive so do a huge shop in laon before you go.Laon is about 20 mins away) Friday got busy for the weekend but we practically had the whole park to ourselves during the week. Would definitely go back.
title: Beautiful place
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I have been going to Centreparcs in the UK at least once a year for the last 30 years but we decided to try France this year.Mixed feelings really, we booked a VIP villa on the lake 507 for the week.When we entered we were disappointed, after reading other reviews about the cleanliness I was just hoping we were not one of the unlucky people with a dirty villa. There were cobwebs everywhere , the floor was covered with thousands of little hairs , the side table in the lounge had not been cleaned for months , there were door handles missing, screws sticking out from the walls, paint off the doors in the hall, the parasol outside was broken with spikes sticking out , one of the floor boards outside on the patio was raised so a health and safety issue. This was concerning as these things could of caused harm.We went to reception to point these issues out but there were rows of people there so the wait would of been hours.We decided to get the bleach out and clean the villa ourselves.After a really disappointing start we fell in love with the lake and that really made the holiday.The weather was great which also helps. We tried a few of the restaurants in the park but found them below average so we eat out in Laon every night. There are a few lovely restaurants overlooking the cathedral.To summaries, wish I had the money to transform this place it has so much potential and I urge Centerparcs to give it some TLC , firstly make it safe and secondly review the cleaning procedures with tighter checks and standards.However we would return just because of the beauty of the lake but with a car full of cleaning supplies a hammer and a tin of paint.
title: Could be so much better.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a great 5 day break at Le Lac. We have been to Centerparcs in the UK a number of times so this is the first time we ventured to a European one. At the end of August there is a lot of availability and prices are very competitive, way cheaper than the UK ones for the same summer holiday timeframe. The set up is exactly the same as the Uk ones and this parc has an excellent water area with lots more chutes and slides than I recall at the UK ones. We spent a lot of time in there - weather was a few degrees warmer than in the UK at the same time too. The restaurants were good too, especially the Italian one and service was really friendly. I was able to get by with my franglais! One day we popped in to Reims to see the champagne houses - it was only 40 minutes or so. The drive from Calais to the parc was just over 2 hours so not too bad at all. And the mattress? Shocking - the most uncomfortable few nights sleep I have ever had - soggy and horrible. Pillows were huge and similarly uncomfortable. They are upgrading all cottages so hopefully new mattresses for 2017? Let\'s hope so because this is the only reason I didn\'t give 5 stars. Otherwise, great stuff.
title: Terrible mattress but otherwise great!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Very good family holiday with lots of activities. Nice to be able to go back to your own house. Much better value than the Center Parcs in the UK. Easy to travel to. Relaxed atmosphere and a pleasant holiday.
title: Great for the family
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a lovely summer holiday to this centre parcs, really easy to get too once on the French motorway. Straightforward and no hiccups. Arrival was smooth and the location of the cottage was great. We chose a VIP lake view cottage. Location was excellent, cottage size and layout was fine, however cleaning standard was not that great, (dusty skirting boards and the cottage needed a good air) apart from that it was lovely. Towel package won\'t see you through the week, bring own. The swimming pool was amazing as we\'re all the other activities. Nearest supermarket was 20 minute drive again straight forward and there was a macdonalds there too for the kids. Really good active family holiday but with time to relax too.
title: Really lovely family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We enjoyed our stay and our accommodation was really good. Booked a VIP cottage on the lake and had the added bonus of the otter family and water wildlife. Loved to sit out on the veranda and watch the otters and birds. Very relaxing.
title: Lovely time
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Weather definitely helps and we had a hot,sunny week in our recently renovated two-storey villa. Superb Aqua Mundo with loads of slides and a good sized outside area. We spent half a day there followed by half a day playing with our dingy in the lake. Very easy 2 1/2hr drive from Calais. Only gripe was that they do not enforce the \'car-free village\' rule. People seemed to be driving around freely, even on non-changeover days. Otherwise, a brilliant family holiday for the price and we would definitely go back.
title: Fab family break within easy reach of Calais
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just visiting centreparks. Positives: beautiful countryside, well equipped supermarket, amazing swimming pool, really positive staff (except a blonde lady selling delivery to cottage stuff - rest assured you will need to spend at least 45 minutes trying to figure out where your order was.... That\'s a Very crap part of holiday in CP related to staff. Luckily the other member of the staff, despite they were already closed, arranged us a replacement pizzas and an apology present, which made it a bit better, thx to Her this review is more positive - FYI management ;))Negatives:1. The cottage was not cleaned, never mind spiderweb in the kitchen and missing lamps, cutlery was also missing :))) for 6 people cottage we got... 4 knifes and 2 forks :) if you are not an authentic Indian food gourme, it\'s a bit of a fuss...2. Broken vacuum cleaner in case you are not happy with a spiderwebs- literally in 2 pieces3. Mirror in a bedroom covered with a window cleaning sprey not wiped away 4. On arrival you got: 3 tablets and 2 kitchen towels - please do bring your own stuff, otherwise you\'ll have to buy a litre of dish washing liquid and a1,5 litre bottle of any cleaning sprey you need :))) a bit extensiveHowever we did go for a not renewed cottage, so we can\'t complain :)
title: Well... We will be back :)
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great place to stay, beautifully designed village with a great swimming pool and lake. Reminded me of New England. Much better looking properties than those in the UK. Looking forward to going back someday.
title: Centre Parcs France
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: 5th visit since 2008, booked a refurbished lake view villa, if by refurbished you mean a very quick lick of white paint and a few bits of new furniture then yes it\'s refurbished but still basic cleaning is so poor the floors hadn\'t been cleaned between guests our feet were black from the dirt it was in every room, we had to hoover and wipe the floors as we had a 5 month old baby and couldn\'t put him down. Bathrooms were moldy still and lights showing wires. Kitchen was more basic than before the cutlery in the draw was dirty. Public areas are still dirty the clumps of dust in the dome area really do need to be cleaned daily, you see cleaners but they just slosh dirty water about in their attempt to clean, staff do not come across happy at all. Outside pool area again was dirty, we sat in the same area for 3 days and the cigarette butts were in the same place each day..yes it\'s a non smoking area but the French just laugh when told it\'s no smoking at one point we were surrounded by 18 people smoking in an area for about 25 people! This area wasn\'t cleaned once while we were there apart from emptying the bin. We thought we would give it a go again after last year as they had refurbished but I don\'t think we will go again maybe it\'s better to drive a little further to one of the newer sites. Over all the activities are much cheaper than in the UK and each time we have been more has been added but they just need to look at maintaining what they have first and GET SOME NEW CLEANERS OR MAYBE MANAGEMENT NEED TO OPEN THEIR EYES TO THE BASICS.
title: Dirty - Such a basic thing that they can\'t get right
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Very cheap holiday when booking however activities aren\'t very cheap. Sports facilities extremely poor - more like a rubbish youth club. 10 euros for 30 mins of tennis or badminton on a concrete floor in a grey building with no air con and an old net is not center parcs quality. Used to the plush surroundings and nice courts. No air con anywhere not even in the centre. We had very hot weather and it was unbearable. Villa cramped and not cleaned at all well - mainly the floors. Beach and lake beautiful and lots of beach activities but rest is a let down.
title: Disappointing -  not center parcs quality
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Environment and water park are very good. Where the restauration is over priced for the quality it has. grocery store and bakery overpriced for the quality. Get ready to pay. Most of the shops close very early, so plan to buy things during the day not in the evening when returning back to your cottage.
title: Environment good. Restauration poor
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Pleasant stay at le lac d\'ailette. As previous reviews expressed the cottages do need updating. My mattress was particularly worn and uncomfortable to sleep on. The decor is dated and there is no oven in the kitchen. But we managed to cook meals using the hob and microwave. Our kids aged 6 yrs, 4yrs and 6 months old had a lovely time. The aqua Mundo being a firm favourite.. We spent hours splashing about. We enjoyed bike rides around the site which was a nice size.. Lots of hills though.. So our 4 year old who has recently learned ended up pushing her bike up quite often. The baby enjoyed the trailer though which was padded and comfortable. The staff on the front desk were very friendly and helpful. I have limited French (which was propped up using the google translate app.. Yes very basic). I tried to use a few phrases and they were very patient with my lame attempt at the language and alway happy to help.We even "popped" to Disneyland for the day (it\'s just under 2 hrs away) Would stay there again.. But maybe uograde to VIP or a refurbed cottage as the mattress was pretty bad.
title: The cottages are tired and need updating otherwise I would have awarded 5*
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After reading previous reviews I was really worried about our booking, however there were lots of positives. I travelled as a family group with a 16 9 and 8 year old as well as my husband. We stayed for a week from Saturday to Saturday during the last week of August beginning of September.Negatives Arrived and our towel order hadn\'t - chased it down three times by phone (at huge cost) and still didn\'t receive despite promises they were on their way.  I finally got them on the Sunday after complaining to receptionOrdered a delivery of food to our lodge on the Saturday as we were tired from our journey.  Ordered around \u00a3100 worth of food to be delivered between 7 and 8pm.  Half the order arrived gone 8pm and the rest didn\'t arrive until 9.20pm - we were not impressed Villa carpets are old and could do with refreshingPark seemed to be expensive and food choices limitedPositivesWe stayed in a VIP villa right by the lake and the views were stunning and as we had such lovely weather we were able to sit out in the evenings and enjoy the views and the animalsBeach area was lovelyPool was great and had a lovely outdoor areaBowling alley was perfect for the childrenThere was no cars around at all - lots of karts but all well behavedMini golf was funTreetop adventure was enjoyedWe would go back but would be more aware of how expensive it is on site (much more than kempervennen).All in all a nice relaxed week
title: Lovely relaxing trip
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Parc facilities were really fantastic. Aqua Mundo, the water park, was first rate and we could have spent all day there. Although we booked premium standard, the cottage was pretty basic. We opted for a lake-view cottage, which would have been lovely, but the 8 erstwhile welcome swallows nests, under the patio eaves, created mounds of poo that no amount of cleaning, apparently, could shift prior to our arrival. Not sure that explained the dirt and cobwebs on the recliners though. We all know CP take liberties with pricing, but it really hurts to pay well over 3 quid for small bottle of coke. I really disliked feeling like I was being taken advantage of. Customer service left a lot to be desired - when it\'s sweltering in the main building, proving an AC unit that you point only at your staff, while your customers melt does not give the best impression.I\'ve recorded cleanliness as poor, but it should be clarified that the site was faultless.
title: Could have been perfect
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Lovely parc and fairly flat for a wheelchair user. The cottage we had however was described as a premium cottage, the carpet was filthy, and the plastic garden furniture was dirty which we cleaned ourselves. Other cottages seemed more up to date and had wicker furniture. A mop in the shower area would have helped to avoid dragging wetness through the cottage.
title: Wheelchair cottage
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed at this center parcs during the last week of August the weather was beautiful and so was the site, we had a 2 bedroom vip cottage 601 which was in a perfect location about a 5 minute walk from the center and in a very good state of repair we had two bedrooms both ensuite plus an extra toilet and a sauna, the onsite facilities were great we spent a lot of time swimming, we also hired a pedalo and played both types of golf which were really well kept my husband and son went on a buggy ride which they both enjoyed, we ate at the grill restaurant which was lovely and we ate at the buffet restaurant twice once for dinner and once for breakfast both were nice but nothing special. We also did a shop at the supermarket before we arrived so stocked up, we also visited Astrix parcs for the day which was great.
title: Great family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: First time at a European Centre Parcs and very pleasantly surprised. Some mixed reviews on here so we went expecting a few disappointments but it exceeded our expectations.We booked early and got a good deal including picking our cottage (went for a VIP lakeside cottage for four in zone 6) and got a few free activities (opted for table tennis and bowling). Our accommodation was fab...jacuzzi bath, sauna, wrap around veranda. Three bathrooms, towels and bedding etc on arrival....I think from reviews it\'s worth the upgrading and this cottage particularly good for us as the decking was fenced, a must with an inquisitive 3 year old who loved the ducks, moorhens and water rats coming up to our decking in the hope of a feed.We took our inflatable kayak, bikes.... and after reviews went armed with pillows, mugs and a slow cooker though I didn\'t really feel we needed the latter-pillows seemed fine, we had large teacups and a hob and microwave oven. A pleasant surprise too was to have a dishwasher with three tablets supplied. In places the furniture and cupboards looked a touch worn and the twin rooms sink was v slow to drain but comparable to UK Centre Parcs gripes this was minor and didn\'t deter from our holiday. We had cottage 621, from the map and exploring the site zone 6 and 5 are well placed for the centre/beach and other well placed lakeside cottages with similar privacy/great open views would be 493, 608, 658, 726/728. All the cottages looked very pretty, New England style painted frontages, as mentioned in other reviews the site is quite vast and spread out....I kayaked a lot of the lake and biked all around so plenty to explore. Lots of play areas dotted around, farm animals, a great little water play area by port and for older kids skate parks, outdoor decks...plus for those with budding footballers a fab interactive football wall.We booked as a treat the spa and for around 30 euros had 2 hours use of lovely spa....jacuzzis, steam room, sauna and salt room plus herbal teas and loungers. Very relaxing and stylish. We also paid for pony riding and zip wire...both reasonably priced compared to UK. Only downside of zip wire was it was very high up and after initial Tuition pretty much left to it!! At times it was physically difficult for my 8yr old to move the carabenas and manage the climbing....a member of staff at each platform would have been better as lots struggled. The aqua Mundo was great, kids loved it (aged 3 and 8)....lots of slides, lazy river, play areas etc. Was busy especially at the weekend but never queued for too long for the slides.We didn\'t really shop onsite....went into the Intermarche in Laon, about 20 mins drive but nice to get off site....as expected the onsite shops expensive. We ate out twice the better of the two restaurants was the Italian....nice pizza/pasta. Lots to do and a well laid out site, the beach area was nice....it is a lake though and a few algae blooms so didn\'t feel great swimming out into the lake but great for paddling and chilling in the beach. All the staff all seemed to speak English though I can speak a little French so this wasn\'t an issue. Overall a great holiday....we struck lucky with the weather, heat wave on arrival so mid 30s was too hot to go off biking, settled down to mid to late 20s. Had it been cooler we would have explored more of the locality cycling as there are a few paths off site. I would recommend it as easy to get to from Calais-straight forward toll motorway drive most of the way. We also went to Disney one day (2hrs away).Great centre Parcs and well placed.
title: A great active family break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Cottages are in the process of being renovated - our one looked a bit tired so obviously hasn\'t been done yet, which is fine, but that doesn\'t excuse dirty floors and a dirty kitchen sink.On the whole, we had a good week though, and may return one day.
title: Premier Lakeside Cottage
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The location of this Centre Parcs is beautiful, lake & beach make it very special for all ages. The one thing that I wish I had known before booking is that this is a very large park. We have been lucky to have a cottage quite near the centre, but you need to bring your bikes or budget to hire some equipment. Offer is large from bikes to buggies - we have paid 166e for 4 days, but could not have managed without it, having a group member with walking difficulties. The pool is smaller than we have in UK and with so many cottages we think that it can get very crowded when weather is bad. We have been lucky to have great weather and have spent most of the time on the beach/lake. It is possible that we return to this location another summer.
title: Big parc - hills up and down. Think Bike or Buggy if you have children or elderly
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: we spent a week in late August, we have been several times to this park & the weekend is always extremely busy, from Monday onwards the park is a lot quieter and feels more like a relaxing holiday. the VIP cottage by the lake is just fantastic and if you get some sunshine the beach area is great for digging holes and making sandcastles. the real gem is the aqua-mundo water park, the slides are great for kids of all ages.
title: Activity week for the family
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our first stay at Le Lac d\'Ailette, but 4th stay at a European based Centerparcs. 4 nights including August Bank Holiday Monday, and probably half the price of a similar UK trip, even with Eurotunnel costs. We stayed in Premium Lakeview - a family of 5, with one additional teenage friend. 4 bedroom, two bathroom (plus additional toilet) worked really well. Kitchen well equipped and everything clean on arrival. Aesthetically I think this is the loveliest Center Parcs site - massive lake and lots of coloured cottages (including 2 storey ones) - not the concrete toilet block looking things that we\'re used to. Aqua Mundo a hit with everyone (the rapid and slides weren\'t quite as rapid as some other Center Parcs) but still a lot of fun. We did additional paid activities of high ropes and canoeing  - all pretty good value for money, and the high ropes in particular was a great course (better than some we\'ve seen at other center parcs location). We booked the holiday on-line which is all fairly straightforward. They have a system of "toppings" whereby you get some extras basically, including being able to choose cottage location. You can pre-book activities, although confusingly not some key ones, . However - we had no problem booking everything we wanted to do whilst on site. We didn\'t use any of the on-site restaurants, and only bought a couple of things from the on site shop. Another reviewer had helpfully mentioned that there\'s an big Carrefour on the outskirts of Laon - but it\'s about 20 mins drive away - so worth one big shop - bearing in mind you can\'t drive your car to the cottage other than on arrival and departure day (there is a shopping trolley provided). Other reviewers had mentioned that things were in bad repair - didn\'t notice that - I think our cottage was relatively recently refurbished. Our decking was slightly broken and there was a slight blockage in one basin - we reported both but they weren\'t fixed during our stay - that was the only slight downer - and although the accommodation was definitely clean - I\'m sure there were a few stray corners that could have been cleaned a bit more thoroughly. This Center Parcs site seems quite spread out (3.7 miles round the perimeter roads - I ran it!) - depending on your location you could be a good walk away from the Aqua Mundo and the lake / beach. We took bikes and scooters. Great holiday - all 6 of us genuinely had a good time.
title: Beautiful setting. Great value active and relaxing holiday and loads cheaper than Center Parcs UK!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Where do I start? ....Customers expect what is promised, sadly not here!!Cottage - very uncomfortable, very dirty & with 3 electrical items (dishwasher, nespresso & toaster) didn\'t work. Reported - not fixed. What\'s the point of a premium cottage?Bikes - It was very difficult to find 3 that were roadworthy & maintained. At 51 euro for the week EACH in that condition, far too expensive.Wifi - Far too expensive via KPN centreparc hotspots, especially when 3 party providers can be used cheaper! Boing & FON etcAqua Mundo - External guests can pay to get into the pool = ATROCIOUSLY BUSY, what\'s the point of a swimming paradise when its jam packed with no where to swim in the pool ...or sit down out of the pool.Customer Desks - Far too busy, lots of people complaining!How about providing more staff & making the process more efficient, or provide more desks.Be careful selecting a premium Lakeside cottage (at a premium price), it doesn\'t mean you will get a lakeVIEW - lots of lakeside cottages on the lake have trees & shubbery islands blocking a lakeVIEW.For the facilities & experience received at the price point offered, CENTERPARCS need to do MUCH MUCH better. Shockingly expensive for an experience I could have got far better elsewhere.I recommend booking elsewhere unless you wish you & your family to be extremely disappointed.
title: Really DISAPPOINTING stay!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a good week at this Center Parc location. According to the website when booking it is in the process of being update and some cottages have already been done. If you are ok with a slightly older design and a bit of wear and tear then the unrenovated cottages are ok, if not for a slight cost increase a renovated cottage can be booked.The pool was our favourite feature with plenty of slides, a lazy river, a white water slide, wave pool and a kids water play area offering plenty to do.Pros- Good Lakeside situation- Good selection of activities to keep everybody busy- Laon nearby is good for a day trip to the old town- Good quality food delivery- Big pool with lots to do- Cottage had good facilities and was lakeside- Beach was good- Resturants have a good selection of food- Children enjoyed the kids show and disco- Well stocked bakery and shop on site for essentials and daily fresh food- Lake based activities were fun - Kids particularly enjoyed the tree top activity - Good road links to EurotunnelCons- Cottage needs renovation (which is in progress)- Some areas need updating (which seemed to be in progress)- Resturants are good but a little bit over priced- Kids playgrounds were only okOverall I would reccomend the location, we had a good trip at a reasonable price.
title: Summer Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just got back from a week in cottage number 41. This is a 4 bed VIP cottage that was situated within a 5-10 minute walk from the main hub. We opted not to have lake side as we wanted some outside space for our young children. I don\'t believe this is a newly renovated cottage, and we didn\'t pay the extra for one. I must say, we were really pleased with the accommodation, it was spacious and clean. There were areas that could do with a touch up with some paint, but certainly nothing that would detract from overall feel. Wrapped around two sides was a lovely secluded deck area looking out into woods (the beach was also visible through an opening) - see photos. The outside furniture was rattan chairs, table and sun loungers - all of good quality and felt quite new. There was a sauna in the back, but we were blessed with scorching weather, so it wasn\'t used. As for the rest of the park, it was great. Amazing aqua centre with loads of slides, a lazy river, rapids and outside pool. We were in it every day and the kids loved it. There\'s loads of activities to choose from and were reasonably priced. The supermarket was convenient but expensive. The restaurants were expensive with food that was reasonable. We did visit the hypermarket in Laon, it\'s about a 20 minute drive, definitely worth stocking up on food,  beer and wine for your whole stay as it\'s quite cheap but it was a little stressful and chaotic, so I wouldn\'t recommend making multiple trips. Staff at the park were always helpful and through broken English and my abysmal French, we communicated well and it was nice to see they appreciated my efforts. Overall, we had a great week. Perfect place for children and would definitely come back again.
title: A brilliant week
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a great week at Le Lac d\'ailette. There was lots to do for our children (aged 4 and 7).  The swimming pools (like all center parcs) were fantastic with a brilliant water house... but be careful the first time the bucket tips... one of our boys never really recovered from his first soaking.  There were plenty of other free activities including the brilliant baluba indoor play. We found the paid activities quite expensive but enjoyable nonetheless.  Partly due to the exchange rate the park was overall quite expensive but the accommodation was a lot cheaper than the UK parks.  Our house (premium) was very tired, particularly the carpets in the bedrooms. Please don\'t expect the accommodation to be as good as a woodland style lodge in the UK.  It didn\'t matter too much for us... we mostly just slept and ate in the lodge! My tips would be to pop to a supermarket before arriving. The park shop is over priced. I also recommend coming prepared for any food allergies... gluten-free was not well catered for.  Come prepared with some basic French phrases too!  We had a great week, the kids loved it and the lake was beautiful.
title: Great facilities but tired accommodation
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After booking the holiday I became really concerned that we were going to be disappointed with our accommodation and the cleanliness of the resort. But I must say I shouldn\'t have worried, we had a VIP cottage lake view - 539 and the cottage was lovely and more than adequate. The very minimal odd mark and cobweb here and there. What you would expect from a rental property, I definitely didn\'t need all my cleaning bits I brought with me.  Cottage 539 view of the lake is partially blocked by trees and shrubs but we still had enough of a view to be happy. My 4 children age ranging from 5 to newborn loved the pool area and the different sections to it and the beach area was a massive hit with them. There are lots of activities to keep the children entertained each day including the free play areas and soft play area. The bowling lanes are adequate for young children but I would say they could do with some work to update them. We used the shop on site for any essentials we were getting low on but found it quite pricey so we shopped at carrefour which is only 20 min drive away. We had a great week stay and would definitely return!
title: Lovely family holiday.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were a party of 6, including 4 children, staying for 1 week. Booking: easy to book, however, no one told us about the restriction list of the free activities that came with our booking, we found out on arrival only, which was not so helpful. Cottages: on arrival, after having driven since 7am from London and expecting a home from home experience as in Centre Parcs Elveden (England),  we were presented with a cottage that was dusty, unclean, unkept and in complete need of refurbishment. After speaking to a lovely at reception, we were allocated a refurbished cottage with the opportunity of a cleaning team to facilitate our needs if required. The garden of our cottage was unkept, the furniture drabby and not matching with one modern lounger and one old plastic one. Please be mindful that the Centre Parcs of Lac D\'Ailette does not offer the same experience as in Centre Parcs in England: no oven facilities, no made beds, towels come as extras, wifi also comes as an extra. Restaurants: we wanted to enjoy eating out as a family and tried the main grill restaurant facing the lake for some traditional French cuisine. Queues are not managed, no front of house visible to swiftly manage those who wish to sit outside and those who wish to sit inside. Huge queues are formed. The service was pleasant by slow. The food portions were fine, however, our fish was uncooked in the middle and we had to return it. The prices were quite high for the quality of the food.Aqua Mundo: the main aquatic centre: the policy of taking shoes off to enter the premises is not respected by everyone, and therefore does not help with the hygiene of the place. It is not Centre Parcs\' fault, but perhaps someone to manage it would be an idea. For the big water slides, staff was visible to watch people using them, but there was no queue management which creates overload and an unsafe environment where everyone is trying to go down at the same time. The children area was really good, except for the sand at the bottom of the water. The lac: amazingly beautiful setting, nice beach, but too much pond weed which could be managed by Centre Parcs. There are unfortunately no changing rooms or showers by the beach. The food shop: good selection, well stocked. The parc and its logistics: the website does not inform on the very many hills of the parc, which makes it very challenging for most parents with young children, which was our case. We believe this should be made explicit on the website/when booking. There is a solution which is to hire a golf like buggy at a cost of EUR200+ for the week....Overall, a beautiful lake with mature natural surroundings, however, a tiring experience, ruined by the fact that we had a personal bike stolen. When reporting to security, we were told that they did not deal with such things and that we had to speak to the reception. When speaking to reception, we asked whether there was a camera at such an integral point in front of the main complex, and in view of the security hut, and were told that we would not have access to any videos, and that security would contact us. We were then given directions to the local gendarmerie and sent on our way to deal with the issue. At no time during our stay after going to the gendarmerie, did a member of the security or the management team came to talk to us. Please note that the gendarmerie advised us that Centre Parcs was a prolific area for the stealing of bikes. If we had been informed of the security failure, we would have not, like many others, bought our own personal bikes. Again, we enjoyed the natural beautiful location, there were some very hard working and pleasant members of staff, however, we personally felt that there were many failures by the management/directorship who, as it seems, do not have their finger on the pulse.
title: Havens by the lake.....
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We\'ve been to a few Centre Parcs in Europe and Lac d\'Ailette is the one we\'ve enjoyed the most  - it has great activities, is set in beautiful woodland with lakes and a beach and the Aqua Mundo is absolutely brilliant.
title: Excellent Experience
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Setting - beautiful - lake etc lovely. But BEWARE - accomodation absolutely filthy + just about comparable to a comfort level in Britain. I paid extra for lake view + premimium cottage - got the view but cottage had stained dirty carpets, blood on walls from dead swatted mosquitoes, wall paper peeled off, poo on toilet wall. Asked to move to another cottage - slightly improved but still shabby stained + no way worth the 1990 euros .  Such a shame as lake beautiful.
title: Lac d\'Ailette - beware
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After booking our holiday to La Lac D\'ailette, I became increasingly concerned after reading so many negative reviews on here.  However, having just returned from a simply amazing week here, I needn\'t have been so worried. From start to finish, the holiday was faultless. The staff were all incredibly friendly and we had a couple of experiences where customer service was exceptional. Aside from one member of staff in the snack bar, everyone we encountered spoke excellent English. The accommodation was completely adequate for what we needed. Ok, so there may have been some chips to the paint and a couple of marks on the carpet but I really can\'t understand anyone who would let that ruin their holiday. We stayed in villa 540 which was a vip cottage with stunning lake views (some trees and shrubs partially blocking the view but still openings to see it). We were fortunate enough to have a heat wave during our visit so we spent some mornings on the beach, we hired electric boats on the lake and spent lots of time in the amazing pool (which in my opinion is better that the English Center Parcs). We received 3 activities vouchers as part of our booking and we weren\'t entirely sure what these could be used for. When we arrived we were given a list of what we could use them on. We used one voucher for a adult to play indoor mini golf  for free( which was fab) and then we discovered our other two vouchers would allow us to hire a bike for free for our entire weeks stay. This was amazing! Compared to English Center Parcs, we found the prices very reasonable. We did our food shopping in Laon which is only 15 minutes away and we had a lovely morning out in the medieval city as well. We knew we would only get a microwave oven in our villa so we didn\'t plan any meals which would need an oven. We did try to use the oven to heat some bread on one day but my husband and I could not figure out how to use it and subsequently burnt the bread! Had we needed to use the oven again we would have had to call someone out to explain it to us!!We are looking forward to going back to Center Parcs again next summer as we had such an amazing time! If you\'re going soon, don\'t listen to the reviews, it\'s fab!
title: Amazing holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: When I first arrived, I could have literally cried at the horrendous accommodation. I had no idea how I was going to live in that accommodation for 7 days. However we are here on a holiday and I had to get over it and enjoy our time together. It was dirty, shabby, old and very poor. We all enjoyed time in the pool (outdoor areas could do with a clean) and children had so much fun in here. The park is in a beautiful and stunning location. The sunsets are striking and there is a real relaxed feel to the park. We spent time exploring the surrounding area as well as relaxing in the park. We all loved eating in the pancake house, staff were super lovely in the pasta and pizza house and whilst I loved my meal in the grill restaurant my husband wasn\'t so keen. I was a bit freaked out to see a Coypu (like a very very large rat) right outside my cottage that it put me off being out there. Overall we had a lovely holiday, really enjoyed our time together and overcome the poor accommodation.
title: A great family holiday but really needs some tidying up.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We\'re a family of 4(two children under 6) from London and decided at short notice to book a trip to Center Parcs @ "Lac d\' can\'t pronounce the rest".  We really had very basic needs:  Comfortable cottage with a nice view, Soft play for the children, and a nice pool.  This checked all of those needs and really exceeded those expectations.1)  The cottage:  Again, reading the one star reviews made us worry about the accommodation.  We chose a 4-bed Premium Cottage(not newly renovated) near the lake and facilities.  It was lovely - exactly what you would expect from a holiday cottage.  Of course it had some wear and tear as it hadn\'t been renovated but having stayed at resorts both here and in the US I wouldn\'t say it was in any worse condition and in fact given that we had young kids we were happy to see that they spent more money on keeping the cottage clean, then repainting the walls after every visit.
