Although one challenge was the website wasn\'t great at telling you what actually came in the cottage as far as cutlery etc.. and we were pleasantly surprised here to find a fully stocked kitchen with plates, glasses etc..2) Facilities (Soft Play):  What more to say our day basically revolved around Soft Play(they have one massive area, along with another smaller soft play by some restaurants) and this free facility kept our children happy for hours on and off throughout the day.  My son especially loved the little motor cars you could put a token in and drive around the track - he is 3 and was able to do this on his own.  It was hard keeping him off.3)  Facilities (Pool):  The pool was immense - granted we\'d never been to any other center parcs before but even though the pool had a lot of people in it, there was so many slides, water features, pools, lazy rivers both inside and outside that we had a blast.  It was also nice that as a family we could use the slides together and spend time as a group.In summary - we went with low expectations and left thinking about when we were going to coming back.  So if you - like me - are worried about the one star reviews then hopefully this review helps.
title: Amazing week - don\'t let the one star reviews scare you!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Premier cottage desperately needs refurbishment. Electrical issues, fridge, microwave and lighting kept tripping out. Staff unresponsive, food delivery service failed to deliver, no apology offered. Customer services closed in the evening so know one available to address issues. Onsite activities and restaurants are very expensive. On a positive note - the pool and slides were great!
title: Parc in need of refurbishment
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Centre parcs at its best lots to do, great pool, very pretty lakeside location, But the cottage number 632 not so good, supposed to be lake view, but had trees n marsh view instead, booked premium cottage but cleanliness somewhat missing, mismatched furniture , spa baths smelt of bad eggs couldn\'t use them, cob webs n stained carpets. I think hadn\'t been used for a while n need updating badly. Cleanliness around the dome also abit lacking lots of dust on surfaces etc. But I would return just not when it\'s busy n definitely in a renewed VIP cottage.
title: Great parc shame about the cottages
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: my wife and I, with our two young children had an amazing time at the Centre. It is tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the city and has all you need for true relaxation and fun, I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a good family holiday, at a good price.
title: Great holiday place
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great holiday at a lovely location, unfortunately let down due to poor maintenance of accommodation, despite paying for a Prestige Cottage. Given the price, a higher standard was expected. Swimming pool lovely although crowded due to day visitors being allowed boosting already high numbers in the park. Food and drink prices high, but almost to be expected. Fireworks on Sat night was a hidden bonus!
title: Upgrade all the way - prestige.... not so much
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Wonderful park with a lot of nature and great options for kids at all ages.The water park is amazing and very clean and organized.The rooms are not 100% clean at arrival but this is due to the nature of the park that is located in the middle of natural forest.
title: Great place to stay at!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just returned from a week here. The site is fantastic, a beautiful location with loads to do to keep all ages occupied. We are a family ranging from 3 to 16, and everyone enjoyed it. Some of the accommodation is a bit tired, and our house could have done with a good dust and a decor update, but siting in the house and looking at the walls wasn\'t why we went so it didn\'t really bother us. The beds, bedding, bathroom, towels and kitchen were clean so it was fine. The site shop is on the pricey side and would recommend finding a local supermarket if you want to buy more than the basics.
title: Fantastic Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a large family holiday group visiting this park.  The location was beautiful and perfect.  The furniture with the house was basic but concerned when it was broken!  Staff friendly and the site was clean.
title: Family Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Spent 7 nights here in a 4 bed lakeview Premium cottage with our friends, 4 adults and 3 children 5, 8 and 5 years old. We were in cottage 348 which has a slight side lake view but we didn\'t spend anytime on that side of the cottage as we had a lovely outdoor table, chairs and sunbeds for alfresco dining every night. We bought food with us for the week which we cooked on the stove, grill, microwave and BBQ (which we purchased for 12 euros in the onsite supermarket). We used the onsite shop for milk, fresh baguettes and a few essentials we had run out off. The weather was amazing 35 degrees nearly all week apart from today which was a little less sunny but still 28 degrees. We spent a few hours each morning on the beach as the kids loved swimming in the lake and building sand castles. In the afternoon we spent most of our time in the Aqua Mundo which was amazing so many slides to pick from, lovely outdoor infinity pool, Rapids and a great lazy river. The kids really enjoyed the swimming pool. We didn\'t feel the need to do any activities and was quite happy spending time together and swimming/going to the beach every day!  The accommodation is tired and needs a lick of paint and a real good scrub but we come armed with cleaning stuff after reading the reviews on here. Flies and mosquitos around when leaving the windows of a night as it was so hot - no air con and no breeze was really hard to sleep some nights. We\'ve been center parcs in the UK for the last 5 years so as long as you DONT compare then you\'ll be fine. I would come back again and would probably book a few activities next time. Also we hired a golf buggy for the week at 270 euros and 500 euro pre authorised deposit which was pricey but the kids loved it and so did the adults. We were a little far out from the swimming pool and beach and in the really hot sun it was a god send having the buggy to use.  We are all packed up and sad to leave tomorrow morning but will definitely be coming back another year as its so much cheaper than Center Parcs in the UK.
title: Great week away! Don\'t compare to UK Center Parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Could do better in some areas, need more staff in the bars and eating places, needs to be maintained better and more buggies available. better facilities for teenagers that are of a reasonable price as most do not earn money, and the facilities need to be open longer.
title: Could do better
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have been to several Center Parcs. This was a good one, though I have a few reservations about some inflexibility from the staff. The pool area is excellent, with lots of slides that are enjoyable for the kids and unusual too. The houses are new and well-kept, and like all Center Parcs houses they\'re very practical. The supermarket is good, as is the little bakery which has great French treats, pizza and sandwiches. You will need these snacks, as the restaurants are unfortunately very slow service and (I found this inconceivable) understaffed, so that at lunchtime with hungry kids there was a half-hour wait for a table, even though the restaurant wasnt full. Most of the restaurants are closed at lunchtime (whose idea was that) and others are booked by "groups." The lake is beautiful and a boat ride there is delightful, though you will (again) have to wait for the boatman to have his 2 hour lunchbreak before you can take your kids out. That\'s the bureaucratic element. But the organisation of the place is great. It\'s also a lovely spot for a day trip to the medieval town/cathedral at Laon and Reims.
title: Exciting pool, staff a little bureaucratic
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Good value for money & lots to do before you even start to pay for activities. We brought 2 young children & they enjoyed mornings on the beach, picnic lunches & fun in the pool. We also hired a pedalo & that was easy & fun too. Recommend to all families.
title: Fun, perfect for children, great stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We\'ve just got back from seven days at this Center Parc. We were very worried by the reviews before we went but we had an excellent week. We stayed at a VIP lakeside cottage. There were some scuffs in the paintwork and the top shelf of the dishwasher was broken but apart from that we were happy with the standard of the accommodation (I haven\'t been to Center Parcs in the UK so can\'t compare). We rented bikes for the week and loved cycling everywhere. The children loved the activities, especially Aqua Speed. We don\'t speak French but found that most of the staff spoke English. The only potential issue was with the high wire adventure (like go ape). The instructor didn\'t speak English and a French lady who was also taking part translated for us and a German family. If she hadn\'t been there I think there may have been some issues about taking part without being aware of the full safety instructions (I\'m not  blaming Center Parcs for this as I was guilty of assuming that everyone  would speak English without checking).  The course ended with an optional zip wire which my daughter loved but parents may wish to be aware that participants have to climb a ladder several meters high and then attach their safety wires themselves to return on a second zip wire with no instructors present.  The highlight was the swimming pool which is one of the best I\'ve been too. We went everyday and loved the water slides and Rapids.  The supermarket was quite well stocked but very expensive so we drove to Carefore in Laon. The medieval town centre is also worth exploring.Overall we had a brilliant week and will definitely be returning.
title: Great Week Away
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Many of the reviews made me apprehensive of what we\'d find when we arrived but thankfully we were pleasantly surprised. A good description of the accommodation would be, a little bit tired. Our lodge was clean and had everything we needed for a week away.  We knew there was no oven so planned ahead and had a couple of bbqs, enjoyed the food from the onsite patisserie and used the restaurants.  One point to note in particular, all of the restaurants offer free menus for under 4s. While the subsequent choices appear limited we were able to have alterations made where required in every restaurant and the children were more than happy with the bountiful portions offered.The onsite supermarket was well stocked for the small shop it is, you could easily make a wide range of meals from what they sell. That said we did make use of the hypermarkets in Laon that had a wider range and were cheaper.We all enjoyed the pool immensely, the lake was brilliant for swimming, with a lifeguard service, the play park had lots out keep the children entertained and the spa was brilliant for a treat for the mums!Throughout the staff humoured our attempts at French, whether in the shops, restaurants or on activities. At no point did we struggle to get what we wanted or understand any instructions with staff going out of their way to give us bespoke English guidance where required.A brilliant holiday and we will definitely consider going back.
title: Fantastic holiday with friends and a trio of 2-year olds
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: First trip to Center Parcs and I was not sure what to expect.With two children, we felt like I had taken a holiday. They were entertained with plenty to do both free and fee paying. Enjoyed also by grandparents. a great place for all the family in a beautiful location!
title: Fabulous family holiday!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Like many other people, I had been concerned by the many negative reviews - especially about cleanliness. In fact I had been dreading getting there and spending hours cleaning on arrival. Fortunately, I was very pleasantly surprised and in the end we had a fantastic week! Best bits: swimming pool is brilliant, especially the rapids and slides, and we had many nice afternoons on the beach with lovely views. There is a good choice of activities though some were better than others. The older kids (11 and 9) really loved the aqua speed and the five year old loved the parcours ouisti (climbing about in trees), mini golf was really fun, all kids thought the skate park was great, the pony ride was lovely and at forty minutes great value. It was also nice to have such great free facilities available: for example, the playground, the farm, the DJ decks. You definitely would not need to pay for activities every day if you didn\'t want, there are lots of free things to do. The paintball was a bit disappointing though, and as other people have commented, the high wire is not for the fainthearted. Definitely only for older and confident kids. We did not have any problems booking any activities.      The accommodation isn\'t the most modern and was a bit dated but definitely did not have the negative experience that other people have commented on. Only slightly annoying things was that the dishwasher didn\'t really work and the mugs were tiny (I know that is very nit picky but when you need a proper cup of tea, you need a proper cup of tea.....) It was very pretty from the outside. The living space was very big, and the bedrooms were decent, though the kitchen is on the small side. We only ate out a couple of times because as other people have said, it was fairly pricey. However, both the food and the service at the pizza restaurant and the creperie we tried were excellent. We also got a takeaway raclette and fondue one night and that was fun. I had booked early enough that we were only five minutes walk from the beach and from the swimming pool. I think if you were anywhere else, you would need bikes. Many people had rented the golf buggies which did look good though were quite expensive.  I had no problems communicating with staff. I spoke very basic French learned at school which was enough to order food and shop with, but there was only one staff member we encountered who had no English. Overall, it is not as fancy and up to date as some of the centerparcs in England but of course you get what you pay for and this was incredible value for money. I wouldn\'t hesitate to go back. Really lovely time for all the family.
title: Lovely family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Everything was great (activities, spa, pool, lake) except for the lodging, the "VIP" cottage itself, all was so dirty we didnt even want  to sit on the sofa, the walls had weird stains, the fridge smelled like piss, and all was old and worn out, spiderwebs everywhere, dusty carpets, it seemed a bit abandoned!.
title: Dirty!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The site was great and the kids loved the freedom and activities. The site was car free so the boys could ride their bikes in safety, which they really enjoyed. The swimming pool was great and never too busy. All the activities were well organised, but quite expensive. The food options weren\'t great, but there is a shop so you could cook your own food if you had an oven, which we didn\'t. My main issue was the location of our accommodation. We requested water front and did call and check twice and it was confirmed. When we arrived we found that far from being waterfront it was on a mosquito infested pond in the woods (see pic). I did complain and to their credit they did refund me \u20ac120 in vouchers, but that wasn\'t what we wanted. We wanted to be on the lake. We were in cottage 701. Apparently we should have asked for lake front, which is exactly what we thought we\'d requested, so I feel it was a bit misleading. Also I was refunded with no fuss, so I don\'t think I was the first person to complain!
title: The kids loved it, but......
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We arrived on Friday at 2.30 having booked a \'Premium\' lakieside cottage. Well what can I say... if you class:- -6 swallow nests on the eves of your veranda with birds and bugs swooping all around and cob webs every where-outdoor furniture covered in bird poop-rubbish on the grass area-dead flies on the stairs-stains on the carpet and furniture-cob webs in the kitchen-miss match furniture ( dining table had three different styles of chair!) -very tired decor -strong smell of insect spray as premium then you\'ll be fine here.  We didn\'t unpack as we felt this was anything but premium.  After talking to a very unhelpful assistant at the information desk we were promised a phone call from the duty manager who strangely was in a meeting (when all of the weekend guests were checking in...bad timing!!!) . He said he would send a team of cleaners to clean the cottage but unfortunately, the Parc was fully booked so we could not pay to upgrade to VIP.  We waited...and waited...and waited, no phone call, or cleaners. We checked on-line and there were still VIP cottages available to book, so we went back to information. Luckily we spotted the manager talking to another family complaining.  At this point our luck completely changed.  She was extremely helpful and after stating our disgust we were upgraded to a VIP which was lovely.  It had everything we needed. Perfect location with a view of the beautiful lake and from this point on our weekend was wonderful. The activities were reasonably priced, lovely pool with great flumes, good Bakery and loads more.  The bike hire was good and well worth it as the Parc is very big.  Great fire works on Saturday night.  It\'s a shame that we missed half a day sorting out poor standards and bad customer service so my advice is... if you go, GO VIP!! anything less is basic and dirty.  Or I guess we could have just been unlucky :(
title: Great...in the end!!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: good cottages, best water park, great lake, excellent service and restaurants. The supermarket prices are approximately twice then Laon\'s supermarket (interMarche). the place is very safe and closed so the kids can go around by themselves. cleanliness can be better inside the cottage. nice places and villages to visit in 30-40 min radius
title: Dream vacation
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Park was beautiful setting on lake wonderful however their idea of a VIPs cottage is not the same as mine. Bath taps hanging off wall cigarette burns in table cupboard handles missing and screws petruding out. Shame it could be lovely. Activities are cheaper than English center parcs
title: Badly maintained
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We are a family of four who are Center Parcs fans - in the UK, France and Holland! This was our second visit to Le Lac D\'Ailette (last visiting 5 years ago).Until day 4 of our holiday we were having a fab time helped by the amazing weather which meant we visited the man made beach in the day and the swimming pool late afternoon. We left the swimming pool to find that two of our four bikes (my husband\'s and 11 year old son\'s) had been stolen from the bike park. They were locked together at the bike park opposite the main centre and bicycle centre. We were absolutely shocked and disgusted by this and my two children (11 and 8) were extremely frightened - the fear on their faces was just awful! My husband immediately reported this to the information desk where he received no sympathy. A form was filled in and he was old to report it to the police in Laon. My children wanted to come home as they felt so unsafe and we ourselves as adults and parents had to put a brave face on for them and explain that they were safe and explain that sometimes bad things like this happen - not what you want to do when you are on holiday supposed to be relaxing from the routine life!! After much debate one of the managers agreed to provide us with a golf buggy for our remaining days in the park - this took a long time to sort out the next day!We went to Laon to report the incident but the police station was closed, we were directed to another which was also closed, so we decided to return there on our way home to report this crime as we had discovered that it was probably an organised crime that had targeted several bikes that day by people who pay to enter the park with a day pass!! When we returned to the police station en route to Calais we were told (all in French of course) that we could not report it there and we would need to report it in a local police station near Center Parcs. We decided we could not go back to do this as we had a ferry to catch.No compassion, sympathy or accurate advice was provided to us by Center Parcs staff, which has left a nasty taste in our mouths!!On top of this on our last night at 2.30am my husband woke up to find that the house and park was in complete darkness. A power cut maybe? Then aggressive shouts and cries could be heard, along with rustling of leaves and feet on gravel. We had no idea how far away these noises were coming from and what was going on. It lasted for about and hour and was very frightening. Luckily my children did not wake up and hear this. We felt so unsafe we could not wait to leave and get home. We should have asked what had happened before we left but following the lack of engagement and compassion following the theft of our bikes we just wanted to get out of there. Not what we are used to at other Center Parcs!!
title: Security issues & lack of compassion for the customer
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I have been to a lot of the Centerparcs\' in UK, France and Holland. I have to say that the experience is probably best in Holland, for service, experience and overall feel. This particular Centerparcs was fine he had a decent enough trip, but felt very much like it needed updating. It didn\'t help that it rained most days I suppose, but there are definitely better options in Europe to choose from. In terms of value it is much better than UK, it\'s around \u00a3400-500 for 5 days compared to over a \u00a31k in UK. The food wasn\'t great here, the restaurants were just bang average. Lots of the facilities had strange opening times, like the ice cream place which only opened for a a few hours a day. The setting is pretty, with nice lakes with beaches and it was nice to cycle around. The kids play facilities were good, had a big indoor soft play that went down well. The beat feature is probably the pool, which had some great slides and rapids.
title: Group trip, pretty average Centerparcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having read some of the reviews before heading to France, it is fair to say I had some concerns. Thankfully I need not have had any. We all had a fantastic time. Yes, the chalets we were in were a bit tired and ready for renovation but, presumably as with everyone else, when booking we had the choice - pay more for a renovated cabin or have one which has not been renovated for a discount. We went for the latter. I took cleaning products with me having read the reviews but need not have bothered. Those reviews which criticise the restaurant staff for speaking their own language in France are, frankly, bewildering to me. Do those reviewers believe the UK Centreparcs staff are multi-lingual? Aside from a few primary school French lessons, I speak no French at all, just one example of my ignorance was asking for a table for 16 instead of 6 on our last day. Despite this the staff were friendly, good humoured, helpful, patient with my ineptitude and thankfully spoke enough English to understand.I have not been to a Centreparcs in the UK so have no direct comparison for Le Lac d\'Ailette but it was everything I hoped and expected Centreparcs to be and so much better value than UK prices.The beach and lake was beautiful and great for toddlers to paddle around in. The pool area was great fun. The grounds were beautifully green. The children\'s playground area had lots of play equipment. The kids liked the little farm and ponies. All in all, a super holiday for us and our toddlers :-)
title: Fantastic group holiday with 3x 2.5 year olds
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed in a VIP cottage which was ideally located near the Aqua Mundo swimming pool complex.  Very conveniently located but not really VIP....  The dishwasher didn\'t work and the toilet didn\'t stop flushing which kept us awake.  The maintenance team didn\'t speak English so i didn\'t get the problems fixed unfortunately.  That said, the activities were brilliant, (arrive on time though as they start promptly), and very reasonably priced.  The pool complex is awesome as well!  Overall, well worth a visit and much cheaper than Center Parcs in the UK.
title: A Center Parc Mini Break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Visited with my wife and 4 children aged 1-11.The Good parts:Scenery - it had everything you would expect from a centre parc\'s resort, stunning views that make you feel that you are in paradise and have escaped normal life. Looking out onto a sun drenched lake with a lighthouse out there made it look like a scene from a movie.Pool - the splash zone in the pool was amazing, my kids spent hours just in the splash zone alone, with the slides, geysers, and giant bucket that showers you in a tidal wave.They had so many slides to choose from that my eldest 3 children had a varied choice of slide depending on their bravery.My wife and I loved taking my 1year old down the lazy river which was exciting enough for him. Mini-golf - the mini golf had obviously had a lot of money spent on it, each hole was like a scene from \'20\'000 leagues under the sea\', it had nautical technology from the 1800\'s, it had and unexploded bomb that would start ticking like a time bomb if you hit it with your ball, the kids loved it.The best hole was in a room that had fish on wooden blocks on the wall and a shark\'s jaw,  the usual decoration you\'d see , but when your ball goes in the whole, the lights go out and your surrounded by a UV painted room, with all the exhibits leaping out at you (not literally). There was no need to keep score either, the balls are chipped and it is tallied up for you by the customer service desk when you return the ball.Entertainment - they had a PS4 in the bar area and foosball tables which kept my 6 & 9 year olds busy. That\'s it!The not so good parts:Accommodation - it wasn\'t terrible, don\'t get me wrong, but it had a 3 star foreign hotel feel to it, if people are used to the comfort plus villas at Sherwood, then you\'re gonna be disappointed.The Living room had a sofa that looked (and felt) like it belonged in a student digs. The kitchen had no oven, so if you plan on cooking then bring tins of stuff. It had a hob and a microwave, luckily my boy loves miro fries.It did have a dishwasher which was good, although my 1yr old loved to switch it on every 5 mins, (just to check it was still working I think). The decking led to a smaller lake on our back garden, which was not great looking, more like a bog than anything, so if you request a lake side cottage (which we did) then you may expect a bog side cottage instead. We did see a beaver, no joke, they had real (dam building) baevers.The rooms were very basic, bland d\u00e9cor, the beds had foam mattresses, and we had to make our own beds. They weren\'t comfy but I\'m sure if the weather wasn\'t so hot I\'d have been able to sleep on them.The restaurants - the choice of restaurants was poor, they had 4 restaurants and an ice cream place to eat;A Pizza & pasta place, (very nice, but selection was poor, max 8-10 things on the menu)A grill place, (very poor food, selection was poor too, max 5-6 things on menu) A pancake place (didn\'t go, kids have allergies to eggs, seemed popular though)A buffet place, ( was OK, although my fussy child still struggled with the selection)And an ice cream parlour( kids liked it, but more of a cafe than parlour)The food selection was really poor to our standard, but they did have a great bakery selection in the shop. A massive counter full of cakes, breads, baguettes and sandwiches.Entertainment - they had a kids show on for about 30mins a night, but it was on late and all in French (to be expected in France, not complaining), but my kids didn\'t enjoy.The bar and bowling areas fail to even meet the standards that we expect from Sherwood. Sherwood has a massive bar area,(multiple bars at Sherwood too) loads of seating, TVs, and soft play area where you can enjoy a meal or a drink and keep an eye on the kids whilst they play.But in france they didn\'t have this, the bar (only one bar!)  looked more like a school cafeteria, and the kids play area was up stairs, where it was boiling hot, And instead of having a bar up there, we had vending machines with the smallest (most expensive) cups of coffee in Europe.That\'s it for night life, let me summarise, you can have a beer in the school cafe, whilst your kids run around sweating in the \'boiler room\' play area up stairs. The bowling alley was terrible, it was run down, cramped and just really old looking, bits were falling apart, the little desk you type your name in actually came of in my hand to reveal a sharp circuit board underneath.Overall summary - I have mentioned a lot of negative stuff, but we had a really good time, the managers at this centre parcs have spent their money making the pool area brilliant, it far surpasses any of the pools we have been to in any of the centre parcs that we have visited before.In fact it far surpasses any water park or pool we\'ve been to in a long time.The weather was amazing, and like a true Brit on holiday, I got sun burnt. (Should have used the kids factor 50)As a family we would recommend trying out this place, because it was beautiful. And fulfilled our holiday abroad expectations, whilst keeping the costs down.It took us 2hours 20 mins drive from Calais. And the drive is easy.
title: Some great things...some not so great things.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Lodge was absolutely filthy. There are stains and hairs all over the lodge. The levels of cleanliness are nowhere near our usual Center Parcs at Woburn in the UK. Also the staff onsite were openly hostile to the British visitors. Very unhelpful. Key points:All kids clubs including mini disco were entirely in French. For horse riding you need to have closed toe shoes for you and the child (French visitors are lent boots but English need their own).For boats etc you need to book a day in advance rather than turn up.Shop is good and well stocked. Aqua fit was excellent.The swimming pool slides were all closed when we visited for the weekend due to technical problems.The spa was very good and worth visiting.The atmosphere generally was very chaotic compared to Center Parcs UK. You can purchase lodges onsite for 150-200k, perhaps look into hiring one of these as they might be cleaner? Hope this helps. Helen
title: Needs deep cleaning!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: What a beautiful scenic camp, as you can see by the pics, the lake is stunning and is more enhanced by the restaurants surrounding it. We hired bikes to get around the camp as its so vast but if you find hills a challenge to ride or walk then I\'d suggest the golf-type buggy, as it can be quite tiring. Exploring the camp on the first day of your visit is a must, check out the activities before you book them as they are quite expensive if more than one of you choose to do them and non-refundable if you wimp out (high adventure particularly). We only discovered the children\'s playground and other free climbing frames hidden amongst the forest on our last day.Good Points: Location, swimming pool with pool party one evening, range of activities, a few places to eat, local-ish (20 minutes away) supermarket if you want to eat in, spacious cottage, efficient help desk/reception staff. Ample parking, ample bikes to choose from, safe camp (left bags & jackets on back of our bikes and they were still there when we returned), also a forgotten coat in a restaurant was there when we went back too. On-site shops, free little farm, most staff friendly and patient.Bad points:*CLEANLINESS of accommodation, hairs all over our supposedly fresh sheets on arrival, remnants of something on the bedside table and some horrible stains from top to bottom of our radiators in the bathrooms, meaning we would not use it throughout our stay. I took cleaning equipment after reading some previous reviews so I was equipped to clean our bath, sink and shower but shouldn\'t have to when you go on holiday.Even the public toilets had a rota of cleaning which needed to be signed regularly once cleaned but wasn\'t completed for our whole 5 day stay, which showed by the lack of cleanliness in them.*COMMUNICATION - even with my GCSE French I struggled quite a bit. We got by in the restaurants and around most activities with my broken French (please don\'t say I should learn more French when travelling to France for a 5 day trip). But felt really out of my depth when the health and safety talk for the high adventure was done in French to me and my niece. An English speaking member of staff was told to come and speak to us when we arrived but for some reason kept dealing with everyone else and didn\'t come to us (for 40 minutes). When the original member of staff returned, he was shocked to see us still there, felt sorry for us and took us to one side, but proceeded to explain the safety rules in French and we ended up pointing at the different hooks and modelling what we thought we might have to do. Other holiday makers got stuck on the zip wire but staff were very slow to react, health and safety seems a little non existent at the camp to be fair.Missed Opportunities: *No entertainment of an evening, meaning the pool tables were our only option or bowling if you booked way in advance.*mini-golf and other activities could be extended into the evening.* fast food restaurant was shut of an evening meaning only dearer options were available. Could extend their opening hours.* coach/ bus excursions into other towns would be great as after two days on site we needed to get out. (We drove to Paris and Brugge)Much prefer Center Parcs - Belgium
title: Stunning setting \ud83d\udc4d\ud83c\udffb Needs to be kept clean \ud83d\udc4e\ud83c\udffb
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We thoroughly enjoyed our holiday here.  The weather was awful but, of course, out of our control.  Our accommodation was lovely, about 10 mins from the main hub.  The log fire was a great novelty!  All rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable.  Aqua Mundo was fantastic fun for us all (aged 2 - 42)!  We would happily return again to this Centre Parcs.
title: A lovely family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Positives: Lovely lakeside setting with plenty to keep the kids (10 & 7) busy. Availability was generally good (tennis, badminton, table tennis, motor boat, canoe, Aqua Speed, mini golf, paintballing, tree top route, Cool Jump) although the permitted area on the lake was limited so 30 minutes was ample for the canoe or boat. The kids loved cycling round in a safe environment and the view from our cottage across the lake was relaxing.  Our cottage was on the boundary (844) and we were glad that we had a golf buggy. Food was a bit overpriced with slow service but was reasonable quality.The negatives: the holiday went from \'good\' to \'poor\' on the last full day due to an accident and how Center Parcs handled it. The man behind me on \'Cool Jump\' was allowed to jump too early (far too cavalier an approach to safety from the guy running it), catapulting me off the 4m high inflatable and so I landed from v.high up and badly injured my knee. The security guard was called and took a look - his view was \'ce n\'est pas grave\' and that we should go and get some ice from a restaurant (which we kept doing all evening - ice cubes in a J-cloth). That night it ballooned up and I could hardly walk on it (let alone drive to UK). Took golf buggy to info desk to complain about Cool Jump and ask for another night. Manager wouldn\'t see us (because she didn\'t speak English, even though I speak French) and the staff tried to be helpful but didn\'t know what authority they had to remedy the situation. Were from our VIP lake view (844) to a Comfort no view (820) cottage. My wife had to shift all our stuff and we had to vacate 844 before 820 was free. Had to pay 86 Euros for an extra day of golf buggy. 820 had a used nappy and 10cm deep piles of bird poo on the windowsills (swallow nests above the windows). Unlike 844, the bedroom was upstairs, hell for my knee! Back in the UK now and receiving physiotherapy on the knee but nobody from Center Parcs has apologised at any point and the duty manager\'s refusal to talk to me (even though she walked past several times) was very disappointing.  The kids enjoyed the holiday but the terrible customer service was a big let down.
title: Nice setting but poor customer service
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having visited all the UK Center Parcs we decided to try one in France this year. It was good value for money, and cheaper than a week at a UK park even with the additional travel costs. I read the reviews on this site before travelling so was a little worried. However, I needn\'t have worried - we had a great experience and a lovely holiday. Positives - ok, so the cottage could have done with a lick of paint but other than that it was perfect. It was cosy, comfortable and had a most beautiful view of the lake. The service was very good, and despite what has been said in earlier reviews we found that all staff spoke good English, we got by with very basic French and lots of smiles :) We tried all restaurants and especially liked the Italian and the grill restaurant. Also had some of the most delicious pizzas at Bar Bowling. The bar staff at Bar Bowling all worked very hard and were exceptionally efficient despite being very busy. The on site shop was handy and the bakery was a delight - I\'d run round the park every morning and pick up fresh croissants on my return! The swimming pool was good, but best to go in the evenings when it gets a little less busy. Wifi was very efficient if a little expensive. The park was beautiful, and wildlife was abundant. The drive from Calais was straightforward. Negatives - the only thing I didn\'t like was the number of electric golf carts whizzing around the site. The park really isn\'t that extensive to justify this. Also, every day seemed to be some kind of changeover day due to flexible bookings, so it meant there seemed to be always cars on site. Oh, and our keys were inactivated before 10am on departure day so we could have locked ourselves out....we didn\'t, but this should be addressed. All in all it was a great holiday, and I think some of the negative reviews from fellow British guests are a little harsh and unjustified.
title: Fantastic holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Really enjoyed our week stay, and would return again. Our cottage was great but would recommend a VIP Cottage with Lake View, our deck could do with some minor maintenance.  Biked and used the pool every day. Our 5 year loved it. Staff was excellent and addressed all our questions and able to get on all activities we booked.  Food generally good although we found the buffet quality not as good as the other locations.  Breakfast excellent. We had fantastic weather and was outside all the time.
title: Summer Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Arrived at exactly 15h for check-in at a lakeside cottage premium. But the cleaning lady already accommodated unknown people inside the cottage without verifying first their identities nor reservations. We had to call the security several times to make those strangers leave (who by the way, started cooking!)We lost a lot of time waiting (cleaners had to pass by again & verify the cottage.) As compensation, the supervisor at the accueil coldly said we can stay until 12noon on departure day, but refused to explain further what caused the disagreements and non respect of check-ins.
title: Not secured...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The site was overgrown and looked scruffy. The toilets didn\'t flush properly for the first 2 days. The fridge door was broken. We had ants in the cottage. Restaurants were very expensive. The activities were fun but again very expensive. It would be a nice setting with the lake if they kept the bushes and grass trimmed. The lake view was also restricted by overgrown bushes.
title: Poorly kept and expensive, but otherwise ok
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We booked a 4 bedroom \'Premium\' lodge for 10 nights and travelled with 4 adults, 3 children and 2 one year old toddlers. To say I am disappointed is an understatement. I was livid at the condition of the lodge and disgusted at how dirty it was. The lodge was filthy - there was dirt and dust in every corner. There was peeling paint on every wall. There were dead flies on the ceilings in the bathrooms. The bathrooms were dirty on arrival. I cleaned the floor in the living room and kitchen and the cloths I used were black, thick with dirt and grime - just what we wanted with two crawling/toddling babies with us!! I also wiped out the wardrobes before putting my clothes in them and again they were thick with dust. Mould was ingrained in the seals of all the windows. The furniture was old and tatty. The fixtures and fittings in the kitchen and bathroom were like being in a time warp they were so out dated. The lodge was also just very damp. See attached photos. General maintenance of the lodge was terrible: - Paint peeling off the walls in numerous places in the lodge - Curtain rail fell off the wall in twin bedroom and whacked my sister on her head leaving a big bump - Loose tile on decking \u2013 we had to put chair over it to stop walking through it - Broken window in one bathroom so we were unable to close it - Not all of the heaters work - definitely an issue given the rain. Everything inside the lodge was damp \u2013 including all of our clothes - due to terrible insulation but also lack of ventilation - Extractor fans in the bathroom don\'t work- The carpets in the bedrooms are so sticky and disgusting, I had to wear shoes in my bedroom. We had two small children of 1 year old with us: - High chair was broken and had to be replaced on arrival. High chairs provided don\'t have harnesses so toddlers could easily stand up and climb out. - TV in living room was a death trap for toddlers as it was balanced precariously on a small table at perfect height for a toddler to pull down. A flat screen TV should be secured to the wall. We had to construct a make shift guard. - Both cots were broken on arrival. One was incredibly unsafe - it creaked and I literally think it would have collapsed if my toddler had shaken it - No stair gate on bottom of the stairs. The cots were replaced and so was the broken high chair but that\'s not the point - these things should be checked before being handed out and also it\'s a hassle you don\'t need at the start of your holiday e.g. we had already wrestled the cot up the stairs and into the bedroom before realising it was broken and then had to get it back downstairs again, I then had to go to the reception desk to report it to the maintenance team (there aren\'t phones in the lodges and on arrival we had no idea how to call to get stuff changed), then we had to wait for the new cot etc etc. We then had to do the same with the high chair. Such a pain and a waste of time! I am amazed that Center Parcs allow a lodge to be rented out in this condition. I am sure the response of management will be that the lodges are being refurbished - but that isn\'t the point; knowing the lodge next door has been painted doesn\'t make me feel any better!! The fact remains the \'Premium\' lodge I booked wasn\'t fit for use and the fact I paid \u20ac325/ night is just a joke. From reading the other reviews on Tripadvisor and talking to other guests in the park I know I\'m not alone. It is disgusting that Center Parcs is ruining people\u2019s holidays by providing this terrible standard of accommodation. These lodges should not be rented out until they are refurbished and all of the equipment such as cots and high chairs should be checked or replaced before there is an accident. All TVs should also be put on the walls and not left on low tables \u2013 it is just waiting for a toddler to have a nasty accident. Center Parcs should take action before this happens. I paid a lot of money for this lodge and the service I received is a disgrace. I sent in a complaint about a week ago and I still haven\'t received a response.
title: I paid EUR325/night for this...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a lovely relaxing holiday despite weather not being great. Loads of fun activities, many had to be paid for but plenty of free options including the amazing swimming pool, clean beach and fun water playground. The accommodation was adequate and pleasant but in needing refurbishment. Walls were grubby, there were lots of spider webs and a fair bit of mound in the showers. Nothing horrendous but less than perfect...The supermarket was v expensive but we drove to Laon 15-20 mins away and bought food from the Carrefour the just topped up with daily croissant and odds from the onsite supermarket.We are out a couple of times the food was fairly average but the service was abmissmal, we waited ages to even be offered a drink, the when we were served the staff were surly. My husband had finished his pudding but mine and the kids had not arrived so I went to enquire (no waitress to be seen!!) I was ignored at the bar and then told with a huff that they would bring it. We tried the creperie a few days later and it was better but not great (although food was yum). We ordered BBQ to our room another night which was fab though!That said, it didn\'t spoil a really lovely and relaxing family holiday, would recommend but not if you have v high expectations of accommodation or expect to eat out most days.
title: Fab family holiday if a bit run down
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were recommended by a colleague who repeatedly stays at this location however was concerned regarding some of the negative reviews on here. We stayed in a comfort renovated cottage.Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised that it was perfect. It was clean, spacious and well equipped. The only down side is that it was quite hilly so getting back to the cottage (122) from the dome was tiring being 20 weeks pregnant with 2 young children but nevertheless once you were at the dome you spent most the day there anyway so no need to be close to cottage. I would however recommend a lakeview cottage if you want to avoid any hills.The cottage was well equipped, there isn\'t an oven but didn\'t really need one. We drove 20 minutes to an Aldi, there is also a larger Carrefour in Laon. Eating at the complex was expensive, ie. buffet 25 euros an adult and 8 euros for children (under 4s free). Looking back it was cheaper to buy an evening meal in advance. The shop on site had lots of home brands however was expensive.We took our own bikes and bought a trail gator to tow my 4 year old\'s bike which worked really well, our 7 year old managed well on her bike but we had to walk our bikes up a couple of times.There were plenty of activities however the kids clubs and "wannabe" activities were not worth it if you didn\'t speak French. On other activities the staff done well to explain instructions in English. With the pony ride, parents are to walk the ponies and you must wear trainers. I didn\'t realise this at first but went to reception and they changed the time so I was able to go back to the cottage and swap my flip flops over!The swimming centre was brilliant and we spent 2-3 hours a day there. Plenty of changing rooms/lockers. Health and safety seemed to be very relaxed ie. you can wait in pool at bottom of flumes, only traffic light system on flumes so often people don\'t wait for green light and just go one after another as there are no staff at top. What is nice is you are free to take photos of your children having fun in the water so invest in an underwater camera or lots of people were using the waterproof bags for phones etc. There are plenty of life jackets for children to borrow too for the deeper pools. They put brand news ones out whilst we were there.There wasn\'t a great deal of paid activities for my 4 year old to do, over 8s can do a lot more however she didn\'t mind as she enjoyed the parks and pools etc. They particularly enjoyed the treetop adventure and trampolines.Fireworks on Saturday night were good, it was a long wait however until 11pm but the children enjoyed playing in the soft play area until late and then there was music playing outside whilst waiting for the fireworks to start. Will defiantly be returning.
title: Great fun filled family break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: It\'s a shame that the chalet really need an update although really enjoyed the park in general and the beautiful lake. The chalet still has 1970s furniture and decor. It\'s clean but you can really feel it when you stay in the chalet -even the wall is tired. Unfortunately it\'s our first Centre Parc experience. Having said that, the would like to commend the good services provided by the staff, we called to let them know that we can\'t see the lake because of the overgrown (although paid for lake view) and the gardener came to clean the area for us. So, thumbs up for the prompt services.
title: Really need TLC and update
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This is a great location amid the Champagne region. In general we had enough room for 8 of us in a four bedroom house by the water. I felt that the house was tired, stains on carpets, wood on walls was dirty and needed a re-coat. The outside area needed wood work re done as exposed wood everywhere. We had a few maintenance issues but these were resolved quickly but should not have happened. Cafes opened later than expected but on the whole ok - good. Recommend Pizza restaurant.  A general lack of bar staff meant long waits for drinks which was poor. This is our third European Center Parcs and the best location but it felt tired and rundown in areas and standards were slipping so early into the summer season.One pet hate is the amount of dog waste in grassed areas. What is going on with that.
title: Great location, but standards are slipping
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Perfect location, excellent staff, great activities for children. The park was well managed, kept clean and such a large park. Bike hire was great although we could have done with a golf buggy we had 4 hills to climb at the end of a full day!
title: Great family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We travelled to Centre Parcs in July 2016, myself, my husband and 4 of our children ages 8, 10, 15 and 16.  We booked a 4 bedroom, premier lake view cottage.  I was quite excited about the cottage as the photographs on the website, showing pretty, bright, airy, cottages around a beautiful looking lake, had definitely been the deciding factor in us booking this place.  We had paid extra for a premier lake view cottage. We were extremely disappointed.  The back garden, backed on to a lake, but the stinging nettles and untidy plants had grown so high, that from the lounge and outside terrace you can hardly see the lake.  The cottage was dirty.  The wooden floor throughout the ground floor had a film of dirt over it and when the children took their shoes off, they got dirty feet from the floor.  There were no towels at all (which were supposed to be included) so we had to make a trip to reception straight away to get some brought to our cottage (the girl told us we could have them without charge only because she was "feeling nice today" - they were supposed to be included in the price of our holiday anyway!).  There were 3 bedrooms upstairs in the cottage which the children took, and my husband and I took the downstairs bedroom and shower room.  It had a door out to the side of the garden.  There was rubbish on the ground outside the door and the view was of overgrown bushes.  It was a very damp bedroom and even after airing the room, the smell never went away.  Also the bathroom with no window, smelt of damp.  It was dingy and in bad repair and I didn\'t ever look forward to going in there (and was glad to leave)  The bed was 2 singles pushed together with a sagging double mattress topper put on top.  Uncomfortable.  The plates in the cupboard were still dirty from the previous guests.  The furniture, apart of the sofa and outside furniture, was all old chipped and falling apart. \'Premier\' standard is an absolute joke.  It was a dump. Our holiday outside of the cottage was good and we used the pools and the beach.  As a family we enjoyed each other and hired bikes for the whole week.  My 16 year old son is a skateboarder, so he enjoyed the skate park.  Parts of the site were pretty, and we looked enviously as the cottages around the lake that we thought we had booked.  The buffet restaurant was very small and ran out of some foods.  The staff made no apology for any of this.  Generally, the staff were pretty unfriendly.  As a British family we did not feel welcome, even though my husband speaks fluent french, and all 4 of our children (and myself) speak the language well enough to give it a go.  I would hate to go there as a family of Brits who don\'t speak french.  I dont think that would go down very well with the staff!  Don\'t expect them to speak any english to you! I filled in a survey when we returned, I also asked Centre Parcs for an email address to make a formal complaint supported by photos, but a week later have not received any acknowledgement or response to my email.  A very poor show.
title: Disappointing dingy, dirty accommodation
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: As rooms were on 1st floor & rather small, we decided to swap for 2 VIP cottages as there are no VIP cottages for 6. Unfortunately 1 of the VIP cottages allotted to us was infested with black ants! The next one allotted to us was inexistant. Finally a security guard gave us another VIP cottage but he couldn\'t get the door key cards activated. By now it was nearly 9.30pm & we were all exhausted.  Everything got sorted out the next day & all the staff were apologetic, v v helpful & pleasant.E cars v practical as the park is quite big
title: Premium Cottage for 6 (4adults & 2 kids) - rather cramped & stifling
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our third vacation at a Center Parcs, the whole thing is a very well oiled machine for a family vacation with young children, as with all parcs you can expect a large variety of activities, some free, some cost extra. However this parc feels a bit dated, the facilities are overall ok but the carpets of our renovated cottage had stains, the mattresses were too worn, and the aquamundo didn\'t have any inflatable ring slides. The breakfast buffet was also a bit sparse, but as with other parcs the staff is very friendly and helpful
title: Center Parcs are great for family holidays, this one feels a bit old
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a nice week here. We stayed in a VIP accommodation (after having read the reviews below). Large accommodation and clean upon arrival with sheets on the beds, towels and showergel&shampoo. Quite basic but everything you need is available. The inside of the house has been painted recently but the fence on the terrace  must still be painted because it is old. Baby bed and baby chair were already in the accommodation, no need to ask for it. We had a beautiful view over the lake from our terrace, so a great place to be for a drink when the kids were in bed! Please do not walk on your bare feet on the terrace outside your house because we all had so many splinters in our feet. Especially for our toddlers, this was a nightmare. Good facilities for the kids (acqua mondo, large playing ground) although I agree with the reviews that they should invest in the parc to update the facilities because they have become rather old and outdated. The shops and restaurants are available in the parc, and the cooking facilities in the house are good. Really quiet spot, all families staying around in the other houses near ours, were quiet and did not make noise (kids not shouting, not playing music outside the house on their terraces etc). We can recommend this place!
title: Nice holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We got one of the bigger cottages (VIP) for 2 adults and 2 teenagers, it was one of the worst holidays of our lives. We rented bikes for a week and the condition of the bikes were horrible, the brakes didn\'t work and most the tires were flat. The breakfast was simple and not bad. It was rainy for the two weeks that we were there so it sucked, there was nothing for us to do. The swimming pool was way to small to accommodate the amount of cottages.The mini golf was boring and the lanes were in a bad condition. We left our holiday early thats how bad it was. Definitely wouldn\'t recommend. The next city is a good 2 hour drive away.
title: HORRIBLE
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Spent a week here and stayed in a renovated cottage!Well worth the extra money!Cottage was refurbished to a good standard and was clean and comfortable throughout!The park is set in lovely surroundings.All the staff were very friendly , helpful and approachable and seemed appreciative of my limited use of the French language to get by!Reception staff spoke very good English though which was very useful when trying to book activities etc!!!All in all a lovely holiday!!!Would book again for sure!
title: A very pleasant holiday!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Visited during a family holiday from Australia, having sent time in the UK Centre Parcs and was very disappointed. The accommodation was very worn and tired, tired carpets, holes in walls, mould in the bathroom.  The whole park needed some TLC to bring it up to the standard of the U.K. Parks, and the activities weren\'t that well run.
title: Disappointed
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Had heard good thinks about Centerparcs and this one in particular. Our experience was very disappointing for a number of reasons. The accommodation felt grubby when we got there and was pretty disappoint overall. The property felt really tired, microwave scary and garden an overgrown mess and the beds really uncomfortable. The water park was brilliant and saved the holiday from being an utter disaster. The food was poor overall especially in relation to price and despite there being a few restaurants it was all a bit samey. The most disappointing thing was the lack of regular \'entertainment\' in the early evening for young children. There were things on twice a week for about an hour but it wasn\'t great. I doubt we\'ll return.
title: Really disappointing first (and probably) last trip to Centerparcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We (two adults and a 6 month old baby), stayed here for a week in early July in VIP cottage 345. The park itself is beautifully located around a lake and we really enjoyed the peaceful view from our veranda, overlooking the lake trees. Note: it was a 15 minute walk to the center of the park where the pool and restaurants were situated. We loved this as it was a relaxing walk, we had great weather and we had deliberately booked to be further out. Depending on your needs you can rent bikes or an electronic golf-cart to get around the park easier.The park in general is great in the sense that there are plenty of changing tables, microwaves, baby chairs available. Anything you can wish for really, like all Center Parcs it is aimed at families and the staff is clearly used to it as well.There were loads of activities for the different age groups, some required parental supervision/participation whereas others did not. I\'m not sure how busy it was in general but the park itself never felt crowded and we never had to wait more than a few minutes anywhere, check-in from the car was very convenient.Although we did not have a good experience at the Italian restaurant (waited over an hour for our main course and then the pasta was very overcooked), we had a great time at the Creperie and L\'Embarcadere where the food and service was good as was the price/quality ratio. We also made use of the breakfast and Delivery service where you get food delivered to your cottage which worked really well and was practical, book the breakfast delivery for your first day if you will have a late arrival! It was a shame that there was no bbq with the cottage, you could buy one in the supermarket on-site but with a VIP cottage I would have expected this to be included. Also, there were no kitchen towels and the towel set consists of 1 big towel and 1 hand towel per person so bring your own towels for the pool!Now the cottage itself, we booked a VIP cottage and I dread to think what a comfort one would be like. The lay-out was perfect, the sauna also, the view amazing. However the entire cottage just felt really worn out and was not clean. The fact that there was birdpoop on the veranda because of two birdnests is absolutely acceptable, the fact that there were spiderwebs everywhere (both inside and outside) was not. The kitchen was not clean, the tap of bathtub in the mastersuite was half detached from the wall, there were no bedsheets for the babybed, etc. There was not one big thing we were not satisfied with, it was all little bits and pieces which added up.All in all we would recommend this park to other families, because we did have a very relaxing stay in a beautiful environment which just needs a bit of an upgrade.
title: Amenities and park were great, cottage needs urgent TLC.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Overall we had a lovely break here but a lick of paint here and there wouldn\'t have hurt. Check-in was quick and efficient, minor language barrier but was not a big deal. The real disappointment was with our cottage, it looked as though it hadn\'t been cleaned and after a 10 hour journey didn\'t really expect to be spending 2 hours cleaning the cottage.... Cobwebs, hair and food crumbs all over the kitchen worktop, dishwasher was full of food, hand prints all over the walls.... I could go on!!! The aqua mundo was good but I was very put off by the cockroaches crawling across the changing rooms on 2 separate days. Restaurants were expensive, we went for the buffet on one evening which was very overpriced for what it was. We ate in the rest of the time but cooking was difficult with no oven as only had combi microwave. Overall we enjoyed our stay, I wouldn\'t be rushing back to this particular resort but I know centre parcs can do better.
title: Upgrade requirdd
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Ok 1st thing dont compare to uk center parcs as its differentSo positives:-Great swimming pool, easy check in, nice location, good restaurant faciliies, great lakes, loads of information, alot quiter than uk so you can do things on the hoof and not pre book weeks in adviceNegatives:-Needs a lick of paint, sports hall dissappointing, sports hall closed for a week??????
title: Dont compare to uk center parcs go with an open view
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We\'ve just returned from a very soggy week stay at Le Lac d\'Ailette. I\'ll try not to let the weather alter my view...It\'s a lovely family friendly holiday resort with some fantastic amenities. The pool is the best centre parcs pool I\'ve seen with so much to entertain all ages. It\'s well kept and has really good practical changing rooms. It was also very quiet and we didn\'t have to queue for any slides or didn\'t feel overwhelmed by people when the waves were switched on. They do provide life jackets for kids but I have to be honest these didn\'t come across as the best quality and need replacing. We used arm bands. The mini golf inside and out were great. Again one of the best I\'ve ever seen. The activities seemed a bit limited in comparison to the UK resorts but they looked good. We used the kids club once for our 3 year old but the language barrier was a bit of a problem and he didn\'t want to do it again. I\'m sure it was fine if you spoke French. My only criticism is about food and some wear and tear in the accommodation. We ate breakfast in the buffet once and it was terrible. Much cheaper to buy your own in the shop. The other restaurants didn\'t seem appealing. We ate in every night.... Note that there is no oven in the accommodation. Just a combi microwave.The other wear and tear was in the soft play which. The soft play really was amazing but large areas where closed off because of damage and even some of the open areas looked unsafe. My son refused to cross some rope because it was broken and I had to go in a rescue him.If you are from the Uk and considering this as alternative then it\'s definitely worth a go and there is also a lot to see nearby.
title: Good alternative to UK parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Cottage basic and a bit grubby around the edges but adequate. No lock on back door and lead straight into a steep slope covered in head high nettles. Lots of cars and golf buggies driving round meaning it wasn\'t safe to let our toddler walk. Aqua mundo enjoyed by our toddler but again grubby and the floor in the children\'s area is unfinished concrete and our toddler cut her knees on it. Restaurants limited and expensive. Bikes cost 30 euros a day to hire and 12 euros to hire a children\'s helmet. Soft play fine. Other facilities closed due to a convention. My biggest issue was with the pony ride we booked for our 2 year old (which is the age it is advertised for) This should have been canceled due to the weather making unsafe. 7 children and horses with one member of staff 2 children fell off and weren\'t checked to make sure they were OK. Our toddler only managed of stay on as we had 2 adults, one to lead the pony and one to hold her on. Overall a disappointing stay not up to centre parcs standards.
title: Accommodation basic but lots of issues
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Kind of disappointed at the arrival as the cottage was not even cleaned. Lucie at the Italian restaurant was more than amazing especially with the kids, she is a great value to the restaurant. The Aqua Mundo is nice but the "wild river" is far from the definition of wild compare to the one in Les Trois Foret but apparently there was some maintenance on the pumps, which would have been better if we would have been advised prior to arrival. The staff can be quite rude sometimes, one of our family member was kicked out the pool area because she was wearing casual clothes as she didn\'t want to go in the pool, however there is no sign anywhere of such rule, and there was other guests fully clothes all afternoon. Beside few members of staff saw us and didn\'t say anything, and there was a lot of people bathing in their own underwear... However you feel like the staff value the guest satisfaction, always willing to help and make amend for the bad points. Frederic at the Embarcadere restaurant offered a very warm welcome and was very friendly.
title: Could have been better
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Arrived late afternoon,and check in straight forward.Language problems all over the parc ,street lighting poor.Weather was poor the second half of our stay,so,activities were limited.Alot of hidden charges .Trip to Laon well worth a visit.Carpets very tatty in the bedrooms ,so ,the house,s  ,needs a lot of cosmetic treatment.Would,nt be in a rush back!!!!!
title: NEEDS MAKEOVER BADLY
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Our bedroom carpet was filthy and smelt of pets! yuck!  This aside we had a great holiday!  The dishwasher did break but the maintenance man was quick to fix it, our bathroom towel radiator didn\'t work either but it was completely replaced, very promptly I might add!
title: Cottages needs a good clean and the majority need to be pet-free!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Overall, we had a good stay during UK half-term at a good value price, despite lots of rain.  Having stayed a lot at UK CP, it compared favourably in terms of price and setting (including a beach) but ...1. sports hall closed for whole week due to a conference - particularly an issue given the weather as less to do indoors.2. Limited choice of restaurants in evening and limited opening hours - buffet opening at 6 (but closed one evening due to conference), Italian opening at 6.30, grill opening at 7.00.  (Also fast food restaurant and creperie open during the day only.)3. Swimming pool changing rooms could have been cleaner - but on a par with UK ones4. Golf buggies could be hired and therefore not as safe for children walking or cycling (or indeed for adults) as there were lots of them going quite fast.We also went out to the local area and enjoyed trips to various WWII sites, including a good tour at Caverne du Dragon, and Reims Cathedral.
title: Good setting, good value but some issues
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: To be fair the weather was against us, and to give Lac D\'Ailette its due, it is half the price of the ones in the UK.  However, you do get what you pay for: broken electrical items in the house, no locks on the doors that lead directly to the river and activities that we were warned against booking due to lack of supervision and poor quality. The staff that came round to fix the various things that went wrong were always very pleasant, but someone smashing a broken and beeping smoke alarm off the ceiling with a broom on the first night (it was not replaced during our visit) and having to be called out to mend a leaking boiler was not the most relaxing start to a holiday. I get the impression that things stay broken here - I\'d like to think that Centre Parcs would help their staff to feel more proud of the work that they do rather than making their lives difficult with the constant apologising. Oh, and if you\'d told us on booking  that the sports hall would be shut for the whole week due to a conference, then we would definitely have thought twice. Still, the kids enjoyed swimming, which was  a blessing.
title: Just another review
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: There\'s enough free activities on site for families on a budget to have fun. The aqua mundo is great. The park is set in a lovely area. Reims is about one hour drive away. Would recommend it and go again for sure
title: Nice family break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After hearing that Center Parcs is renowned for being pricey, but excellent quality, I decided to bite the bullet and take my family on a trip over the half-term holiday.In fairness, after being put off by the price of the UK parcs, there was a reasonably priced package for Le Lac d\'Ailette Center Parcs, situated about an hour and a half drive from Charles de Gaulle airport (north of Paris). In fact, it was half the price to go to Center Parcs in France for five days than it was to go to Center Parcs in Sherwood Forest for three days!!!Naturally, you have to pay separately for any activities you want to take part in at Center Parcs, so I opted for a couple of spa sessions for my wife and daughter, archery, paintball and the adventure course. It was sort of ambiguous as to what was actually included for each activity on the website, but I took a chance and everything was booked correctly, albeit very pricey. Upon arrival we were greeted at the entrance by an attendant who I managed to communicate with in my high-school French; despite getting a lot of British tourists (apparent from abundance of UK reg plates in the car park), much of the staff didn\'t speak English, but this wasn\'t a massive issue as I remembered a lot from my younger days. I was given a pack that included a map, key cards, activity tickets and a car park ticket, which I was to display in the car at all times during our stay. I was shown on the map where our cottage was and where the reception could be located.  When arriving to the cottage, it was grubby looking, smelt funny and the mattress, duvet and pillow (you have to put the poor quality bedding on yourself) were grey and flat. My family and I were greeted by a cat that sat on the rear porch, one of many that roam the park. When checking out the bathroom, that too was grubby, the bath was dirty looking and worn and there were no towels; we found out later that we had to pay \u20ac6 per person to rent a towel pack, consisting of a large and small low quality towel. We turned on the television which defaulted to an app that gives you information about the park, however it was crashing every few seconds and made a right racket!Long story short, the service in the shops and restaurants is something to be desired; the staff seemed apathetic to everything and it was extremely overpriced for the quality of the holiday. The activity time slots are very limited too, so we missed out on two activities that were paid for.
title: Center Parcs - Not what I expected!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: we have just returned from a half term week at Centreparcs lac d\'aillete.  I must say I did not know what to expect given the nature of some of the reviews but we had a really enjoyable week - despite the awful weather.   We paid the extra and got a VIP cottage - it was OK,  not VIP to English standards,  but OK,  although it could have done with some TLC for example a lick of paint,  the decking outside staining etc - but it was generally clean.   But I must say if this was VIP I would hate to see the basic comfort -  so definately pay the extra to get one of these.    Aqua mundo was fantastic - kept the kids entertained in the bad weather,   kids club was great - the guys who worked in this did a super job and my kids loved Orry.   Lots of English onsite in half term week (half the price of Centreparcs in the UK so I can see why).  Agree staff did not speak great English,  but a good chance to practice your french and the staff did generally appreciate people who made the effort. Those  who complain about staff not speaking English - well you are in France and, surprise surprise people actually speak French there .    Only downside from me was that there was a conference on in the week we were there, IKEA I think.  We had 4 very noisy (and drunken) frenchmen in the cottage next to us - who woke us at 4am one morning - would suggest Centreparcs puts all the conference people together to avoid disturbing young families who have busy days so need their sleep.  We ate a couple of times on site - once on the buffet, once in the Italian - I found the Italien better,  they were not overly expensive, typically English prices.  Avoid the Supermarket though - as other people have said use the Carrefour at Laon 15 mins away  - as it is significasntly cheaper (and better).  All in all a great week, despite the weather,  Kids were well satisfied - did not complain about the weather once,  and if you keep the kids happy and occupied it makes for a smoother holiday.  Site was in a lovely location -  We will return
title: Centreparcs lac d\'aillete
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We visited Center Parcs in UK half term.  We did manage to have a great holiday in spite of the terrible rain. It would have been even better if the indoor tennis/badminton facilities had been open. These facilities were one of the main reasons for selecting this particular parc as my daughter is a county tennis player and needs to practice.  We were told that we could use the outdoor tennis courts for free as Ikea were using the indoor ones, but in torrential rain it\'s not safe nor pleasant.
