We are waiting for Center Parcs to respond to our complaint about Ikea.We were really happy with our cottage. I am shocked at the number of people moaning about the quality of the accommodation. After all, it\'s cheaper than many static caravans and the cottages are perfectly adequate.We loved the Aquamundo and spent many hours there as we were so limited by the weather.  We cycled everywhere and used our activity vouchers (for early booking) on a pedalo in the pouring rain(!) and bowling. These were great fun.We ate out 4 times and again don\'t understand others\' complaints. The buffet was amazing and really good value.  One of our best meals was having a Raclette Grill and all of the ingredients brought to the cottage.  The kids also had pizza delivery.The staff were all great - everyone trying hard with their English.One of the nicest things is the fantastic French bakery on site. The kids went and bought the fresh bread and croissants every morning and they had all manner of delicious cakes etc.I think we\'ll be back as the journey is so short and easy from Calais.  Next time I\'ll ask if they plan to book any conferences at the same time!!
title: Not much to do in bad weather when main indoor facilities are being used for conferences
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Visited last week between Monday 30th May and Friday 3rd June as a group of 90 people including Parents, Grand Parents, Children & Babies...... After travelling through the night from South Wales (which in fairness wasn\'t a major chore at all in fact it was as expected and part of our holiday) We arrived at a very wet Centre Parcs Le Lac D\'ailette...... Cheers rang out for the bus driver...We we\'re here \u263aNow unfortunately everything goes down hill dramatically......Around and around the buses go, looking for signs of human life in way or shape of a member of staff that works at centre parcs....We stop and disembark at what looks to be some form of reception area....Nope, back on bus and back to the security hut at the entrance to the park....Granted we were in a foreign country but the language barrier was huge (this was maintained throughout the complete stay)....What happens next still beggars belief....The driver who has managed some French returns to the bus and apologetically says that everyone has to disembark at this point and there is nobody to meet, great or even tell us in which direction we are to walk....Try and imagine 90 people....(some in their mid seventies with disabilities and some only babies) just given a pass key, room number and a map of sorts, trudging in different directions, carrying cases, holdalls, shopping and babies in the pouring rain in what turned out to be at least a half mile walk in any direction up and down hills looking for their accommodation....Shocking to say the least.....Does it get any better.....No..... When everyone finds their individual dwelling, they are of course locked out as the key cards are not activated until 3pm....Try as we may to find help, there just isn\'t any,  other than the odd cleaner that speaks no English at all and certainly doesn\'t want to either..... The next 90 minutes are spent huddling under trees and shelters trying to keep already soaked babies and luggage away from the torrential rain.....I was in Lodge 905....This will be the one (I\'m sure there\'s plenty of others though) with the blocked basin in the bathroom upstairs that fills itself very rapidly without the aid of a plug... (amazing how much water can be retained by masses of head and pubic hair ey!).... Very attractive whilst brushing you\'re teeth....Downstairs any better??.....No......Shower room when in use is also blocked, absolutely stinks and oh I nearly forgot it also floods the bathroom and hall.....Furniture covered in all manner of stains, maybe the spiders come down from their never ending cobwebs during the night and have one hall of a party....Who knows?.....I think the other reviews cover most other disappointments such as.....Buffet Restaurant......Disgusting Italian Restaurant 10 feet away with same management.....Good??Grill Restaurant with same management. .......Fabulous?Aqua Mundo......Superb....Other Activities.....Totally booked or taken over by the conference of what I now believe from other reviews to be Ikea......Again in my opinion the very loud drunken undisclosed conference took complete president over everyone and anything else and was a huge part of the problem...Just to finish.....One of the worst traits to any company in my opinion is when the management comment on kinder reviews but don\'t on honest not so kind ones.....Check the other reviews and watch this space.....Hugely Disappointed.......
title: NO STAFF....DIRTY ROOMS.... NOBODY CARES...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The cottage was basic bit clean and comfortable. Just enough for what we needed. The beds were really comfortable but the pillows needed replacing. (We normally take our own!) Lovely location and the park was beautiful.
title: Very comfortable and all we needed.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just got back from Center Parcs Le Lac d\'Ailette and generally we had a good trip.We stayed in a Premium chalet which was better than expected after having read some other reviews.  It was clean and the beds were comfortable.  Had all the basic amenities and we didn\'t have any problems.We managed to book pretty much all the activities we wanted to when we got there, as we weren\'t able to book online before we arrived.  The pool was clean and the changing rooms were regularly swept out.  The lazy river and the slides were well maintained and good fun for the whole family.Our biggest issue was the food - or lack of it.The grill restaurant was only open every other night.  There was no online facility to make reservations and if you couldn\'t get there between 12-2pm when they were open for lunch you couldn\'t make a reservation for the evening, which was a problem as we were a large group. We ended up in the Italian restaurant three times as we\'d had a dreadful experience in the buffet restaurant.  The so-called fast food restaurant was only open from 12-3pm, which meant that was not another option.One one evening we couldn\'t get in the restaurant, so went to get food from the supermarket which was already closed, so had to make do with sandwiches in the chalet. I would go back, but I would ensure I took more food back to the chalet to cook meals in.  The kids loved all the activities and it would be beautiful on a sunny week, to get out on the lake and sit on the beach.
title: Enjoyed our trip but need more restaurants
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Arrived with a large sports team party of +90. Unfortunately we didn\'t get a meet and greet and had a bit of a hike with luggage to accommodation. House was well equipped not particularly clean downstairs with grime and stains on furniture, general refurb is needed in our opinion. Upstairs seemed cleaner and the bedrooms were comfortable. IKEA convention each day made the large sports hall unavailable. Everyone enjoyed the pool complex although we would recommend families to take bikes and book activities in advance of arriving. Used x3 restaurants, the buffet place was an absolute disaster (very little food on offer) on the first night but a conversation with the duty manager saw a full refund for around x6 families, the grill house located outside was very enjoyable with good service and food quality so too the Italian.  Enjoyed the stay but would be better prepared next time in terms of activities and possibly opt for better accommodation. Distance to Disney 1.5 hrs by car. Approximately 2/2.5 hrs from Calais. Onsite supermarket well equipped and not overly expensive. While you cannot control the weather I am sure that dry days make this place all the more appealing.
title: 1st Center Parc Experience by Bus from UK - Wettest Week in modern French times - Still Enjoyed !!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We are huge fans of Center Parcs holidays but sadly this is one we will not be returning to.We booked a premium lodge which was far from that! Very basic, small, not enough furniture inside or out to accommodate our family. Whole villa was very poorly maintained and absolutely filthy even after the cleaners had been called back to redo it. Lots of activities were unavailable as IKEA had booked it out for their sole use the whole weekend......something we were completely unaware of until we arrived!! Staff were not really interested in helping or even trying to. So called fully equipped kitchen had no conventional oven, just a hob and microwave which made feeding 4 adults and 4 children very difficult. We hired a BBQ which was the smallest electric BBQ I\'ve ever seen but just about did the job. Fridge seal was broken and sink leaking.Will most certainly not returning!!
title: Very disappointing, not up to center parcs standards. Poorly maintained.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Despite being UK school holidays, most activities were very restricted for times. Lack of staff (normal in French CPs). Food was appalling and many people asked for refunds. Never again. Faulty bicycle cause injury to child - nobody was bothered. 6 person cottage did not cater for 6 people. Snack bar not open at meal times. Shops closed at odd times - children wanted to spend their pocket money but couldn\'t! Parcours and boat hire only available for a couple of afternoons.
title: Disappointing and expensive - with lack of facilities
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have enjoyed many family breaks at Center Parcs and this was our third visit to Le Lac d\'Ailette. The park is looking tired and the accommodation is in need of refurbishment. There were lots of dirty stains on walls/curtains plus the seating was torn. The main reason however for the poor review is that facilities were unavailable. All activities on the lake were cancelled Sunday due to a regatta which would have been acceptable as a one off but when the weather turned to rain and we tried to book sporting activities, we were told the Jardin de Sports was unavailable all week to guests as there were two conferences being held there. The park was full of adults taking part in the conferences, not what we would usually expect at a family holiday destination. On our last day we wanted to go for lunch but three of the restarants were again unavailable to guests due to the conferences. A few other issues like high ropes taking 2.5 hours instead of 45 mins due to lack of staff so overall very disappointed.
title: Poor reflection on  Center Parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Our cottage was dirty, and not as described on the website. The swimming pool not very clean. the children\'s activities not properly supervised and no evening entertainment. The food choice was limited.
title: Dirty accommodation not what advertised
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Noisy neighbours celebrating a 30th birthday into the early hours, IKEA parties every night for the hundreds attending a convention that closed the sports hall but we weren\'t told about when booking, and young lad screaming until 4 in the morning meant that this was not a particularly enjoyable week in France.
title: Noisy neighbours...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We love CP, but this was our first trip to Lac D\'Ailette. Next year we will return to De Vossemeren as it offers better value for money and larger accommodation. There were no animals at all in the farm (one of our favourite things) and the sports hall was closed all week. The shops seemed to close at odd times during the week and the supermarket seemed very poor value for money. That said- the staff were fab and the pool is great (although the the rapids weren\'t very rapid!)
title: Not up to usual center parcs standard
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We travelled as a large party of 12, some of whom had never been abroad before so we decided to go to Center Parcs, France and booked 4 villas.The check in was very straight forward and efficient with no delays.  The cottage itself was ok, not brilliant... The pillows were really lumpy and bumpy so I would recommend bringing your own.  My mothers villa had the kettle and remote control missing which were never replaced despite several requests.  The first night we decided to eat at the buffet... This was a HUGE mistake !! After paying over 20 Euros each (you pay before you enter) we were met with empty dishes... their was literally no food available at all.... unless you like plain pasta and cold chips with custard .... Very disappointing and not a good first impression... several other customers also complained.  We went to the Italian for the next 2 nights which was a very pleasant experience, the waitress went out of her way to help us and the food was very nice.  The final day we visited the crepe restaurant and after waiting over half an hour (even though the restaurant was a quarter full) for a table were seated.  The crepes were ok ..nothing special.  Whilst in the swimming pool my disabled mother was told to leave by a rude lifeguard with no explanation given ... we later found out that it was because she did not have her swimming costume on.  She was on a seat causing no harm and was very traumatised by this.... It was completely unnecessary and caused her a great deal of distress.My sister hurt her foot on the water slide and was given no first aid ... after returning to the UK she has been to hospital and her foot is broken !Would I return to Le Lac D\'Ailette ... No way !
title: Disappointing
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We visited in what was probably the wettest week for years in France! However, my grandchildren had plenty to keep them occupied and amused. The setting is perfect, on a huge lake which has, for good weather, a large sandy beach area. Plenty of wildlife to see. If you are an angler, like myself, it was disappointing fishing is banned. The swimming area is what you would expect from a centre parc, plenty of water based things to do. Most of the outdoor activities were shut, due to the poor weather. For me, what let this resort down was the accommodation. It was tired, furniture shabby and not in good repair. The fridge stank, to put it bluntly, and there was a stale smell throughout the house. Cobwebs in most rooms, and we had premier accommodation. It is not as good as a purpose built centre parc. The on site shop is adequate but pricey. The restaurants the same. One bonus is that it is an easy journey from the uk. Would I stay here again? Probably not. The other parcs in France are better.
title: Great place for children, but looking shabby
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Unfortunately it rained all week as we were in France and some of the indoor facilities were closed off due to a conference so that limited our indoor options.pool was fun but the kids club very average
title: Centre parcs with children
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great pool and very interesting location for outdoor sight-seeing, my main complaint was poor quality staff.  Unfortunately (and I\'m married to one) the old French poor attitude to customer service is very much prevalent there - slovenly attitude to service!
title: Great Centerparcs, let down by poor staff
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed here over the May half term in a Premium cottage (not lakeside as we didn\'t trust our 2 year old to wander off!). The cottage itself was a little tired and could have done with a lick of paint. We did have a broken chair which we reported & it was replaced within the hour which we were impressed by. We didn\'t realise there was no over just a microwave so we would adapt our cooking accordingly next time. Even though it rained pretty much all week our children were not put off. We swam in the amazing Aqua Mundo every day enjoying the slides, waves & lazy river. Again there were roof tiles in the shower area that looked a bit tired and could do with replacing but the facility was very clean and there were plenty of family changing rooms. The other facilities were very good. We went bowling and mini golf when it rained and the children loved this. Outside my son did the mini tree top trail which i recommend to burn off energy. The playgrounds were very good and great space for safe scooting. We felt the restaurant food wasn\'t particularly great and the service a bit slow. They also have missed a trick with the open space in front of the main building could easily have a cafe with seating outside. Also the park is close to the Champagne region so we did a day trip to visit the caves which we would recommend. We will definitely visit again and hope for brighter weather to enjoy the lake and walks more.
title: Great place to visit
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The Lac d\'Ailette villas present a refreshing change from the traditional lodges found in other Center Parcs, giving the appearance of a New England village nestled within a stunning, undulating and well maintained, mature landscape.  We opted for a 4 person VIP villa (519) which, whilst not having a lake front view (for which you pay a premium), does have a water front veranda on a quite inlet; it did not feel overlooked by other villas and was in a fabulous position for watching and interacting with the abundant wildlife including birds and coypu.  Our initial concerns over safety of a water front veranda, with an almost 4yo, proved unfounded;  it was very spacious (wrapped around two sides of the villa) and very well enclosed allowing kids to play safely as well as see and feed the wildlife.  Outside the front of the villa however required close supervision of small mobile children as the water\'s edge was potentially very accessible and inviting for an adventurous child! I would suggest a continuation of the veranda railings would improve safety here.In terms of facilities and decor this VIP villa was as expected if a little tired and in need of a lick of paint here and there (in particular veranda railings) and some minor repairs to water damage on kitchen skirting and bath panel and a replacement kitchen cupboard door where the laminate had peeled due to hear from the combi oven.  The sofa had seen better days and the hairdryer in the twin room did not work.  There were plenty of wine glasses but mugs were very small from a British tea drinker\'s perspective.  On balance however none of these points affected our overall enjoyment of the villa (though they may have, had we paid high season prices).In particular we loved the sauna and the kids really enjoyed the whirlpool bath tub. The open fire created a really cosy atmosphere though the logs on sale on site are overpriced so consider bringing your own.  We found the beds very comfy and there were ample pillows provided contrary to some other reviews I had read.The 500s zone proved to be a great location as a pretty level ride to and from the village centre; other zones were much more hilly and may be less suited to younger bike riders. The standard bikes were perfectly adequate for cycling around the park but we found them less suitable for tackling a circuit of the lake - be warned! There is a fabulous 7km traffic free cycle way accessible directly from the Park entrance and for the more intrepid explorers, armed with a map, it is possible to cycle a beautiful circuit all the way around the lake although note that part of this is on a busy road and much of the off road tracks are better suited to MTBs.  Certainly not recommended for small novice riders but great for teens and adults (strongly suggest going clockwise!)We all loved the pool and there was a great choice of slides (my personal favourite was the disco black hole!).  Felt the outdoor Rapids could have been a bit stronger but great as they were for small children who had the time of their lives! Restaurants were good (we ate out at two) service was friendly and timely and food tasty and reasonably priced. Nice touch that kids under 4 eat free! Staff on site were very helpful and spoke very good English but were also accommodating in allowing us to speck French! Super market was generally well stocked (though limited fresh milk) but a bit pricy as was to be expected.  All in all a fabulous short break easily accessible from the UK in about 2 hours from Calais.  So far my favourite of the European parks we have been to. We will definitely be back and would not hesitate to book the same villa again!
title: Great value half term holiday for Brits
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed here end of May / start of June with a 4 and a 6 year old. Premium 2 bed cottage was nice, better than expected given some of the reviews. Even had a sauna and a DVD player. The place is huge so stay in a cottage near the main resort if your little ones aren\'t up to cycling long distances yet. The weather was terrible but still the kids did pony rides, quad biking, bowling, cooking, table tennis and mini golf.  There is a good playground, indoor play area and a beach too. The pool area is large and really good, we spent a good few hours here every day. There are loads of slides as well as a water playground, rapids and a lazy river. Whilst most slides say they are for 6 to 8 year olds, our 4 year old was fine on everything. Bring pillows (the ones provided are lumpy) and bring food, some extra bin bags and dishwasher tablets (beware there is no oven though). The shop is fine for bread, more coffee capsules and the odd thing but not for your main food shop as limited and expensive. We have never been to Centre Parcs before and I was starting to get worried given some of the recent reviews but we were impressed, the standards are good and the variety of activities is excellent - will be back next year.
title: Brilliant stay with 4 and 6 year old
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: \u00a3750 for a 4 bed cottage with 2 bathrooms for a week in UK half term. We fitted 5 families with bags and bags of room into 2 x 4 person cottages. The cottage was bigger than the photos looked. Everything was clean. The facilities free or reasonably priced. Worth bringing bikes. 2 hours and 15 min drive from calais, pretty much just one motorway all the way so even if you have never driven in France it\'s pretty simple... Stop off at a massive Carfour in Laon on route and stock up. Brink a BBQ with you. It rained and rained and rained but we still had a great time
title: Absolute bargain for UK half term holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Let\'s b clear, most people go here in the half terms as its half the price of the centre parks in the UK. Two hours from Calais is just as quick too. I\'d recommend booking activities before you go as we struggled to book when we got there. Swimming facilities really good and the location of the water side villas is also great. The accommodation isn\'t as good as the uk parcs but we know this but it isn\'t as bad as others have said. Local golf course is also really golf, shame my golf isn\'t! The sports facility isn\'t great but again it\'s there and the price is the reason you go as its a bargain. Hire a golf buggy to travel around the parc. There are recent improvements to activities and the kids club area.
title: Shame about the weather, but it\'s half he UK price in half term
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Nice holiday with family,always great for the kids..the parcs is nice with a lot of activities for kid and adults..the cottages are a bit of need of TLC..a nice fresh paint inside will do the job..concerning the biking be prepared to find it a bit hilly and no electric bikes on rent at this center..you always have the option to rent a golf buggy but be prepare to pay around \u20ac 250...if you love golf,fantastic golf course opposite thelac..10 minutes by car..9 holes or 18 holes..
title: Family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed in a 2 bed comfort, number 782.  This was a good location for us (single mum, 2 children), as we enjoyed the walk into the main centre and back again in the evening.  The cottage, for the price, was perfectly satisfactory.  Hob, fridge, microwave, dishwasher in the kitchen, all worked fine.  The beds were reasonable, however the pillows left a lot to be desired.  The bathroom was definitely the most tatty area, but as we were in the pool every day, we showered there.  We didn\'t hire bikes as I didn\'t see the need to spend the money.  We had bought cupboard foods with us from England and bought fresh foods from a supermarket nearby.  The free toppings available to us were not any good, given the weather that France is currently having!!  I paid 24\u20ac for a 4 day wifi pass which dipped in and out the whole time we were there.  We did pay to do the high rope adventure which was worth it, but takes much longer than the 45 minutes they suggest.  It took us nearly 2 hours - go to the toilet beforehand!  Other than that we spent all our time in the pool complex.  The children loved it so were happy to spend 5 or so hours in there every day.  There is a lack of restaurants to eat in (only 2 really suitable for family eating - choice wise and cost wise) but several snack places.  We ate at the buffet restaurant every evening as the food varied each night, 20\u20ac for me and 8,50\u20ac for each of the children.  However they did want to charge adult price for my 12 year old but I argued the toss and got away with child rate.  Drinks weren\'t too bad, 2 soft drinks and a glass of red for 10,50\u20ac.  All in all, for the price it was a good break away in Centre Parcs as there is no way I could afford Centre Parcs in the UK in the school holidays.  The people in the information centre spoke excellent English.  We had to use the first aid in the pool one day and the lifeguard that looked after us between his English and my French we managed.
title: Cheap half term break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed in a 4-bed cottage (822) which, yes, was a bit tired but quite frankly, who cares??! It rained every day but we had plenty of things to do. The pool was a godsend for us all and great fun. The shops, although a bit pricey were perfect for emergency shopping. We went to Carrefour in Laon for the bulk of our shopping. Purchased wifi every day for 4 devices so had plenty of access to the Internet and we also brought DVDs to play on our laptops for the kids and many games.  There are no ovens in the place but we took a slow cooker (which we only used once) and also a bbq. We will definitely return in larger numbers next year despite the rain, bearing in mind it was cheaper to come here for a week than to rent a cottage for a weekend in the UK.
title: Perfectly adequate
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Our premium lakeview cottage was lovely, not outdated at all.  We were a little disappointed  that our cottage didn\'t have a clear lake view due to an island in front but the wildlife was amazing. The swimming facilities were great which was good as the weather was not. So much to do, many friendly staff. The kids team were excellent and the kids loved the show at 5 with Orry and Bing, the kids staff work really hard. It did surprise me that some of the bar staff didn\'t speak very good English but then us English are a bit spoilt when we go abroad. My only improvement would be to have longer opening for the eateries. This may be busier in peak season but for us it wasn\'t easy to catch Mr Crok, the crepe place being open. The lovely Italian was only open from 630 and the other restaurant by the lake was not open every night and only from 7, a bit late for little ones. The other buffet restaurant I think opened at 6. We will definitely be returning
title: We loved it
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a great holiday .The Center Parcs formula works well for us . Activities are readily available and plenty to do for a week.This is a really easy drive from Calais We had a vip cottage which is very well equipped . The parc is 8 years old and the constant use is showing on furniture and fixtures . Nothing dangerous or unhygienic , but I can see how it might not meet expectations if you paid lots of euros. There are signs up promising a refurb through to next year.We did not pay a lot. The cost of this holiday was a fraction of elveden, longleat etc. This was May half term , though not at all busy in Europe. Don\'t worry about the language - this week seemed to be predominantly English clientele and the staff were fine with English .I would not say the staff were particularly enthusiastic  . They did what they needed to, unobtrusively, didn\'t go much further than that and I would also say they were in short supply...This may have been because there were 900 Ikea staff on site for a convention which closed some facilities and restaurants. This was not explained at time of booking, but the bonus was that the remaining facilities such Aqua Mundo and the activities were readily available.Because of this, I regretted booking the family activity package - best resisting an urge to pre book. Unlike uk Center Parcs booking on arrival is ok, but you will need to line up. The pre poked packages do not guarantee availability and some of the items were not available. If you do not use your package, they will not refund it...We tried the pizza restuarant and it was really slow . The staff we\'re stressed and unpleasant . This may have been due to the convention, but check to see if people are getting served before sitting down.We also struck out for a day. Went to epernay (1 hour) . The Mercier champagne cellar tour is disnified enough to engage our 5 and 8 year old boys. Also stopped in Reims to look at the cathedral and have pizza. Seems to be plenty of weekend events and parades.
title: New parc, don\'t expect it to be pristine...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: if you don\'t expect very clean rooms and comfortable  beads all the rest is great .better eat in room restaurant were ok but not high quality. some were still closed for winter . great location but old cottages
title: great fun for kids and family
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: It was nice place to stay, nice location, lake with wildlife. Staff friendly even with limited english. But accommodation by it self it\'s really outdated. If be honest it was worst accommodation compare with all UK centerparcs. It really lacks of new furniture and just simple paint. Also beds and mattresses needs to be replaced as state of them was disgusting. We staid in premium apartment, but i can compare it to buttlins standard chalets back in uk.
title: Nice place but...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed at a premium lake view cottage for 7 days.The view from the cottage was lovely.  The exteriors were quaint but the interiors were extremely tired, worn, dirty and smelly.  Our room on the ground floor smelled like wet dog.  The bathroom floor and the rest of the ground floor living space were filthy.  Same goes in our friends\' cottage.  The facility was fine.  It is what it is.  The kids enjoyed it well enough.  It could have been a decent enough holiday if the accommodation was any where near adequate.
title: Tired and dirty cottages spoiled the trip
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Me and my family have just returned from 7 days @ Lac d\'Ailette. Overall we have a good time, the dome was excellent for swimming. My 4 & 2 year ago love their time in the pool, there are plenty of lifeguards but I would say their attention isn\'t the best. I saw one man get into trouble when the wave machine was on with no acknowledgement from them and another one having a cosy chat with three girls. I would recommend you do your food shopping before you enter, as you can imagine you are captive audience so the prices are  automatically raised. If you do forget anything the little supermarket has plenty to select from. We stayed in a premium cottage which was a good size, but if you have young children I would recommend you do not have a lake view. You can not physically lock the back door and the front door from the inside. The back doors can only be locked by the internal handle and the front door is on a key card. The cottage itself was a bit dated a bit like the rest of the park in places, a lick of paint would not go a amiss. The indoor and outdoor play areas were very good too, but do not expect to see any animals apart from pigeons and chickens in the farm (a bit disappointing for the kids).
title: Good family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our 2nd visit to this site and it will be the last but my review is based on both trips.Cottage: Our 1st stay was in a 3 bed Comfort - this was basic but acceptable and we were lucky to have a water inlet site so enjoyed regular visits from Coypu and ducks. The sheets provided were paper thin and badly worn so it was lucky that we had taken our own bedding. the mattress in the master bedroom was disgusting and the shower downstairs was too small to use so the 4 of us used the upstairs bathroom which was ok.On our 2nd visit we upgraded to a 2 Bed VIP cottage and this was 100% better. The rooms were a good size and the beds were made up with nice sheets, quilts and pillows. There was an ensuite shower with full body shower in the 2nd twin room and the master had a full bathroom with whirlpool bath (looked a little worse for wear but ok). The bonus was the sauna which was a good size 2-3 person sauna with a large wet room attached. The kitchen was tiny but had pretty much everything you could need. TIP: buy the Nescafe Dolce Gusto pods before you go - they are twice the price in the site supermarket!This cottage was set high in the woods so the location wasn\'t as nice as the first time.The reason for the low score was because this time we had our bikes stolen from outside of our cottage whilst we were inside having lunch. Considering they were locked which meant the back wheel would not turn, I still cannot figure who would do this or why. When we tried to report it, the lack of English spoken by the staff caused real problems and it was not until the next day that we got new bikes so then it was a struggle to get reimbursed for the day of bike hire we lost. The staff did not seem bothered or apologetic for what had happened and it left us worried about leaving the cottage again or even being inside if someone was so willing to steal when you are inside.On the last night I also had an accident when tidying up the outside garden furniture. I stepped back and some rotten decking gave way under my foot so I got my ankle caught which made me fall over the sun lounger. This left bruising on my arm and ankle but based on the experience of reporting the theft,  we did not bother to report this to anyone. In any event, there should not be rotten decking but based on how dirty the patio was, I guess no one does any maintenance outside the cottage.Center Parcs is great for a quick getaway if you just want to relax, ride bikes and swim but it is expensive
title: Bikes stolen, lack of English spoken on site and accident due to rotten decking
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a wonderful quality time with our children. The swimming pool was great and they loved it. Posey club farm and kids club... Enough activities for them but not for us.Pre book the children activities to avoid disappointment and do not use the wannabe passes you are not going to be able to use them to rebook online and it is impossible to contact the resort by phone The reception staff are very disappointing and not very helpful. They don\'t know half of the answers and they need to ask someone If you lose an item you better forget about it as the number they give you for lost properties is not relevantI loved the concept but I have to say that there is a lot of work to do on customer service
title: Wonderful parc but disappointing reception staff
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a fabulous Easter holiday at Center Parcs.  The views from our cottage and around the park were stunning.  The 6 person superior cottage was warm, comfortable and very well equipped, although it should be noted that there isn\'t an oven in the kitchen.
title: Thoroughly enjoyable Easter holiday at Center Parcs Le Lac d\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed in house 702 after being offered a free option to chose our location by booking early. Checking out the map and seeing that this house overlooked what appeared to be a small lake or pond confirmed our choice. Unfortunately the map is very misleading, the pond was in fact a small man-made plastic lined ditch full of green algae and broken beer bottles.Upgrade to a Premium or VIP house and there are lots to choose from that are right on the main lake. Next time we\'ll pay the extra.We opted for a Comfort which inside was looking dated and tired, with broken and worn furniture, mold growing in the shower rooms and generally grubby. The beds are small and short and the pillows were stained. Bed linen is provided in vacuum packs so you need to make the beds yourself. The exterior of the houses is lovely, each house is different and a refreshing change from the UK\'s wooden clad breeze block buildings. The resort was quiet despite being at close to capacity with the only queues for guest services which was often overwhelmed. Aqua Mundo (swimming pool) was brilliant, loads of slides, a lazy river, rapids, wave machine and dedicated kids area. The supermarket was also ample with lovely fresh bread and croissants throughout the day. Prices were quite high but we took a lot of items with us and used the supermarket for daily consumables such as milk and bread etc.Not as much choice for restaurants as we are used to in the UK, a fast food outlet, an all-you-can-eat buffet, an Italian, a creperie and another venue which we didn\'t try (opened too late for the kids). These were all priced OK, \u20ac20.90 per adult for the all-you-can-eat for example.There are lots of outside play parks and a huge indoor play park too so great if the weather is poor. There is also a small petting zoo too which is free. A large and clean beach on the lake and plenty of nice walks.A nice touch was the golf carts to hire. Too expensive for us (\u20ac166 for a four seater, \u20ac231 for a seven seater for a midweek stay) and it was quite annoying after a while as they were constantly speeding along the roads which kind of defeats the enjoyment of the \'no-car\' policy. As they are electric and fast, and often driven by the kids it meant we had to always hold the hands of our own kids when walking around.All in all, I would recommend it to others. We travelled via Paris and Disney Land the weekend before and with the ferries and fuel it was still cheaper than the UK (Easter)!
title: The village is now looking a little tired.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Beautiful park not your usual center parc accommodation,all the apartment\'s are like cottages,the whole park looks like a french village,with a lot of the cottages with a veranda actually next to the lake,the insides are just like any other center parc accommodation so if you\'ve been before you know what to expect.The aqua dome is big,with alot of slides,lazy river that goes outside,crazy river which goes outside,infinity pool outside,and a large wave pool,all the pools are heated and have a good presence of life guards,there is also a seperate pool with slides and things for the younger children,there\'s also a cafe and snack bar inside,also in the dome there are  restaurants, bars,10 pin bowling and loads of other things to do.One piece of advice I will give is do your shopping before you get there,the supermarket inside is exspensive,there\'s an aldi,lidle and carrefour in the small town Laon only 7 kilometres away you\'ll save "ALOT".The parc is also very handy for day trips out,paris,euro disney and astrix land are all within range.All the staff we had dealings with were all very helpful and did there best to help,if they couldn\'t help they did there best to find someone who could,the bike centre had a good selection,it had more bikes than needed which makes a change,normally if you don\'t pre book or get there early you miss out on a decent bike,no worries here.As an over view a fantastic parc,car free after 10 on the day after your arrival,wide range of activities for all ages,quiet and relaxing,would definitely recommend.Please feel free to ask any questions,if i know the answer I\'ll try to help.
title: Fantastic!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I stayed with my husband and three children at this center parcs over the Easter Break. We have been to many other center parcs before (Longleat, De Vossermeen, Sherwood, trois forets) and were very disappointed by the whole experience which was not to the "center parcs" quality standard. The cottages are very old, dated and poorly maintained. The cushions on the sofa are ripped, toilet holders broken, stains on the wall, floor, bedding, carpets. The carpet in our bedroom stank and no amount of air freshener or open window would make a difference. The mattresses are absolutely awful: really soft like marshmallows. The rest of the facilities (including the aqua mondo and the dome) were similarly quite dirty and poorly maintained (with broken glass revolving doors) . The dome and the aqua mondo are quite disappointingly small. compared to the other center parcs.The reception staff seem to really go out of their way to be unhelpful and can never answer any questions and seem to begrudge any interruptions. They never try to find a solution to any queries and are just content to send you away. There are a lot of "maintenance" electric mini lorries driving at rather high speed on the roads, who clearly think they should have priority over pedestrians so if you have young children, beware! The only redeeming factor was the animation/activity team. They were really a friendly bunch, very nice to the children and very helpful. If only the rest of the parc was a bit more like them
title: Poor accommodation, very disappointing - worst center parcs ever
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Aquamondo is excelle for all the familly. You shouldn\'t neglict the emplacement of the cottage as some of them are really very very far from the activities (more than 30 min walking). Even in winter you have activities to enjoy, but it must be more pleasurable going to sprint-summer.
title: mobility needs to be improved
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have just stayed a week in VIP cottage 570 and have an overall positive view with a few points to improve on this Center parcs.Pluses: - it is a pretty village, not as nature oriented as what we are used to with other Center parcs though- the cottage is very close to the Center- there were plenty of activities for our 4 and 6 yo who thoroughly enjoyed their stay here and had plenty of free space and great play grounds to run around. They quite enjoyed the wannabe sessions (1 hour 45 plus 15min of presentations to parents at the end for the cook and circus experiences) - we really enjoyed the bamboo and Polynesian massages performed by Betty at the Spa- nice fajitas set (food and equipment) ordered and delivered one evening at the cottage, we conveniently only had to leave the equipment outside the door once we were done for Center parcs staff to collect it- staff is generally very friendly and helpful- great range of activities (quad, poney rides, sailing, cycling, segway ...)Points for improvement:- maybe due to the location of the cottage, the feel was more that we were in a pretty leisure village than in a secluded place surrounded by nature. We did have a view on the lake but with a view on the football pitch in between (which also had the benefit to offer plenty of free space for our kids to run around). Most annoyingly we had to endure the noise from the very loud mixing table located outside, feeling we were located near a disco for most of the day and late afternoon. Can be very painful when you come here to relax and get some quiet from city life- apart from the parent and baby class at the aqua Mundo with a lovely coach and free Bledina lunches for babies, there is close to nothing in terms of activities for babies in that village. The closest thing to a baby playground was the giant Lego play area in the children soft play area in the village Center but the floor was quite dirty. No bed sheets provided for the cot in the cottage. - leaflets for food delivery in the cottage not up-to-date in terms of opening times (check the actual times at the back of the map that is provided in the welcome pack)- very difficult to reach the maintenance service by phone (had to ask directly at reception for 2 items that needed changing) although once the reception desk was made aware both issues were swiftly sorted in a couple of hours- This is likely to be a difference between a village in the UK and one in France, but despite our cottage being VIP and staying for a full week, no change in towels or replenishment in toilet paperOverall a very nice experience which is likely to provide our eldest kids with plenty of nice memories. More of a family experience, less nature oriented than the UK one. Depending on what you are looking for, it may not be as relaxing for parents as could be in the UK due to shorter activities for kids, no cr\u00e8che for babies and difficulty to occupy the baby especially during bad weather due to lack of activities for them. Our VIP cottage was very conveniently close to the village Center with nice interior and exterior decoration. It could only be faulted by the mixing table noise, and slightly shabby appearance of some of the furniture (sofa fabric torn at corners mattress in master bedroom that has been shaped by previous visitors among others)
title: Good for families with kids 4 and more, not for babies
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Average Center Parcs.  Definite areas for improvement.  We rented a VIP Lakeside cottage which was looking tired inside and in need of an update.  The TV sporadically worked.  All activities have a cost (except a few and Aqua Mundo) and seemed over priced and not good value for money.  The small farm was cute but only had a hand full of animals.  Long lines for booking activities and getting information and it was a very quiet week guestwise so I would suggest booking ahead.  We rented two bikes for the afternoon and it costed 44 euros - no great value for money.Beautiful setting and location.  We took the bikes to some lovely abbey ruins 11km away with the kids and the cycle paths are outstanding and well marked.Restaurants - buffet was very average and overpriced, we purposely didn\'t eat there againCrepe Suzette was very goodIl Fornina - pizza and pasta was very good, great service and goodLakeisde grill - very overpriced, took two hours and food wasn\'t very good.  Waitressess were running off there feet and were unable to look after guests propertly (three requests for water and two acknowledgements of this and still never came, wrong drinks order, two hours for a burger etc - all in perfect French!)Bakery - breads very good but get there early as the preferable loaves go earlyNo where to get a coffee, no free wi-fi.
title: Good overall.  Some areas for improvement.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We spent four nights in a VIP cottage, really relaxing and comfortable. The site is nice even thought it\'s a big Center Parcs. The restaurants, as usual, too expensive and not great food (but OK all the same). Pool area was fun and there were lots of activities for the kids. We had four good days even though the weather was mostly dull.
title: Good family fun even on a rainy weekend
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed at CP in France for a week during half term. After looking at the UK CP (double the price) and other tour operators our family and another family decided to stay in a four bed cottage.Reviews on here really worried me. Yes it\'s a bit worn but it WAS clean And was a great base. The four bed cottages have one bedroom downstairs and a twin above it accessed by its own staircase. Then two more bedrooms upstairs accessed by another staircase. So for two families it was great as we had our own space as well as being together.The kitchen was fine - as long as you remember it doesn\'t have an oven! TV has English channels - BBC 1 and 2 and CNN.We did report a broken toilet one morning and within an hour it was fixed. Impressive.We rented bikes with trailers for the kids but we also walked a lot. From zone four where we were it was about 15 mins walk, quite flat and a lovely walk so we weren\'t too far away. Golf buggies were expensive! Hence we went for bikes.The area is beautiful - wildlife to see and the lake is lovely.We used the soft play a lot - it\'s huge and safe for kids and kept the four year olds easily entertained. It\'s a huge plus over the UK CP.The pool is great too - water temp is good and the lazy river is fantastic despite it being freezing outside! The boys had so much fun in the pool, it exhausted them.Cleanliness there was as good as any public pool I\'ve been to in the UK so nothing to be put off by.We shopped at CarreFour in Laon which is huge and topped up from the - rather pricey - shop on site for fresh fruit and bread. The restaurants on site are expensive so we only ate at the pizza place once - \u20ac80 for lunch for 7.I\'d love to go back.  But probably to another CP on the continent as they are far more reasonable than the UK ones and not rammed at half term either.
title: Great half term break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Was worried by reviews but very happy with our 4 person vip cottage.  Non lakeside but chose villa 579 and had a terrace on the waterway with plenty of ducks and coypu to feed . No problems re cleanliness and mattresses looked new when I stripped the beds in departure.Paid euro 55 in advance for a family minigolf, 55 min bowling and 30 min racquets.  Good value when you add up individual cost. Only other activities were \u20ac12 for 3 jumps on cool jump.  Struggled to use 3 free toppings that we got for booking early.  Choices were limited for those with older kids who aren\'t into the wannabe or baby ropes course. Used 2 for bowling (before 5pm only) and wasted one.  Shame that they couldn\'t be used in adult high ropes, cool jump, quad biking, pony ride or Segway. Recommend shopping at carrefour in laon.  Only bought bread and pastries onsite.  Bring your own dolce gusto pods, big mugs and wine glasses unless you like thimbles.Pool was very good although water quite chilly and nowhere near enough seating.  Lots of slides but Rapids not as powerful as erperheide or de vosserman.  Villa was nicer than those sites but preferred the Belgium sites for less hilly, less busy at Feb half term and seemed to have more on for young teenagers.
title: Vip cottage Feb half term
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed for four nights over Christmas. Weather was great which was a real bonus, the park itself and the lake are lovely and the pool and reception facilities are good. The cottage we stayed in (2 bedroom for 4 people) had a good view (number 536). Good layout for us and two small children but it was a bit dirty very tired and had a very worn feel to it. Centre Parcs market themselves as an upmarket holiday but this is not the case, I have stayed in better equipped and more modern mobile homes on French camp sites. That said the area is great, kids loved the pool, restaurants looked good but we didn\'t use them as they are very expensive (great local restaurant in the village two minutes down the road). It is much cheaper than the UK Centre Parcs so we will go again as we love France but don\'t expect anything too plush.
title: Lovely place just don\'t expect the sparkly cottages portrayed in the brochure.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Whilst first impressions may not meet up to our previous stay at CP Longleat in the UK it became apparent very quickly that this is a wonderful place. I can only imagine what it is like in the summer. Amazing place for kids, all centred around the lake. Accomodation seems old compared to Longleat but you soon get into the swing of things and you move on quickly. Cottage 551 recommended for being on the lake with private garden. Much better value for money compared to the UK. Drive from Calais takes 2 hours on 1 straight road all the way.
title: Centres Parcs Le Lac d,Ailette December 24th 2015 4 night stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We rented 2 cottages this summer for a little family vacation.Location is good: near Paris, can drive to Laons to see the cathedral.Service and housekeeping are HORRIBLE! Housekeeping had left windows open, there were leaves everywhere in the cottage (including on the beds), and one of the stray cats had probably peed in the foyer (welcoming smell was awesome). There are spider webs everywhere. The sofa have nasty stains (walls too...).  The dishwasher had smelly stagnant water in it. We call for maintenance. When we came back, it was still there. We had to run the dishwasher multiple times (and we never used it, smell was horrible when opening).Bottom line: housekeeping could not care less. We saw them smoke outisde the cottages , I guess they really don\'t check or do their jobs.TV reception is very poor.We asked for the towels and sheets packages. We rented cottages for 6 people and asked (and paid) for the same number of packages. We arrive in the cottages, not there. WE go to the reception, remind them, and go to the pool area. When we come back, they had not dropped the right amount of towels. I mean, what the heck?!Pool amenities are ok. Water can be dirty (hair, bandaids,...). People can be very rude and careless (elbow pushing in the rivers) even with young children. Lifeguards just sit on their chairs, waiting for their shift to end.Convenient store has very little fresh produce. I guess it\'s easier to manage stocks with just frozen stuff and potato chips.If you are a group of friends just willing to have fun, that should be ok. If you expect a nice little cottage and family fun in the pool, you might be disappointed.
title: Water fun, but that\'s it!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed late August 2015 in a VIP lodge.  We booked as we paid the same price to stay here for a week (inc ferry, fuel, insurance, and a night in a hotel at dover) as we would have paid for 4 nights at the same time at Centre Parcs in the UK.  We where a little put off by other peoples reviews so we decided to go for the VIP villa to try and do all we could for a good holiday.  It certainly paid off.  The VIP villa was comfy enough, it was clean but a little tired in places, but nothing unacceptable.The facilities where also adequate and our two children (6 and 1) had a great time in the pool.We liked it so much, we are going back in August 2016!
title: Not UK Centre Parcs but close enough for the Price
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The Aquamundo might be the best of all Centerparcs, for very young, till old, everyone will have something fun to do. Also a very big center layout with a big winter garden. Restaurants are oke, but I expect better quality, prices are a bit cheaper the in BE or NL, but still, I would pay more, if I can get better food. Opening times are also a bit strange, definitly have a look at all the opening times of the restaurants to plan your activities, you might be stuck in the swimming pool with nothing to drink or eat until 14h.Cottages was very clean, off course, you might have a bug or spider, but it\'s in the middle of the woods, you can\'t keep all of them out, in general clean cottage, however, they are all getting very old, kitchen needs replacement. this time we had a VIP cottage, and I would expect a nice flat screen tv, well a 39cm 3:4 (no wide screen) TV doesn\'t do it for me. this is definitly unworthy of a VIP cottage, time for them the build some EDEN cottage and do a major overhaul of the current ones.
title: Center and Aquamundo are very good, cottages are getting a bit old
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We spent four nights hear with friends and were a bit disappointed that there was not much going as was out of season, the pool was good but slides were mediocre, the Villa we had was a premier villa  but we unfortunately got one with bushes in the way of the lovely view of the lake and we found the beds a bit disappointing. All in all would recommend the centre parks in Belgium is much better.
title: Nice place but not much going on
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I had a problem with the booking, called the call center, waited 20 min at 0.23 \u20ac/min, spoke to a representative who said she could not help me. I insisted and repeatedely asked to speak to a supervisor. This request was flatly denied, and the a did not even pretend that the supervisor was busy. I was not offered a call-back either, nor an apology. "That\'s the process" is all I got.
title: Worst client service ever!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Nice place to stay. Lake view is lovely. Lots of walking and not as car free as uk centre parcs. A lot more activities than uk centre parcs. Restaurants not open for long periods. Swimming pool was great.
title: Pre Christmas get away
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After staying at 2 Netherlands locations, we\'ve decided to give France a chance..After reading some of the reviews here on Tripadvisor, we came with some concerns, but we were pleasantly surprised.We were a party of 6 including 2 kids (6 & 13).It took us 1 hour & 20 minutes from CDG Airport. Very easy to find with very clear signs once getting closer to Parc location.The nearest city to the parc is Laon. It\'s about 15-20 min away. You can fuel your car next to Laon & you can visit one of many restaurants in the city. If you wish to go to a supermarket, you can find Carrefour supermarket just at the entrance to Laon. It\'s a huge supermarket with nearly 1/2 the price (on many products) comparing to the prices they have at Le Lac d\'Ailette Center Parcs supermarket.The check-in was fast & easy as we used the online check-in prior to our arrival. Received our key right at the gate (Electronic key, what a surprise at Center parcs!).We stayed at Zone 0 (zero) which was not that far from the Aqua Mundo, restaurants, supermarket and main Parc facilities. But still, note that the Parc is huge and walking might be difficult for some. From our villa, it took us about 10 minutes to walk to the Aqua Mundo and we were relatively close..The setup of villa\'s around the premises is beautiful!  2 story colorful villa\'s all around the parc, what a great view. Our villa was Premium Cottage and included 2 levels. On the first level, we had a double bed bedroom, shower & toilet, living room, kitchen & covered terrace. Second level had 2 additional bedrooms, one with double bed and the other with 2 single beds. We had a bathroom (toilet inside the bathroom) upstairs as well and some closets inside the bedrooms & at the corridor. The villa was very clean. OK, if you really picky, you will find some broken tiles and some worn out  furniture, but this is not a 5 star hotel and you should come with no expectations for a 5 star hotel. It\'s a great villa in a forest area and it was great for us.Heating system was working great all around the villa and it really made the difference when trying to dry out the towels..Kitchen was well equipped with dishes, silverware, cooking pots, cooking pan\'s and everything you need to accommodate your party. We had no issues to accommodate 6 people. It\'s true, there is no oven in the kitchen, but you won\'t need one either.They do supply 2 kitchen towels, 3 dishwasher tablets, some washing cloth, one garbage bad and that\'s about it. In the rooms we had our beds made for us which was nice. In the bathrooms you will get one toilet paper roll..So.. to make your life (and stay) easier, make sure to bring with you the following: Few toilet paper rolls is a must, couple rolls of paper towels, extra kitchen towels and extra garbage bags. Very important to bring couple of towels to use on bathrooms floor, as there are no carpets in the bathrooms and it does get wet when you take a shower. If you didn\'t take the towels package from the parc, make sure to bring 2 sets of towels per person, one for home use and the second for the pool.We brought with us some sugar, salt, coffee in small bags, as you won\'t find anywhere to buy it in small portions.Sleeping quality wasn\'t something to write home about.. Mattresses are too soft and defiantly need to be replaced.. Pillows were awful. Bring your own if you can.The Aqua Mundo was superb!!  Just outstanding! Nice sized main wave pool (but not huge), many slides (I counted 8 to 10) and very fun for kids at all ages. Great pool area for the little ones as well. The entire area of the Aqua Mundo is very well kept and it was very clean. You will find lockers at the entrance to pool area. Each locker is for refundable 1\u20ac (you will get your 1\u20ac coin once you return your locker key into the locker), so you can use it as many times you want.We took the "family wi-fi" card which gives you 4 days of use, up to 4 different devices. The wi-fi service (by KPN network) was working fine for us, especially at our villa, but it was working fine all around the parc. You will need to register to the network each day, which is kind of annoying, but you need to do what you need to do in order to stay connected.. So take a pic of your wi-fi card to have your password in hand.The activities were nice, but as many wrote before, the activities are pricy. We took the bowling, trampoline, mini quad (for our 6 year old) and the Segway Tour (16\u20ac PP), which was 30 minute tour around the parc (10-15 minute to get the gear & training & about 15-20 minute ride).Animal farm was disappointing as they hardly have animals there.. When you plan your activities at this parc, take a note that on Fridays & Mondays (check-in & check-out days at this parc) there are almost no paid activities, so plan your activities accordingly and make sure to check activities plan at to information brochure you get upon check-in (or use the app, we did and it was great).We did eat once at the Pizza restaurant at the Dome (Il Giardino) and it wasn\'t so bad.. Nice sized pizza for 10\u20ac-15\u20ac.Other than Laon, we went couple of times to Paris (1 hour 30 minute drive away), Disneyland Paris (1 hour 15 minute drive away using toll highway, 6\u20ac each way).The staff at Le Lac d\'Ailette speaks no English at all, so If you are not French, be ready for some language challenges..Overall we had a great stay. This location is our favorite so far, and if we choose to return to Center Parcs again, Le Lac d\'Ailette will be our first choice.
title: Great Center Parcs choice!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: So I came armed with antibacterial wipes, spray, utensils, plates, cups and air freshener after the reviews I read....well I can only praise this place! It was amazing! We entered our HOUSE (no 484) complete with 2 toilets, large open plan downstairs and 2 bedrooms upstairs and immediately felt at home. Ok there is no oven but as we already knew that from reviews we\'d prepared for this and there was holes in our bedroom curtains but I can live with that! The pillows were a bit lumpy but we took our own anyway. Everything else was perfect and very clean. The dishwasher was a bonus too. Yes there is some bird poo and cobwebs on the exterior but let\'s not forget center parcs is based around being in a forest so what do you expect! The staff were lovely, gave us free activities, free wine, free desserts and always happy and helpful. The pool area was clean, there was lots of slides and they were all suitable for all ages. We were allowed to take photos in the pool area although they do have staff going round taking photos which you can purchase. It also says no picnic but I saw many people with their own drinks and no staff complained. The weather was amazing, the whole place was very quiet (maybe that\'s why it was so good) but I would definitely recommend coming at the end or out of school holidays. We paid less than half the price of the same holiday at UK center parcs inc our fuel, ferry and a gite for the night before! The food and drink on site was expensive so prepare in advance. We cooked breakfast and dinner at home but brought drinks in the bowling bar during happy hour 5pm-8pm and then desserts in the Italian restaurant and had wine there for \u20ac10 for 1 litre. There is a supermarket in laon called L\'eclercs where we brought our food and drink and we also brought a couple of disposable bbq\'s. The activities on site were very good although they do seem very laid back on the health and safety aspect, especially on the zip wire! Indoor mini golf was \u20ac8.50 for adults and outdoor mini golf was \u20ac10 euros each for adults but we paid \u20ac11 for 2 u12\'s and we just shared their clubs. Free jump was \u20ac8 for 1 jump or \u20ac12 for 3 jumps, I\'d advise doing the 3 jumps and our son was asked back up to do an extra jump for free. Jr quad biking was \u20ac11 for u12\'s, adult quad biking was \u20ac16 for over 12\'s but they said our 10 year old could do the adults quads if he wanted and they were definitely worth the money. We didn\'t hire bikes, our house was a 15 minute walk from the complex but we were happy to walk altho next time I\'ll take our own bikes or hire them so we can do a tour of the whole park. We booked wifi for the 5 days for \u20ac25 for up to 4 devices and it worked perfect. There is only one English news Channel on the TV so our boys iPads were good for keeping them entertained in the evening. We have visited 3 other center parcs in Europe years ago but this was even better than I remember them. It\'s not 5* but it\'s worth every penny and We will definitely be back!
title: Brilliant! We will be back
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed here for a lazy week, returned after 5 years... Hasn\'t changed - still decent value, still got the absolute best wild water rapids anyone can go down... Total hilariousness... Noticed the eating options are a bit limiting this time (as my family is getting older) but as its a nice mix of self catering and eating out when you visit this hardly matters. Food for younger kids is excellent.Would recommend paying the extra for a mountain bike if you\'re hiring. Some of the very old bikes need a bit of TLC...Staff couldn\'t do enough for you and were very friendly and helpful throughout.Accommodation wise it was very clean and comfortable especially the memory foam beds.But those water rapids. They are the best.
title: Best water rapids!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We are a family of 4 who have now been to all the Center Parcs in France and 2 in the UK. We have tried Comfort Plus and I believe what is called now Privilege - the one with sauna or Jacuzzi.What is striking with this Center Parcs is the natural mix of water and forest surroundings which can account for every taste. The accommodation was on two levels, but that did not inconvenienced us, it offered plenty of space for all of us. We always have used the half board method, which was great as when the children were small they were free, which I believe is unique to this site. The restaurants have always really good food on offer, we are aficionados of the Buffet, but beware that when there is a large company seminars they are likely to requisition the whole restaurant and you will have to go elsewhere. The Center is of easy access from Paris and from the UK. As for all Center Parcs unfortunately the activities are pricey but then so enjoyable. I will not say anything about AquaMondo, except that it is a dream for the children.We have always enjoyed a very warm welcome from all staff there and as such we came back to this particular site 3 times. It is not the most recent of them all, but I stand by my overall rating that it is the best. Thank you
title: By far the most pleasant Center Parcs I have stayed at
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Booked a week in a premier lakeside villa.Villa very tatty and worn out.Shower tap falling off wall, chairs rickety. Bird poo EVERYWHERE on verandah so it was unusable.Bedding threadbare and my little boys\' had holes in it. He cried because he thought there were bugs in it eating causing the holes.Staff aloof, too much smoking allowed on a site that caters for children. Toilets in Aqua Mundo and floors in swimming pool area filthy.Cycle hire staff quite rude and admittedly my French is limited but their English was poorer.Although we had paid for a week we ended up staying at the golf hotel around the other side of the lake for 3 out of the 7 nights as we were so disappointed.Restaurant wouldn\'t serve drinks without food and the cafe was stacked out with only 2 staff on. Majority of the other eateries were closed or very limited opening times....in August!!!!!The farm was a health hazard.Needs major investment.Won\'t be going back.
title: Disappointed
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I think reading reviews that cottages are being updated but our VIP cottage was filthy with stains on walls and holes in the sofas.  The dishwasher had been replaced but everything ended up with bits on it (which explained why all the glasses looked like they had been put away without being washed up).  The food was disappointing with too few staff trying to serve large numbers.  Crazy golf was \u20ac10 per person.  The lakeside setting was beautiful and the weather stunning and the cottages looked pretty from the outside.  We had a sauna but didn\'t use it.  We didn\'t mind that there were shrubs at the edge of the lake as it was hot and so offered shade.  I am sure if you get a newer cottage, it would be a great place to take a family.
title: Tired and Dirty accomodation
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Well was disappointed in this park.We booked a lakeside cottage but we didnt get a lakeside view instead we got a over grown area of trees blocking our lakeside view which we paid extra for & to be honset all you needed was a gardener to soetbit outn& i am sure it would have been fine.Our cottage was aboustly filthy from top to bottom we had white sunloungers on the veranda but was covered in green mould the place hadn\'t been cleaned in a long time real shame so my adivce to you if you are going to this place make sure you take cleaning materials with you.The whole place needs a good vamp up.Another thing i found really starange being a family resorte nothing opens till 10 am in the morning which i do find a little bazaar especially with little ones .No cash machine available no medical centre .! Activities thats just a nitemare they advise you to book before you come on the webstie i tried 10 or more times & it just wouldn\'t let me book i even tried to email them with a request for help no reply whats so ever so in the end I tried to call with the number they supply on the webste no answer .So yes we had to que everyday to book the children\'s activities be warned you would have to be very lucky to get a day & time to suiet you aboustly everything you do to craxy golf, bowling etc etc all have to be booked its such bad management.coupke if good points the beds are really comfortable & if you do want to book a lakeview i would suggest to go near the beach as possible.oh & your rubber gloves....:)
title: Disappointing
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Took a Mon-Fri tip. Took 3 hours from Calais with a stop off. Booked a VIP cottage and the trip was still cheaper than a basic cottage at a UK Parc! It\'s a really spacious place and a huge beach area next to the lake. The cottages are not the usual bland chalets but include 2 storey ones. The doors are opened with electronic cards so you can arrive early and then they switch them on at 3 so no need to try and time your arrival. The car park is near the middle so you can stretch your legs etc. The internal lake levels were a bit low but we still saw ducks, swans, a coypu, a pelican, moorhens and lots of birds. There were a few very friendly cats wandering about. Indeed if you\'re a light sleeper you may want earplugs to avoid being kept awake by the ducks quacking!Has all the usual CP stuff however the Aquamundo is amazing. 10 slides, some that go outside or are dark, outdoor Rapids, a lovely warm outdoor pool. If you like football take a ball with you as there\'s a pitch and a cool electronic skills game that kept our boys amused for ages. NB booking activities takes ages as there\'s always a long queue so check the weather forecast and then book as many in at once as possible. The badminton and table tennis are v good value. If you can, book in a family activity pack in advance - you get bowling, crazy golf & badminton or table tennis cheaply. The only thing that let it down was the food. It\'s all a bit Food Court - quality isn\'t great. The Grill restaurant is overpriced. If you have garlic bread in the pizza place ask for it without pesto as it\'s totally drenched in it! The best place was actually the buffet restaurant. Enough variety to keep the kids happy and you don\'t have any worries with slow service. Will we go back - yes definitely - probably to a cottage right on the main lake rather than an internal one.
title: Fantastic stay but let down by the food
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Lovely location on the lake and an easy drive from the channel tunnel but the whole resort could do with a face lift. We stayed in a VIP lake view cottage - didn\'t feel very VIP. The furniture was worn and walls battered. Also the kitchen was utterly inadequate for a family so not easy to be self catering. Eating at the restaurants on site is pretty expensive - 3 lunches and 4 soft drinks was \u20ac 65.Massive queues to book activities.Lots to do though and our 5 year old was in his element in the water park.
title: Tired
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After a good stay last year, got the feeling standards had slipped or they\'re running the place into the ground. Pool area still good and lake side activities plus a few new bits like zip lining. Booked a lake side cottage. Damp marks every where. Smell of sewage downstairs. Balcony, one of the main reasons for the room type, filthy. Had to clean it as well as all of the furniture. Wifi didn\'t work and, on calling hotspot provider in the Netherlands, told the wifi in the cottage, no 510, had been out of order for some weeks although Center Parcs refused to accept this which lead to many visits to the reception where there is always a long queue. Never resolved. Restaurants don\'t follow the printed opening times. Thus, considered food delivery option - half of the available items not available due to restaurant \'technical issues\'.
title: GONE DOWNHILL SINCE LAST YEAR
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were a party of 8 in two VIP waterside villas, aged from 2 to 60. We were, after previous reviews, apprehensive about cleanliness but I was pleasantly surprised. Both villas were clean but being honest they were tired. The facilities for younger children were excellent but I felt that grown ups were a bit over looked, compared to English centre parcs. The golf buggys they have are both a godsend and a curse. We hired one and it was fantastic for getting from our villa to the main centre which was 20 minute walk away BUT at the same time there were ones being driven too fast and by children and this made it dangerous if you had your small ones walking or riding in the park. It would perhaps be better if the buggys were a bit more restricted on the roads to prevent this or having roads dedicated to just cycling and walking. The pool area was fantastic although this can become more over crowded due to the visiting coach parties!!The staff were very pleasant and whilst I would not expect them to speak English it made booking such things as activities very difficult.
