A simple solution would be maybe a printed sheet so you can point at pictures or something similar it would save frustration on both sides. Overall it was an enjoyable week but I don\'t think I would rush to return.
title: Good but could be better
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have been to several of the UK Center Parcs and one in France many years ago.Unfortunately the accommodation was in need of a good clean,  many cobwebs, flies in the kitchen,  hair in the bathroom, and a balcony overlooking the lake with birds me on the floor and the furniture.   Fortuna let with 2 teenaged sons we didn\'t spend much time in the cottage.The pool and slides were nowhere near as good as the ones in the UK particularly Woburn which we visited a month earlier. The quality of the food in the Italian and Grill restaurants were good  and staff were welcoming.  The service however was very slow due to the numbers of staff on duty.  This was also a problem in the bar with no more than 3 staff working at any one time. The activities were good and my son\'s enjoyed the high wire the most.  Once again however there were nowhere near enough staff and the whole process was very slow.In summary the cottages are in need of attention and Center Parcs need to staff up to provide a better service.
title: Poor Service and Accommodation
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having stayed at Center Parcs Longleat before, we thought it would be nice to take our 2 children (aged 3 and 6) to a Center Parcs in France.  Stupidly we assumed that the standards would be consistent throughout the Center Parcs brand ..... oh how wrong could we be!I should firstly point out that we stayed in a VIP lakeview cottage, which is their top of range accommodation, described as \'High End\', \'Luxurious\' with a \'fully equipped Kitchen\'. I am trying not to laugh whilst quoting these descriptions!!We arrived in the evening to be met with a pile of dirty laundry at the front door, from the previous guests\' stay.  On opening the door, the smell of stale cigarette smoke was really quite disgusting, but not as disgusting as the overwhelming smell of urine coming from the toilet in the hallway (which was so bad it filled the cottage if the door was left open).  Already feeling disappointed, we have a little look around hoping that it can\'t get any worse....oh yes it can! There was a pile of cigarette ends left on the the terrace together with a dirty glass half filled with rain water that had been used as an ashtray.  The cobwebs around the lights in the main bedroom would have made any haunted house experience envious and the cigarette ash on the carpet next to the bed can only leave me thinking that the carpet had not been hoovered in between stays! There were stains on the walls throughout, holes in the sitting room upholstery, the kitchen cupboards were peeling. Also the \'fully equipped kitchen\' had no oven, except a combi microwave oven/grill, so the pizzas we had bought the kids on our way as an easy first night meal choice was a waste of money!So with no facilities to cook a pizza we head off to pick up our bikes and have something to eat at one of the restaurants. We take the opportunity at this point to stop off at Reception and put in our first complaint about the cleanliness of our Cottage. The details were noted and we were assured that the cleaning team would be notified - no apology was offered though and they didn\'t even seem particularly surprised!  After eating we arrive back at our cottage to find everything as it was, no cleaners had been, but by this point it is too late to complain again.In the morning we take another trip to reception, which is also the point to book activities, so we have to queue.  We put in a second complaint, but by the afternoon the only action taken is the removal of the dirty laundry.  We do not want to spend our weekend queueing to complain, so I take matters into my own hands and buy toilet cleaning products and air freshener.Whilst on my hands and knees scrubbing the floor around the toilet with disinfectant wipes it is obvious that the floors of the cottage have not been moped in a very long time - the wipes were black!! At this point I insist that the children wear their flip-flops whilst in the cottage, rather than walking around in bare feet!  I find a hoover in the cupboard so give the bedroom a good hoover to get rid of the cigarette ash. Although this clean temporarily helped the smell of the toilet, the urine was so ingrained in the floor that the disgusting smell just kept coming back.  Had we been in the UK I think we actually would have gone home at this point!Still unable to sit out on the terrace because of the pile of cigarette ends, I complain for a 3rd time on the Sunday, informing reception that I have cleaned the bedroom and toilet myself (although the smell keeps returning), but that in the interests of the next guests they really do need to get the terrace cleaned.  I showed them a photo on my phone just to make sure nothing was being lost in translation!  I was asked if I minded it being left until we checked out the following morning - I explained that at this point I couldn\'t care less, I was complaining again for the benefit of the next guests and that we would never be returning because the place is filthy!  Again, no apology and no surprise at hearing my comments, just an explanation that 2 cleaning requests had been passed to the cleaning team!What sums the whole experience up was the fact that having taken the children swimming for one last time on the morning of check out, we were joined in our changing room by a Cockroach \u2026.. nice!!Aside from the cleanliness issue, this Center Parcs is also not a safe environment for children.  We almost seemed to be in the minority when it came to cycling.  When I think of Center Parcs I think of outdoor activities with a safe traffic free environment for kids to cycle everywhere.  This could not be further from the truth at Le Lac d\u2019Ailette.  So many people continued to use there cars throughout their stay and if it wasn\u2019t cars we were having to dodge, it was golf carts which where available to hire. Needless to say, we will NEVER be back!
title: What a mistake!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: 1st time to Center Parcs.Huge place but pleasantly surprised by style of cabins (colourful Scandinavian style wooden chalet buildings), well set and spread out.We had VIP lakeside, right on water with views onto lake and across to sailing school on other sideCar free resort (you unload car at cabin briefly and then park in main car park during rest of stay), so you definitely need the bikes (rent them there) or golf carts. Clean resort, well laid outLots of activitiesManic queues to book activities on arrival so next time would do online ahead of timeFood - was hoping being in France that food would be better than what I had heard about the UK Cps. There are a few restaurant choices. Pizza place was fine, though service slow. Main buffet restaurant (marche du monde) - kids enjoyed the tex mex buffet night. Food ok. Very little choice for those with restricted diets (I am vegan.....) and they don\'t offer discount (given there were only a few things I could eat it was quite expensive per mouthful.....!)That said, it ticked the kids boxesAmazing zip line over lovely lakeside beachAwesome water park, busy but reasonably well spread out, given we were there at peak time
title: family friendly in lovely surroundings
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Last  minute decision for our family (2 adults, 1 ado, 2 kids and a dog) to go to the lac d\'Ailette in a nice cottage with lake view. Accommodation was clean on arrival, well situated end of terrace of 3 cottages. Cottage on 2 levels with one bathroom and one shower room, great terrace and small garden overlooking the lake. As soon as arrived the local wildlife came to greet us: the ducks, swans, nutrias and a female cat with her 3 adorable kittens! Plenty of activities for all of us, but I recommand strongly to rent an electric boat to go around the lake, the aqua undo is fabulous making everybody happy, the beach area at the lake is one of the highlights of our stay where we could all enjoy the glorious weather including our dog. The restaurants were as always in center parcs not cheap but we can say that we had a fantastic meal at the Italian restaurant with an excellent service from Lou ou waitress. All French staff were very friendly and helpful, nice to have  a lot of locals to get tips about day trips. We also went to visit the town of Laon, incredible medieval town 25 minutes drive away. The free visit of the cathedral is a must and we had a wonderful lunch Place de l\'hotel de ville at the Arcades restaurant, great friendly service and one of the best duck i have ever eaten! Now with the down sides: not so many but the reception was always crowded, maybe a general view for services that more staff could have been at hand. Definitely a good stay in a beautiful area we were delighted to discover.
title: Lake life in a beautiful French region
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have now been two years running during the UK easter holidays and the price is less than half that in the UK. Even when you add the extra fuel and tunnel crossing it\'s still much better value than the UK.The pool area is one of the best we\'ve been to and we have been to quite a few centre parcs places across the UK and Europe. Second only to Longleat.The houses are very colourful and different to the the almost hidden single storey affairs in the UK.Will definitely go again next year.
title: Good value compared to UK
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: nice surrounding of the parc. nice swimming pool.But with two young kids of 0 and 2 years old not recommendable. Also when you want some kind of luxury do not go there. We went for a premium cottage, but did not get the things we applied for.no bubble bath, did not work and they did not fix it. It looked old as well. No 2nd tv, according to Center Parcs in this parc there is no 2nd tv due to a mistake of the webmaster. Sorry but thats there problem and should not be mine.next to that bookers should know that there are no cars allowed and that is not or not clearly stated on the website. i still didn\'t found it even looking for it after our stay. Not fun with two kids and also when you need to walk a lot.for a solution they would contact me, but almost 2 months after our stay still no answer from them. Very disappointing
title: Nice surrounding, bad accommodation and bad service... paid too much for services did not turn out to be there
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: All i can say \' you get what you pay for \' \u00a31250 for a week is pretty good value in peak season for any holiday, but dont expect any luxury! Two main complaints was no air conditioning anywhere, and when its 30 odd degrees its a must in our opinion. Food for adults is poor (worse than disney!) we ate at the near by golf club which costs us about the same but was excellent. We stayed in the most expensive cottage but in need of refurb, especially outside decking is shot. Wont be returning.
title: \'You get what you pay for\'
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This is a really nice place to stay in France for a week. On the site there are lots of amazing activities you can do and there is a lot to do at this holiday park.The cottage that we stayed in was a V.I.P cottage so the beds were already made and it was clean and tidy in the cottage that we stayed in. The beds are really comfortable in the cottage because in some places that you stay in in France the beds are not very comfortable but in this location the beds are really comfortable to sleep in a night.Also you can pay for wi if for a weeks wi if pass so you can check all of your updates on your devices and when you get the wi if you get a card which has the wifi code on and you can use the wif I code for a week when you get it.Another thing is some of the cottages are close to the lake so on night times you could go out on the balcony and see the beautiful sun setting.Also at the centre parcs there is lots to do on site. You can go to the Aqua mondo which is a swimming pool and inside the swimming pool there are lots of different water slides to go on and there is a wild water course which is really fun, there are 4 hot tubs in the swimming pool 2 of the are inside and the other 2 are outside and also in the swimming pool there is a outside swimming pool and there is also a plunge pool which is really cold but it\'s really refreshing if it\'s a really hot day in France. Also there is a supermarket on site where you can buy all of your grocery essentials from and in the shop there is a bakery section where you can buy freshly baked things, and there are also 3 restaurants on site where you can eat it.When you go to the center parcs after you have unloaded all of your stuff in to your holiday cottage you will have to park your car in the main car park and when you have parked your car in the main car park to save you time walking back to your holiday cottage you can hire bikes or golf buggies. On this holiday we hired bikes to get us around the center parks and the bikes were really useful as we didn\'t have to walk around the site all the time. When you are hiring bikes you can choose the bikes that you want to have. Some of the bikes you have to pay for but the other bikes are included in the price that you paired for them.Overall I would really recommend this holiday park for anyone what wants a really nice week away and a really nice holiday place to stay in.
title: A lovely weeks stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We love the UK Center parcs - well Whinfell Forest actually. We\u2019ve been going at least once a year for the last 12 years but we also love France, so it was a no brainer in deciding to combine the two. It pains me to say anything negative about France or the French (my grandmother was French) but alas I feel I must give an honest account of our recent holiday there.Directions to center parcs Le Lac D\u2019ailette from nearby Laon were good. Check in was smooth, we were greeted at the gate by a girl who was polite and spoke good English. She she gave us our lodge number and directions to it. As we drove away I was wondering what her and another girl at the check in gate were laughing about and after now spending a week there at our VIP cottage I now know the conversation must have gone along the lines of this:\u201cHey Audrey, this family from UK say they love the Center Parcs there and how great it is , I\u2019ve given them cottage number 747\u201d With that the pair of them were doubled up laughing. I am also sure I heard Suggs singing \u201cWelcome to the house of fun\u201d as we drove past security.Our VIP villa looked promising at first glance. 3 showers, a sauna, 2 toilets and a large decked area overlooking a small lake and we were about a 15 min walk to the centre. However the cleaning of the villa was not great, stained carpets in the bedroom and cobwebs under the bed and balls of dust under the settee. The first morning our pastries delivery did not arrive as promised in our villa package, then we plugged the toaster in and not only did it fail to work it then tripped all the electrics in the cottage. I found the number on a leaflet to ring for technical issues and tried 4 times from 9.30 am onwards to no avail. I quickly figured out what the open fireplace was for - it was to send smoke signals to summon assistance. Luckily my other half managed to sort out the electrics and later on we went to the information desk to request a new toaster.That evening we went to bed only to realise the significance of our lodge number. The spa bath decided to \u201cauto nettoyage\u201d at various intervals during the night despite no-one using it at all. The first time it happened I thought a jumbo from nearby Charles De Gaulle had mistaken our porch lights for the runway. Stupidly the next morning I tried the technical helpline number several times but no answer. My other half suggested I try the booking enquiries number and surprise surprise it was the same telephone number. I came to the rapid conclusion that I would have more joy getting hold of Francois Hollande and asking him to deliver our missing pastries than getting hold of someone on that number (I know I am going on a bit about those pastries but I was so looking forward to them!)I trekked up to reception to report this and was promised a \u201ctechnicien\u201d would come and take a look but the next night the same thing happened. Again I reported it to a rather bemused looking staff member who told me to just switch it off. I kid you not. At this point I was ready to blow (just like my toaster) but refrained and instead politely ask what number it was on the electrics board so I could do this. I think they employ the FODY method of customer service in this center parcs - try and work out what this is, I\u2019ll give you a hint, the last 5 words are Off and Do it Yourself.Which brings me to another point. The villa does not come with any instructions for any appliance. It\u2019s like playing a game of Russian Roulette when you switch something on to see if it does actually work or you break it completely. We tried to use the DVD player but soon found out the TV was HDMI and they supplied only a SCART lead. The same \u201ctechnicien\u201d arrived when we reported this, looked and then shrugged saying he didn\u2019t have a HDMI cable. Luckily the fun didn\u2019t stop there, in the words of Jimmy Cricket \u201cand there\u2019s more...\u201d . We decided to look into the fact that despite it being 80 odd degrees outside the temp indoors was closer to 200 and found that underfloor heating had been left on in the living area. There there were probably Sheikhs walking around downtown Riyadh that were cooler than we were in that cottage. Again employing the aforementioned FODY method we managed to sort it out.We also decided to sign up to the wi-fi 40 euros for 4 days as we have a teenager who cannot be without Instagram etc for at least 6 hours a day or she turns into Evil Edna. However we couldn\u2019t connect from the cottage. After sending a few smoke signals to summon help with no response we decided to walk to the centre to report this. They told us to once again use FODY by ringing the people who supply the wi-fi. They quickly checked and told us the modem was broke in the cottage and we needed to get the technician to have a look. By this point I was on first name terms with the technician and was considering asking them to put a bed up in the lounge for him. I saw him more than my own kids on this holiday.The VIP package also includes towels, you get one bath (hand) towel and one hand (face) towel per person. If you are older than 9 then you might struggle for the towel to completely cover you up. I stepped out of the shower the first night only to be disappointed with the size of the towel and it reminded me of that scene from \u201cPlanes, Trains and Automobiles\u201d when Steve Martin has to use a face cloth to dry himself because John Candy has used them all. This measly allowance has to last you the full week you are there so make sure you take more (big) towels!We ate at the Italian restaurant a few times and it has to be said that a few of them must have attended the Basil Fawlty charm school. A pause of more than a second whilst ordering for our party of 10 was met with a loud and abrupt \u2018et\u2019 - she managed to cut her tip in half that night. They were at times bordering on rude and appeared impatient. To get around this I drank lots of wine to soothe my nerves which by this point were teetering on the brink of collapse. On a positive note the food was ok and the prices were decent - 10 euros for a litre of house wine.Entertainment of a night was distinctly average. There was a quiz in French and English a few nights that included fascinating questions such as this:\u201cWhat is the length of the largest lake in France. Is it: a.) 18kmb.) 20kmc.) 13kmd.) Don\u2019t careIt\u2019s a d every time for me.The karaoke was soulless. The lad doing it had all the charisma of an escargot. Song choices were, well in a word abysmal and included tracks such as Samantha Fox\u2019s \u201cTouch Me\u201d. If anyone has ever picked that I\u2019ll personally give them 100 Euros. In conclusion I have given it 2 stars one for the Aquamundo (did the Fonz name it this?) which was fantastic and 1 for the beautiful area and cycle rides around Le Lac D\u2019Ailette. All that was missing from our fun house cottage was a rotating barrel and an array of distorted mirrors. I love a good laugh but this was a bit too much even for me so I\u2019ll have to say it\u2019s a no from me if I was asked to return. I hope I\u2019ve given you all a little taster of our holiday and you can decide from that if it\u2019s the kind of holiday you too would like to partake in. Me, I think I\u2019ll be sticking to Whinfell Forest even with the Great British weather....
title: Bonjour Technicien
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed in a 3 bed cottage. Late booking. Weather was fantastic.  Parc had everything we needed including its own little beach. Aqua mundo water park was fantastic and our kids would have spent all day everyday inside.  Cleanliness of the cottage was not particularly great with some magnificent cobwebs down the side of the fridge!  Garden area not particularly great but to be honest we were out most of the time Bathrooms, bed linens immaculate though. Kitchen area quite small and not much room to store things. We ate in the on site Italian a couple of times.  Depending on who serves you depends on the friendliness of the place. The waiter on our second visit was amazing and was tipped accordingly unfortunately the waitress on our first visit couldn\'t muster even a smile!!  Food was gorgeous though on both occasions.   We hired bikes for two days and wished we\'d had them earlier as their are some brilliant cycle routes. On site shop expensive but nearest supermarket is about 7 miles away so not far if you want to stock up. Would recommend but don\'t be too fussy about the accommodation.
title: Family Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I would definitely recommend staying in VIP accommodation. Our VIP cottage (519) was 2 bedroomed, had a sauna & whirlpool bath, 2 toilets and 3 showers! The huge veranda which was on two sides of the cottage and had 4 patio doors leading onto it, overlooked the river near to the lake. It was in need of a coat of paint, but it looked like this was an ongoing project as some of the other veranda\'s looked fine. It didn\'t really spoil our holiday. there were a few scuffs on walls etc, but not the sort of thing that I would feel the need to photograph and post on here! The cottage was clean when we arrived. Aqua mundo was fab. there were play parks, indoor play area (which my children, age 10 & 6 enjoyed), football pitch, volleyball court and beach. When you book early, you get to choose 3 free activites (ask for the "toppings list" from the booking desk). there were plenty of activites that you could pay for, and we didn\'t find them to be expensive compared to UK parks. The bike hire was cheap (17 euros for a child bike for a week)we ate in the Italian restaurant & the creperie, which were nice. we didn\'t fancy the all you can eat buffet, and didn\'t get round to the steak house but it looked nice. Poolside snacks were reasonable. The onsite supermarket was fine - we didn\'t feel the need to stock up off site. my negative comment would be regarding the golf buggies that people can hire. It seemed a bit unnecessary, when you can choose a cottage close to the centre or further away (say 20 min walk) if you enjoy a stroll. Considering, we were there from 24th to 31st July, we didn\'t really have any problems booking activities, or getting a table in a restaurant. the Pool wasn\'t overcrowded and there weren\'t long queues for the slides. A bonus to the holiday were the Saturday night fireworks at 11pm.to sum up, this center parcs probably wasn\'t quite as well maintained as some of the UK parcs, but it cost us approx. \u00a31250 for a family of 4 for a week. about half the price of staying in a similar UK accommodation. we would have no hesitation in going back to a center parcs in France
title: reasonably priced compared to UK center parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We arrived for our 3 days stay to find a dirty smelling house,and a disgusting terrace full of bird droppings. Never been cleaned.We upgraded to premium for \u20ac55 this house was much better and clean.Pool ok but a bit dirty, full of leaves from outside. This park is tired and needs a good refurbishment, a bit like the whole of northern France. .Only stay premium in this place
title: Comfort house was disgusting
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: fantastic, this is a really good centreparcs. I was a bit nervous when I read some of the other negative reviews, now having been I can conclude that my fears were unfounded. The people who write a bad review based on a small mark on a wall or that accommodation is not five star, should not really be allowed to leave their house! the pool is great, accommodation was fine and in a really nice forest location. I have now visited all of the centreparcs in france and this one is easily the best. The restraunts are reasonable, the pizza one the best, good supermarket and all staff were really helpful and nice.would recommend and will be going back next year
title: great centreparcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I booked a premium cottage for my two teenage daughters and me for a midweek break.  On arrival our first cottage was from the outside covered in poo and dirt.  There were nests in the windows of the bathroom.  We went inside to be greeted by a smell of damp and dirt everywhere.  The balcony was unacceptable due to the dirt and poo everywhere on the chairs the floor and the table.  The carpets were also very badly marked.   All of us felt dirty just by being there.   We went to the reception to complain and was stood at the side of another guest also complaining about the same items.   We were moved to another cottage but that wasnt much better and in the end after one 1/2 hr trip to the Aqua mondo which was dirty and far to overcrowded we left.   We as a family have been to centre parcs before and never been met with this.
title: Very dirty
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The accommodation is tired and uninspiring, definite lack of cutlery. General feel of the place is that it is in desperate need of a make over. Dirty glasses in most restaurants and bars. Being in France which is well known for its culinary delights, the food is dull, tasteless and lacking in imagination.On the bright side most of the staff are courteous and helpful, but mis managed particularly at the main reception area.Our children did enjoy themselves, which was the main purpose of the holiday, but I feel centre parcs need to up their game to attract our family back to any site.
title: Tired and mis managed
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Over the last few years we have been regular visitors to various Centerparcs sites in the UK. We have thoroughly enjoyed these but now that our children are of school age we find the school holiday pricing rather hard to stomach.So we decided to take the plunge and try one of the sites in France. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the price for a week during the school summer holidays is roughly half the UK price for the same week.Le Lac d\'Ailette Centerparcs is in a fantastic location which is easily accessible with a 3 hour drive from the Eurotunnel.We chose to stay in one of the VIP cottages (number 492) located next to the lake and a short ride from the beach and centre. The cottage was a very spacious and comfortable bungalow. However it is worth noting that the decor is slightly shabby when compared to the equivalent UK accommodation  which has been refurbed in recent years. This however is a minor issue which is more than outweighed by the location and value.The facilities on site are a mixed bag. The subtropical swim areais easily the best of all the Centerparcs we have visited with a large number of water slides and interconnecting Rapids/Rivers.However the restaurants on site are disappointing compared to sites in the UK. Whilst the staff are good, the range of eat out options are limited with only two restaurants open on a regular basis.One other minor gripe is the fact that golf buggies are available to rent. This is an issue when you have young children on bicycles as we do. We usually enjoy the fact that our children can ride freely without the worry of any other vehicles on the road but the golf buggies spoil this luxury somewhat. Overall though despite some minor issues I would thoroughly recommend this site for a good value relaxing family break. We would definately consider visiting here again in the future.
title: Fantastic Location Great Value
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This is a nice 4-star place, but do not expect five. We stayed in a premium cottage which was nice with a dishwasher. Pretty good sound isolation between different rooms, we had four bedrooms and two bathrooms. It is quite a walk to get to the central areas so think about that if you have small children (we ended up having to carry our three-year-old a lot). The water park is wonderful and a lot of fun for all ages. Water slides for both kids and adults and a lot of different kinds of pools. They keep the water park dome at 28 degrees (it was 40 outside when we were there). They buffet restaurant was not so fun, food was not fresh and there were flies everywhere. The Italian restaurant was nice though. A little pricey but a nice family resort!
title: A nice time but not a five-star resort
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: My husband and I are the sort of people who will always make the most of what we have... And this was really put to the test at this center parcs. We go to center parcs every year in the UK and love it, but we both felt that this place really let them down. On the face of it, it\'s very pretty indeed, but the cottages need some serious renovation. Not just a lick of paint or an update, but a complete renovation. We had damp... Lots of it. Skirting boards were flaking away like wet cardboard. The fitted baby gate was no longer attached and just fell off (and it was a big heavy one so could not be used in case it fell on the baby!) The kitchen was falling to bits as was all the equipment. Kitchen utensils so bendy I couldn\'t even stir pasta in water! There was no kettle and a disproportionate number of cutlery... Loads of forks but 3 teaspoons! I know this is probably due to other holiday makers taking the cutlery with them but the management should make an effort to check the cottages between rentals. There is no phone in the cottage so any problem means paying from your mobile or a trek to reception desk. The sofa was covered in cigarette burns. The patio was plastered in bird poo... Did not want to sit outside. The whole cottage was filthy when we arrived... But we soon corrected that ourselves. Positives about the cottage - comfy beds and good shower, but that is where it ends I\'m afraid. We had read the reviews before going but always take reviews with a pinch of salt. But this place was a serious disappointment. When we arrived we asked if we could upgrade to VIP as we were already in premium, but the receptionist told us that all cottages were in the same state and had not been renovated for 7 years! And it really shows. It feels like they just don\'t really care about it... Very different to the UK where pride is taken by every single member of staff to keep everything in tip top condition. The village itself... The centre was odd as for the first half of our week it was deadly quiet... Eerily so. Then the weekend arrived and it was absolutely heaving and felt uncomfortably full everywhere. The swimming pool was one of the best I\'ve been to. 3 slides were shut but there were still loads of slides. My daughter loved it as in the UK they won\'t let her on most of the slides but there seemed to be few rules here, so she could go on everything. We also enjoyed the pancake house and fast food restaurant. Indoor soft play was fab too. We did have a great holiday but would only return if we knew the cottages had been renovated.
title: Lots of potential, but not quite there
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: My first impression was good. The park is, as always nicely situated and the houses in different colors look nice. When we arrived at our cottage, the cleaning team just left. I was a little disappointed entering the cottage. It did not seem to be so clean and everything looked rather worn. I have to agree with many of the reviews that it can use some TLC. Aquamundo seem to be rather dull at first, but it turned out to be very entertaining for my 3 year old daughter. She can basically do everything. For us it was not so exciting, the only two \'red\'-category water slides are in...the kids area :) To be fair, they were building something new for older kids.Food in the main building was not cheap but at least the buffet and the Italian restaurant were more than ok. WiFi had to be paid ( \u20ac25/week 4 users via KPN Hotspots ) but was at least was fast enough ( D15Mbit/U10Mbit per user ) for Netflix, surfing and VPN.In the end we had a nice family holliday, and we had a lot of fun in Aquamundo!
title: Not bad, had better!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Typical Center Parcs, very clean and spacious villa. Got lost a couple times trying to find it! The bakery and supermarket were great, allowing us to buy things for lunch etc and was reasonably priced. Big supermarket not far away for doing a big shop just after we arrived. The pool was great, as were the rapids and water slides which the kids love. Didn\'t use the restaurant, the kitchen was big enough to cook for the 6 of us each night.
title: Excellent week stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Built on and around a picturesque lake the location of this centre parcs can not be faulted. Well sign posted from the highway in all directions it is easy to reach and staff are efficient at getting you checked in. The facilities are exactly to the centre parc specs - great swimming pool (can get busy we were there in low season and there was still over 500 people in the pool), an on site supermarket selling all essentials, a bakery and a variety of restaurant/cafes (not all are open in the low season) and sport facilities. Arriving at the beginning of the season we were disaappointed at the state of our accommodation - not only was there a stagnant, damp smell upon arrival (which required us to run taps and open windows) there were a number of fixtures and light fittings broken (see photos). Whilst we didn\'t spend much time in our cottage (there is a lot to be amusing your self with outside) the price-value of the accommodation really dampened our holiday here.
title: Beautiful location shame about the shabby accommodation
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The door of the cottage doesn\'t work properly, no number to call, need to go to the reception and wait for somebody to unlock. 30 mins under the sun and still awaiting. Yesterday they didn\'t give me bike because they had just close the place for renting.Better rent an house in a real village.
title: door blocked still waiting for somebody to unlock
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Really dissapointed with the accommodation and general upkeep of the site, it\'s really sad as such a lovely place and a good deep clean and general maintainable is all that is required, if it\'s broken just fix it! The chairs in the sport bar had duct tape on them 3 years ago and now they just have more duct tape on them! Our villa needed lots of little things fixed and a really good clean, it was cleaner when we left than when we arrived, I don\'t really go on holiday to spend the first two hours cleaning!The worst thing this time was the pillows attached lumpy photos! So if you go take cleaning products and your own pillows!
title: Fourth visit in 7 years, probably our last.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Please do not be put off by some of the reviews! We stayed here last week (8th June) and the place is lovely. The cottages look great, yes some marks here and there on the walls but what is to be expected when 2 families a week are staying in them. The park its self was very clean and tidy.The staff were friendly and tried their best with us although we knew no French at all!! The aqua mundo was amazing, even at its busiest point was never too crowded. Yes supermarket a little over priced but only what you would expect from a small local shop in England. We ate at the italian a few times and the food was good.We have a 4 year old and 2 year old, went pony riding which we loved. No cues to book this in and even booked for next day.Only negative was a bit of a walk from some cottages to main centre. (10 mins max!)Please don\'t be put off by negative reviews as i was a bit worried due to these, (have high standards) the place is great and very beautiful! Much prettier than our english centre parcs! Can\'t wait to return! (easy drive from calais and disneyland)
title: lovely family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I really enjoyed this parc . Bring your bike if you have strong calf muscles as a bit hilly. We hired a golf buggy which was great.  It was nice having a proper house rather that prefab,although was in desperate need of a re-furb. Even though we went at spring half term it was 1/2 the price nearly ok uk centerparcs and not as crowded.
title: Enjoyable but don\'t go comfort!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were a party of 3 adults and 2 children (5 & 2yrs) travelling in UK half term (not a school holiday in France) and having read some of the reviews on here I was apprehensive about the accommodation.  I needn\'t have worried, we were in the basic lodge and it was a bit tired but perfectly fine and was more than made up for by the beautiful lake setting, beach, numerous playgrounds and relatively quiet pool complex with the great kids pools. Plus easy 2hr drive to Paris. Would def visit again!!
title: Lovely place - much better than some reviews suggest!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: When arrived the cottage smelt musty and bad. carpets were stained, duvets were filthy, pillows were lumpy and both smelt discusting. Took three complaints to get this sorted and it took until 9pm.  Ordered a moving in and relax pack which con sited of towels, kitchen towels, toilet roll, kitchen roll and washing up liquid. Instaed of milk, tea and coffee, they gave me a bottle of sunflower oil and a 2ltr bottle of vinegar????? Kitchen pots and pans and utensils not up to standard. Kitchen smelt really bad and fridge reeked of onions.  I would not recommend to my worst enemy.
title: Aweful standard of accommodation
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a fantastic time at this parc, please don\'t be deterred by the negative reviews.  Our cottage was clean and comfortable,  Don\'t get me wrong there were a few bits that could have done with a bit of attention (a couple of small holes in the bottom of curtains) and the deck area could have done with a bit of a clean up from the weather wear.  But it had everything we needed.  The beds were really comfortable and the house lovely and warm.  The kitchen was well equipped, with the exception of an oven (we still cant work that one out!)  We hired bikes and I would say these are essential as the parc is fairly large and with young children (ours are 7, 6 and 4) they might get a bit tired walking to and from the aqua mundo.  The aqua mundo is awesome, we swam every day.  Even at it\'s busiest it was still great, there\'s a wave pool, a lazy river, loads of flumes, a water play house for the kids and and a very lovely calm pool area for the real littlies.  They have buoyancy vests available for both children and adults and most days there was also a photographer in the pool who took lovely family pictures without pressuring you into buying them.  The changing rooms were clan and the showers warm. The supermarket was well stocked and if so inclined there is also a Carrefour in nearby Laon.  The restaurants are however a big let down, we ate at both the buffet and the italian and wouldn\'t recommend either.  The service at the italian was painfully slow and the food average for the price.  The buffet we felt was overpriced without a huge range and the quality was again average.Due to the age of our children the activities were slightly limited but we took part in pony riding (adults need to wear closed toe shoes), high ropes (this was awesome!), pedalos and indoor mini golf.  The kids loved all the activities and we would recommend them all.We would also recommend the creperie for lunch or a snack, delicious.Be prepared that the staff overall speak very little English, we tried really hard to communicate as much as we could in French and the harder we tried the more accommodating we found the staff to be.The park itself is very scenic and there is loads of wildlife to spot.  It has been made to feel very natural.  There are several, well maintained play areas for the children and areas for the older children too - a skate park, an interactive football goal etc.I would definitely recommend this park and we will be visiting again.
title: Hidden Gem - Great Family Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed in a 2 bed Premium Villa with a lake view, perfect location (no. 553).  We had a walk through the village and noticed how some of the other villas, not lake view ones were very much in the trees/would be quite dark inside, so very glad we booked a lake view.  The beach area, aqua mundo and activities were all brilliant.  Plenty of slides in the aqua mundo, the rapids, a very long lazy river and the infinity pool, all brilliant.  Our villa had a lovely covered decked area which we ate most of our meals at.  Inside could have done with a paint job and new carpets in the bedroom, but it was very clean and comfortable.  We took a little bbq which was nice in the evenings.  My 15 and 13 year old boys bought a football to play against the football wall/game - this was in constant use, very good for them, together with the volley ball nets and football goals.  Would definitely stay again.  Very easy to get to from Calais too.
title: CP stay Fri 22nd May to Fri 29th May
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Le Lac l\'Ailette is set in a beautiful location next to a picturesque lake and back drop of hills.  Having visited 8 CenterParcs in France and Netherland this has one of the best Aqua Mundo in the number a variety of water slides, its wild river, lazy river and pools.This was our second visit to Le Lac and we would highly recommend this park
title: Great CenterParc in France
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: A super location for lots of fun with children and family. No matter if it is warm (there is a lake with the beach and aquatic activities) or cold (the AquaMundo is just spectacular, a huge system of swimmingpools, open and closed slides, waterfalls, rivers...), there is always something to do.There is also  a spa to relax.Dress comfortably, as there is a lot to walk in the nature, very agreeable.
title: A kid\'s paradise
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The previous two reviewers appear to have stayed at the same time as us, and I agree totally with their reviews.We arrived quite late on the Friday evening. It\'s half term, so we expected it to be busy.  We stayed in a 4 bedroom premium lakeside lodge.  The lodge was perfect for us, as the four kids had the upstairs to themselves, so we didn\'t have to look at the mess.The accommodation could be quite lovely with a bit of love and care.  There was a lot of dust and dirt - which is a real shame.  Our fridge didn\'t shut properly unless you leant on it for a few minutes.  With four teenagers, this was difficult to police, so the contents were not always kept as cold as they should have been.  Indeed there\'s not an oven, but we had a microwave that had a grill facility.  We used that as storage space for bread and croissants, as if you left them anywhere else (and I mean anywhere) they were engulfed by ants.  We didn\'t, thankfully, have a wasp or hornets nest on our veranda, but we did have a birds nest that was constructed during our stay.  The visits from the family of ducks and European Water Rats were always lovely.So, we pre-booked and pre-paid for six adult bikes.  We arrived at the cycle park mid-morning to experience carnage like you can\'t imagine.  There were tens of people wandering around trying to locate a bike - of which there weren\'t any.  Not one adult bike.  Our four children are teenagers and taller than me - they were so excited at having a bike for the week they were forced to choose a children\'s bike - which was far too small for each of them, and the brakes were a little iffy to say the least.  We were unable to source an adult sized bike for myself and my partner.  There were also no golf buggies available for at least four days.  My partner and I had to walk the mile or so to the center every day, sometimes three times each way, and were were pretty fed up and tired by day 3.  At this point we had to beg for a golf buggy, which we finally manged to obtain late on Monday.  We didn\'t want to have to pay such a large amount of money, but having spent 3 days walking we were desperate for any kind of transportation.Activities.  We tried archery first.  We pre-booked 6 places before we arrived, but were only issued 5 tickets, so one of us had to just watch.  There wasn\'t sufficient safety equipment - no arm guards were given out or finger guards.  I suffered horrendous bruises on my arm.  The instructor spoke very little English, so very little instruction was received for our kids.  The bows and arrows were quite old and worn out.  Overall we had quite a good time though.The swimming pool was excellent.  We enjoyed this activity the most.  Even though the main flumes were closed, the ones that were open, along with the water rapids and lazy river, were fantastic fun.We booked segways.  Again for 6 people.  Upon arrival one of the segways was broken, so again one of us had to miss out.  The session was for 20 minutes briefing + 20 minutes segway experience.  I would guess the briefing took 10 minutes, and only 13 minutes experience (I followed in our golf cart with a go pro recording so know it was only that long).  That was quite disappointing.Three of our children did the high ropes - this was very well organised and would highly recommend it.The on-site supermarket is good, however I took a drive to the local supermarket in Laon where the prices were almost half.Queuing at the information desk is hit and miss.  We spent 40 minutes on one occasion, to sort out the paintballing session (again, pre-booked but tickets were issued for the children\'s version rather than the adults version so needed to change it).We ate in the pizza pasta restaurant - food was pretty bland and tasteless.  Also ate in L\'embarcad\u00e8re - which was excellent.The resort is beautiful.  So pretty compared to the UK box accommodation.  The kids still preferred the UK Center Parcs, but purely because of the language barrier.
title: Very good resort - but massive room for improvement.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: A pleasant setting and better than expected cottages (VIP) but experience marred by feral cats roaming through the garden and all over the garden furniture.  Attitude of staff when reporting this was a study in indifference. Center Parcs Lac D\'Ailette has so much to offer so a great shame that the cats became such an issue.  Clearing cat faeces from the grass is not what we went on holiday to do.
title: Cats not on the menu
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great location on the lake - but room was not cleaned very well on arrival . When compared to UK sites still a lot to improve - not as many activities offered, poor sports hall, restaurants not open every evening. Also on change over days no activities which needed staff were on. Does appear they are trying to keep costs down by having limited number of staff.
title: Enjoyed but several issues to be resolved
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed for 3 nights in a VIP, lakeside cottage at Lac d\'Ailette over UK May half-term. We have been to 3 different centre parks now and the activities are always great fun. However, the catering at this resort was poor to average and the cottages are in need of a makeover.they are kept reasonably clean and spread with lemon scent upon your arrival, but this only masks the tiredness of the properties. Someone needs to get a paint brush out.Service around the parc in general is very good with the exception of the restaurants where it is very slow and perfunctory. Il Giardino was the best by far. Lovely location, great fun ... overall very average value.
title: Great activities, tired cottages and very average catering.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed with 4 adults and 3 children in a 4 bedroom premium cottage. Cottage was tired and a bit worn. Most mod cons, dishwasher, microwave, electric hob, coffee machine. No oven though which was strange.Cooked one night and a million flys invaded us!!!Not much choice to eat at the park.  However there is a buffet which has lots of options.Great on site shop. Biggest tip is to book all your activities when you first arrive or before. We missed out on a couple of activities.All in all this was the first non UK centreparcs we went to and we will be going back.  Great fun !
title: Family Fun
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We are at the centre parcs le lac d\'ailette just now.  This is our first visit to a Centre Parc so I knew nothing about the set up.  I booked all inclusive and to be honest it\'s really been a problem since we got here.  We came for three nights - Tues to Fri and check in is 3pm, although you can arrive earlier if you choose we had a long drive and arrived at 3 on the dot.  I found that we had 3 lunch tickets each but only two days (Wed and Thurs) to use them as we have to check out on Friday at 10am.  I asked at the lunch delivery counter if it was possible to use the 3rd voucher on Friday and take the lunch away with us but they said this was not possible as they could not deliver it before we left at 10am.  The young girl was very helpful and took me over to discuss an alternative with the staff on Customer Services.  Another 15 minutes passed while I explained this to her before she went off and got a Manager. After yet another 15 minutes (45 in total) the manger decided there was no easy way around this and said we could use these vouchers in exchange for drinks or dessert (as these are not included in all inclusive). As we just wanted to get on with our break I agreed and asked her to put it in writing incase I wasn\'t lucky enough to find an English speaking staff member at the restaurant. By the time all of this was sorted, our daughter had had a swim and got ready to go out it was 9pm. There was only one restaurant open so we headed there.  We didn\'t take any cash with us as we were covered for a drink and a meal but I thought I would present the voucher to staff first.  After yet another 15 minutes of discussing it with a lovely lady in the Pizza Pasta restaurant she called her manager and after trying to convince me to use our toppings for drinks and another 15 minutes passed it was decided that they would not be able to honour what the customer service manager had agreed to, What a waste of my time!!! When I got back to the accommodation I wrote an email to Centre Parcs via Facebook as it was the only contact I could find.  I received a very polite letter back advising that I had written to the UK one and they are a completely separate company to the one in France and advised me to write to centreparcs.com which took me straight back to the one I had written to. I have posted on Twitter asking for a contact email address but am yet to get a reply.  There are telephone numbers to ring but I want to discuss this in writing and there is NO EMAIL address to write to - hence why I have taken to trip advisor.The all inclusive arrangement appears to be somewhat of \'best kept secret\' from the staff at the resort. Breakfast can be eaten at L\'Orree du Bois but after searching we could not find it and were turned away from the Marche du Monde as it was not valid for that restaurant although another 10 minutes queuing at reception the manager advised it was one of the same place and took us to the restaurant again and told the staff our vouchers were valid.There are no clear guidelines on the All Inclusive arrangement.  The tickets says drinks not included but nothing else is specified and the staff don\'t seem to have ever seen these tickets before.  I certainly won\'t be booking all in again.  It\'s all been a bit exhausting and I still haven\'t got a result.
title: On the whole a nice stay but will never go All Inclusive again!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: brilliant family holiday with lots to do. we have a 5 yr old and 9 months old and we found this to be the best family holiday which we all enjoyed. There is plenty to do and if you don\'t know what you want to do or it rains there is the indoor play area or swimming pool to use
title: Brilliant for all families
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The location is perfect, the amenities are plentiful, the accommodations are worn and could do with a deep clean and refurbishment. There are not enough staff to assist with the amenities and the restaurants are not well patronised. Lengthy queues at reception, but very professional service once you are attended to. One step up from camping, with lots to do across the site, but be sure to plan your activities, pick a cottage in zone 5 or 6 and venture to Laon for an alternate dining and shopping experience.
title: Lacks a little something
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just got home from a fantastic stay at this place.  Would recommend it but it did have a few down points.The service was really poor and slow.  Expect to sit for 10 minutes at least before being offered a drink.  That\'s after waiting 10 minutes to be seated.  Food was ok, cost about 40 euro\'s for a basic meal for family of 4. Apartment was big and spacious.  Unfortunately all the wood needed re doing and the sealant around the bath was all falling out.  This was the top VIP cottage aswel, I certainly wouldn\'t risk going for a lower grade one.All in all, lovely place, we will return but hopefully it\'s had a spruce up and more staff before we do.
title: Great place, could do with some TLC
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The cottages are out dated and  dirty, in the Supermarket you have almost nothing (make sure you do your shoping somewhere on the way to the parc) , the Italian restaurant only has frozen products, in the "Creperie" we had to wait more than one hour and we were told that this is normal(!?). The Aqua parc is nice and the there are a lot for children but this they have in other Center Parcs as well so as I said DO NOT GO THERE, choose another Center Parc
title: Don\'t go there choose another Center Parc
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Center Parcs in France was cheap at Easter compared to those in England. Lovely location, good food and fantastic house wine at \u20ac10 for 1 litre! The accommodation was nice with lots of wildlife to watch. We had a great time.
title: Very good value for Easter period
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: My husband and I with 4 children (2 of his and 2 of mine, 16 year old twin boys, a 13 year old boy and 9 year old girl) went for a week here last July.  All children enjoyed the activities on offer; we had bikes for the whole week, swimming (free), with slides etc, pony riding (extra) and catamaran sailings (extra), which is available at the sailing school situated a 2 minute drive \'next door\'.  We stayed in a 3 bed VIP villa.  The level of cleanliness was average/good, although the bedding could have been better and the pillows were very firm, of which, you only had one per person.With regard to the restaurants, the pizzeria is the best.  Stay away from the fast food hamburger outlet - awful!  The fresh bread from the patesserie in the morning is excellent.  We also enjoyed the in villa barbecue service a couple of times - they deliver a table top barbecue and food and collect the equipment the following day.  There is a charge for this obviously....The onsite supermarket is expensive so well worth venturing out to the local town to buy provisions.  With flights for 6 people to Paris, car hire and the accommodation costs, it was cheaper to holiday at this Center Parc than one in the UK!!
title: Great Summer Holiday for all Ages \ud83d\ude0a
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Excellent value for money compared to the cost of UK Center Parc sites.  Great location around a lake.  Choose a chalet ahead of time near to the lake and avoiding the slight hills.  Recommend self catering.
title: Great value for money
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Overall the parc is set in a very beautiful area, very easy to drive to from calais. Cottages are very lovely and comfy, activities are very easy to book but if going at a busy time make sure you book in advance. Highly recommend the children\'s wannabe activity it\'s \u20ac10 for 90 mins and my daughter loved it. Bikes are in good order and a must have, aqua mind I is fantastic, very clean and great changing area.The biggest thing that lets this parc down is the restaurants. The cottages have no ovens only a hob and microwave which l I must your ability to cook
title: Do not eat in the restaurants
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This is a very different setting to our previous trip to Les Bois, in that most of the housing is set around a large lake. We had a 4 person VIP lakeview that had lots of ducks, swans and copyu\'s coming to visit. The house was clean, but a little worn in places and the dishwasher did not work - this did not impact on our enjoyment at all, but was a little annoying.We hired bikes for the week and really enjoyed the \'car-free\' cycling unlike at Les Bois. Please note that the back of the park away from the lake is quite hilly - epecially going upto archery! The AquaMundo was fab and a real highlight of the trip, especially the Aquaspeed activity which the staff went out of their way to make fun. We look forward to going back.
title: Le Lac at Easter
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just come back from an incredible week at Lac d\'AiletteI was slightly nervous after reading the reviews about the cottage cleanliness at Lac d\'Ailette but was really happy on arrival to find the place was emaculate. All items ordered were there and the whole cottage was clean and well equiped.Other than a problem with the lighting along the beach where some development of an additional high adventure was being completed the whole parc was as you would expect from Centre Parcs.Both the italian and steak restaurants were very good, the buffet restaurant had a very limited selection although food was ok.i would definitely recomend to friends.
title: A really great week
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Had a great time, lacking in facilities compared to UK but good value. The reviews that we read about lack of cleanillness  not correct in our experience but we had a top of range accomodation. Only issue a couple of plates not properly cleaned from previous guests but other than that fine. Would defo go back x
title: first C P outside of UK
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Very enjoyable place.. lovely situation on the lake (although this time of year many of the outside / lake activities did not seem to be active). Easy check in, Comfort villa was "comfortable",  Swimming pool is great.. better than we had experienced at UK Center Parcs (Longleat)... plenty of slides and variation to keep everyone amused in the water.  Well stocked super market and good options for food... In all we had a  very relaxing time..   On the not so good side Beds were awfully soft and the single beds are very narrow (our 13 / 12 year olds struggled).. and they rent electric golf buggies out to clients.. WHY???.. man up people a use a bike / walk... it caused unnecessary stress on the roads in our opinion
title: Long Easter Weekend At Center Parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: A colleague of mine recommended Lac d\'Ailette to us and having previously spent time at Elveden I had high expectations. The park didn\'t disappoint. In fact it surpassed my expectations in some ways. I had read enough reviews on Tripadvisor warning me of shabby accommodation so I was expecting it to be a bit run down but having now witnessed the place for myself I can only assume that these reviews were written by the same people who rush around Eleveden in their expensive North Face jackets and turned up jeans competing to fill their pretentiously named children\'s diaries with activities and meeting their own overly high expectations...The fact is this is France not the Surrey hills, it\'s relaxing for the parents and full of things the kids love to do. My kids are, 11 & 8 year old boys. Swimming and football are what they want to do so they were well happy with the amount of opportunities they had to do this especially the interactive football wall which provided numerous hours of free entertainment. We also have a daughter of nearly 3 who is happy on the beach or in the, again free, huge soft play! My only disappointment really was to do with the make up of the surrounding flora. Don\'t get me wrong the park is nice enough, beside a beautiful long lake in a lovely part of France but we were there at Easter before the leaves were on the trees so it felt a bit bare. I had wrongly assumed the park would be in a pine forest so I had been looking forward to enjoying the serenity that comes with that. My mistake.Definitely one of our better Easter breaks, and half the price of Elevden even with the ferry.Oh, and the park has healthy population of beavers!
title: Center Parcs without the snobbery
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a family get together and were all agreed that we would do it again as there were so many activities for the children. We also booked an apartment that had lovely views of the lake and would recommend that
title: Exceeded our expectations
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great parc and holiday.  Rates in France are easily more value for money than England.  Centre parcs is a safe environment for kids to have a bit of freedom on their holiday.  Would recommend to any family
title: Easter 2015
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Fantastic time in France.  Great outdoor holiday for whole family.  Much cheaper than equivalent time in UK (saved at least 50% including travel there)Negative is lack of laundry facility and lack of oven (there is a microwave)
title: Great value holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Park is great, overall clean and well run. Cottages are clean, functional and nice. Unfortunately due to family illness had to leave after only 1 night however I look forward to returning at a later time.
title: Good time in Lac D\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Went to Lac d\'Ailette on a really good 6 night deal over Easter. Had a great time with the kids but accommodation could do with some love and attention felt rustic but not in a good way. Swimming good but also could do with some TLC
title: family hols
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The lodges here are in a type of New England style-painted different colours which is a welcome change from the breeze blocks in England. Our Comfort lodge was fine-it had a covered decking area at the back that overlooked a small water area. It was adequately sized for four of us and was in reasonable condition. Not exactly luxurious, but it was the basic lodge and it was much better value than a break in England.  The pool area is great with plenty of waterslides of different types and steepness to keep everyone happy. You don\'t get the glossy file that you do in England and to book any activity you had to queue at the one desk in the main dome area which could get really busy but that\'s only a small point.
title: good value
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was my first ever Center parcs trip but my girlfriend had been to UK ones before so why choose France? For one if you time it, you can get it inside the school holidays in the UK but outside in France so rather than \u00a31000s it is hundreds of pounds. Also, being a littl further south, the weather and temperature can be better.Overall, a fab holiday, the weather was 20 degrees plus which makes a big deal. Here are my top tips and comments.:1. You can arrive anytime on the first day but can\'t go to your house till 3pm so either take a late crossing or have your swim shorts ready to go enjoy till it is.2. Choose your villa using any topping deal. We chose a lakeside house and it is worth it. You get to wake up and eat looking over the lake and it is magical.3. There is a great l\'eclerc supermarket in Laon about 15 mins from centerparcs so stock up there on food and wine.4. We ate out one night at the pizza restaurant and for five people it was 140 euros which is ok but the ambience is a bit \'Disney\' and fake so I\'d say eat at home and save your money.5. Did the mini golf which was very good.6. Bring your own pillow. Theirs are like a bag of tights. Seriously.7. The villas are great. Yes, they need a lick of paint here and there but it\'s fine for a holiday rental. 8. Unlike the UK, you can get your car the evening before. Reception said 7pm but security said 8pm. Think it varies but lovely to have it there to pack up in the morning.9. It\'s 2.5 hours from Calais so easy peasy to get to. Overall highly recommended.
title: Lovely Easter break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Overal a nice holiday but it could be so much better there for a little investment in the cottages, grounds and cleaning of the cottages. The main complex however was excellent as was the location. Cave du Dragon a few minutes down the road is an excellent exclusion for 15 euros for a family ticket.
title: Nice holiday but 5* parc lacks investment
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Loved our first center parcs France experience. Not too big or crowded. Went with our kids aged 7, 6 and 9 months and we had plenty to do daily. The pool was superb with slides/ rapids which the kids enjoyed. The lifeguards were relaxed but professional. Great indoor and outdoor play facilities. Stayed at premium cottage - slightly worn decor but it was comfortable and clean. Some downsides were that there isn\'t a conventional oven in the kitchen and the shops/ restaurants were expensive. However, some forward menu planning should circumvent the above problems. Also there are no mugs in the kitchen. Overall, it facilitated quality family time and will be back. Good price compared to UK counterpart. Will recommend this to families with young children.
title: A wonderful Easter break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Drive was an absolute breeze. Cottages are beautiful, though beds are a little uncomfortable, landscape amazing, facilities and service superb. Shame that only about 2-3 employers spoke English. However, you don\'t see anyone in CP UK talking other than English. On the other hand. i havent seen other Europeans travel to UK, why would you to be ripped off??
title: Wouldn\'t go back to CP UK now, trying Belgium next year
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having stayed at Lac d\'Ailette a couple of times before, we were looking forward to our holiday in a Premier Lakeside cottage. We were very disappointed to find that although the views over the lake were beautiful, the accommodation was not up to the usual Center Parcs standard. The floors were filthy and had not been mopped. The furniture was dirty and old and the bedroom carpets were stained and threadbare. The whole cottage felt in need of renovation.The main centre was still smart and the whole family enjoyed different activities, including bowling, Segway\'s, badminton and table tennis. The aqua mundo was clean and there were plenty of life guards on duty. We ate out on the last night in the buffet restaurant which was reasonable and there was plenty of choice for everyone.We enjoyed our holiday, but feel that urgent renovation of the cottages is needed in order to keep up with the standard we expect from Center Parcs.
title: Feeling it\'s age
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I am sure some cottages are more up together than others but ours (417) was, without exaggeration, filthy dirty and lacking in vital maintenance. Whilst we expect an amount of wear & tear, there is absolutely no excuse for the level of general dirt in our accommodation which made us reluctant to spend any time there. There was a long list of problems including filthy walls & grubby, heavily-stained carpets, grafitti on a bed panel, dirty flooring, thick layers of dust around the tiles/towel rail/window in the bathroom, a dangerous childguard which was hanging from the wall, remnants of the previous guests\' faeces in the toilet, cobwebs, holes in all the bedroom curtains, old pillows which had barely any stuffing, mouldy & dirty outside furniture/area, a nasty stale smell throughout and a front door that didn\'t open until we waited one hour for a maintenance man. I did raise our dissatisfaction with an on-site manager who nodded and agreed saying that the cottages were due for a refurb at the end of this year. That wasn\'t much help to us so he said he would send cleaners over "immediately" for a thorough clean. That was on day one and nobody ever arrived. The unacceptable accommodation, coupled with a truly disgusting meal at Il Giardino and generally slow, unfriendly service throughout would not make me want to return or recommend this place. The poor response to my complaint on-site would not make me want to return to any Center Parc. On the plus side, the location is truly beautiful and the kids did enjoy the activities. Our short break was salvaged by some stunning weather and the nearby town of Laon where we were able to enjoy some great food and good service.
title: Shabby, dirty accommodation
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After reading reviews on here I was expecting the worst (dirty cottage, lack of inventory, cars zooming round the site etc) it was not like that, thank goodness!  Yes the place could do with a good clean of walls, skirting boards, bathroom seals, but the surfaces were all clean. There were 8 of us in an 8 person cottage-the kitchen area is not big enough to cook for 8!One of the beds was broken, we reported it and were told it would be fixed but it wasn\'t. There was a general lack of maintenance about the cottage. There are plenty of bikes available, you don\'t need to book in advance. The swimming pool is great but go after about 6.30 when it is much quieter ( and you can also watch the sun go down over the lake from the infinity pool).The shop on site is very expensive-call at the big Carrefour in Laon on the way. If you are intending cooking it is worth taking a sharp knife and cooking utensils. Overall the site is lovely-beautiful countryside around the lake with cycle paths just outside the entrance. Wifi is unreliable especially at night. We had a great time and would definitely go back.
title: Better than led to believe from previous reviewers!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were disappointed on arrival to our cottage as the access cards didn\'t work and we had to make the 15 minute walk back to reception to resolve it, with no apology. The inside and and outsides of the cottages looked tired and neglected but once we got over this it was still comfortable. The facilities were brilliant and made up for the accommodation. We all loved the Aqua Mundo, especially the rapids. It was clean and warm and there was lots to do. We tried the mini golf and the table tennis which were both fine and my son tried archery, which he enjoyed. The layout of the site was good and we would recommend taking or hiring bikes to get around more easily. Overall a good week and I would definitely come back to Centerparks.
title: Great facilities and atmosphere but the cottages could do with some TLC
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: lovely area by the lake, clean place, very quiet, very good pool, tennis and badminton courts not great due to being on concrete, very hard on your feet and legs. Pool very warm. Pancakes and pizzas very good.
title: stay in france
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great to get away. Really good connection with nature and loads of bird song to greet the mornings. The layout does lead to you needing to walk a lot, or dodge buggies or cars left by the verges( not so ideal) so some supervision of children on bikes always needed. If mad keen on covering all that centre parcs offers do check that the facilities you enjoy are available and open, a range of repairs were taking place over Easter. Some great novelty ideas to keep kids active and a great Aqua Mundo,with a range of brilliant water shoots. It did get a bit crowded and there is very limited outside space when the weather is sunny. Overall a pleasant environment to spend some quality time as a family.
title: Incredible scenery and fabulous water park
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: As a fan of the centre parcs experience it was nice to see the le lac d\'ailette provide a different accommodation to the normal, the cottages were all positioned well to still give you that feeling of isolation at the rear of the property, and if you Are lucky enough to have a lake side position the views would be even better.With regards to the accommodation, my review would be tired and in need of basic maintenance, we had foot prints on the lounge ceiling, the top floor shower didn\'t work, and a few other niggly annoyances, this was a premier 4 bedroom cottage.In general the parc provides all the usual centre parc features, with a great beach area, the restaurants are limited and the staff service can be very slow, don\'t count on a romantic atmosphere for couples, we never found a nice bar area apart from the baluba, although having your drink sitting on the side of the lake with the weather we had was very pleasurable.One criticism would be the use of golf buggys, in my opinion this detracts away from the centre parcs concept of walking or biking, most people treated the walkways as a personal race track which if you had small children walking freely would prove stressful.All in all we had a great 4 days and would consider returning.
title: Family holiday can\'t complain
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Positive sides: beautiful place at a lake, nice cottages - clean inside, well equipped, a lot of activities, well organised.Negative sides: perhaps the maintenance around some cottages could be better, the beds are too soft for our taste, the Aqua Mundo a bit small given the hundreds of people inside, some pavements along the main roads would facilitate the movement of people.
title: Very nice place with only a few flaws
