price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This resort is very pleasing on the eye and has a lovely setting, but the properties and facilities are looking rather tired and need some time and money invested in them.  We have been many times to Center Parcs in Holland, UK and this one in France and it is fair to say that the service you get in both UK and Holland are far superior to Lac D\'Ailette.  The staff here give the impression that they are \'going through the motions\' rather than trying to make your stay truly memorable.  Not sure if this is a culture thing or just the fact that we are English.  I totally understand that there will be language issues, but I speak a bit of French and would say that it was more about attitude than a language barrier.  I have to balance this report by stating that we had a lovely relaxing stay and we chose this resort because of the very reasonable price this Easter.  The setting is magnificent, but an extra effort from the staff (and a few more staff in bars and restaurants!) wouldn\'t go amiss.
title: Third visit - slightly disappointed
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After reading many reviews I was hesitant. However we had a lovely holiday, the cottage was clean and a much better standard than I had read. Stayed in 168 and would definitely go again, take pillows!
title: Lac D\'Ailette Center Parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed mid-week in a VIP waterside cottage. The look of the park is really nice on approach and the cottages are painted in different colours which is very effective. Having read previous reviews I was feeling a little anxious and unfortunately I was disappointed when first entering the cottage.  The walls and skirting boards were dirty and really needed a good lick of paint. The kitchen could also do with modernising although it did have everything required......except a proper oven!  Apart from this the accomodation was a good size and generally comfortable.The park itself however was excellent. Aqua mundo was the best we have visited and the indoor children\'s play area was huge! There is also plenty for the older children such as pool tables and a private area with music etc.I\'ve read previous comments that the park is small but I disagree, I think the park is a really good size.Overall we had a really good break and I would recommend, but don\'t expect UK standard of accomodation.
title: Excellent facilities but the accomodation is in need of some TLC.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We love UK CP\'s & have actually visited this one before when opened & we had a great time, but this was awful.. hardly anything to do for older kids ( UK offer loads ) everything seemed to close early, the staff were ok, not that much English being understood though...We wanted to use the boat but were told not open, the beds were awfully saggy, the dining chairs squeaked, the sofa is so uncomfy & we kept sliding off, the downstairs loo was freezing, there is no oven so most food we had taken got wasted, the delivery food service was rubbish, woman didn\'t understand what we wanted, overall just awful, we even left a day early!!
title: Grubby, dated & nothing to do!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Lovely first stay at centre parcs, weather not great but did not matter as we spent every day having fun in the aquamundo water park! Will go again, great value compared with uk prices and very easy to drive to from east of England.
title: Great for kids
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a villa with a lake view which was lovely.  Lots of birds and wildlife to see.  We had Coypu\'s coming onto our patio which were amazing as never seen one of them before and we had 3 visiting for breakfast every day :)Lovely park to cycle round, although some slights hills so not flat.  Would have been nice to walk round the lake but the weather did not lend itself to this as it was wet and windy nearly every day we were there.The Aqua Mondo is excellent with 13 water slides across the whole space - fast ones, dark ones and little ones for smaller people.  Rapids good, but not as fast or fun as other Center Parcs rapids we have tried.  Bit annoying to have the NO PICNICS signs everywhere as what is wrong with bringing in a bit of snack food and drink?  If you wanted to stay in the pool area for a length of time, you had to buy food and drink at the snack bar. :(The dome itself not no heart and feeling and we poorly set out I felt.  Other domes at other parks are much better and make you want to sit down and have a drink and watch the world go by.  This dome is boring with no real place to sit for any length of time except round by the bowling.  We would return though as the site is so pretty.  Would like to try it in warmer weather.
title: Beautiful setting around the lake
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Despite plenty of wet and windy weather we enjoyed a great Easter break on the lake. Glad that we opted for a lakeside cottage as it meant that we could watch the ducks and the swans come to visit. Very relaxing and plenty for the children to do. Bear in mind that Centerparcs in Europe is very different from Elveden Forest and the rest in England, but much better in my opinion
title: Easter at the lake
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We went with 4 uni students and my 11 year old son.  A great time was had by all.  Will take the rest of the family back sometime in low season.  Would have loved the Aqua Mundo to stay open longer in evening.
title: Fun Time at Lac d\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: It\'s a great place to spend qualitiy time with your family and friends. Plenty of sports activites ( as long as it\'s in the summer) however,beware of the costs of each activity. The only attraction that is included in the price is the aquamondo , amazing experience, but all the rest comes with a quite high price. Avoid doing your groceries at their local supermarket unless you are prepared to stand queuing up for 10-15 minutes and pay 3 times more for any product you find at Tesco or Sainsbury.There\'s a carrefour 20 min away where you can get much more decent prices and a wide assortment of high quality poducts. By and large it\'s fun to stay there
title: In the nature with family.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We booked for two families to go to this Centreparc site over the Easter period, mainly due to the cost, it was half what the UK trip would have cost. The parc is not overly large, it is well maintained, the facilities are excellent, the pool area etc is what you would expect from Centreparcs, however the water slides for children were brilliant, the right amount and size to cater for all age groups. The main pool was clean, as were the changing rooms and shower areas. The reception area, restaurants and public areas are well kept, clean and reasonable in price, even the supermarket. We ate out in the buffet restaurant and found the food to be excellent quality, plenty of it and enough to cater for all ages / tastes. The Crepe restaurant was the same. We liked the accommodation had four bedrooms, two doubles and two twins, over two floors with two bathrooms, which were clean and tidy with comfortable beds and large bedrooms with plenty of storage for clothes. The heating was easy to understand and we were never cold. There is not an oven but we knew this before we went, so were able to arrange meals that we could prepare on the hob or mircrowave. There was plenty of crockery, granted there are no mugs, just teacups, which for the morning coffee  are not big enough, but this was not enough to put us off.  We did have a couple of issues, the first being ants, which once reported to reception was dealt with quickly within the same hour as was the dining chair that was faulty. The service was second to none, the staff nearly all spoke English, which put us all to shame. The childrens activities were good fun and easy to book, as was the archery. We did not need to hire bikes as the villa we booked ( number 950 ) was only 5 mins walk to the pool and shops and 10 mins to the beach, skate park, mini farm and main play park. All in all, great holiday, fab facilities, just what we have come to expect from Centreparcs but not as expensive as the UK. I was a little concerned before we went due to the number of bad / not favourable reviews but was most pleasantly surprised and we would def return. Thanks for reading.
title: Le Lac d\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: There are a lot of the negative reviews that go back a few years about the cleanliness of the accommodation, and I can see why. What I don\'t understand is that the management must look at these reviews (on returning I got an email questionnaire and a link inviting me to comment on TripAdvisor) but the same comments about grubby cottages keep cropping up. If you can get beyond the doors hanging off hinges, the fraying furniture, ants in the kitchen, dirty marks on carpets, curtains, walls (all of this in a VIP cottage as well!) and the general feeling that the place hasn\'t had a good clean for a good long while, it\'s actually a great place to spend some family time.  The pool area is great for young and older children, its a maze of pools, slides, rapids and lazy rivers inside and out and never felt crowded.  There were always plenty of staff cleaning the changing areas. There is a well stocked supermarket and lovely bakery. However the places to eat were below expectation - ok but not great.  The Pancake place was the best, but clearly understaffed. There are loads of activities on offer - we did the Parcour Treetop Adventure without harnesses - the kids loved it and it was great fun - although there was only one member of staff for both activities. The poor guy was running around ragged. We hired bikes and it was great to go for long rides around the park. Clean up the cottages Centre Parcs and this could be a fantastic place.
title: Good, but could be so much better
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Lac d\'Ailette is a great place to stay for all the family.  Plenty of activities to take part in or not, depending what you would like from your stay.  Staff very accommodating, but lack of WiFi unless paid for in advance.
title: Easter at Center Parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have been to Center Parcs several times in the Netherlands and we were always very satisfied, so we were looking forward to trying out a 5 star park in France. Unfortunately, our dreams were short-lived.The Premium cottage we had booked fell well short of what we had expected. It was dirty and in a poor state of repair. There were dirty dishes in the dishwasher, the carpets were all stained, there was mould on the walls ... the list goes on.  The facilities were also poorly maintained and very dirty (hair and dirt all around the Aqua Mundo floors, no toilet paper or soap in any of the toilets on any of the days, decrepid bowling shoes .... it realy covered all areas of the main facilities).We complained immediately, were told someone would come over, no-one came. I complained again when we got home but still no reply.This is something we really hadn\'t expected from Center Parcs as all our previous experiences have been so positive.
title: Very disappointing, not what we are used to from Center Parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I\'m confused by negative reviews - spacious clean accommodation, not entirely modern but why does that matter? Great Aqua mondo, lovely natural environment- we had visits from swans, ducks,cats and coypu! Busy on changeover days but not sure how you can avoid that really. Still dramatically cheaper than centerparcs in the UK and I think it has more charm.Our only negative was that the lake boats and pedaloes don\'t run at Easter because of the cold and the petting zoo is a little pathetic! It\'s not as spotless and regimented as the Dutch ones but a more relaxed feel.Other tips- hire bikes, it\'s so easy and not really expensive.
title: Fantastic time had by all
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We go to Center Parcs in the UK regularly but have been put off by the huge holiday price rises. We booked an Easter break and took our three boys who are all under seven. We had a lake view cottage which was fine, a bit tired in places but, perfectly fine and tidy. Kitchen has no oven and the dishwasher was a bit old but nice big fridge and plenty of cups/glasses etc.Aquamundo was great. Three excellent kids pools and sandpits. None were ever very busy and the water is far less chlorinated than in the UK so no sore eyes. Slides all fun and we found it to be clean and well maintained - it is certainly as good as the UK.The shops in the market dome are a bit limited - one clothes shop, one toy store and a food shop which has a lovely bakery attached to it. We went into Laon just down the road and found several large and cheap supermarkets as well as clothes stores etcWe found we had plenty to do. The kids enjoyed bowling and the new indoor minigolf course was great. Outdoor play areas were good - some obviously being done up, a nice little farm and interesting things like an outdoor mixing deck and electronic talking football wall. We only had to pay for one activity all week and still kept the kids well amuised.There is a large indoor soft play area which my three loved. We ate at the buffet several times. The kids preferred the breakfast which had unlimited fresh pressed juices (the kids loved watching the oranges get squashed!) bacon/sausages/eggs and also a range on continental dishes. Lunch had a great selection too - plenty of choice of hot dishes and puddings. It is different to the UK. Less commercial and not as developed which we quite enjoyed. We spent much less money as there aren\'t as many shops/places to buy coffee. It was a more traditional family holiday experience and really very enjoyable. We will go back.
title: Lovely child friendly holiday.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This is a very small center parcs and no activities run on a Monday or Friday.  In addition, it is almost impossible to find a staff member between 12 and 2pm as they all have lunch together and there is always a queue in reception.There is no oven in the accommodation and the restaurants are not open for very long either!I thought it was a poor reflection on Centre Parcs but we enjoyed the pool and the surroundings are nice even though it is a tiny place.
title: Disappointing
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great place, great ambiance. VIP cottages are nice and very well equipped (except some of kitchen wares)Beautiful place with very nice views and nature. We mainly cooked, but the Pizzeria and the Crepes restaurants are very good.
title: Great, Great,Great
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After reading many negative reviews we were slightly concerned about our stay. Fortunately it was much better than expected and overall we had a great time.We stayed midweek in a four person VIP Lakeview cottage number 507. Great views of the lake and beyond and a nice location just a 5 minute bike ride from the centre. Tastefully furnished and only real issues were a small kitchen area and loose door handles.We ate out once in the pizza/pasta restaurant. The food was good and reasonably priced.Not all restaurants were open during our stay but this was made clear in the welcome pack provided at arrival. This states all times and activities which are happening throughout the period.The supermarket was well stocked and not too expensive.All staff were friendly, professional and helpful and most spoke passable English (better than our French!).We liked this park and would return but generally we prefer Center Parcs in Holland.
title: Suprisingly Pleasant
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was a family half term holiday, the villa which was classed as a premium was shabby, the pillows for the bed were virtually non existent, the light coloured carpets in the bedrooms were tired and marked, the lounge furniture was passed its best, the kitchen though serviceable was basic and looked like it had been designed in the 70\'s. The downstairs toilet had an unpleasant smell. Surely the room should have been tiled not vinyl flooring.We had a meal in the buffet restaurant after being ignored for several minutes waiting to be seated in the pasta & pizza restaurant. The buffet was expensive with mostly poor quality food. We also had a lunchtime snack in the water park, we should not have bothered. How the French put up with such appalling food is beyond me, probably why the restaurants were never very busy.The water park was fantastic! We all enjoyed the slides the lazy river and the wild river run.
title: Good and Bad
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Our family of 6 stayed at a Premium cottage . We had been here 3 years before and noticed this time the  general maintenance of the cottage and  park had declined.We had some issues including a dining chair collapsing, dishwasher coming loose etcOverall we had a good time with the kids enjoying the swimming/slide centre.
title: Enjoyable holiday spoiled by cottage issues
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: overall a very good parc although let down by some minor niggles,excellent facilities and some great staff who were very willing to help.compared to uk it is a little pricey but on the whole best not to look at the cost
title: christmas break in france
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Enjoyable weekend with family and friends, the village concept without car is very nice for the kids. The restaurants offers good food for a fair price. The playgrounds are free, however, other activities are paid.
title: Super weekend
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Visited several in Belgium and Netherlands, this was easily the best kept and equipped village and in a great area too - as always, not a cheap holiday but I wouldn\'t hesitate to recommend a stay there
title: Best CenterParcs yet
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We hadn\'t visited a Centre Parcs for around 20 years so it was nice to see how they had changed over the years.  The main improvement was the villas, no sign of the orange decor we remember so well!  We had a lovely 2 bed lakeside cottage which was spacious and comfortable.  Ours was surrounded by trees which meant it was permanently in the shade, so we could not sit out and enjoy the late summer sunshine.  In hindsight we should have asked to move to a sunnier spot. Also no kettle in the kitchen so had to brew tea in a saucepan!  We only used the sauna once, probably wouldn\'t book that again.  We loved the bike rides, the pool lived up to expectations and we thought the shop was better than expected.  Has a few lunches in the Pizza place which were good but remember to get there early, the French like to finish lunch by 2, no open all day restaurants here!  We thought the supermarket was good, although we did stock up in the Supermarket in Laon.  Didn\'t realise the Parc was so close to the site of the Battle of Aisne battlefields and cemeteries. All beautifully kept and very touching.  Worth a visit.  We plan to return within 20 years this time!
title: Still as good after 20 years
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I read and heard from people that have stayed at other Center Parcs that this place isn\'t "as fancy" as some of the others.  I also read the comments below, by people that were disappointed.  After spending a midweek at this Center Parcs location (in October), I can say the following:While this may not feel like a 5-star hotel accommodation, it is definitely a very comfortable arrangement for a family holiday, on a lake, with fantastic facilities available for fun and relaxation. The accommodation was good, comfortable and clean.  It\'s easy to get everywhere by bike, and despite the rain, there was plenty to do both indoors and out.The main attraction of the place, from the children\'s point of view, was definitely the Aqua Mundo (large indoor water park).  It has plenty of water rides, and keeps the kids busy for hours at a time.The water is warm, and the adults in our party had a very enjoyable time as well.The restaurants were good, especially the Buffet and the Creperie.  Food isn\'t cheap, but not terribly expensive either.A few tips:1.  Dress warmly, also in early October.2.  There is a supermarket on location, but if you want to save money, buy your basic essentials in one of the towns nearby.3.  Not sure about the internet connection, so brought our own SIM cards with internet plan.4.  Have 1 Euro coins ready for the lockers at the Aqua Mundo.5.  Bring your own towels for the pool, or pay a bit extra to rent them at the front desk.6.  If you get the Premium package, no need to buy kitchen towel, sponge, or dishwasher tablets.All-in-all, a very nice vacation with the family.
title: Very nice for children
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Horrible place to stay. Accommodation  was really shabby and in real need of some refurbishment. Staff not the friendliest. The market place restaurant was a let down and very overpriced. Swimming pool was the only thing going for it. If you have young kids.....watch out for lazy people driving golf buggies everywhere!!
title: Worst centre parcs by far
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We returned to this Centre Parc, on the strength of the great time we had. However, things have changed for the worse. No catering before e12.00 noon, meant no cafes or snacks. Creperie,in fact all catering points closed!!
title: First visit was better.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have been to Centre Parcs many times before, both in the UK and abroad, and have never been disappointed before. We will undoubtedly go again. However, we were disappointed with our recent holiday as we felt it failed to live up to the standard that we have come to expect from our Centre Parcs holiday.Firstly, I have to say that the swimming complex was excellent. The sporting facilities were plentiful and to our pleasant surprise were very easily booked, despite being in the height of summer. The setting of the complex is stunning and the views over the lake are quite beautiful.Sadly, however, the accommodation was not up to standard. The house looked very nice from the outside but once inside we found it to be very grubby. Cleaning had been very superficial before we went in. There were thick cobwebs overhanging the pictures. The carpets were very soiled and areas of the house actually smelt bad. It felt damp. The WC and drainage from the kitchen smelt foul at times and persisted, despite the liberal use of bleach which we had to buy and use ourselves before we could even attempt to use the facilities.Despite being able to get a Badminton / Table Tennis court quite easily we were very disappointed with the sports complex. It was dark and untidy. It actually looked as though the courts and tables had been put together as an \u201cafterthought\u201d. Most of the time it was unsupervised and there were occasions when this led to some conflict as to who had hired which court/table.I was also perturbed by the lack of hand washing facilities at the \u201cpetting zoo\u201d. We used to live close to a petting zoo in Surrey which was almost closed down a few years ago due to an E-Coli poisoning outbreak.
title: Disappointed
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: With 15 people in our party it was difficult to walk away and go somewhere else so I was faced with starting my holiday with a complete vacuum and clean of our grubby chalet ! After changing the first chalet we were given a slightly less grubby one!! Spiders and cobwebs all over the ceiling , squashed flies all over walls- in need of a refurb !!The beds a disgrace to the point I slept on the edge with clothes on and not their grubby duvet complete with hairs!! Not to mention the stained mattress! Complete with body fluids Yuck ! An absolute disgrace! The accommodation ruined what could have been lovely holiday. The lake is picturesque and I imagine it was  great place when it was first built but unfortunately centre parcs have taken the money and not invested in a good maintenance programme .  How a staff member could have made up a bed with a mattress in this condition beggars belief!
title: Don\'t stay here ! Wait until this  place has been refurbished
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having visited many of the UK sites we thought we would try the French equivalent. Much to our disappointment we found that rules around site traffic to be nonexistent as the site traffic of both cars and golf buggies made travelling around the village with children stressful and slow. It was too dangerous to let our children ride on ahead and we were constantly telling them to watch out for that car/buggy! The cottages were dirty and old too. Not the experience we were hoping for....
title: Not a safe environment for children
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having stayed at a uk CP my expectations were high but was disappointed. Park was very pretty and easy to get to from Calais. Yes take your own pillows as others have suggested. Don\'t bother with kitchen start pack as most missing and had taken everything anyway. We had to move to another cottage on day two due to rain coming in our bedroom and running down the walls and coming into our daughters bedroom and flooding the carpet soaking their clothes etc! Nobody came when they said they would so had to keep chasing!Second villa had a wasp nest under covered verandah and again I reported it but nobody bothered to sort it so we couldn\'t sit outside and eat. Kids loved the aquamundo but don\'t expect any levels of health and safety from lifeguards! One even had earplugs in!!Couldn\'t swim in lake because of algae and boats were all out of action too presumably for same reason!Be mindful of golf buggies charging around too - speed limit doesn\'t seem to apply!The Carrefour in Laon is in a dodgy area! Don\'t leave anything in the car! A trip to Reims worthwhile and the nearby Dragon Caves! Take your own bikes if you can - great cycle route nearby.We stayed in a VIP cottage on the lake which was lovely but be warned you will be woken up by ducks early every morning! Kids loved feeding the coypus who are very friendly. Kids enjoyed it but will try somewhere else next year!
title: Not up to scratch
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: It\'s the third time I\'m coming to center Parcs, As always we appreciate the nature, the feeling of a family modern and pleasant place.If you are like me need to connect and use the internet to work, the WIFI is not the best the speed is so so and VPN from there to my office was a real challenge.Yes the cottage was clean, yes the buffet at the restaurant was good (breakfast)Yes the "aquamundo" was well kept, safe and enjoyable...For the rest it\'s a vacation...
title: Center Parc to relax
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were appalled by the total lack of cleanliness of our cottage (119). The floors were all grubby, the walls dirty, the bathroom a disgrace. On top of that expect to get mown down by speeding electric buggies throughout the park. The only redeeming feature was the Aquamundo pool which the kids loved despite the poor cleanliness and general \'tired\' feel. They also like the creperie but thought the Italian restaurant on site was appalling. If you want a decent meal drive off site to the Hotel du Golf on the other side of the lake - it costs more but so worth it.If Centerparcs people read this, here is what you need to do - maintain the cottages to the standards we expect from Centerparcs in the UK and don\'t charge \u20ac1000 per week for peak season unless you can deliver a good holiday for the money. I hope this review prevents others from arriving, seeing the accommodation and having children cry that they don\'t want to stay somewhere so dirty. This is what happened to us.
title: Avoid this grubby and badly maintained place
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The park itself is very nice. The lake and surroundings are pleasant and all of the activities seemed popular although our children were mostly too young to participate (as we\'d expected). The Aquamundo water park is great and I could imagine a fun short holiday there with friends and children. The cottage however was a slight disappointment, too worn for the price charged. General upkeep should have been a bit better with regard to painting.
title: Lovely park, not great accommodation for the price
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Went to Lac d\'Ailette at end of August for 1 week with 4 adults and 3 children under 6. The children had a great time which made it so much more enjoyable for the adults. Aquo Mundo and the water tree were great as were the various playgrounds around the site. Really enjoyed the stay.
title: Good family fun
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Poor expensive sporting facilities, particularly for older children. Cottages poorly equipped and in need of refurbishment. Onsite restaurants: service very slow and quite expensive. Local area: CP situated in the middle of no where. No local restaurants to cycle to. Nearest town is Leon which is OK to eat at (5 miles away).
title: Center Parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having stayed previously at Lac d\'Ailette we were a little disappointed this year, our cottage was a little shabby and in need of refurbishment. The 8 person villa felt small downstairs compared to other villas we have stayed in at other Center Parcs villages. The Aqua Mundo was enjoyed by all the family and location is good for exploring the area. Children enjoyed the facilities at Baluba. Center parcs is great for family including all age groups.
title: Cottage in need of refurbishment
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We decided we needed a late break and it worked out cheaper going to France inc the crossing than going to a UK branch!2 1/2 hours from calais ... and easy to find.We had a VIP lakeside cottage - and in short it was awesome!  Absolutely spotless, super comfy beds (memory foam which looks new) and perfect wifi (which you paid for - 18 euros for 4 days. Only criticism u could level was outside bannisters needed some paint - but so minimal a complaint i wouldn\'t raise it!Bike hire was simple, and my 5 yr old loved the Aqua Mundo.We went half board, next time we would do self catering and just buy meals as and when needed as u really don\'t save much with the prepaid meal plan.My first visit to any centre parks, but def impressed.
title: Nice break away!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: the walls had lots of bugs and spiders squashed on them. there were also a lot of spiders and cobwebs in the rafters of the bedrooms. The patio furniture was in need of a good wash down as it was old and dirty.
title: cleanliness
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a great time. Relaxing. Hire bikes as they are good fun though expensive. Drinks are astronomical so beware. Shop in Laon before you arrive. Food is expensive in France anyway so be prepared. The cottage was ok. A little tired but mostly clean and well maintained. The microwave/grill is not an oven. There actually isn\'t an oven! Aqua Mundo is amazing here. So clean. Lots of slides and the rapids are great fun. The market buffet was good using the kids eat free vouchers and would recommend. High ropes course was fabulous fun too. A few negatives here but all in all a great holiday and good value compared to the uk
title: Relaxing holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We booked a VIP cottage and was very pleased with it. It had a nice garden  with a wrap around terrace and views of the lake. The sauna was fantastic and better than we were expecting. The properties are in much better condition than any other centre parcs we have been to both in the UK and the continent. I would highly recommend this centre parcs. Feeding the ducks and Copyu\'s in the garden every day cost us a fortune in bread but the kids loved it.
title: Very Pleased
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a pleasant stay but the food in the restaurant and in the supermarket is incredibly expensive and the activities are overpriced too. The cottage was nice and clean but if you are not lucky enough to come with your car you have to buy absolutely everything from the bedsheets to the towels including cleaning product to wash up and clean the kitchen after cooking.  Apart from that it was very enjoyable.
title: a pleasant stay but food and activities are overpriced
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Have stayed in 2 CP in the UK & this trip was our 3rd in France, by far the worse! So much broken stuff in the public areas, Premium cottage need modernising & painting.Staff & food was amazing though
title: Needs modernising & maintenance
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We travelled with another family and children ranging from 11 to 13.  We had adjacent VIP houses overlooking the lake.  The houses were clean and comfortable with 3 bathrooms and a sauna.  The outlook was beautiful with patio doors opening onto a large decked patio area with a table, four chairs and two sun loungers.  There is a cycle path (green route) nearby.  The WW! museum and tour of the dragon\'s lair (underground caves used by the French and German soldiers) is worth a visit - check times for tours in English and wear something warm.  There is a sailing school nearby.  Also, very close to the Champagne region of France, so it is possible to visit a local producer to find out about Champagne production and taste some Champagne.
title: Centre Parcs Le Lac d\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: First time at centre parcs, thought it would be a fun break, with plenty of things to do, Dull Dull Dull, the most boring holiday ever, No real entertainment, no atmosphere & rude staff, poor quality restaurants, that have some very odd opening times, Only thing worth doing was the aqua Mundo swimming poole, every other activity you pay for, No exaggeration, this was the worst holiday I have had to date,
title: Over promised, Under delivered
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Accommodation dated and dirty.Communal buildings badly maintained and the communal area resembles a high street going out of business.Understaffed everywhere.Food is poor. We travelled to Laon for dinner.Staff mostly appear disinterested in being friendly or of service.We felt unsafe in the pool as the lifeguards were unresponsive
title: Worst holiday ever
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Very relaxing holiday, clean and fun. Plenty to do and we weren\'t left bored at any point. Aqua Mundo was fantastic and provided hours of entertainment for my son. I recommend a house with a Lakeview. This made our holiday even better.
title: Lovely Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a premium lakeside villa, in a perfect location with a deck over the water that face the sunset, absolutely lovely. The overall look and feel of the site is more attractive than the previous location we visited in  Les Bois Francs last year. However, there were various aspects that we felt let down by. We really enjoy the traffic free cycling, with our kids aged 14, 11 and 6, but the combination of so many golf buggies and a much more lax approach to the number of cars allowed in all the time really put us off. The pool is good, not as big as les BF, and the rapids were nowhere near as good, almost as though the water wasn\'t running fast enough to push you through the course. Les BF has a really good hot deli counter which we used several times last year, for BBQ ribs, roasted spuds and rotisserie chicken etc - saved cooking faff, cheaper and better than the restaurants. Le lac only had very over-seasoned chicken, or the very pricy \'deli-very\' service to the chalet. We tried the former once, didn\'t bother with the latter. Also, previously we have eaten main course at the chalet,  then pud of ice-cream or creeps at the creperie. At le lac, the creperie closes at 7pm-ish, which was far too early for this to work. These are all small things perhaps, but they left an overall sense that this isn\'t what we are after. CP in France is cheaper than the uk, which is  a draw for Brits I think. However, to keep it feeling good value, they need to up their game at this site.
title: Beautiful location, mixed feelings on quality and standards
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Take chilrens gloves if you do the adventure park as the zip wire is dangerous. My grandon lost his fingernail and we ended up in casualty. Staff where good but we had to find the hospital and there was no follow up.
title: Family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The premium lakeside cottage we had was clean and well equipped and was better than expected having read other tripadvisor comments.  For families with young children there is lots to do which is free ie lots of indoor and outdoor play areas but as we went with teenage children most of what we needed to keep us entertained during a week of poor weather had to be paid for and typical of centerparcs was not cheap.  One of our party was on crutches and this site is difficult for those with mobility problems. Main issue was lack of decent dining options: Italian restaurant poor quality and small portions so not good value for money.  Buffet expensive and mediocre food.
title: Good for families with young children
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Good place to go with the kids, great water park and plenty of play areas. food and drink expensive in restaurants and shops. Nice location and easy to travel to. Comfort of beds and pillows could do with improving. Overall we had a good time and the kids loved it so would probably go back.
title: Good place for kids
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed in a lovely VIP lake-view cottage. Food in the restaurants was poor quality and very pricey. The supermarket on site also expensive. Luckily I\'d read up on this and we did a shop in Laon before arriving. I enjoyed cooking and eating in the cottage. Remember there\'s only a job and a microwave. No oven but still possible to cook lots if great good there or on a BBQ (disposables can be bought if you haven\'t brought your own).We made the most of aquamundo and the football goals on the beach over the 3 days and had a great time during the day. The extra activities were too expensive for their quality/time limits. The mini golf was a bit tired and in bad condition so paying for it was out of the question.The evening entertainment was awful and everyone had a bizarre "dead-behind-the-eyes" look. Karaoke lacked any atmosphere. The bingo was bizarre. The kids area with the arcade machines was depressing.We enjoyed walking around the site but felt golf buggies and speeding bikes to be very dangerous. There should be a  designated pedestrian path.All in all, we had a great 3 days thanks to a supermarket shop in Laon, a lovely VIP cottage and 2 excited kids who didn\'t ask us to pay for any extras.It\'s great for 3 days if you come prepared but we would\'ve struggled to find stuff to do for more than that. Not sure we would return.
title: Great in parts and the rest no-so-great
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Absolutely amazing setting. Our VIP lakeside cottage was well worth the extra money to have a jaw-dropping lakeside view. Our children loved feeding the ducks and the rather intriguing coypus with day old baguette from our decked patio. The paid for activities that were real hits were the tree top high wire and the pony ride. We tried a "wannabe" session which our children tolerated but they didn\'t rave about it. I\'m sadly echoing other reviews when I say that the staff are not always up to what is expected from the Center Parcs brand. We were first timers and didn\'t really understand how the whole voucher/topper system worked and the reception staff seemed quite cross that we didn\'t... Also, some things that we ordered when we booked the stay via the call centre never showed up, namely a barbeque and a mid stay clean...hey ho, not show stoppers but as we had expected them we were disappointed. When this was raised with the reception staff we got a shoulder shrug and were told "It\'s not on the system" and blankly stared at, no further help was offered - thanks a lot! Our hired bikes were very tired and rusty and way off the standard expected by my keen cyclist of a husband...when one of the children went out on their bike for the first time the chain fell off. The Aqua Mundo saved the day though, fantastic water park and no interaction with staff required - bonus! We self catered for the whole week having seen many a miserable face when walking past the restaurants and recommend the Carrefour 20 mins away as you literally halve the cost of buying your food in the on site supermarket which we simply used for fresh baguettes and milk.
title: Stunning setting, great fun...but let down by staff - a real shame
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great place, got it all. Only 2 hours from Calais. Lakeside setting. Not too big to get around. Nice waterpark. Cottage nowhere near as bad as some 2013 reviews which suggests a touch up took place over the winter - they\'re not pristine but definitely more than adequate. Some reviews don\'t praise staff too well - I had no issues whatsoever and found everyone very helpful, approachable and friendly. English is pretty widely spoken. We went for 4 nights and planning a return for a week next year!
title: WORTH IT - NICE PLACE!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We are a multi generational group, grandparents, parents and children and we all thoroughly enjoyed our stay at lac d\'Ailette. We stayed in a large villa overlooking the lake and each family member loved the wildlife. The lake setting is beautiful and the planting is well maintained. We were disappointed with the furnishings in the cottage which as other reviewers have mentioned, need attention. We would also recommend recommend taking your own pillows. Aqua Mundo is great fun for all but does get very busy at weekends.We would suggest a trip to lac de monampteuil which is about a 15 minute drive away but a great day out if you want a break from center parcs.
title: Great family fun
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We took the VIP houses. Big disappointment as for value for money. I\u2019ve been 5-6 time in different Center Ville villages \u2013 this is the poorest quality amongst all of them. Cleanness is also an issue. We\u2019ve found dirty kitchen and smelling bathroom. Shame . Also, the village looks old and not well maintained. The best part of the village is the Aqua Mundo.
title: Cleanness
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed here for 5 days this august as a family of four with children aged 8 and 6. It was perfect for us. Plenty to do, activities cheaper than uk center parcs and a stunning location. We stayed in a VIP lakeside house and feel that this was definitely worth the extra money. Took our own pillows following advice from other reviews. The accommodation is not as modern as uk sites but still good and we found we spent very little time indoors anyway. Pool is great- children had a great time here. On site bakery was good value. We stocked up in carrefore in Laon for drinks and breakfast bits. Would definitely recommend and we will return next year
title: Great location
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: If you go to this Center Parcs, we were not happy with the cleanliness of  the cottage. Don\'t expect Restaurants to be open until after 7pm. On changeover days Parc virtually closes, so probably best to go out that day. Main redeeming plus of this Parc was the outstanding views of the lake, with the addition of the wild-life, and it does have lots of the things the kids wanted to do.
title: Center Parcs France
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Very enjoyable.  Great for the children.  Aqua mondo was amazing!  The lake views were lovely and the nature was abundant.  If you don\'t like spiders go for accomodation without a covering!  Food expensive but very nice.  Go to a supermarket outside the park.  Much cheaper!!  Highly recommend visiting Laon.
title: The Vallins
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: A great location and lovely cottage. The activities are extortionate - just like popcorn at the cinema once you\'re there you\'ve got no choice.  I loved the place and so did the kids, I just wish I\'d budgeted to spend double the cost of the booking! Make sure you stock up at a supermarket before you get there.
title: Nice but expensive
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: A great family location and the aqua Mundo was amazing.  The cottage was perfect and for the price very good value for money, simple but with everything we needed. We knew that there was no proper oven so planned meals around the hob and microwave.  We took our own pillows based on previous reviews. Very easy to get to from uk via ferry.  Next year is already booked.
title: Great Easter holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I was very disappointed with centre parcs, a huge waste of money and I would never go back. They need to get a grip and give the place a make over. I seriously can\'t believe it cost us so much money that I could cry!! I would never recommend this place to anyone and would actually discourage people to go. \u20ac1600 for six days of what I can only describe as a disappointment
title: disappointed
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Nice place, lots of activities for the family, not really a relaxing holiday as always on the go. Will keep the kids entertained. Aqua mondo has plenty of slides and is great funthe one thing to let it down was the weather :(
title: Adventure Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Range of activities was excellent, but standard of the living accomodation is very tired - cushions falling off the sofa and lounge chairs, dead flies squashed on the walls/ light fittings etc and the drainage from all the sinks was very poor and often a smell of drains pervaded the cottage.  We were double charged initially and it took too long to have this rectified.  However, our grandchildren had a great time as there is so much to do.
title: Disappointed
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: First impressions not very good compared to uk sites but after a good look round we started to warm to the place. The pool was very good although lacked enough seating areas. Kids really enjoyed the accro speed activity and paint balling.
title: Good stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: On the surface, the price seems reasonable - the cottage was very good value compared to the UK parks. We chose a VIP cottage with lakeside view, pre-paid for bikes and buffet breakfast. Getting to the park was really easy, 2hrs from Calais and signposted once you\'ve reached Laon. On arrival, we queued for around 10 minutes and the security guard couldn\'t speak english. We were sent to the information desk to collect our keys, etc.The first thing we noticed when parking up our car was just how busy the car park was. It\'s a big car park, on a hill and we had to park right at the top.Cottage - We chose cottage number 637 and the location was good for us - far enough away from the main dome that it was quiet, but close enough that it wasn\'t too long a cycle. The cottage was nice - we had a great view of the lake and overall, it was fairly clean and well maintained. A couple of complaints though - The dishwasher was useless and the whole place felt a little damp. We got a good WiFi signal, but it was *really* expensive. I only managed a 2G phone signal too. Food - The first real experience of the food was the buffet breakfast and it was terrible, considering the price we paid. The coffee tasted cheap and nasty, there were 5 hot items, sausage, scrambled egg, bacon, fried potato and grilled tomato. It was the same 5 items every day and was dripping in oil. There was some cold options too and a lot of bread, but not even closely worth the amount we paid - we were really disappointed. The supermarket had everything that we needed, but was expensive compared to the supermarket, the Bakery had fairly cheap baguettes (1 Euro) and they were nice enough. Most days we ate out (in Laon, etc) or in the cottage. The dinner prices were really expensive for what you got. I noticed in "The Grill" that onion rings with bbq sauce was 7 Euros!!! We ate once at the Buffet, but it was really expensive and when you consider how much people rave about French food, they clearly have never stayed here :).Swimming Pool - The swimming pool was great - lots of good slides, fun outdoor rapids and a wave machine - there is a but and it\'s a BIG but... It was incredibly busy, all of the time. You couldn\'t slide down the rapids without hitting someone. It\'s a shame - I really think a wristband type system could be useful, to minimise this.Surrounding Area - The surrounding area is lovely, we visited Laon and it\'s medieval city, and Reims and it\'s cathedral. We also went to a fort around 30 minutes drive away which was pleasant.Everything else - Be warned, don\'t pre-order the Center Pass resort credit - I was expecting a pre-paid debit type card which we could use wherever - it fact it was printed 5 Euro vouchers and no change was given - I thought this was incredibly cheeky. The staff were pretty much all rude, very little english spoken (fair enough) didn\'t seem to care a great deal. The bikes were all run down and not it great condition.Overall, I would not recommend this place. The food and activities are really expensive. The food was terrible and the entire place felt a little dated.
title: Busy, Tired, Expensive
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The setting is excellent, a lovely fresh water lake which can be swum in! The Parc is well established, with the majority of French; Dutch and Belgique visitors. The area featured sadly heavily in WWI, with lots of memorials; museums and cemeteries. A beautiful part of France, only 2.5 hours South of Calais, with its own Champagne region! The parc is large, only feeling crowded in the Aqua Mundo at weekends, long queues for rides. The local town of Laon sits on top of a prominent hill, super views at night. The cathedral is atmospheric and the summer light show is excellent. Overall, a nice parc, but explore Aisne region for some very poignant reminders of WWI.
title: Peaceful  Lakeside Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I\'d read a few reviews before we left and was a little worried - I didn\'t need to be, the staff were helpful and patient with our lack of French, our lodge (VIP) was fantastic and we all loved the pool.  We went half board and found the choice of food to be good, quality was also good, glad we did that as I am sure we saved money in the long run.
title: Center Parcs Le Lac d\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have sampled many of the Center Parcs villages, but found Le Lac d\'Ailette to be a particularly friendly and attractive village and we would definitely return.  The trip from Calais (about 2.5 hours) was uncomplicated and check in was far less busy than a UK Center Parcs.  Our house was clean and pretty and the village itself was charming.  Activities were great and cheaper than those at the UK parks: I would definitely recommend this village for a fun break; the aqua centre was amazing.
title: Great break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great holiday loads to do all day everyday! Good choice of food. The activities mean you get to eat loads and not put on too much weight... The atmosphere and environment are simply lovely.  Wonderful!
title: Great Family hols
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed in a Premium cottage on the lakeside which had beautiful views. The furniture, TV\'s and kitchen were a little outdated and need upgrading. The facilities were great and staff very friendly and accommodating - most spoke English. Overall we had a fun-filled, wonderful family holiday. We have stayed at other centerparcs resorts and we found this one quite busy and a little noisy with any vehicles on the roads throughout the week which was a little unnerving for children on bicycles.
title: Good family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Location and the lake are lovely, aqua-mondo is a great family feature but for the total price improvements in service and quality/price need to be made. We travelled with our children and grandchildren and stayed in 3 cottages in zone 4 (quite a walk to the centre) two cottages had a lovely view over the lake and grass access to the young kids play park, the third on the opposite side of the road looked out of too high grass which completely blocked the view. The lake, beach, aqua mondo are all great, the two biggest let downs are the staff and the cost of extras and when you put the two together you have the worst bits, which is shocking customer service. Staff - generally seemed to actively avoid customer contact and then were uninterested, one exception was the buffet restaurant where they were definitely trying and one chap was really pleasant. Cost of activities was really steep and booking was tricky, no explanation to the topping system for us first timers. Put the two together - we got turned away from the booking desk 3 minutes before it as due to close on the Tuesday (I had thought it was open until 9 not 8), so then couldn\'t order the takeaway for the group that had stayed in, so I queued at the pizza place to order a takeaway, after 10 mins with only three groups ahead was then told that takeaway was ordered at the bar, waited another 5 minutes for the team leader to finish making coffees and drinks for other team members without being acknowledged by any of them. Then was told the \'offer\' that is in the pack can\'t be ordered there only at the desk (now shut!). Ordered two pizzas (26 euros), then went to the bowling to get a drink and sort out the rest of the groups evening bowling, another 10 minutes being ignored at the bar, eventually ordered a drink (6 to 7 euros a pint), asked about booking bowling and was told it was at the desk, when I reminded them that it was closed, I was told to wait for his colleague who got distracted by serving ice cream, cleaning outside tables, other customers still waiting for bits of their order etc. Eventually got a lane booked but like almost everyone else we saw, we couldn\'t work out how to enter names on the scoreboard, so lost more time getting someone to come and key it for us. The time ran out before the game was finished, and the time was not paused while the scoreboard was sorted and we came across other people with similar issues. Later in the week had a nightmare trying to book the electric boats and the paddle boards, only open 2 til 6 and only have five boards, and couldn\'t get three boats at the same time on that day, and basically a take it or leave it attitude at the desk - and we would say don\'t bother with the electric boats as they are really slow, and expensive. We booked three of the grandchildren on the junior forest adventure, the info desk checked they were all over 1.10m, but when they got there the eldest (13 year old girl) was turned away for being a couple of inches too tall, again with a take it or leave it attitude, so her two brothers went on while she watched, and their Dad was told off for helping the 8 year old whose safety rope got tangled. Properties are a bit uncared for but not really a problem, but was really glad we took our own pillows as those who didn\'t found them really poor. Cost of food and drink at the shop and bakery was generally two to five times the price of Carrefour at Laon so did three trips there in the week - this really is extortionate profiteering - but be careful if you do as you can\'t get your car back on expect first and last day so you have to carry it, or if you are lucky borrow a big green barrow thing, which for a 15 person group took two trips from the car park!! Found the quality of the food in the buffet good and varied, bit of a scrum around the desserts but no real problems and the prawns and beef were gorgeous!!!
title: Lovely location, staff poor
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great location with the sun setting across the lake as we had tea on the decking, capybara cruising past with the coots and herons flying along the water. Quiet on the west side of the site and not too far from the centre on a bike.
title: Quiet evenings
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Gorgeous place - fun safe and calm holiday for all the family .  Beautiful setting and a visit to the old medieval town in Laon a must.  Near to the Champagne trail too! Recommend lake view cottages - the view just adds so much to the visit.
title: Beautiful Lac d\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The spot is great. A good place for families as the facilities are nice and many. We have not been able to try all the facilities, but we have been everyday to the "dome pool" which is extraordinary. The cottages are small but well arranged. Only flaw: the cleanliness! Cottage smelt strange and was not well cleaned.I can therefore not give the full grade... nor can I say it is average. The personnel is very very friendly, in each shop or restaurant we were. (The communication policy is strange: we forgot an item there, and there is no way to get the direct number to this particular center parc. After several calls we still do not know what happened to my jacket. All because individuals are not entitled to call the resort immediately ...deuhh!!?)
title: many facilities
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: No oven or BBQ. Other than that it\'s really easy to get to, nice and relaxing, plenty of activities. Wifi poor so take DVDs. Had a great time, would thoroughly recommend. Perfect family holiday destination.
title: Great time
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Dirty carpets + linen in chalet, kitchen could have done with a better clean. All but one restaurant open after 7pm so if you\'ve a young family you are stuck with a very expensive buffet (50EUR for 2 adults + 1 child).The beach has a cafe which only opens at 2pm, doesn\'t sell any hot drinks and only has hot dogs as food, if the deliveries come.Overall maintenance is poor, even the revolving doors at reception are failed to be maintained, only 1 of 3 works consistently. The site is lovely but needs money spending on maintenance and the catering management need to adjust their schedules to meet the requirement of families.
title: DIY or not at all
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We loved this facility.  TONS of family activities, loads of restaurants and catering facilities (although the opening/closing hrs are awkward).  No laundry facilities a downside.   Bikes are provided so don\'t bring your own.  Fridge/freezer was a good size.  Bedrooms were well equipped, kitchen had some pots and pans but no sharp knives or a spatula.  You can buy these in the shop but very over priced.  Overall, HIGHLY recommend.  Beautiful lake, beach, and AMAZING waterpark!
title: Great facility!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Centre parcs France is a much cheaper, prettier experience than its UK sister, and our VIP cottage clean, comfy and modern, but it\'s food and, importantly, service, a mere patch on UK version. Nothing is open when you need it, the rules are ludicrous, restaurants won\'t serve at their outside tables in peak summer season, fairground rides shut at lunchtime when kids are around, you can\'t even look in Aqua Mundo unless dressed only in swimsuits, lockers don\'t work, takeaway service that\'s supposed to be open til 9 wouldn\'t answer the phone at 8, and refused to serve anything but pizza when ordered in person even at 8.30! Crazily bad service. Our promised inclusive morning bread/croissant delivery simply never arrived. However, it\'s clean, aqua Mundo is out of this world - best water park of all 4 centre parcs we\'ve visited by miles, bike hire was easier and quicker than in Uk. But food, especially as we were in France was pretty poor. I\'d go back based on price and cleanliness - but don\'t expect good service or quality food!
title: Lac d\'alliete
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great location, poor cleanliness. A good location for families however the cottages are small and our VIP Cottage smelt and was covered in dead flies in all rooms. The fridge was switched off and had not been cleaned so smelt awful when we opened it. We needed to clean everything and run all crockery through the dishwasher we before we could use. Our veranda was set on the lake however it looked like the reeds had just been cut and left all over the veranda. We certainly will not be going back.
title: Dirty VIP Cottage
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Center Parcs is great for families. We loved the bikes, the play parks, and choice of activities. We tended to eat out for lunch visiting areas such as Reims and Epernay which were lovely. We then made our own dinner so cannot comment on restaurants within the park. Lovely setting but although we had a premium cottage it was tired with dirty carpets and broken wall hangings. There was also no air conditioning so we were plagued with bugs. Bakery was lovely with a great selection. The water park had plenty of slides to suit all but no matter which time we went it was always extremely busy. They seem to let in day visitors so there were a lot of schools and organised trips of young people. This meant it was stressful with young children as they could be lost easily and changing rooms were packed. Inflatable bouncy session was great and reasonably priced. Overall we enjoyed the Center Parcs experience but would probably choose a different park.
title: Fun holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed in a waterside house - a little small and more than enough bugs, mozzies, spiders etc but on the whole fine.Pool area great for the kids, easy to get around. Amazing Coypu animals for the kids to gawp at. However do not visit here if you plan on eating out.  Stock up at supermarket before you get into the parc and dont even attempt to eat at one of the restaurants.  France - the gourmet capital of the world? not here...the buffet area (plain pasta, chips, frankfuters etc) was poor.  Long waits - had to clean own tables. hundreds of mosquitoes in the area of the food.  The Italian  if you want a slightly poor pizza but thats it.   The lac restaurant  - the \'fine dining option\' was as bad.  Nachos starter? thats a bag of emptied out broken Doritos on a plate with some funny guacamole.  it arrived the same time as the EUR 25 steak and chips. no sides. no sauces.  just shocking.  plates not cleared away. No one checking if all ok. no drinks re-ordering. mention to the manager and there are of course no issues...everyone is happy. of course they are. nice lake but shocking service and food.
title: great pool and wildlife..shocking food and service...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: great place lots to do for families,very safe and relaxing,kids(9 and 7) said it was the best holiday ever!very suitable for active families not hounded every 10 feet to eat as in spanish resort strip. minus points expensive to eat and drink there recommend buying food shopping in supermarket off site.cars driving around on site should be stopped by management as a priority its too dangerous with so many kids around
title: family fun
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We managed to get a good price on one of the Premier lodges by the waterside and it was a great location with fantastic views over the water. Lodge had a sauna, jacuzzi bath and en suite power shower. The decking could do with a lick of paint but that was our only complaint about the lodge. The staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. On an evening it is a bit of a rotation as to which restaurants are open on any given day so check before you set out for your meal. Only gripes would be a) the golf carts that can be hired are sometimes driven to fast and over grassed areas and can be dangerous to cyclist and pedestrians, b) cars that had been left outside lodges and had notes placed telling them to be moved were still there 3 days later. The park is easily accessible from Calais on the main autoroute after about a 2 and half hour drive. Free wifi in lodge worked great with a kindle fire but was a bit hit and miss with other devices.
title: Midweek stay in July 14
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our second stay in Lac d\'Ailette. While I agree that there are some small signs of a general lack of maintenance (broken windows and doors at the center entrance, broken coat hangers and benches in the aqua mundo), all in all this is a pretty and enjoyable parc. The only thing below Center Parcs standards is the breakfast buffet.The surrounding area is beautiful, and allows for some hiking and cycling. Places like Reims, Soisson and of course Laon are relatively close by and are worth the visit. The Aqua Mundo is big, has 11 water slides and the kids loved it.And just for clarity, the rodents in the parc are NOT rats, are NOT muskrats, nor are they otters or even beavers. They are coypus. They are completely harmless and very fun to watch.I would certainly stay here again!
title: No, they are not rats :)
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were here for 4 nights as a family with 2 small children (aged 2 and 4). The accommodation was basic despite being a premium cottage. The pool was fantastic but the rest of the park just seemed a bit dated and run down.
title: A bit run down
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our second trip to Le Lac, and the experience was just as good as the first. I agree with some of the comments that certain aspects of the park are "tired", however this didn\'t detract from our experience. The Aqua Mundo was brilliant, and with 2 children under the age of 4, this is where we spent the majority of our time.One criticism would be the policing of cars on the site during the week. Many cars were not moved to the main car park after unloading, which left some areas congested. Add to this the golf buggies that can be rented, it meant that the roads can be quite dangerous if you have young children. I must emphasis though, this is a minor gripe, and on the whole we have great memories of the holiday and are already talking about going back again next year.
title: Great family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: A super setting for a family retreat. We had a lovely time in a VIP 4 person cottage overlooking the lake. The children enjoyed the local wildlife and the activities on offer. They were thrilled with the Aqua Speed activities and can\'t wait to do it all again. We had a problem with an uncomfortable bed, but it was soon sorted with a new mattress. Our dishwasher didn\'t have any hot water either, but the staff were friendly and tried to sort it out. Unfortunately for us it wasn\'t fixed till day 6. The decking woodwork could do with a lick of paint, and the sofa was a little worn. The supermarket is a little pricey, but we took the car to Laon which had a large supermarket which was really cheap.
title: Lovely setting
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Lots of vehicles and electric buggies rather spoiling the usual atmosphere one would normally expect from Centre Parcs.  Also Aqua Mundo was very busy at weekends with nonresidents.  Accommodation and location very well thought out and pretty on the lake.  However, lodgings needed a really good clean and facilities generally needed better maintenance and care.  Broken lockers, toilet facilities, floor tiles in Aqua Mundo.  Also the rapids weren\'t as fun as other sites but there were more flumes.  Disappointed when booking the free topper activities as not all the options were available.  Never come across this in the past at other sites.  Overall good location in France and close enough for a day trip to Paris (approximately 1 1/2 hours drive), but if you are looking for the usual tranquil break that Centre Parcs offers perhaps look elsewhere.
title: Not up to the usual standard
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: for such a new park it was surprising to see the poor condition of the cottages. This brought the value down on what normally should be a luxury stay. The pool is good and fun for the family. The nature remains lovely
title: great environment but poor maintenance
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We loved the location and the park itself. It was such a shame, that in our booking CenterParcs didn\'t clearly state that the park would be closed for public on the last day of our stay from 10 am on. We found a tiny note on our booking documents saying that "Check-out time was 10 am", but since you always have to vacate your cottage in the morning of your last day, we didn\'t find it odd at all. Only when we got there were we handed out a letter with a clear indication that something was off. But still no clear lines about the "park being closed for public use". So we went to ask for information at the reception where some of the staff was still nice, others were plainly rude - and a manager was not to be found. I also waited to share my experience over tripadvisor for over 10 days, because - after I replied to CenterParcs\' email for our opinion of our stay there - I expected a reaction from them. Nothing came so far and by their behavior at the park, when we were there, I must say that I\'m not surprised, that I didn\'t hear from them.
title: Great park - poor staff!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have 3 young kids and are generally get up and go when we are on holiday and retire back to the cottage for the evening so did not use the restaurants. We made immediate use of the bikes and pool areas. the kids just love exploring and there were plenty of cycle tracks and nature to keep them busy. Off to the pool in the afternoon was the normal arrangement. Not too busy at all and plenty of seats even at peak times. we were there in uk mid term break. Bikes a bit tired and needed a clean if you were going to be fussy but overall we had a good time and the kids were tired and in bed early enough to enjoy a glass of wine with the balcony doors open over looking the lake. will return as price was very competitive compared to the uk centre parcs during the school holidays. 2 hour blast up the motorway and your in Calais.
title: Young family of 5
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Perfect 5 night break (fri - wed) for our young family travelling from EnglandGreat Cottage on lake sidePark was clean with great facilities for children - play parks and farm animalsAqua mundo was excellent (lots of sides)Restaurants good and reasonable priced
title: Perfect break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: While cp has a great pool the VIP lake side cottage with sauna, deck, jet pool was dirty tired with many pieces of equipment broken or not working. The reception is not easily identifyable so complaining is not so easy.  We stayed for three days two nights and did not want to waste our holiday time arguing with  cp about the quality of the cottage. They need to get a grip since they are, in my opinion, in danger of becoming a modern day Butlins or worse. So thats my rant, I\'ve filled 2 forms to let them know of my concerns and will wait to see if they respond.    We stayed in cottage 273 which was about 1 mile away from the main building and car park. Essentially too far for walking if time is not on your side. Bikes hired would cost another \u00a3100 so either bring your own or pay to choose your cottage location and stay closer. Also our cottage had a northly aspect so never got the sun, who designs holiday homes this way???? So to conclude we stayed in a low rent hotel the night before where the hospitality, food and most importantly cleanliness was 5 star. Therefore maybe we should all start to give these big firms a wide birth and try the small, more hospitable  holiday firms instead!
title: dirty cottages
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We just returned from Le Lac Center Parc, and we had a really good time.Our cottage was perfect, we had a spa bath tube, a sauna and 2 showers.The kitchen/ dinning area/ lounge was big enough for us and with every thing that we needed for a week holidays. The rooms where also good and both with a closet to put your things.We do have a few complains, to manny webs in the house and dust on the walls, it\'s nothing to put me off but means that they aren\'t putting enough attention to details and it will get worse.I do understand that not all staff speak other languages the French, but then again they do get a lot of clients from the UK, so the basic would be nice. And before I get criticised I speak Portuguese, English and a basic French, but sometimes not enough for my needs, I\'m afraid.Apart from that, the Aqua Mundi is great fun, we would stay there for about 3 hours, the rest of the day we would be riding our bicycles and explore the area. We also went out a couple of times to know some villages around there, I sincerely advise those that can to do that. It is beautiful!! Hope it helps
title: A great family time
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Booked a \'Premium\' cottage after staying at Center Parcs in UK. On arrival we were sure there had been an error, but no. The cottages are very poor with basic furniture and equipment. Site not safe for young children. Shopping expensive
title: Property misdescription
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I was unsure of what to expect, as this was our first stay in Centre Parcs. We chose Lac d\'Ailette because of the exquisite setting, and we were not disappointed! Absolutely fabulous, a great way to get away from the city... Beavers, swans, ducklings all on our cottage doorstop! Even though the weather was not as sunny as we had hoped, it was still a great get-away. Lots of activities to keep us busy, the children were in 7th heaven! And happy children = happy parents.
title: pleasantly surprised!
