price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The location of the bungalows around the lake is fantastic and absolutely beautiful. We enjoyed the mini farm, the playground and the small beach area as the weather was good. There\'s plenty of space if you want to go  for a hike or a cycling tour. On the other hand, the pool was only so so and not very clean nor very big. I think overall this is way too expensive for what you get. Our cottage was not very clean either (dirty carpet in the bedroom, kitchen cabinets were sticky, etc.) which was a serious letdown. The fireplace didn\'t do much and as there were only electric heaters in the room it was too cold to sit comfortably in the evening. Our whirlpool didn\'t work (we paid extra for a premium cottage though). Most disappointing was the food. There was one  italian restaurant which was okay, but the Marche du Monde buffet was terrible. For a price of 30 euros pp (drinks excluded) it was a complete rip off. Therefore, overall, I would not recommend it.
title: Too expensive
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Essentially, we had a lovely 5 days at center parc le lac and a great time with our young family.BUT the no cars policy is not enforced at all! Such a shame and also very dangerous. After staying at Longleat CP where there wasn\'t a single car in the parc for 4 days, here there was a constant flow of cars for the whole 5 night duration. I thought this was the most important part of the CP philosophy?! And because of this we did not feel comfortable letting the kids cycle out of immediate view, the freedom of a family bike ride was spoilt. The parc is quite run down lots of visual wear and tear. Our cottage was fine, though very much lacking an oven.
title: NO cars means no cars
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: NO WI-FI!!! and v. poor wired internet connection in the cottage.expensive for some of the activities and need to book them in advance to avoid disappointment. Swimming pool excellent. Buffet not bad, but only 2 evening restaurant choices in April (the other was pizza, also on the buffet).lake side was very pretty and overall well maintained. Few cracked tiles in swimming pool to watch for. evening entertainment pretty poor, but lots of other stuff to do.
title: good break with kids
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We booked up for 4 days in Easter Holidays. 3 adults and 2 kids. Flew from Newcastle to Charles De Gaulle and a 90 min drive to Lac d\'Ailette. Had found whole booking process less clear than UK (then again \u00a3500 cheaper for same in UK). You get "Toppings" that give you free activities and choice of cottage location. We had 602 (premium 3 bed cottage) which was very well located, on banks of lake, entertained by a few duck families, other birds and even a beaver! 5 min walk to main complex but nice and peaceful. Cottage itself was big enough for us, kitchen has hob and microwave, rooms did a job, if you need a couple of pillows then yes you have to be innovative!We arrived at the location at lunchtime, and although you cannot get to your accommodation, you can use facilities, and pool is the star here, a step up from the UK in terms of slides. If you arrive early you can also use this time to book your activities. All activities are booked through reception (or similar desk at activity centre). It was quiet when we booked, as we were early, but later the queues were massive and many things were fully booked the next morning. So my tip, if you are early, is spend some time deciding what you want to do straight away and then take your time deciding at desk (as only there do you know times!!) and book, before the crowds arrive. This is where toppings come in if you have them, they give you free activities, but with many exclusions, tip is to try to use them on priciest options. Staff were helpful in pointing this out.Kids did Accro Speeder (high ropes), Quad Bikes (tame), Pony Club (a stroll on a pony), Aqua Speed (looked like fun). We hired a boat, did archery, played min golf & tenpin. In total came to \u20ac150. In short, activities are not at full on a UK, but felt cheaper.Eating options a bit limited if buffet is not your thing. Did not try buffet due to picky kids and \u20ac26 per adult, \u20ac9 per child) Snack bar in day, Italian and Pancake house open most nights, Grill restaurant open 3 nights a week. We only ate in Grill and it was good if not a little pricey (as you would expect in CP).Very good on site bakers (mandatory to carry a baguette at all times) that opens at 8 for Brekkie. On site super market has most things but a little more expensive due to on site privilege.The medieval town of Leon is about a 15 min drive north (easy to find). It has 2 supermarkets, but, to our surprise, had a magnificently preserved ancient town with a massive cathedral that is well worth a visit  for a couple of hours with plenty of food and drink places to dine if you wish.Just to mention the language thing. I remember a little french GCSE but no more. Some staff have perfect English, some you work though, in one case (quad bikes) the instructor has no English but we got by - its just part of the fun.No wifi and did not look for wired connection - felt quite weird not having connection in 2014 but also added to the relaxation!If you are full on UK centre parkers you may be left wanting a but more. But blessed with warm weather and a great location to chill in, we had a great break. The pool, parks, indoor soft play all provide free options to entertain kids and let one of us chill in peace back at the house looking out on the lake.
title: Pleasantly Suprised
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Way better than thought! Kids 2 toddlers loved it fell straight asleep every night from all the entertainment so v happy parents! We don\'t speak French but fitted in v we\'ll!! Beach lovely! Pizza great wished it opened at 18:00!
title: Great easter vaka!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Nice centre parcs village. Main swimming centre is excellent but restaurants are a bit limited. No oven in the cottage so difficult to cook food there.Overall a nice relaxed family holiday which was much better value than UK parks
title: Nice time in France
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having read some reviews, we were expecting worse! On the whole we were very pleasantly surprised. Despite one stained mattress, the rest of the cottage was clean. Aquamundo was fantastic! Staff great.
title: Accommodation better than expected!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Dirty villa, unkept grounds, small, cramped changing facilities, random restaurant opening times - wine massively overpriced and poor quality in restaurants when better stuff is sold for \u20ac4 in their supermarket. Would not go back.
title: Poor
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After reading some of the reviews we were a little nervous before staying at the Parc.We are a family with 3 children (age 5, 2 and 6 months) staying in a 2 bedroom premium Lake Front Cottage. Due to it being Easter holidays a week later in France compared to England the price for the cottage was excellent value.The cottage itself was perfect, amazing position on the Lake with a balcony that you can relax on. It is safe for small children. As in other reviews some of the furnishings are a little tired such as a loose wardrobe door and a stiff stairgate but nothing that really causes any problems. Kitchen was well furnished.The Parc itself is great, so much for the children to do. We could have spent another week there and still not done everything. The pool complex is fantastic for children of all ages and we spent a whole day there with the children still not wanting to leave at the end.Overall a great family holiday that is safe and full of activities to keep the children entertained.
title: Fantastic Family Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We swam, we cycled, we had a lot of fun! the surrounding countryside was lovely. The staff were ever so helpful and spoke a selection of languages. Water park and extra activities were great. Food was too expensive!
title: great family break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This is our third time staying at Lac d\'Ailette. It is a very easy and enjoyable break for us and the kids. I can\'t comment on the restaurants as we tend to take our own food (be aware that there is no oven in the cottages only a microwave and hob). The aqua Mundo is excellent and there is a much more laid back approach from the staff
title: Great family fun
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our first visit to Centreparcs outside of UK.Well , it was a real success , we much preferred this place to Elvedon .Firstly we are a family of 4 , 2 kids aged 7 and 10 .We visited in April half term in 2014.The first thing to say is its a lot cheaper , we hired a VIP 2bed , villa for about \u00a3400 less than a comfort villa in Uk .Secondly the site is very attractive , beautiful views over a lake with its own beach . Unlike UK , the villas are brightly coloured units giving a New England look in style .Our villa (440) had a L shaped furnished balcony right on the lake edge with otters , ducks etc .Inside well equipped , two bathrooms jacuzzi bath , separate Sauna room/shower . Nicely furnished  lounge  with comfy sofa and two chairs . Small kitchen , dishwasher , four ring ceramic hob , microwave/grill but no oven ...depends on how much cooking you want to do .take a chopping board with you !Really felt homely and yes a few licks of paint needed , but not an issue for us .Centre is smaller than UK , 3 main restaruants Pizza place , Grill place and Buffet restaurant.A takeaway delivery service is available too . Restaruants are pricey but so are those in Uk Centreparcs , they do also have a burger fast food place during the day and a crepe restaraunt .   A decent sports bar with bowling (albeit a bit pricey on the drinks) . Decent mini market which supplied the basics you need and not really overpriced as some  suggest .Facilities are as UK and Aqua Mondo swimming was very nice my kids liked it , really good for younger ones too. My 10 year old son did Paintball , high wire and loved  it -staff were polite and helpful and mostly spoke good English . Excellent facilities if you have younger kids with large indoor climbing centre( jungle gym) which is free .The weather was excellent which no doubt helped , but what wins this place over the UK  is the beautiful setting , really is stunning and much more "open" feel to UK .We would definitely return  and many Brits there shared the same view  - it\'s worth the trip over .I would recommend the VIP villa as they are much better equipped .Excellent little village ... Enjoy ..
title: Centre Parcs Le Lac d\'Ailette Nr Reims France C\'est Bon!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have visited all the parcs in France numerous times over the last 10 years and this one second time around really let us down. Although the location is outstanding, this is all it had going for it this time. The villa was a poor example of VIP with the covering on kitchen doors coming off, cobwebs all over the place and neither tv\'s working. We ate in the restaurants this time which we didn\'t last visit and found the food dreadful except the Pizza restaurant. . If I visited again then I would definitely cook in the villa.
title: Not so good 2nd visit
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We shared a 4 bed Premium and were delighted with C Parcs, especially things previous reviews had raised concerns over. We felt the cleanliness and cottage comfort and provision was higher than implied. The Aqua Mundo was entertaining for 2 hours every day for a week, for an age range of 2-9 year old children & adults never bored either. Plenty of free stuff - skate park, play parks, paddle on the beach, scooting everywhere... Enjoye dourselves.
title: Lots of fun for families sharing
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We\'ve just returned as a family of four from a few days in 288, a VIP lakeside cottage. Nice view across the lake but rubbish pillows and very tired external d\u00e9cor. Plenty of space though, albeit we would rather have had a bigger kitchen than a random sauna in the cottage ! We recommend choosing a cottage in the 500s instead - more open space, great views to the centre of the parc and a playground for the little uns.
title: Very different to UK Center Parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have frequented different Center Parks for many years but this was our first visit to Le Lac d\'Ailette.  We usually stay at Longleat at this time of year but I can confirm this was cheaper even including Eurotunnel and petrol costs.We had a 4 bedroom chalet which was close to the dome (no. 10 /11)   The layout was somewhat baffling with two separate sets of stairs at opposite ends of the chalet, on one side leading to 2 bedrooms and a bathroom while on the other side they led to one bedroom and a bathroom.  The sofa and armchairs in the living room were unbearably uncomfortable and the only plus point was that they provided constant entertainment to the 3 children in our party, as the cushions spent the majority of the week on the floor. The TV was barely bigger than a laptop.  The kitchenette is small and no oven. There were instructions on how to use everything from microwave to jacuzzi in english.  There are only very small tea/coffee cups, so one of our first expense was purchasing some mugs in the gift shop (at inflated prices of course).  Definitely remember to bring your own pillows!  The carpet in the double bedroom downstairs appeared quite new and clean while the ones upstairs had definitely seen better days.  The towels were threadbare. There is underfloor heating and the small radiators have no problem in topping up the heat. Our first impression was quite disappointing.  But the Aqua Mundo made up for some of it.  So much better and more to do than any other we have been to. We and the children did not get bored all week and there were literally no queues for the slides etc,  although that could have more to do with the time of year ... on changeover Monday we actually found ourselves at one point as the only people in the large wave-pool. it would appear that the no car rule in this Center Parks is not policed whatsoever.  We found ourselves avoiding traffic the whole week we were here and to make matters worse, a few times were actually intimidated by drivers to move out of the way. The golf type buggies are just a nuisance and not necessaryWe took our dog on this trip but were very disappointed that we could not take him into the dome or any of the restaurants.  Usually the continent is so much more animal friendly.  However, he did enjoy running on the beach and the woodland walks.  In the summer this might not be so easy with people sunbathing and using the waterfront more.We did ask  the information desk staff to help us out with making a reservation for his vet visit prior to returning to the UK and although they didn\'t quite understand why we wanted the appointment, they assisted us no questions asked.  The Vet\'s practice spoke no english at all but they knew what was legally required and the whole procedure was a breeze. If anybody needs their details, dont hesitate to email me. One afternoon we drove to Leon and would recommend this for a little diversity (and yes, the dog came along and was allowed in a restaurants and cafe no problem)  Before returning to Center parks we shopped at Carrefour for essentials at half the price of the on site supermarket.  Overall we would say this park is a little tired looking and the accommodation could definitely do with updating but we had a good week and enjoyed the experience but will not return.  I had the feeling that the management never actually walked around the park or they would make appropriate changes.
title: Average
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Not bad place to stay, but houses should be definitely bigger. Some other remarksOpen fireplace must be covered if not used otherwise the company\'s statement about green and nature friendly resorts is just a words, as heat is escaping from the open chimney very quickly. There is no way to close the chimney if fireplace is not used.Logs (or more specifically a log) for fireplace is kind of artificial and made by tobacco company. It is real nonsense as you can not burn normal logs in the fireplace. This approach is not "green" at all ;(:(:(
title: Good but overpriced place
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I agree with many of the reviews already on here, we booked a premium lakeside cottage but would certainly not describe it as premium.  It was comfortable enough, but in need of redecoration, the paintwork was scuffed and marked as were the bedroom carpets, and the outdoor furniture looked very worn, although we were there in February so it may have been sat outside unused for some time.The lake view was lovely, very relaxing to sit and watch ducks, swans and an otter swim past! The kitchen facilities were basic with hob and microwave, but we pre booked meal vouchers which were reasonable.  The buffet breakfast was excellent!Swimming pool was brilliant, we mainly went between 1 & 3pm and wasn\'t too busy so we didn\'t really have to queue for anything.  The children\'s swim jackets that they provide for non/ less competent swimmers were great for my 5 year old so she was very happy going round the lazy river and rapids with the rest of us.We filled the weekend quite happily swimming, cycling and in the indoor and outdoor play areas so didn\'t try any activities. We had prebooked adult bikes which were quite good value, and took children\'s ones with us although they did have a good range of styles and sizes.The number of cars on site throughout the weekend was annoying given the site was supposed to be car free, and a bit worrying with children around, it was worst around the aqua mundo but not too bad the rest of the site.It was an easy drive from Calais, and significantly cheaper than uk center parcs especially during half term, and whilst it wasn\'t as high a standard as uk sites the kids loved it and it was an enjoyable and relaxing weekend so would return.
title: Fantastic pool, accomodation could be better
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Nice village, safe and secure place to relax, not as good as some of the other Center Parcs we have been to but still a great time to be had. Only one English speaking TV station and that\'s CNN and no Wi-Fi ( just a warning to to English speaking visitors, not meant as a negative remark )
title: Christmas at Center Parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We rented a cottage around the lake (VIP). the location was very nice, and very pleasant.I was surprised to see that the cottage was so much run down...it looked like it was 20 years old.For the rest, it is a typical center parcs. The best restaurant was the creperie... really enjoyed it!
title: Nice around the lake, but housing not aging very well
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This is a lovely village but houses are closer together than parks in the UK. There are way too many cars still parked on the road all week and they are used throughout the village - not acceptable.Houses are basic, even the premium ones, beds are comfortable but pillows so bad we had to leave to buy some new ones.Great water park/swimming pool which everyone loved.Bikes were poorly maintained - especially the brakes.Food of a higher standard than the UK
title: good fun but come prepared
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We\'ve been to a number of Center Parcs both in the UK and on the continent but this has to be my favourite.Yes the accommodation needs a bit of a clean and redecoration but we were never really there but to sleep. The beds were clean and comfy, needed an extra pillow though and the views across the lake were amazing. The villa was well appointed with everything you need to self cater, no oven to speak of though.The swimming complex is phenomenal with plenty of slides and a fantastic area for younger children. The free activities are always a bonus and the fact that it was half the price of a UK parc makes it excellent value.Would thoroughly recommend.
title: Great October break!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: we booked for christmas time, they called us to stay more time, we did, then they forgot our options, we had to make several time the line (1hour wait) to get everything we booked online. After 2 days we were stuck outside our cottage in the cold and rain because they forgot to merge our reservation, tools were missing from the kitchen,  they didn\'t accepted our kid on an activity on christmas day because our options wasn\'t activated enough ! Don\'t try to reach a manager they are not trained to fix anything... worst christmas ever...
title: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Very nice break, lots to do as a family. Accommodation was good but site shop was only option. This center parcs location was not near any other grocery shops. The aqua mundo kept the kids happy for 3 of the days we were there and other activities we booked took up another. Our 3rd center parcs in as many years and I wasn\'t disappointed!
title: Week\'s break at Lac d\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: In the brochure and on the internet this park looked ideal for our short family break. In reality the whole park is very tired and needs a good clean and essential maintenance. In the swimming pool out of about twenty showers only five worked and  supplied luke warm water that had so little water pressure that  it was insufficient to wash the shampoo out of my daughters long hair. In the gents toilets only one of the four urinals was working! The whole shower and toilet block need a complete refurbishment. Around the park lots of the street lights are not working and some of the cycle paths along the beach front had all of the lights off  for our complete stay switched off making riding home after our evenings meal unsafe due to areas of the pathway that had fallen away onto the beach. There was no signage alerting anyone to this. Our cottage was fine with the exception of the cleanliness especially the walls and the upstairs carpets. Known of the extractor fans worked in the bathrooms or toilets which for the down stairs toilet without a window next to the kitchen made it unusable.We have stayed at a other centre parcs in France and have always had a great time, we made the best of this holiday but would not recommend this park to anyone!
title: Unfortunately A Dissappointment
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Being a centreparcs fan and having visited all 4 of the UK sites we decided to venture and try europe.We picked Le lac due to its closest proximity to Calais. Having read all the negative reviews we were prepared to not have too high expectations.As it was a very wet week we spent most of it indoors and hence cannot really comment on the outdoor facilities/activities. Also our son is a toddler so most activities he would have been too young for (apart from the pony riding i think) the rest were from about 8 ish. Ill try to be as objective as possible and my experience might be different to others..Accommodation: we stayed in a 2 bed VIP cottage which overlooked part of the lake so me and my son fed the resident ducks and beaver daily. Space wise the UK cottages are definately more spacious. I preferred the UK Woodlands style to these but despite that found the furnishings quite comfy and dozed off on the sofa most nights. The cottage was quite clean and no smell of cigarettes either so could not complain. The added touch was underfloor heating which was very nice as it was a cold week. Kitchinette small and as previously mentioned no oven, I struggled to use the grill setting in the microwave combi and ended up cremating the nuggets. It would have been helpful for there to be instructions. The VIP had a sauna and jacuzzi bath which was nice to have for us adults to relax. Both the rooms had en suites:-master had double bed, the jacuzzi bath and toilet, second bedroom had 2 singles and a shower. There was a wc next to the lounge.The bedding is probably what let this place down the most. The pillows were hollow fibre (bleugh- grab your own pillow if you\'ve got the space in the car) and the duvet a bit thin (although we were not cold). The towels were rather threadbare imo. The sheets not as luxurius as the UK ones and bed probably not as comfy. Aqua mundo: this is where we spent the most of time during our stay. It had the most slides of all the centreparcs we\'ve been in, even with 2 closed there were still like 6 or 8 slides. There were hardly any ques too which was likely due it being out of season.The rapids were quite tame  for us at least- and we even took our 3 year old on them- again, and again! The splash zone was great for younger children as you could just lounge and watch the kids being drenched by a giant water bucket or go on the slides. The babies pool had 2 slides as well and a sand pit so perfect for under 3\'s. It was let down however by the general wear and tear that could be seen all around, there were a lot of leaves and debris from the indoor live plants and I even swam past a cockroach in the pool. The actual pool was not as big as longleats and there was a lazy river, which was very lazy. Around the parc: Inside the main area they had the childrens play area Baluba which was great- like an indoor soft play area with a seperate lego building section and a several coin operated arcade games for the older ones. We didint eat in the restaurants but I really liked the jungle dome interior when passing (much nicer than Elveden).There was a small playground not too far from our cottage and a main play ground which was quite good by the beach. The cottages dont have that secluded woodlands feel you get in the UK parcs and are more terraced style. It was not hilly apart from maybe 2 or 3 inclines and our 3 year old managed most on his bike himself. The area around the lake is quite scenic and there were pedalo and rowing boats for hire. The parc market was very expensive. We bought a whole roast chicken at the carrefour in Laon for about 6euros and it was over 12 in the parc market! We only got some bread there when we ran out. Laon was about 7miles away and we got the fresh groceries there. I found prices in france (for our usual stuff) more expensive and tip would be to buy and bring most of your usuals (cereal etc..) if you can. We brought our own bikes but I think the prices are similar for hire to the UK ones about 23 euro for midweek adult bikes. They only had the one type of bike from what I could see, not like the Uk ones were you have the mountain bikes and city, these were just the city bikes. Golf buggys (which I found annoying as they would wizz past little kids struggling on their bikes) were about 150 euros for midweek I think to hire- they sat 4 plus any kids on your laps i guess. There were a lot of younger people with cigarettes hanging out of their mouths wizzing past on these. It would be one of my criticisms to centre parcs management. I feel they should be hired only to those with difficulty getting around, centreparcs is one of the times when you can enjoy leisurely bike riding without the fear of traffic, and for those with young children a seat or attachment is available. The staff were pleasant enough and even though it was a bit of a stuggle with the language barrier we managed to get most issues accross. The heating was not coming on initially and someone did come out albeit several hours later. They have handy housekeeping points around the cottages. We could not get in on day 1 and walked over to these \'SOS\' points. The house keeping staff came and used her card to open which was handy not having to drive all the way back to the reception. So overall the negatives are it could do with better bedding, cleaning of the aqua mundo, less smoking!! boy were there a lot of smokers, even in the playground with children playing and in the house keeping \'help\' areas they just chugged- ashtray full of butts! Reducing the traffic in the parc- cars would still be in and out and those annoying buggys and their chavvy drivers!!However it does provide good value for money and despite all of the above I would still recommend and go again in the future. I would only chose to stay in VIP and will go for lake view next time around.
title: Pleasantly surprised
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a lovely time at this parc, our daughter loved the swimming complex. The only criticism I\'d have is the restaurants close early and compared to the uk there is a limited choice. I\'m sure we\'ll go again.
title: Great holiday, good swimming complex
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We hadn\'t stayed at Centre Parcs for 20yr or so, but thought it would be a great location for a family reunion - 14 of us, including 5 grandchildren booked into two cottages, located in the same section of the site. On arrival, one family (together with 14 month infant) were informed with no explanation that they had been moved to another cottage at the extreme far end of the site - 25 minute walk from the other cottage - very disappointing.The cottages themselves were also a disappointment - the furnishings and fabric looked "tired", and one bedroom smelled very strongly of a nearby septic tank. The promised ground-floor "bathroom with shower" in a 4 bed cottage proved to be a WC and a tiny hand basin - as two of the party were disabled this again was not satisfactory. The grounds were overgrown and prices for any but the included activities are exorbitantly high.We originally booked a 4 night midweek stay (Monday - Friday) and agreed the price. When we received the confirmation I noticed that the duration of the stay had been amended to Monday - Thursday, but with no reduction in the total price. I queried this with Centre Parcs and was informed that this was because the Friday was a Public holiday in France, No refund for the shorter stay was offered, the only option I was given was "take it or leave it - do you want a refund?". Because it was a family reunion we reluctantly agreed the shorter booking.On the plus side .. the children loved the water park facilities - flumes, etc., and also the indoor children\'s play area.
title: Disappointed
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Went on holiday this summer and decided to give Centre Parcs a go for the first time. Went with friends who have been to Centre Parcs in the UK and they said it was very good.4 Adults, 2 young kids and 2 babies in total. We managed to pick a week in the summer where there wasn\'t good weather, but even with the rain there was plenty to occupy the kids. I\'d recommend hiring cycles for the duration with the buggy attachment for the kids and for caring your shopping from the local shop to the chalet.The chalet wasn\'t as high speck as the ones you get in the UK (so our friends told us) and the kitchen was small but for the price we couldn\'t complain. We\'ve decided to go again, but will take a bigger apartment next time.
title: Low cost family fun
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Really enjoyed our stay. House was literally next to the water. Everything was very clean. 3 year old daughter loved the swimming pool and playgrounds. Great time for all and vrry pretty.the beach was nice, but didnt really use it much. Pony ride and farm were brilliant for the little ones.
title: great stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Ideal for families, a small center parcs that is absolutely beautiful and perfect for parents with young children as everything is close by. Aqua mundo kept my 3 children (3,2 & 1yrs old!) entertained all day long!
title: Excellent
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed in lake villa with lake site and sauna. Was very very nice. The swimming pool was big and a lot of nice slidings. I really liked the part for children.From bad site than in reception they did not talk English well, the same staff for activities I.e. Aquagym or baby swimming. The could also be more friendly at reception. One day we couldn\'t order cottage delivery because it was 1.01 pm and the lady started a break, so she just sent us out.I was also sorry for bunnies at animal farm who had very very small cages :(The other thing, that even those inside the park you cannot park, there were a lot cars parked, it seems the rule was not the same for everyone. But all together we have very good experience, especially that we were with small baby. One time we may come back :)
title: Great family holidays
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have stayed at centre parcs in longleat England and it was fantastic. We booked a trip to France and saved for many months. We took our 1yr old and 2yr old. Travelled 7hrs via car and ferry. On arrival it looked very scenic and we were so excited to get into our \'premier\' cottage!! What we got greater with was highly upsetting and we left after only two days and came home. The cottage was dirty and had dried food on the floor- which my 1 yr old ate! Dirty microwave with food in and filthy cupboards. The kitchen was falling apart and chipped everywhere. The carpets were filthy and we just wanted to go home. We complained and were told it was \'tough\' to make matters worse the doors could be opened by my 2yr old and walked towards the lake! He could\'ve drowned. There were no locks on the doors front or back. He would go from room to room and we didn\'t get a moment to relax. My 1 yr old nearly fell out of the highchair because it had no straps on. We paid a fortune and it was a disgrace. Never go there!!
title: Worst holiday ever! Do not go!!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Six of us and a baby went for eleven nights in September to a VIP lakeside cottage.  The setting was wonderful, right on the lake with swans and ducks swimming right past the balcony.  The villa was much cleaner than I thought and fairly well equipped.  The setting is great and Laon is a lovely town and the close proximity to the champagne villages is nice.Unfortunately there were some negatives.  The bedroom carpets and walls were stained and the pillows were dreadful.  The patio needed repainting and the outdoor furniture was filthy and looked black even after we cleaned it.  Our television wouldn\'t work and was not repaired when we left.  The Aqua Mundo was not too clean and we saw a dead mouse in the outdoor pool, it is obviously difficult to patrol this large area, but nevertheless this is off-putting to say the least!  I thought the bars and restaurants were pretty soul-less and lacked atmosphere and the drinks were very expensive.  We had a lot of rain, and this is a very boring area of Northern France, there is nothing to do and nowhere to go in bad weather.  Overall I don\'t think we will be returning here.
title: Mixed feelings about this park
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a great week. Weather was mixed (late August) but more sunshine than cloud - temperature just right, high 70\'s.Setting is beautiful, lodges clean & facilities really good.Despite other reports, we found the staff were friendly and helpful.Prices for drinks are a little high.Limited menu options across the restaurants - particularly for vegetarians.  We\'re looking forward to going back.
title: pleasantly surprised
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We spent the long weekend here in a premium room on the lake. Place was clean, lovely views and even though we were very close to the main buildings it was nice and quiet. Great days on the high ropes, paintballing and the waterpark. Fun family evenings cooking a meal and playing games. This was our first center parcs experience and really enjoyed it.
title: Fun weekend with teens
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Good holiday for young, able bodied families. Lots of activities. Main centre a long way from your cottage and there is no child minding available. Restaurants don\'t know about gluten free or coeliacs!
title: A car free village in the woods...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great family holiday had by all from youngest aged 8 to eldest aged 74, something for everyone. staff were excellent all spoke good English. Plenty of activities particularly enjoyed the Segways. Will be back!
title: Family holiday August 2013
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: very lovely and much better value than Uk CP. read reviews on here before trip and felt a bit negative but it was really good. Lovely cottages, very nice setting and nice mix of nationalities. Nice to have the lake/beach as well as usual Cp stuff. great trip for two adults, one 5 yr old and 2 teenagers
title: family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Had a very enjoyable mid-week break in a villa by the Lake side.  Saw mixed feedback on Tripadvisor before going and was a bit concerned but was very pleasantly surprised.  We loved the location by the Lake and all of the villas seemed very evenly/well spread out.  Two key tips is to be aware that the fridge is turned off on arrival so come armed with a cool bag for any purchases en-route and secondly stock up on items in Laon on the way as the Center Parcs supermarket is expensive and doesn\'t necessarily have the range of items (but is good to top up on items or bread/cakes etc).  The car park was very large with lots of spare parking space so parking was better than some of the other Center Parcs locations we have been to.
title: Excellent Location
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a great time and having read reviews went equipped to clean, but were pleased to find the cottage clean and ready for use.  No oven was a little tricky, but we used a barbecue as the weather was fabulous.  Our children, 9,6 and 2 loved the swimming and being able to swim in the lake.  All the kids loved the slides and the rapids.  The older two did the woodland high climbing thing which was great.  All in all would recommend, we got a great deal also for the last week of the UK school summer holidays.  Also 4 hours door to door.
title: Lac d\'Ailette Great family break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Attractive houses, good facilities and good quality food.  It was very disappointing to find that we had such trouble communicating though, considering we speak 3 European languages - Unfortunately French is not one of them.  The Baluba playarea was disappointingly small compared to others we have been to at other Center pard facilities. The beds were very uncomfortable with very soft sponge mattresses.
title: Good facilities, but few staff can speak English, German or Dutch
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed here for a 4 night break 26/8-30/8. 2 adults and a 5 year old. Had a really great time and already looking in to booking for next summer!We booked a last minute deal on their website and as the prices were reduced, we went for the top of the range VIP cottage on the lakeside. We were really pleased with it, really modern and spacious with a big decking area to the side and rear overlooking the lake. The VIP ones come equipped with all you need such as towels, beds made up, complimentary toiletries, kitchen pack and even a sauna and whirlpool bath! (both bedrooms were ensuite). There are a lot of bushes/trees surrounding the cottages so it felt nice and private and not at all built up. There is a sandy beach with marked out swimming area and my daughter really enjoyed making sandcastles and swimming in the lake. The pool area is huge with outdoor and indoor sections, we went everyday and never got bored - had lots of fun on all the different slides and particularly the rapids one!Activities wise my daughter did the zip wire thing in the trees (there\'s a small low level course for little ones) and also the bungee trampoline. We did go to the mini disco and children\'s parade once but it was all in French (all the songs too) so my daughter didn\'t really join in. There\'s a few playgrounds dotted around, the best one being behind the beach. Also the indoor soft play area was good. We did a big shop at Carrefour the day we arrived but needn\'t have bothered really - it\'s half an hour drive each way and we didn\'t find the prices really much cheaper than the on site supermarket so next time we wouldn\'t bother. Only annoying thing was supermarket shut at 8pm which seemed a bit odd to me as people were still arriving (like us - in desparate need of food and drink on the first night we had to pay silly money for a take out pizza and bottle of wine from one of the restaurants as there were no other options). We hired bikes (took my daughters one from home with us), you do need them really to get around as the place is vast! Also we did a really nice scenic bike ride out of the park to the ruins of an Abbey. It\'s about 4.5km each way (you can pick up a map at the tourist info desk) and my 5 year old managed it fine as its mostly all flat, we took a picnic and had a really enjoyable time. If you\'re thinking of booking, do it! Would definitely recommend paying extra for the lake view as it was stunning and saw some amazing sunsets. It\'s about 2.5 hours drive (mostly all on one road) from Calais. We combined it with 2 days in Paris which is 1.5 hour drive.
title: Great time had by all. We\'ll be going back!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: You can enter the parc before 3pm  and use the facilties but cannot access your cottage until 3pm.  Bike hire was easy and fun with a range of bikes in pretty reasonable good working order.We stayed in a premium cottage which comes with beds made, the cottage cleanliness was excellent- apart form a few spiders.  (Lots of daddy long leg spiders) Lots of activities to do, try to book up as soon as you can esp childrens club as they fill up quickly.  Activities aren\'t cheap.  Beach area lovley.  Aqua mundo was lots of fun can get very busy in the day we found fom 6-8.45pm was a good time to go.  Aqua mundo felt a bit grubby in areas.  All in all we had a great time and would def look at going again.  The journey took about 2-21/2 hrs from calais so not too long a drive.  Disneyland and Paris not too far either.
title: Wonderful stay at Lac d\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After reading all the reviews then arriving to hear an English man complaining at reception about his problems with his villa we thought here we go. After looking around for about 20 minutes an he was still complaing at reception we just laughed in desperation. We got to our villa which was a 2 bedroom lake view VIP villa. I must say we were taken back by the view and the cleanse ness. It was perfect for me my wife and our 2 girls 8&4.. The on site shop was not expensive as we thought and it was well stocked. Yes the supermarket down the road is cheaper. Eating out was ok, the drinks were more expensive. In the main swimming pool area there are lots of lifeguards on hand and rules to follow but nobody does. You see people doing all the things which the signs say don\'t do. There are plenty of activities for all the family and we really enjoyed it. If I do say it was only the English moaning about the old lick of paint. This was better then longlete cp.. Yes golf buggies zooming around but again didn\'t cause any problems. We would go back tomorrow the kids loved it. It\'s a lot cheeper than cp England. It was a great aventure and totally recommend it. Don\'t be put of. The park is lovely.
title: Fab time for all our family
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: 31.08. Having read some poor reviews before departure we were not expecting much. We were pleasantly surprised. Very clean, good value for money and helpful staff. Would definitely go back in the future.
title: Center Parcs Lac d\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Centre Parcs if great fun for all the family. We have now stayed at 7 different parcs in the UK, France, Netherlands and would highly recommend then. Conce you parc your car the holiday begins..  Swmming Walking Cycling painting cooking ... you name it you can do it.
title: Excellent family fun
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Have just returned for a fantastic  5 days at Lac D\'Ailette. It is such an amazing place o be with the ones you love to spend time with. We swam, read, ate (great food in the Marche du Monde), slept, played table tennis, sat on the beach; watched the birds and radogin and just chilled! This CP is not as polished as the uk Center parcs but we think that\'s better. It\'s just not as tucked in. Our cottage was a walk away from communal facilities, but that wasn\'t a problem - only 10minutes away. And our place was a great base but to be honest only had breakfast and slept there!! Hoping to go back again soon xxxx
title: Better than 2 years ago...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a great family holiday, aqua mondo was fantastic. Was recommended this village by a friend, it was just as described it. The cottage was good, clean and meet our expectations. Thank you Center Parcs
title: Great family holiday.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was without any doubt a holiday of two halves, the good and the bad. Let\'s start with the good. We\'ve been to Center Parcs at Longleat (UK) many times - at least a dozen - so a lot of our views are in comparison to it. The swimming pool at Lac d\'Ailette is significantly better, particularly for younger children. There are more slides, more pools, more hot tubs full stop. The rapids are tamer, but better for younger swimmers. There are more things to do for tiny children. The changing rooms are miles better. The continental attitude to health and safety means that if you want to take your kids on a big slide, you do so at your own risk, but you can do it, which is great. The general layout of the site, and the design of the cottages, is excellent. We had a lakefront cottage with a nice verandah, nice view, nice location. The beach area is excellent. Plenty of space, nice clean sand and water. The waterfront area where the various restaurants are located is very nicely designed and generally very pleasant. The indoor soft play is excellent for all ages of children, lots to do, clean and safe. The patisserie is fantastic, lots of delicious breads and pastries. Here\'s the rub. The bad stuff. Our cottage was dirty. Disgusting carpets upstairs, dirty walls, dirty mattresses. Our verandah had weeks and weeks of bird droppings on it - on the walls, decking, everywhere. The spa bath was generally quite grotty. The towels (extra cost!) were tiny. Pillows were dirty and poor quality, as were duvets. The sofa and chairs were worse than useless - simply sit on one and the cushions slide off the base. Now, granted, I\'m a big bloke, but the same thing happened for our two year old twins. Outdoor furniture was cheap DIY shed fare, and pretty dirty. The kitchen was reasonably well equipped, and reasonably clean. One of the selling points of Center Parcs is that the site is traffic-free - you can let your kids ride their bikes without worrying too much about them being run over. Not here. For whatever reason, a lot of cars were allowed onto the site every day, and the large number of golf buggies combined with the cars to mean that the whole thing felt anything but car-free. Mini golf for two costs a tidy \u20ac14. The course is great, very imaginative. But sadly at some point all the balls have been replaced with ones slightly larger than the originals, which don\'t fit through a lot of the more interesting bits of the course, meaning that several holes simply don\'t work. Check-in was a quite slick. Lots of staff handing out key cards, not much of a queue at all. This would have been great if the key cards had worked, but sadly not. 20 minutes queueing at "reception" resulted in a shrug and a set of working key cards, but no apology or recognition that first impressions count and that this first impression was rubbish. Of course, we hadn\'t seen the carpets yet.  The site supermarket was mediocre at best - expensive, nothing special on offer, lack of staff on the checkout. Staff were generally surly. Particularly bad experience was the bike hire staff, who dealt with our issue with nothing less than suspicion, disinterest and rudeness. Aside of a few excellent people, this was pretty much the norm. The site needs better overall maintenance. A lot of the pathways are potholed and rough, a lot of the barriers (logs) between the roads and paths are missing, a lot of the bike parking areas are virtually impassible by bike. On our way home, I received the Center Parcs satisfaction survey email. It asked, amongst other things, whether we had raised any issues when on site. We hadn\'t, simply because our experience of the staff suggested that it wasn\'t worth the bother. I genuinely don\'t think that Center Parcs will take note of this review, or any others - consistent bookings mean that repeat customers aren\'t terribly important. The things that need fixing aren\'t complicated - basic cleanliness is the main thing - but this will be costly so I don\'t think it will happen. So, overall, we had a great holiday. But that was in spite of the poor aspects of Center Parcs. We won\'t be going back, because the overall quality doesn\'t justify the premium price.
title: A typical tale of good and bad
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a super time at Lac de L\'ailette, after being slightly apprehensive due to the negative comments left by other customers. The village is very pretty and well established. Staff are friendly and enthusiastic. Weather was great. Yes there were a few niggles, small kitchen(for 8 people), no bbq, a little dark n the garden but overall a fantastic short break and will definitely return. Have a few glasses of wine and just relax and enjoy yourselves.
title: 8 Go on holiday to Center Parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We got there and a lot of the staff spoke English , it was easy to get in and our place was clean and big and very pretty! We had a veranda that went out onto the lake , it was stunning! It was beautiful , everyday we sat out there , we had a table inside and out so we mainly sat outside to eat because the view was so beautiful , there was a great naturalness around us , we saw swans and badgers and fish and it was a great stay . The activities where cheap and really fun! The instructors spoke French and English which helped a lot! All the activities where so fun! The beach was so nice and clean , the swimming pool was big and we went in everyday and never got bored! We stayed for 7 days .We ate out at the Mundi buffet , which was delicious, we stuffed ourselves! Over all it was a great weekend for the whole family , it brings the family closer! Great for kids , teenagers , adults , grandparents .EVERYONE .The best place I have ever stayed ! GO THERE! Its perfect! Best holiday I have ever had!
title: AMAZING
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed here for a week in July / August 2013. This was our first Centre Parcs abroad having stayed in the UK on a number occasions. We booked here because it was one of the newest CPs in Europe. We upgraded our property and selected a location on the lake which was fantastic location. When you compare the cost with the UK we were looking at \u00a32500 for the UK and only \u00a31000 for France which you must keep in mind when comparing with CP in the UK.The property was an end terrace with a balcony onto the water. It was clean but needed a high level clean and a freshen up. The kitchen equipment was limited 4 cups 4 glasses 4 forks etc and the lack of an oven made things a little more difficult when cooking. The beds were ok but we struggled with the pillows take your own if you have problems sleeping. We stayed in zone 5 which was 0.5 mile from the centre. We used our toppings to get bikes - beware 2 toppings for a bike for a week. We thought we would get all 4 bikes for the 4 toppings. Get there early if you want a mountain bike otherwise you will end up with a French special - which were ok.We found the majority of the staff ok - we tried to speak French to everyone and they all made allowances for our poor French. If you want to speak English stay in England.We ate out a couple of times and we thought it was expensive at 70 euros for starters main and a drink each. We went to Laon Supermarket to get most of the food and topped up with the CP on site shop. Fresh bread from the bakery each day which the kids went and got.We had a day out to Laon which was ok loads of cafes and restaurants and very French \u2013 it\u2019s only a 1/2 day out though. We went out for a cycle to the ruins of an old church which was about 6 miles away. It was well sign posted and pretty flat - take something to eat if you are making a day of it. There were a number of bird hides along the route.We used the pool every day and I think it is better than any of the UK CPs. There are times when it was very busy but we always got somewhere to sit.We used the sports hall but you don\'t need to pre-book like you do in the UK - we just turned up and paid. The golf buggies are a bit of a problem especially when kids drove them.We all had a great time - and yes we would go back.
title: Great family holiday 2 Adults and 2 Children
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a very pleasant stay at Center Parcs Le Lac.  There were 6 of us in a cottage (three generations) and the centre is very good for keeping families happy.The parc itself is set against the lake which is very picturesque. It had a very relaxed atmosphere helped by the traffic free environment.  I would recommend hiring bikes to get back and forth between the cottage and the main buildings and lake front.  There is a beach area with swimming which the kids loved to play outThe cottage was clean and comfortable (but starting to show it\'s age), we did have some issues to start with (kettle not working, a light in the bedroom not working) but these were resolved very swiftly (within an hour).The aqua-mondo swimming centre was one of the main reasons we chose this resort and we weren\'t disappointed.  There are a variety of pools and slides which kept the whole family entertained for the week.  The highlights were the rapids, the lazy river and outdoor pool.  However the pool complex has had heavy use and is showing its age, also some of the areas could have been better cleaned / maintained. e.g. not all jets working in some of the pools, areas of alge/slime, lockers broken etc which took the shine off things.We did a couple of activities during our stay including canoe hire, pedal boat hire and bowling - all were good but quite expensive.  the bowling was very expensive at 30euro for a 1 hour session.Eating wise we BBQ\'d at our cottage most evenings (we took our own portable BBQ as BBQs are not supplied but can be rented), but we did eat out one night at the italian restauraunt - the food here was OK, quite pricey and slow service (probably why we only ate out once).  The supermarket on site was good stocking essentials (more pricey than an off-site supermarket so worth stocking up in advance if you can), we did buy baguettes and bread every day which was baked on site.Off-site we visited the Champagne region and did a tour at the Mercier champagne house.  This was about 1 hour away and was very good, good value at 11.50euro pp as well.  We also visited the nearby town of Laon which has a beautiful cathedral - worth doing the Petit train tour which starts outside the visitor centre, lasts for 40 mins and is only 5euro for an adult.
title: Good stay, nice resort but starting to look tired
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had been to UK Centreparcs a few times and were impressed by the standard of the cleanliness and facilities.  Le Lac d\'Ailette was disapointing in terms of how well maintained the park was.  Our premier cottage smelt strongly of ciggarette smoke on arrival.  As I opened the doors to let some fresh air in, I saw ciggarette ends all over the patio area.  There were hairs on the toilets, stained carpets in the bedrooms and stains all over the walls.  I spend the first hour cleaning, and was going to complain to the management staff, if I could find any!!!  Bring some cleaning equipment with you!   Everyone seemed to be on bikes or golf buggies, which is fine except if you decide to walk, you have to have your wits about you, or risk getting run over!!!  The cottage itself looks quite nice but could do with a spruce up, windows cleaned and a lick of paint.  It is very expensive to eat out, but the restarants seem very clean.  The supermarket again is expensive, so bring as much snacks and drinks for little ones.  The cost of activites is pretty much on par with what you would pay in the UK Centreparcs - \u00a319 for a child to go 45 min High Adventure around trees.  The activity staff seemed very knowledgeable and attentive.  The scenery is breathtaking around Laon, we spent a day off the park exploring the area, which we would recommend highly.  Overall, the bad points were - accomodation was average, the cleanliness was poor, eating out expensive, supermarket expensive.  The good points were the scenery and there are a lot of activities on offer for children.
title: Fair Holiday Experience
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: stay in the uk, this parc is very run down, poor overall, very poor eating, hardly any english speaking staff, cars left on parc all week, golf buggys racing around all over the place, not safe for kids on bikes
title: stay in the uk
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great family holiday for activities just general up keep of the site could be better and cleanliness in the accomadation. Some staff not all were abrupt think they could do with a different system when you can pick your sports up not wait in the cue for 20mins with others waiting to book activities.
title: Family holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: having read the other reviews I went armed with cleaning products. The cottage was cleaner than expected although tired - chipped laminate, broken glass edge of stove.Tips: take a teatowel. Coffee machine is filter machine. No oven although there is a microwave. Take kids\' scooters for getting about.Make sure you go to the infinity pool and hot tub, especially at sunset.This was an enjoyable family holiday. You do sense the money making machine - it feels very commercial, with every opportunity for extracting your cash taken!
title: a good holiday.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have just returned from a super family break at Centre Parcs Le Lac d\'Ailette. Having read previous negative comments regarding cleanliness and food quality we stopped off at a supermarket in nearby Laon to purchase some essentials and were armed with wipes in case our cottage was not cleaned to our standards!!  General cleanliness of cottage was fine however, except for a few cobwebs on high ceilings and floor probably needed an extra vacuum. We stayed in a VIP villa (lakeside) to sleep 4 and the views were fabulous, the sauna and whirlpool bath were great and plenty of space for 4 people.We loved the beautiful lake, aqua mundo and cycling round the village. Loads of activities for kids (many free) and lots to do rain or shine. The centre and cottages could probably do with a lick of paint, but we had such a wonderful week we really didn\'t notice too much. Our children (5 and 8) loved feeding the ducks, coots and look out for the coypu too! Spotting the herons each morning was great. Our 8 year old enjoyed cycling to the bakery to get fresh oroissants in the morning with Dad and both kids enjoyed playing with French children in the soft play despite the language barrier!!
title: A wonderful, family break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Fantastic time at Center Parcs Lac D\'Ailette. Was a bit dubious after reading some of the comments, which seemed to focus around lack of cleanliness, but other than a few specs of dust. I found it to be perfectly fine. Not the most modern of accommodations but certainly nothing to complain about. The exterior view was fantastic and our location looking out onto the lake was gorgeous. We were visited daily by the water voles (or rats?) who loved the attention our kids gave them (and the carrots). The kids had an absolute ball and I would have no hesitation in recommending it for a young family like ours.
title: Lac D\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We arrived and went to view our cottage, I have never seen anything like it, the carpets upstairs were stained, we looked at the beds which were supposed to be freshly made up for our arrival, hairs in the sheets, I pulled the sheets back to check the mattress which was stained with blood, that was enough for me, we returned to the check in office which was dirty as well, we was offered another cottage, checked it out and the same problem, stained carpets, dirty walls etc., and another stained mattress, dirty patios and dirty furniture, the manageress just shrugged, I have tried to contact Centre Parcs to complain it is impossible to get through to the complaints dept.how do Centre Parcs get away with it, I have taken photographs and will be taking this further, we travelled from London arrived in the afternoon, then had to drive onto Reims to find some-where to stay not easy in France in August an absolute disaster plus all the extra time and costs, absolutely livid my whole family were distraught I will never go to a Centre Parcs again
title: Filthy, filthy filthy
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We are a family of six and we all had a great time.  We stayed in the most basic \'comfort cottage\' but were not disappointed.Plenty of activities for the four children and they enjoyed cycling around to and from the cottage.  The service generally was slow, however, we are aware that this is typically french and although a little frustrating, only to be expected!! The kids especially loved the water park, but would agree that the restaurants were expensive, however, the buffet was a hit.  Not  a long drive, which also helps stave off the boredom with the children.  Would recommend, we were happy and had a good time.
title: The kids had a great time
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We booked a 6 person premium chalet, which really was suitable on for a max of 4. The kitchen is tiny-no oven or coffee machine as stated on website. Wicker sofa in lounge broken so no support-we used cot mattress to help during our stay. Pillows lumpy-you would have thrown them long ago at home. Brown smears on wall. TV tiny and din\'t pick up any English channels. Tried to complain to Customer services but their English so limited-as is my French-it was pointless. The bikes were in an appalling state-took us 20 mins to find even vaguely roadworthy ones. inclusive food was of poor quality and was not replenished when gone. aqua mundo is dirty, especially in toilets and changing areas-a lot of lockers didn\'t work or the keys couldn\'t be fastened on wrist. Have tried to complain but center Parcs website not helpful and address can\'t be found. Their end of stay online questionnaire just said \'sorry you didn\'t enjoy your stay, we hope you will next time\'!!!! Not likely. Site was at full capacity (for which a premium is paid by customer) and they just could not cope. Poor quality, poor value, appalling customer service. Try Center Parcs in Netherlands or Belgium as these were infinitely better in the past.
title: Very poor quality and service
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a lovely time here and were lucky with the weather so spent a lot.of time on the beach. Couldn\'t book anything as everything we tried was already full! Seen negative things about the cottages but they were nice, beds extremely comfy but maybe just needed a lick of paint.We stayed Monday til Friday and wish we\'d had a few more days.
title: a lovely break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Premium Accommodation was of a good quality as we expect from centre parcs. My only gripe would be there were not enough pillows so you may wish to take your own. The aqua Mundo was fantastic coupled with excellent weather. All the restaurants seemed to offer good quality and service
title: A great stay at lac d ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was or 3rd, and also last visit, to Lac d\'Aillette . We\'ve been here in fall of 2007 and 2008. This parc opened in the summer 2007. Back then the cottages were nice and clean and the parc was really looking grand. So were the beds, furniture and the rest inside and out of the cottage. Baluba and aqua-mundo were a great hangout for both kids and parents The only thing that was really a pain in the neck back then was that NOBODY could speak and/or understand English. Well, almost everything in this parc is a pain in the neck now: Baluba has changed into an video arcade room; the master-bed is a ramshackle; the couch and kitchen were decayed. The veranda at the back of the cottage needed some serious repainting. Even aqua-mundo isn\'t that exciting any more with older kids. Fortunately this time the reception desk was staffed with English and Dutch speaking staff. In the restaurants the staff still ne parle pas Anglais... After staying at (the fairly new) CenterParc Le Trois For\u00eats in the fall of of 2012, this was really a disappointing stay. I wonder if the decay of Lac d\'Aillette has something to do with the fact that it has been acquired by Pierre & Vacences....
title: This parc is faded glory. Never again !!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was nothing like a UK centre Parcs. Lacked everything that you would expect. Only good point was the swimming pool area. Excellent for kids. The house was dirty in places hand poorly maintained. Very disappointed.
title: Poor
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: They have a beach on the lake which was a nice alternative when the weather was hot. Our 2nd time to Lac D\'Ailette and weather has been great both times (in august). title: great place for beach, activity & pool holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our first visit to center parcs in France, we visited in school holidays and it was half the price of those in england!On first appearance the village looks very nice and is a lovely setting.Our Villa was  ok, although it looked very tired and was a little dirty. The kitchen was poorly equipped and had no oven, only a hob and microwave.The aquamondo was really good and there was lots of slides for all ages, the kids loved it, especially the tree house which kept them all amused for hours.We did find it a littel frustrating that sections of the pool and certain slides were only open at specific times, which was a shame as these were the slides suited for all ages.The restaurants do not compare to those in English Center parcs. The food was poor in all cases and very expensive. The Centre looks lovely set by the lake but they could of done so much more with it.There are lots of activites available to suit all ages.Most of the staff speak some english and all were very friendly.It was a good holiday and i would return but more prepared next time.
title: Not as good as Uk
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: To be honest I had a great time but there were a lot of little things that added up to a lack of quality. Our 8 person cottage was dirty - and shabby, all the crockery and cutlery had to be re-washed when we arrived as it was filthy. We had a broken kettle, a missing quilt and a smelly bath. A lot of the restaurants were closed (we were there in peak) and the service at Suzette creperie was slow - very slow! Lake is beautiful, surrounding area definitely worth an explore.
title: Not quite what I expected
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Location on the lake was great. Disappointed that on a 10 day holiday on change over days the activities were not all available.The cottage was needing an overhaul. Not like the UK parks we have visited.No midweek maid service and cottage was a bit scruffy.Still found it better value than a caravan park for ourselves and enjoyed ourselves.
title: Beautiful setting but a bit tired
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Very disappointing cottage needed complete new paint job and carpets, so badly stained. Poor cleanliness. Good location, nice outdoor facilities, aquamundo good fun. Staff could do with learning to smile and be friendly.
title: Center parc le lac dailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Expect to be let down on the following:- Cleanliness of villa - These are getting tired and the maintenance programme doesn\'t seem to be able to keep up. Prices of food and drink - this has become a joke - Cook at home and take drink out if needed. Go to the supermarket.- Up keep of facilities - This could also be better.On the up side, we love the location, the service in general is pretty good and there is plenty to keep families entertained. We\'ll probably go back - but we will go with lowered expectations.
title: Nice and Family Friendly, but...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Was a wonderful holiday for us and our 7 year old. The water park (aquamondo) is fantastic if a little tired, and the bikes are brilliant (mine was brand new). But the park is a little old, and the resturants are not the best of French we hoped for, they were formulaic and served by non interested locals. We decided to cook for ourselves after a trip to the super market (expensive) but then realized we only had a hob not an oven too. We coped but it could have been better in our tired chalet. The beds aren\'t great but the woodlands around the chalets are beautiful and peaceful and quiet. What a lovely place, just a few persnickety things to sort and it would be fantastic.
title: Centre Parcs Le Lac D\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having read the recent reviews we were concerned about our stay but on arrival we were very relieved to walk into our villa and find it clean! The park is in a great location but does feel a little bit tired. The food is not to be recommended. We had a great week and were glad we booked it.
title: Better than Expected
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have just finished a terrific 1 week family holiday at this parc. No sure I can think of anything other than praise for it. I have read other reviews which talk about there being a need for a lick of paint or some updating - I understand where they are coming from, sort of. Guess it depends on what you want - we weren\'t s bothered about the decor, but wanted a great place to enjoy time with our children, enjoy a swim, with a decent villa where you could sit outside and eat meals together and somewhere to be a base for some day trips out. Ticked all of our boxes - including trips to Laon, Caves du Dragon and champagne houses in Epernay. The indoor water park is lovely, as was a swim in the lake and a play on its beach. We heartily recommend this great parc to other families.
title: Fantastic location, brilliant water park and lake
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We are here for the whole week as a family of 5. The park is beautifully situated by a lake with nice water activities and wonderful view. When compared with other center parc parks, this one has a bit smaller water park as well as a bit old houses. The variety of restaurants is nice but as usual, they are all very expensive. No WIFI in the park at all, which is a big minus.
title: A beautiful  park, a bit too poor, too old
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just returned from a week a Le Lac d\'Ailette. Mrs UrbanFox and I have 3 cubs who are 6,4 and 2. Our comparison is Center Parcs Elveden New style exec lodge. In summary - this is a good resort in which the individual components are about 3 star but which overall gives you a four star experience. Our experience/tips:-AquaMondo - excellent. Warm water. Great splash park, little beach area for young kids. The French invented laissez-faire hence are much more relaxed about our little ones riding the big slides (with a lifevest, under our supervision and with an adult always going first to catch them in the water drop). There\'s no picnic allowed which is a bit of a pain, on the plus side it does mean the water is clean. Queues were much shorter than in the UK. Remember your 1 Euro coin for the locker. No need to don the speedos as with some other french pools hygiene regulations (seriously, who looks good in speedos).-Accommodation - we had a premium lakeside rental. Really not that much different to the VIP at Elveden in terms of facilities. We brought a DVD player noticing that there wasn\'t one there. Quiet in the evenings. Inside of cottage was clean and tidy - no issue. It is by the Lake which means the outside areas are generally a bit dirty due to insects, birds. Bring some cleaning stuff if you plan to sit outside. Also suggest bringing a mosquito coil as there were plenty about, although very few bites. There is no a/c in the cottage. View over Lake is beautiful, kids loved feeding the swans and cygnets in the morning. -Bakery next to the shop sells fresh bread and delicious cakes. Nice little trip out for the kids in the morning. Supermarket is well stocked - as is typically in most french supermarkets - remember to bring your own shopping bags. -Little beach was one of the main reasons I booked - you get the fun of sandcastles in the afternoon after the splash of the pool in the morning. Safe, well steeped. -We did Pony Rides and electric boat trip (the pedalos only take 4 people, electric boats 6). Note you need 1 adult per child for the pony ride and 2 adults if the child is 2. Price is very reasonable in comparison to UK. -Great indoor soft play for kids upstairs. Lots of variety and clean. -We took a cycle ride to an Abbey one evening - about 5-6km away and great for an evening outdoor picnic. We took a mini BBQ and the kids loved exploring the ruins. -We hired 2 bikes with carriages for the kids. The bikes are terrible - inflicts medieval grade pain on the legs climbing the shortest of hill. The mrs and I are pretty nifty on 2 wheels and we puffed like hell. No choice but to suck it up - but just be ready. Roads are quite narrow and (quite wrongly in my view) they rent out golf carts which whizz about. I get it if people have limited mobility and need to get around - but most just folk just looked a bit lazy to me. Get out of those carts and get involved with 2 wheels people. -Finally, if like us you usually feed your kids around 5.30/6 then you should know that the earliest you can eat is 6.30pm. No big deal, stuff for kids to do. We ate at home most nights and then at il Giardino for a few nights. Good service, food was fine. Took 2-2.5 hrs from Calais, easy drive. We will return sometime, I\'m sure. Wish you a good trip.
title: Our advice to others with young kids (6, 4 and 2yrs).
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)
