review: This was our first trip to a center parc, and I was very impressed. I\'m now a center parcs fan. We tried loads of activities - but by far the most popular was the amazing swimming area, which was free. I\'m not sure what you\'d call it - it\'s so much more than a swimming pool - we went there every day - for at least a couple of hours each day - one day we spent about 8 hours there - and yet we still didn\'t do it all! The kids loved the "water mill" area, then we discovered the flumes, then on about the third day we tried out the rapids, and what a blast they are. Brilliant fun - the whole family was laughing together - it was a wonderful family-based holiday centre.We tried loads of other activities, too. We soon came to see the same members of staff at the different activities on different days, and came to get to know them quite well. They were always really friendly and helpful - and great with the kids. One tip - there are no activies on "changeover" days, i.e., Mondays and Fridays, so you might want to swim on those days. I thought the pool area would be busy on those days, but even in high season at a busy time of day the pool area was so large that it wasn\'t over-crowded.Before we went, we read reviews that the cottages weren\'t very clean. Ours was fine. I don\'t know if they\'ve improved the cleanliness recently or whether we were lucky. We\'d taken cleaning materials anyway on the advise of someone on tripadvisor, but didn\'t need them.We also had a well-equipped kitchen (we had a premium lakehouse - I don\'t know if that makes a difference). Since there are lots of restaurants on site, we thought we\'d have only basic cooking facilities to encourage us to eat out, but we had a microwave with grill, a toaster, a hob and a kettle, so were able to cook for ourselves in the cottage and save ourselves a good amount of money there. The restaurants are expensive - apart from the cafe in the pool area - just a shame you have to be changed into your trunks to eat there! But not a problem for us, since we went there every day anyway. The on-site shop is reasonably priced. A baguette for a euro seemed all right for an on-site shop.I\'d also read reviews that the French staff weren\'t always that helpful. Well, to that I\'d say that it depended who you got. Some were absolutely brilliant - they\'d go out of their way to be helpful. Some weren\'t so interested, so we quickly learned who to ask for help.
title: Brilliant family-based holiday destination
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: For such a wonderful location, Center Parcs Lac d\'Ailette does not care for it\'s buisness as it should. The cottages are tired and not modern like the UK ones ( french shabby chic perhaps ) and not very well maintained. I had to cut back the reeds and grasses growth from the cottage decking in order to use it and the patio furnature was cheap white plastic and dirty and damaged.The basics should be addressed and this would soon be put right.There were play features that were broken and \'closed\' and should have been fixed straight away, not left for months as it would appear.Take your own pillows as they are really naff, thin and lumpy. The food was poor ( I thought the French could cook ) and expensive.  On the plus side, the activities were great, the pool fantastic the location and setting beautiful and lucky for us, the weather was beautiful.
title: Tired and unloved !
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a great one week of quality family time. Beautiful scenery great accommodation on the lake, safe surrounding for the kids to feel free and independent. If it wasn\'t for the bad service I would give it a 5 stars.
title: Family Heaven
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I read some bad reviews on Lac d\'Ailette before I visited, all I can say is don\'t believe everything you read. We had a great time, the lakeside villa was clean and tidy when we arrived, just as good as the English and Dutch ones I have visited before.  The activities were great, especially the Aqua Mondo, there were loads of hire bikes to choose from and lots of golf carts available.  The Parc seemed massive so plenty of places to bike or there was a public bike path around the lake.  The staff did there best to understand our few words of French and were able to speak enough English for us to understand.  I didn\'t think the restaurants, shops and activities were anymore expensive than an English Center Parc and some things seemed cheaper than in England.  Carrefour and Mcdonalds were only a few miles away in Laon, but I did think McDonalds was a little more expensive than in England, probably the rubbish exchange rate.  Overall great holiday.
title: Great Stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed in a 4 bed premium cottage with our four grandchildren. The location of our cottage was great and close to facilities. The carpets were filthy and the cleaning left a lot to be desired;   However the facilities and swimming were amazing and we thoroughly enjoyed our week.  Unfortunately we had the padlock cut off our bike chain and our bikes stolen from the area in front of the entrance to shops and swimming pool,  which marred our experience but  we were grateful that at least they left the children\'s bikes!!  Unfortunately Center Parcs do not have any CCTV coverage on their entrance.
title: A very enjoyable family week
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Had been a little worried by previous reviews but it was fab. Some cottages need a lick if paint and supermarket is expensive but hypermarket at Laon very good.  Lovely lakeside beach and children loved swimming in the lake.
title: great holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Lovely location, but facilities & amenities were quite sparse and restaurants had limited opening times. The villa we stayed in looked tired and needed updating and was not adequately equipped to house 6 people for a week long stay.
title: Lovely location but ....
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: great family holiday. everything you need for a relaxed family holiday. beach,lake,sports,adventure zone,indoor waterworld. i would have gladly paid more in the base price than having to get my wallet out every time we decided to take part in an activity. (tennis,badminton,peddle boats,beach umbrellas,parcour,..)
title: summer break lac d\'ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We already knew what to expect going to a Center Parcs as we visited already pleanty of other parcs. This one in France was actually closer to our home than some other parcs in Belguim, so this was a great location for us. The layout of the park almost obliges you to rent a bike or golf cart as our (VIP) cottage was about 20-minutes walking form the center, witch is alot if you need to do that 4 times a day. The cottage was great and spacious with a big terrace on the lake, but very expensive for the weekend. Our 2 year old had a great time in the simming pools and "baluba" and loved the animal farm.We tried the breakfast buffet, but it was very dissapointing compared with other Center Parks (and with 14,5 EUR very expensive too) so we boucht our own breackfast in the store the rest of the weekend.Overall a great and relaxing stay, if you can forget how much you payed for it...
title: Nice stay at the lake
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We are just back from a pleasant stay at Le Lac d\'Ailette.  As other reviews mention, the cottage was a little tired and in need of an update.  Take a fan with you if it\'s hot as there was no air con or fan in our premium cottage.  Also cot came with no linen - so take your own if using their cot.  Kids LOVED the pool, and the lack of interest from the lifeguards was a bonus in our opinion as it meant the kids could go on all the slides (aged 6 and 8 ) - the French were taking their babies on the rapids!!  As mentioned by others, the shop is very pricey (6 euros for a pack of baby wipes??!!!) so stock up before you go.Baluba soft play was good.  Kids loved the pitchoun adventure climbing session.  Pony riding very tame - you lead your child on the horse round a small circuit of part of the park.  Kids liked it though.  Beach is a nice extra.We took a trip out to see the castle they filmed "Merlin" at in Pierrefonds - a nice day out for about an hours drive.   Good restaurant on the lake there.We were a bit disappointed that the children\'s entertainment was all in French - I know the park is in France, and we are more than happy to use our bad French, but I do think they should cater for the kids, who surely can\'t be expected to speak French?All in all a good holiday. Don\'t expect 5* hotel standard accomodation and take some anti-bac wipes in case.  As long as you have packed your swimmers you\'ll have a great time!
title: Great swimming!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just returned from a mid-week stay (2 adults, 2 children ages 8 & 6) in a VIP cottage on the lake. The cottage was grubby (as other reviewers have consistently mentioned) - old and in need of painting/renovation. However kitchen area & bathrooms were clean. After reading previous review on the quality of the bed linens & pillow, we brought our own sheets & pillows and were glad we did. Mattresses were poor quality as well - very soft & you sink down in the middle. Terrace facing the lake was the big plus about this center parcs. Great beach area with white sand - the kids loved it almost as much as aquamundo. We enjoyed having apero & dinner with the lake view! Aquamundo itself was looking a bit old as well and was smaller than Les Trois Forets (and slides weren\'t as much fun but that was ok for the children). The kids loved the indoor playground baluba!We mainly cooked in the room but ate at Suzette\'s Creperie for lunch one day. The restaurant was super clean and food was really good. It is closed for dinner, which we thought was strange. We had baguettes/croissants/petits pains au chocolate delivered every morning - very good quality and fantastic to wake up to breakfast delivered. Our cottage was further away from the center but we liked this as we had more privacy. We rented bikes, which was the chaos upon arrival (lots of poor quality/rusted bikes), but once we found some decently working bikes it worked out well for getting to/from center quickly.We booked our stay at the last minute and saved 30% for our cottage for 4 persons. At this price what we got was reasonable. Would not pay the full price to come here mainly due to the quality of the rooms/sleep quality/cleanliness.
title: Ok if you get a discount
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Family of 4 include children of 16 & 11 went for a weekend. We booked a comfort cottage at the last minute with 30% discount which cut the cost down as we did not mind which centre parcs we go to. We have visited many Centre Parcs since our younger child was 5 months old. Over the years, we have stayed at both of the Belgium parcs, 5 parcs in Netherland, 2 in France and 1 in Germany. In some instances, multiple times at one centre. As the children grown older, we used the centre parcs as bases to explore local surrounding, we felt the cost is comparable with hiring a cottage and still have the option of using the onsite facility; the swimming area is good for all weather! As we were worried from some reading some previous review about the cleanliness of the cottages, we took cleaning wipes with us just in case. However, the comfort cottage at was very clean and had a dishwasher, a microwave grill which were useful.  The only criticism we have is that this parc\u2019s rapid and water slides are not quite as exciting as some other parcs so the teenager found it a bit boring. There appears to be no ways of comparing the challenging level of the water slides between one parc to another unless one has visited the parc and experienced the slides. Lac d\'Ailette parc is perhaps more suitable for younger children. We also found the staff polite and efficient for the few times we booked and enquired about activities and outings. As it is during summer holiday and the parc sells day passes, the swimming centre can be extremely busy during the day! There are some small hills (8%) and some cyclists can be a nuisance to the pedestrians when travelling downhill at huge speed. In the summer, definitely take mosquito repellent as the cottages are near water and in woodland. We were all bitten even with the repellent!Reims is only 1 hour drive away where you can get champagne tours if you are looking for a break from the village.
title: Seasoned Center Parcs goer
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Great village - Nice Aqua World - fine restaurants - ok cottage (cleaning in generel could be better all over the village). The kids show was just PERFECT!! Fine with the car park away from the cottages, but instead the golf-cars was driving fast!
title: Danish family (2 adults and 3 kids)
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have had a lovely second stay at lac d\'ailette, but sadly the proprties haven\'t been well maintained and are in urgent need of some sprucing up,The park has plenty facilities and we enjoyed the beach, aquamundo(especially the rapid river and flumes, which were all excellent) and we liked the high wire activities. We hired a 4 person bike but that was a hard pedal in the heat and up the hills - it was much easier in the flatter parks
title: Accommodation a bit tired
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The Center Parcs concept remains perfect for family with kids. Lots of things to do and a fantastic pool. But the quality the house is not to the standard what we expected and what you pay for it. And after 3 days you have seen it all. A weekend or mid-week is more than OK. The expectations on comfort and status of the cottages when checking the brochures are are set higher then what it is in reality. Prices in restaurants/bars and stores are higher then normal. So overal price/quality level is low.
title: Good concept with medium quality.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: A great stay in a VIP lakeside cottage. Fantastic for boys aged 3&4 although limited structured activities for those younger than 4. Shop is OK although a little too pricey, light lunch options very poor. Would advise a trip on the way in to the Carefour at Laon and a cottage close to the centre to enable an easy trip back for lunch.
title: Pleasant but shop before you come
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The Center Parc concept is excellent for families. A beach, a pool, activities for all, restaurants, shops, etc. Our stay could have been awesome! However, it turned out disappointing.  The activities were very expensive and our "vip" cottage was dirty with dirt marks and cob webs on the walls.. The garden furniture was so filthy we could not use it.
title: Good concept, badly maintained and too expensive!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The arrival was simple, fast and staff were helpful.... then there was a lot of inconsistency and some pleasant surprises but a few disappointments.The cottage was a "VIP" cottage and promised things it didn\'t deliver but overall was pretty good. We thought it was going to be on the edge of a lake but turned out to be in a wooded area with a stream next to the deck - nice just not what we expected. First impressions are really good but there were a few bits (corners of rooms etc) that hadn\'t been cleaned, toilet was smelly and the main bathroom wasn\'t cleaned very well and had no windows so seemed a bit damp - the whirlpool bath was disgusting and we didn\'t bother using it. There were swatted mosquitos everywhere which whilst maybe unavoidable could have been wiped off before our visit if anyone had bothered to actually clean. I am very fussy so most would probably have been really happy but it seemed to me like they put clean linen and relied on the previous tenants having cleaned!Food and drink are VERY expensive everywhere so be prepared! We got a few basic bits from the supermarket which ended up costing 60\u20ac! There is very little choice of restaurants and opening times are bonkers the grill restaurant opening at 7pm which is rubbish if you have very young kids.The playground was probably amazing when it was new but it was very tired and neglected - the broken bits of which there were many were are cordoned off which was all a big disappointment with a 4yr old that loves a park!Brush up on your French as there are not many that speak english and they don\'t like that you can\'t speak French which is perhaps fair but not helpful! This is a holiday resort after all - surely you have to expect english speaking tourists! Some staff were lovely and some were just plain rude!The aqua mundo was really good, helped by lots of sunshine as most of it is outdoors, loads of outdoor seating, sun beds etc, everything leads nicely into everything else and apart from going upwards to the slides you don\'t really need to get out the water much to go places. The changing rooms were a bit dark so not sure if they were clean or not but what you\'d expect for the size of the place. Out little absolutely loved it so can\'t complain.The petting farm thing was rubbish, tiny and contained a grumpy old donkey and load of scabby chickens, couple of overheating goats and a bit fat rabbit in a tiny cage!The pony ride was good although our leader was at the back picking up pony poo so we had no idea where we were going but got told off in French when we went the wrong way which was a lot!Baluba soft play is really good and big but the electric cars cost 1,50\u20ac per token and only last a couple of laps so soon gets expensive :-)the beach is great and such a bonus, massive lake which is stunning and offers boats and peddle-boats etcWe hired a golf buggy which was such a blessing in the heat - expensive but when I normally end up carrying an over tired grumpy child so to be able to chuck her on the buggy was amazing - we did more because everything was just a few minutes away!
title: some good some bad but very tired and not very VIP!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: It is difficult to write a review for Lac d\'Ailette.  In overall terms we had a great time but that was in spite of issues with the accommodation and at times very unfriendly/unwelcoming staff.When we arrived we were told that the cottage we booked was not available.  We had booked a lake view cottage at the start of February and the lake view was an important part of our decision making process to stay there.  The cottage they tried to give us had 4 bedrooms which we simply did not need. We stood our ground and said we wanted a lake cottage and they eventually gave us one.  When we got to the cottage, which was a premium one, we were disappointed in both it\'s quality and cleanliness.  The decking overlooking the lake was filthy.  The bed was dreadful and the quality of bed clothing was very poor.  If you are going we suggest you bring your own pillows as theirs are awful. We complained the next morning and they did change the mattress on the bed but simply wiped down the table on the decking and nothing else.  The staff on the reception desk could be unfriendly to the point of rude.  One girl in particular stands out.  In some ways it became a bit of a joke among our family about what kind of mood they would be in.  Having said all that, the facilities are very good and there is lots to do.  It is particularly good for the 5-10 year old age group.  We also found the supermarket very good and we ate in the Italian which was fine.  It is great fun riding round on the bikes.
title: Very Inconsistent!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Fantastic parc, full of great things to do with our daughter (3). swimming pool and Baluba was superb. restaurants offer great food but a little pricey but thats expected.Accomodation....... stayed in premium but was the same as a comfort that we stayed in last year. Cleanliness was poor and had to do a bit of cleaning ourselves before we settled in for the week!!!!  what a waste of money that was so thats why its only 3 blobs for us
title: premium, really????
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed at this Parc for a week mid June with my wife and two children, daughter aged nearly 4 and 1 year old son, drove from Calais which is a doddle, very easy and took about 2 and a half hours, site well sign posted and found with ease.Checked in with no difficulty around 12 noon, and proceeded to check out the facilities, and pick up the bikes we had pre-booked, this entails the customer trawling through the entire bike collection, probably 1000 bikes which have obviously not been checked since the previous customers had dropped them off, most had punctures, breaks and gears not working and generally no maintenance, on returning ours at the end of the week I attempted to tell a member of staff at the drop of and was told just to take the bike back to the tier that I had selected it from, therefore transferring the problems on to the next customer.Throughout the week this was the general theme, customer service very very poor, the premium cottage we had booked was filthy and is in desperate need of paint and refurb, carpets you need to wipe your feet on leaving the cottage! restaurants not open and when they are not adequate numbers of staff to cope so therefore only a fraction of the tables can be waited on and overpriced if you do manage to get a seat.The general maintenance of the Parc is tired and in desperate need of the management to solve these very basic requirements, everywhere you look there is a piece of equipment broken which is a real shame, the management are missing a trick at this Parc, there are a lot of people with money in there pocket and ready and willing to spend it, unfortunately these people, like me were forced out of this captive environment to shop in the Carre Four with the bbq newly purchased.I have visited the Center parcs in England and have found them to be a totally different experience, well managed, maintained and restaurants fully occupied.On a brighter note we had a great day in the local Cathedral Town of Laon, with a delightful meal in the main square and a miniature train ride around the local sites.
title: Fantastic location let down poor bad management
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We were pleasantly surprised by the standard of the accommodation and the communal areas. The staff were friendly speak some English, but they\'re not entirely fluent so be patient or brush up on your French.The food and drink are very expensive (20 euro a head for a simple pasta buffet!) and also applies to the on-site shop so you\'d be better shopping before you get to the park. The activities are pricey, but you don\'t need to do everything going and the you could easily spend a whole week just cycling and swimming (the aquamundo was fantastic!), with a couple of activities to get the kids out of your hair.I would also add that I was under the impression that cars were banned from the park outside of moving day, but there was cars parked along most of the roads and there didn\'t appear to be any restriction on their movement.
title: A long weekend in Lac D\'Ailette
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Lovely scenery and so easy to find from Calais. All the usual fantastic Center Parcs facilities at nearly half the price of England! No brainer. Nice and clean everywhere and all the staff very polite and helpful.
title: Beautiful place to stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: On arriving I was delighted to see how pretty the site was and how smoothly everything had gone. I was slightly concerned about previous comments about the state of the cottages but hadn\'t quite prepared myself enough. We had booked a Premium cottage as those are the ones we have in the UK but there was nothing premium about these. It was so dated and scruffy but worse than that, really dirty. I spent the first 3 hours of my holiday cleaning, washing dishes, hoovering etc as the cleaners hadn\'t done anything like that. Anyway, we had luckily got a cottage in a good location near the beach and it was fairly quiet. I believe a lot of the others were very noisy, overlooked and far away from the center so study the map before booking. We got some free toppings for booking early (UK take notes) so got a couple of bikes, including child seat, for 5 days for free. We didn\'t really need them as we were fairly close but they were nice to have and made us extremely lazy. Aside from the horrible cottage (which of course you get used to), the not so helpful staff who tend to prefer the French, which make up about 90% of the guests, the silly drink prices and the fact that a lot of things were closed and not working (in June?!!), there were a lot of good points too. The holiday price compared to the UK was a lot better, the Aqua Mundo was brilliant, loads of slides, the water temperature was lovely and the fact my 3 year old could go down every slide as the lifeguards paid very little if no attention to the free for all that was the pool safety!! The cleanliness in other areas was surprisingly good, the shops were good and not too badly priced, the pony ride was good fun and fairly cheap, the bowling alley was a bit rubbish and the drinks were very expensive but again the setting was beautiful. Just one thing to bear in mind... the reception closes about 7pm and there is absolutely nobody around should you need help. My daughter got a very bad dose of chicken pox and when we went to the center at 7.30 everything was closed, nobody spoke English and there was no phone or information of any kind. We did enjoy our stay although I doubt we would return, mainly because there are so many other places to check out.
title: Very hit and miss
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Food in UK Center Parcs is much better - expected better in France. Lovely surroundings by the lake with Canadian/colonial feel. We went in early June, which in other countries would be considered high season, but we found restaraunts/cafes and some activities were not operating on days/times we expected.
title: Lovely place, but food could be much better
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I\'ve stayed in centre parcs holland, uk and France. This was my favourite the staff were friendly even with the language barrier they were happy to help. The village is picturest and the children facilities were great. The pool was fantastic catering for all ages and all abilities. The food delivery service was brilliant allowing us to eat alfresco. Beware for bikers this centre is hilly, so it made it difficult on the bike.
title: Best centre parcs yet
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Food and drinks expensive - not many restaurants open - beautiful lake - fun pool - well worth a visit - lots to do for children - lovely Canadian style cottages but not secluded as they are in England.
title: different to CP in England
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We arrived at Lac d\u2019Ailette with some trepidation due to the negative reviews on here and I have to say I just don\u2019t get it.  We paid less than \u00a3700 for 7 nights when the equivalent week at Centre Parcs in Penrith was going to be \u00a31300 (May half-term).  At less than \u00a3100 per night for a family of 4 I\u2019m not sure what more we could have asked for. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and unlike across the majority of France , most of them spoke English.  The place was very Anglo-centric (and busy) for most of the week although things calmed down on the Friday when most of our countrymen headed home and the place was deserted.  Our only real gripe came courtesy of an English family who let their badly behaved, noisy kids spend most of the evenings screeching and yelling at each other, thus ruining any chance of some peace and quiet for the rest of us and making it harder for our kids to get to sleep.  If you were somewhere around no. 325/6/7 during half-term week then get a grip of your kids eh?The accommodation was well maintained and very clean (with the exception of a previous guest having vomitted out of the window onto the canopy over the terrace.  Nice.), yes some of the paint on the walls was marked and no, the interiors weren\u2019t designed by Tara Bernerd but then we weren\u2019t paying \u00a31300.  The lack of oven wasn\u2019t ideal and made the meal delivery service (most of which were to be reheated or cooked in your accommodation) a little puzzling.  We were waterside and were visited by ducks and ducklings, swans, swallows, a copyu (beaver rat), cats, rabbits and even a water snake which was a little disturbing.  The beds were comfortable and overall we were very pleased with the accommodation, the patio/terrace was fully fenced and therefore safe for our 1 year old.Activities are a little pricey although we moved on to Disneyland afterwards and if we\u2019d gone there first then maybe that assessment may have been a little different!!  We ate out at Suzette (crepes) which were very good and of similar quality to those we\u2019ve had in Brittany .  We also made the error of eating out at Marche du Monde (buffet) and to be honest the quality was really poor and very overpriced for what it was.  The supermarket is also expensive (although a baguette is only \u20ac1 and croissants etc are reasonable) and stocking up at the supermarket in Laon is recommended.The swimming pool was excellent, no speedos required and no attention paid by staff to the signs saying only one person at a time on the slides which meant our 4 year old could come down with me until he felt brave enough to go down on his own.We hired bikes and used our \u2018toppings\u2019 (free activity vouchers that you get for booking early enough) which meant that an adult bike, a bike with a trailer and a kids bike cost us only \u20ac26 for 7 days.  Golf buggies are very popular here so you need to keep your wits about you.Re: wifi, we were told that there was no wifi and that internet access is via a cable which you plug into your laptop and then into a port in your accommodation.We had a great time and would happily visit again, book with confidence!!
title: I don\'t understand all the negativity...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Visited for the second time in the uk may bank holiday and found a typical centreparcs with the exception of generally better accommodation than on other Centre Parcs I have visited.Great things about this Centre Parcs1. Only 3 hours or so from Eurotunnel2. Good value for accommodation in May. Good condition. Clean. Next to a large lake.3. Excellent indoor pool area where you can stay all day.  For those who have not been this is the best bit about centre parc\'s but there is some variation across their parks.4. A nice site, plenty of wildlife, indoor play areas for kids, petting zoo etc.  In fact it seems ideal for a young family.5. Lots of paid activities - like paint balling (about 15 euro), Segway (about 15 Euro), 1/2 hour tennis (about 9 Euro), Tree top trail (about 20 euro). 6. Rain does not stop play!7. Relatively car free.Distractions 1. Anything you pay for is 50% more than the price in the typical uk - e.g. 1/2 litre of beer = about 4 pound. Buffet Adult meal = 20 pound.2. Peak period accommodation costs can be expensive (typical of all Centre parks)3. You have to walk a-lot or hire a bike (or take one).  You can  however choose which accommodation you want therefore choosing near or far.Overall we have been to 5 different centre parcs across three countries and talking everything into account this is the better one.  I would recommend it and I will return at some point.Finally with a bit of planning you could stop at various tourist spots along the way - we visited the Canadian war cemetery which was very interesting and just 5 minutes off route near LENS.P.S. Value rated at very good as accommodation was good value at that point - watch out for peak periods!
title: An enjoyable visit  and just 3 hours from Eurotunnel
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed here the weekend following a trip to Disneyland Paris and was a welcomed peaceful change.  The cottage style is very pretty, and we had the best garden view we have had at any Centerparcs.  The swimming pool is great with many slides, a river and playhouse to explore.The view across the lake is stunning.We were slightly disappointed by the restaurants available, and advised that the providers of the children\'s \'wannabe\' activities spoke limited English and so we chose not to book the children in for the activities (they have previously been to them in CP de kempervennen and had a great time).Staff were all friendly.  Small complaint - the rabbits hutches on the farm where ridiculously small.
title: Great swimming pool and slides 2 hrs from channel tunnel.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I\'m just back from a brilliant week here, my one and only complaint is that I wish I could have stayed longer! I would recommend it to anyone. I was a little worried about the negative reviews before going but to be honest couldn\'t see any of the issues described.
title: Fantastic week away!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just returned from a half term break, great time had by all. We made full use of the Aqua Mundo, bowling & bike rental and my daughter did archery and aqua speed. Didn\'t think much of the buffet restaurant, very limited choice for children and had to queue 45mins for a table at the Italian but enjoyed the creperie.Hired a golf buggy for my mother who has limited mobility the only disappointing thing being we couldn\'t get one until Monday 2 days after we arrived as due to a late arrival on Fri they were all hired out. Would be good to be able to reserve in advance like the bikes.Visited nearby medieval city of Laon and Tattinger champagne caves in Rheims
title: Excellent break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our second trip to centerparcs in lac d\'aillette and we had a great time, despite the horrible weather.  Contrary to a lot of reviews on here our cottage was very clean and well maintained.  We stayed for a week over half term in a premium 6 person cottage very close to the aquamundo.  The price (including channel tunnel) was less than half of that for a four day stay in the uk during half term!The cottage was as advertised and had everything needed.  It wasn\'t luxurious, but was comfortable and clean with plenty of space for 2 children and 2 adults.  My only complaint is that the pillows were very lumpy!In terms of facilities the parc is excellent.  The aquamundo is out of this world with 13 different slides.  The relaxed French attitude to health and safety meant our 4 and 6 year old were able to ride all of them wearing float jackets, even the rapids ride which they adored!  Definitely an improvement on the uk where armbands are strictly not allowed and children cannot access some of the slides.  The water was warm and changing facilities clean.As we booked early we received extra \'toppings\' free of charge.  We used these to book an hour of bowling, hire a pedalo and hire a family bike.  These activities were fun and great for free.  Our children took a pony ride and enjoyed the high ropes course.  Whilst fun, I felt that these activities were overpriced (e12 and E10 for 20 mins)Food wise we ate in the buffet twice.  Plentiful choice, nice and hot, good selections for children.  A bit pricey but you expect that in a holiday village and the quality was good.  Only problem we had was that none of the restaurants open until 6.30 which our two found too late after a long, active day.Staff were all extremely helpful and provided you try to speak a little basic French, are happy to help you out with English.  Everyone we spoke to spoke excellent English to us when our French failed!We visited Laon which is a beautiful historical city about 20mins away.  Also has a large Carrefour which we used to stock up on provisions to avoid the overpriced parc market.My only complaint about this centerparcs is that they offer electric golf buggies for rent.  These drive far too fast around the parc roads and mean that young children on bikes/walking must be kept close at all times and you cannot relax and allow them to wander as you can in the uk.  It ruins the \'no car\' atmosphere in my opinion.Overall though, a great holiday with better facilities than uk parks at half the price.
title: Great break with the kids
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This is the second time we have stayed here. The first time was December 2010 at New Year and we had a really enjoyable stay. The children loved the two storey cottages and said the pool, slides and rapids were better than Elveden and Longleat in England.We returned again at Easter 2013 to celebrate our twin boys 15th birthday, also with our daughter aged 11. We booked in September 2012 so we benefited from early booking discounts and free toppings which could be \' cashed in \' for activities once we arrived. We stayed in a premium villa which was nice but not much different from the comfort villa we had previously stayed in ( except for the jacuzzi bath and beds made up on arrival)  The outside space was not particularly well kept and the trees at the back of the villa which bordered our outdoor space needed to be cut back as they were obscuring a lot of natural light which made the villa very dark.The children enjoyed the Accro speeder, like the high ropes but without a harness, just nets underneath to fall into. They also had a great time with the Segway and Pierre who was their instructor was absolutely superb with them, a fantastic teacher.Unfortunately my husband had his swimming locker key cut from his wrist ( at first we thought it had been lost ) We think this may have happened on the rapids.He had money and his phone stolen from his swimming locker. When we reported this, staff told us it had happened to quite a few people on that day. They were helpful in filling out a report and trying to contact our mobile phone provider, but they told us we would have to drive to the police station and report the theft there and they could not guarantee they would be able to speak English. I do speak a little bit of French but did not feel this would be ideal so we did not go. Consequently, although we tried not to let this spoil our holiday, it made us feel very unsafe for the rest of our stay. I was hyper vigilant and did not sleep very well at night after this.My message to anyone holidaying here is please do not leave valuables in your locker . I am hopeful that security will be reviewed in the light of these incidents but would not like to think this would happen to anyone else.
title: Thief alert
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: First time I went to a Center Parcs, and I was a bit afraid because of reviews form people complaining about cleanliness of cottages. Finally, whole appartment was in a good general status when we arrived. We took the Premium fomula to get sheets in a made bed on arrival. And the basis package to get essentiel stuff on arrival (toilett and swipping papers, oil, salt, diswashing liquid...). Parc is huge, we had a cottage facing the lake. All equipment is available if you want to use (free warm tropical pool, supermarket, restaurants, bikes...). duck and swan feeding was fun. Outdoor warm pool (with almost negative temperatures outside!) was a nice experience. Inside is a bit crowded. But lots of tubes for children play. Nice place to relax and for lazy mornings. Car free place is nice. Laon (fortified medieval town on a hill) and Reims (Champagne cave visits, the nice Cathedral) are in driving distance (between 20 and 45 kms) so it\'s easy to escape the Parc for nice visists out. Overall nice experience for us. Of course, this place is perfect for families with kids but we could still anjoy it as a couple to relax from stressing working life.
title: Calm and freedom...if you want !
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The experience in France is very different from Centre Parcs in the UK. Whereas we tend to stay at the UK resort we found there were a limited number of activities at Le Lac d\'Ailette and so used  its convenient location to travel around France.We found travelling by ferry from Dover was the cheapest and felt we were going on holiday rather than just \'travelling\'. From there it takes 2-2.5 hours on a toll road that costs approximately \u20ac16.A lot of the reviews on TripAdvisor refer to the resort being distressed and whilst I would certainly agree with these comments it did not cost as much as Centre Parcs UK and nor did it ruin the holiday. Indeed it is set on a beautiful lake with lots of space and views.We may have travelled out-of-season (Easter half term) but when we arrived only two of the four restaurants were open. Therefore I would recommend you are prepared for your first meal at the accommodation ***but note there is no oven, only a cooker hob and microwave***.All of the food at the restaurants was very average quality and over-priced with the notable exception of the Suzette restaurant which serves delicious sweet and savoury pancakes that are very filling.There is a well stocked bakers and supermarket. However at the time of writing it is very expensive and so we highly recommend taking your own food, drinks and condiments.The activities at the resort are very cheap and good fun. For example kids quad biking is \u20ac10, Segway driving \u20ac10, Shetland pony riding \u20ac15 etc.There are lots of places to travel around the resort:1. Laon is the closest is beautiful with good restaurants. If you have kids a good thing to do is a cable car that goes up and down a steep hill (cost \u20ac2.50 return each adult).2. Closer by is Soissons but is very average and if it don\'t enjoy abbeys and cathedrals don\'t waste your time.3. Reims is fantastic with lots to see and do. Probably one of the best things to do is visit many of the champagne houses. We loved Tattinger which has an English tour costing \u20ac16 and you get a glass of champagne at the end.4. DO NOT TRY PARIS! It has been described by some on TripAdvisor as a "stones throw away" which is rubbish. We tried going by car, after 2 hours of sitting in typical Parisian traffic, struggling with appalling road signage and unable to find some where to park we turned back! Undeterred we tried going via train from Soissons but it costs \u20ac38 return for an adult and \u20ac25 return for a child.
title: A good base in the NW of France
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our sixth trip to Centerparcs and our second to Lac d\'Ailette. There seems to have been little maintenance since last year. Many bikes were broken and outright dangerous, masks for paintball were old and dirty and not cleaned between sessions with no effort made by staff to clean them. It was NOT SAFE so we walked out with upset children but it should not be up to visitors to assess safety.High ropes had missing pieces, trampolining didn\'t happen because of a \'lost key\', the new Laser Quest for 2013 didn\'t happen at all. The list goes on. The water temperature in the Aqua Mundo was noticeably cooler. Holes in cycle paths were unrepaired, crazy golf falling to bits, playgrounds closed off.I think this place is in some sort of trouble as the standard was so poor compared to our other visits to Centerparcs. Ordinarily we would have booked there and then for next year but unless it radically improves we will never risk a holiday there again.
title: This Centerparcs has lost the plot.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Well, where to start? We took a VIP cottage on the island facing the lake. That was the best decision we made as the view was absolutely fantastic. And kids were thrilled with the gooses and swans swimming just out of their windows. Cottage was nicely furnitured, bathrooms were great - new and comfy (only jacussi\'s cover started to wear out in the corners). Kitchen was nicely equipped but missing some basic staff like potato puree mashing thingie (whatever it\'s called) and cutting knives (luckily I had some with me). Also, there\'s not enough space in the kitchen to store your grocery. But all in all it was simply wonderful - sunsets from all the windows in house and proximity of the lake make your vacation very calm and relaxed.
title: Wonderful place for calm vacation with kids
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: A Premium Style cottage with view over the lake, bathroom with bubble-bath and separate bedroom for the kids? That should make for a great holiday, no? Well, not at Center Parcs le Lac d\'Ailette. Apparently they have a totally different definition of cleanliness compared to us: when driving towards the cottage, you get this impression of a beautiful location (which it is), but upon entering the cottage, that image quickly changed: our Premium Style cottage looked by no means like the ones you see on the website (I know, does it ever): used is the best way to describe it, but on top of that it was extremely badly cleaned, the bubble-bath was broken, whilst freezing outside the window in the kids\' bedroom didn\'t close... We went complaining at the reception, where they told us sometimes it happens that one out of 800 rooms isn\'t cleaned that well... like that\'s my problem... but promised to send someone to (re)clean and fix the window... three hours later we had to go again to the reception since nobody had shown up.Fair is fair... Aqua Mundo, the waterpark, is great for the kids, but when I pay for a Premium cottage, I expect to get value for money, and that\'s certainly not the case here. And the prices in the supermarket and the caf\u00e9s... have a wild guess... over-over-over-priced... but what did you expect... We will never go back, not because of the pricing, but primarily due to the lack of cleanliness.
title: looking for a clean room? Than don\'t go there!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We spent a midweek here in October 2012. We\'ve been to multiple Centerparcs in Belgium and the Netherlands, but Lac D\'Ailette topped all of them without a doubt!We stayed in a 4 person premium cottage and had chosen for a certain cottage number so we were close to the Aqua Mundo and other facilities. I do advice this because it\'s a really big park with a lot of hills so it can be quite a hike if you\'re carrying groceries back to your cottage!The cottage was very spacious for the 2 of us and very clean. Cleaning staff definitely did their job well. The kitchen provided everything you needed for cooking, decent TV in the living room, toilet downstairs and one in the bathroom upstairs, comfy beds and a beautifull outside seating area which we unfortunatly didn\'t make use off seeing as the weather in October simply didn\'t allow us to. The bathroom offered a bathtub with jacuzzi and a big double sink. The pool is AMAZING! We spent hours here and we\'re adults only. I\'m sure that kids and teens will have a wonderful time and won\'t be willing to come out of the water. There are 9 slides and different pools to make use of. It\'s all very new and well maintained, we loved it  in there!We cooked in our cottage a lot so I don\'t really have an opinion about the restaurants. The only one we made use of was the Mr. Crok snack bar at lunchtime and this suited us fine. Burgers and chips of standard quality, served hot and within reasonable time frame. The shop provided you with everything you could possibly think of needing for cooking. Fresh veg, potatoes, meat as well as the canned soup and pasta options, frozen meals, ice creams, crisps, cookies and other snacks, fresh fruit, soda\'s, beer, wine, the forgotten toothbrush or shampoo, ... at very reasonable prices.The park is located a stone-throw away from Paris, Parc Asterix and Disneyland Resort Paris. All three are definitely worth a day trip when staying there, but even without day trips you will have plenty to do and see.We\'ll be coming back in the future and had a wonderful break. The best Centerparcs we\'ve had so far!
title: Lovely break!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Visited this Center Parcs because it was cheaper, even with the travel costs, to journey for 7 hours to here than the 40 minutes to the one in Longleat. Figured it would also be a degree or two warmer. It was.First impressions were not that great. The site has few trees and because it has \'Canadian architecture\' - i.e. two storey villas - and not the usual lodges it looks like a holiday village and not a forest retreat. The building itself, although a Premier one, was it need of a bit of a spruce up, too: specifially, a bit of repainting and repairing.That said, the site is also fairly small and pretty compact, which means a bike really isn\'t necessary for many of the locations. The lake is lovely and the beach nice to walk past on the way to the swimming facilities which are excellent (better than Longleat).Activities are, as in the UK, grossly overpriced but still my children enjoyed pony riding, high wire climbing and quad bikes (and, of course, the pool which is free). Creperie is good but also expensive. On site shop is more reasonably priced. Most of the staff speak very good English although the high wires did require a bit of French and German to understand the safetly instructions. Of course there is no particular reason why the staff should speak English and very good reasons why I should improve my French, it being a French site!Holiday was slightly marred by a trio to casualty when my younger son fell off some monkey bars on to some stones (not the most sensible of surfaces for equipment marked for a younger age group). The staff handled it very well though and the French health system proved to be excellent.All in all, a relaxing trip (hospital notwithstanding). Great for families with younger children (mine are 7 and 10). Will come here again unless it becomes cheaper to visit Center Parcs in the UK.
title: Cheaper than the UK
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have just returned from a midweek break & I have to say they it was the most relaxing Centerparcs holiday we have ever had. It didn\'t seem as busy as other Parcs we have visited and having the lake, made a lovely change. We had a VIP lakeside villa which was Lovely. French VIP is never the same as English standard but if you accept that then you won\'t be disappointed. The pool was fun as were the other activities. Staff friendly and environment clean.I would definitely return.
title: Very relaxing environment.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: As a family of four we chose this Center Parcs for the fantastic swimming facilities and it didn\'t disappoint. With two teenage girls very happy in there twice a day we enjoyed much relaxation. The beach was lovely although shame the beach bar is non existent and one or two maintenance jobs need doing around that area, it was still a pleasant place to while away the hours. Weather was gorgeous so that was a real bonus. Pleased we paid extra for a lakeside cottage near the beach (about 15 mins walk) as if you were further away you would definitely need a bike or buggy to get around. The supermarket and bakery were fantastic. Not a brilliant choice of restaurants and they were not open all the time so at 7pm there was a bit of a pile up to get into the Italian especially on our last night which was probably the same as everyone else\'s! We have been to UK Center Parcs but much preferred this one in France for the sheer laid back peaceful unstressful ambience. It was so lovely sitting on the verandah watching the wildlife on the lake, very enjoyable, we would go back.
title: A peaceful retreat, it ticked all our boxes!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: How to turn a lovely setting into a Center Parcs catastrophe?When we entered our vip villa it stank of fish. Even after the fridge had been cleaned several times  (by us and by staff) it still made everything in the fridge smell of fish. We ended up eating out most of the time - at least we tried to. The parc is chronically understaffed. The restaurants had long queues, often over one hour wait. The pizza restaurant only ever laid up half the tables - the manager explained she had too few staff to wait on them so they just ignored half the tables, despite people queuing (often over 50 people waiting outside all the restaurants. All the outlets open ten minutes late, are then short staffed with queues....The prices for activities are staggering ( a family of four playing crazy golf pay over \u20ac24.)All the facilities, such as the main pool, are smaller than other parcs so the overcrowding is chronic. The parc is in the middle of nowhere with nothing of interest to visit. They sell lots of day tickets so the facilities are invaded by people not staying in the parc. If you leave the parc during the day there is often no space in the car park when you come back and then you have to queue up for ages behind all the day visitors just to get back in. Other people we spoke to described the experience as feeling like sheep being herded into queues just to pay exhorbitant prices for poor services.If you do decide to go bring anti mosquito kit as near the lake you get bitten to death. In other center parcs the villas are offset meaning that you don\'t hear your neighbours. Here, however, the villas are in terraces (some look very rough like a dodgy social housing estate) and you have to listen to next doors tv as the walls are very thin. In August the parc was not full and we got \u20ac400 off by booking late and then another large amount back after complaining about the above so it gives you some idea of how well the new owners (Pierre et vacances - a downmarket operator) are running things. If you think the UK parcs are going downhill since Scottish and Newcastle sold the uk business to a group of fund managers then you have seen nothing. This parc is a disgrace.
title: AVOID
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We really enjoyed our stay at Le Lac d\'Ailette, it\'s the kind of holiday where it\'s as good as you make it. We feared the worst when we first opened the door to our cottage (Number 770) and it was pretty grubby and tired. This seems to be a recurring theme at Center Parcs these days but we\'d come prepared and a quick bleach up, a good night\'s sleep to get over the long journey and all seemed better in the morning although the windowless/ventless downstairs toilet always smelt foul. We also picked our bikes up on arrival which was hassle free. We had planned to get a tag along for our 6 year old but they don\'t do them so she had to jump in at the deep end and cycle everywhere albeit with stabilizers (...turns out that was a stroke of luck as she loved it and could ride her bike without them as soon as we got home!).On the first night we ate at Mr Croks (I think it was called..) and had a pretty overpriced and not very impressive burger and chips. Over the course of the holiday we tried the buffet dinner which was pretty poor and the creperie which was nice but twice the price of the same crepes in the Laon cafes. So I suppose my advice there would be; avoid the restaurants. We bought food at the supermarket and ate at home, same with lunch.Aqua Mundo was brilliant and we spent hours there. All the family loved it. The beach by the lake was nice too.You are in France and, as such, most people speak French! Very puzzled by some of the comments on here listing that as a bad point. Some of the staff speak English, some don\'t. Try your best and, failing that, find someone who does speak English.The little pond outside the cottage was nice for the kids. They fed the ducks and a small river mammal that sparked much debate. I thought rat, the in laws thought beaver; turns out it was a Coypu (otherwise known as a beaver-rat!...everyones a winner!)A day trip into a lovely medieval city called Laon is worth it. Nice cathedral, train ride and cable car. Lovely cafe there for a tasty Croque Monsieur. Obligatory day trip to Disneyland Paris - awesome.The cons jump out but all in all we had a fabulous time which must say something for the place!
title: Pros and cons but overall a great holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I was quite disappointed in the standard of the cottage, quite shabby and a bit grubby. our bathroom window had two big insect nests outside and we called to get the staff to remove them so we would be able to open the bathroom window, they just sent someone to spray them which meant we still could not open the window because of the fumes of the spray also the nests were still there! the front garden was unkempt and the back garden furniture was quite grubby. kitchen supplies were adequate though the tea cups were tiny.fortunately we spoke French as many of the staff did not speak English. we had to call to complain that our neighbours were playing loud music and they said they would send security round. they didn\'t until we called again.the on site supermarket is way over priced so head out to shop in Laon as others suggest. also do not waste money for the internet service it was so slow! the restaurant buffet was 20EUR each and the food was awful.the location is lovely, the beach is really clean. the water park is really great we went there every day. we also hired bikes which were a bit pricey but meant we got from A to B quickly and it was fun for our toddler. we had booked last minute and paid 850EUR for a monday to friday break during high season.
title: ok but overpriced.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: we choose this park as a destination for our summer holiday. On arrival the park seems to be ok. The looks are good at the outside. Once your in you cottage and judge the cleaning it works out that the whole park is poorly maintained. Just opened in 2007 but the looks are 10 years or more. Dirt in corners beside the fridge, stains on the shower curtain, veranda not cleaned for a long time. Also little daylight inside our villa because of wilderness what had te be kept maintained. Toilet smells also as an effect of bad cleaning. The Aqua mundo (swimming pool) looks nice and has lots of water slides looks very nice. Cloack rooms in the aqua mundo again badly maintained, lots of lockers with HS written on it (means hors service french for out of order) Also several changing cabins with one door or no doors. Worst part in the aqua mundo is the staff overlooking the pool. Lack of interest in their jobs , sometimes mostly interested in their cellphone, sometimes chatting with each other , sometimes smoking on the borders of the wild water river. Maybe lack of management maybe lack of discipline........... Italian restaurant ok, serviced in a reasanable time , staff friendly. market restaurant  this is a buffet all you can eat, poor quality . Cycle rental , staff friendly and as a service we got the possibility to change our rental bike for a golf cart.
title: lack of maintenance
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stunning view of the lake and some great service at the help desk and elsewhere with staff speaking very good English. But the central dome was dirty and there is not enough on in the evenings. Also, there are hireable golf carts, which are frankly a menace to other road users, especially cyclists, as not all customers drove them very carefully.
title: Lovely setting
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had read so many negative reports about the standard and cleanliness of the accommodation, that we were really pleasantly surprised to arrive at our comfortable, well equipped and clean cottage.  It was located in quite a hilly area.  Some of the cottages were a very long walk so don\'t choose these unless the whole family are bike riders or you want to hire one of the electric buggies.  Ours was fairly central but even so we had some long walks!There were several highlights - the lovely woodland setting where the cottages were situated and the fabulous swimming pool where we spent many hours.  This was more crowded at the weekend but during the week it was really comfortable with no queues at all, despite being August.  We loved all the slides and particularly the wild water area.  There was a fantastic children\'s area with various slides and water activities, all undertaken while getting drenched from every direction!  We had read that there was a beach beside the lake and we were really surprised at how good this area was and how much the children loved it!  There was a lovely sandy beach and great swimming in the lake too.The bakery was another highlight - not only delicious French bread and croissants in the morning, but pizzas, quiches, pastries, just right for lunch.  We thought the shop too was very good with a great selection of nearly everything you could need.  There were so many activities on site that in a week we hardly tried any of them.  The swimming pool and beach were such a hit with our family and the weather was so fabulous that we didn\'t play  the tennis, bowling, mini golf etc that we had booked in advance.  Another time we would book on arrival.The one thing that we felt let Le Lac down was the restaurants.  We tried most of them during our week.  By far the best in our opinion was the pizza and pasta restaurant where we found the food to be fresh and service good.  The buffet was very hit or miss with not a lot of choice and often not enough staff to keep the buffet dishes full and fresh.  The worst was the grill.  The first night we were told we could only have barbecue, even though we were given a menu.  The barbecue consisted of chicken legs and sausages with some not very interesting vegetables.  We decided to give the grill another try on another night but this time the service was really terrible!  Our poor waitress was extremely stressed with too many tables to serve and we waited for what seemed like hours for our food which was not great when it arrived.  We couldn\'t even get her attention to get some more drinks for the children and were forced to go off and get our own water!  The restaurants were quite expensive for the quality of the food and the indifferent/bad service.  This is such a shame when everything else about the site was first class.In summary, a great family holiday in a lovely scenic setting in woodland beside the lake with numerous activities to suit everyone and just a very easy drive from Calais and not far from Disneyland Paris either.
title: Good Family Holiday
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have visited most Center Parcs in Europe and visited this one last year. The location is one of best in Europe , nestling on the side of a lake. We had a Zone 4 3 bed premier by the lake. The accomodation is unique among Center Parcs as it is a two storey house. The bedrooms are basic but reasonable, there is a bathroom, shower room and separate toilet. The bed linnen was of poor quality and ripped. Apart from a large living dining space, there is a large deck overlooking the lake. The quality of features is average for Center Parcs, although certain things are starting to look shabby. There is only 1 small tv in the living room, not good compared to others. The internet , which costs Euro 20 a week is pretty useless , I struggle to read my email! Any thoughts of downloading tv or media, just forget it. The facilities ae pretty good and as per the website. We have 3 children aged 15 to 5 and they find the activities excellent. There are a lot of mosquitos everywhere and in the centre, which is veryh annoying. There is also NO wifi (even Mcdonalds in the UK has it) !!!!!!!!!!!!! Are we living in the 21st Century, sadly not in this part of France.The food is average , there is a Market Buffet Restraunt , the quality of food has gone down from last year. There is a pizza/pasta restraunt which acceptable and finally a \'posh\' restraunt. Not worth a visit. France is not noted for its service, and this Center Parcs highlights this in bucket loads. It is a stunning location and could be exceptional, but for the staff. While there are some exceptional staff here, many are here in body but not in mind. They go through the motions, ignore you and appear to have little interest in customer service. As with most of France, complaining is futile as one is answered with the shoulder shrug. It is a real pity, this Center Parcs has the potential to be the jewel in the crown if the staff could be injected with some passion and a little money invested.
title: Beautiful location, shame about the staff
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We came to Center Parcs a group of 15, three generations aged 4 months to 62 years. We had a very good time in Center Parcs, and it catered to our biggest need - a place where people of all ages can enjoy.The good things about the place are the location, the scenery and the facilities. The location could not be better. We traveled to Paris, to nearby cities, to castles and more. Compared to other places we\'ve been in, the location here was perfect. The views were also magnificent with a stunning lake and marine and lush greenery all around. Facilities we used included a lot of children play areas, the huge pool (though it was cramped in the weekend), the Baluba which was quite nice, the very good market with Boulangerie, in which we bought fresh Croissants every morning and more. A definite recommendation is to rent bikes the moment you arrive \u2013 it makes travelling around the place faster and much more fun. They even have special bikes for people with little children, so we rented a couple with a trolley in the back in which the children could sit down and watch the view while we paddle\u2026However, I must admit that the overall condition of the place was a bit of a disappointment. Rooms were very basic, with hard beds which are barely clean. The bath tub was smelly and run down. The room had a strong damp smell when we arrived, and spider webs congratulated us from every window opened. Another let down for us which is very specific is the weather \u2013 it was 34 Celsius when we there, and there is no air conditioning or even fans to help around the house. To make matters worse, the nearby lake invited all types of mosquitoes to visit our cottages.Trips we recommend around the area:1.\tLaon \u2013 a real gem, a preserved medieval city with a beautiful Cathedral in the entrance.2.\tCoucy castle \u2013 ruins of an old castle, quite empty at all times, the kids just loved running around.3.\tReims \u2013 this is the \u201cbig city\u201d of the area, and has a very Paris-like center (some said it looks Dutch). It has one of the biggest and most impressive Gothic cathedrals you will see.Overall, all members of our family enjoyed the trips (complaints aside). Kids especially enjoyed, as the place gives you a sense of freedom (no cars!) and you can run around safely. The location is very good and the place is fun.
title: Great fun but conditions should be improved
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I was quite worried about this holiday after reading previous reviews. We had a 3 bedroom comfort villa during aug 2012. Here is an overview of our experiencePre arrival - we used our topping and phoned to secure a central villa. This was worth doing for our families ages.  Site was well sign posted and easy journey from tunnel on toll roads.Check in- quick and efficient using e-check in. Offered to speak to us in english.Cottage- clean enough and comfortable.  We had our flash wipes with us and didnt feel the need to do a clean on arrival. Basic but had what we needed. Glad we packed  2 obathmats, george foreman grill and dvd  player/ scart connector for extra ease / comfort. Wish we had also packed mosquito plug ins for all rooms. Loved the enclosed terrace - private and great for alfresco dining. The complex- pool was brilliant. Been to lots of center parcs and thought this aqua mundo was great with attentive life guards. Thought the baluba indoor play area, the park and beach were all very good. Monday to friday much quieter than weekend yet never uncomfortably busy. Queue for guest services very long on arrival afternoon. We waited until evening / next day and booked all we wanted easily with no queue. Paintball and electric boat on lake were good. Bakery was used for daily baguettes. Always lots available whenever we went in Thought the shops ok for basics only.Wider area- lots to do. Disney, paris, pierrefonds (merlins castle filming location) etc.. laon was ok however not on the top of our returns list with children / teenagers in tow. Used laon for carrefour supermarket. Had great food all holiday with fantastic meats, pate, cheeses and salads (and very nice wine). There is a macdonalds next to the carrefour. We didnt use  it, however it may be of interest.In summary a good holiday. The weather was kind and we enjoyed some quality family time. It is ideal for families with lots to do. Not a luxurious break compared to a 5 star hotel, however in comparison to a caravan used last year for  a similar price - much more comfortable. It offered value for money and an easy option for a family.
title: A week at center parcs
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was our third visit to Lac d\'Ailette, it became our children\'s favourite Center Parcs location, and we were all looking forwards to our week\'s holiday. Although there are still some very good things to say, our overall impression was that some standards are slipping.The Good:-Staff are generally helpful and efficient. Non French speakers should be fine if they are polite and at least try some basic French.-The location remains the best feature. We booked a lakeside cottage and were treated to a free wildlife show every day: Swallows/Water Voles/Swans etc. -The cottages are better designed than most Centerparcs accommodation. Ours was clean on arrival and trivial maintenance issues were dealt with quickly.The not so good-No internet access in the cottage for the whole week (technical problem). This is not acceptable as many people rely on it. There is free WiFi in the dome, but this is not a substitute.-Gents toilets in the Dome out of order for days at a time.-Occasional smell of stale water/toilets in the Dome restaurant area.-The 2 best water slides in the pool were out of use for the entire week, leading to overcrowding of the other slides.-Many broken lockers, doors and lights in the pool changing area. How difficult can it be to swap out halogen bulbs so you don\'t have to get changed in semi-darkness?-Some restaurants (particularly L\'Embarcadere) are understaffed leading to lengthy waits), although the staff were trying their best, they are stressed and a meal there became a test of endurance. Overall, although still a good holiday, we left with the impression that general maintenance needs improving to justify the price and marketing.
title: Standards slipping?
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed with 2 adults and 1 baby in a vip cottage (number 376) with a view ons the lake. It was very nice, but I found a few hair on the pillow and the bath. Further evrything was clean. If you rent a cottage with 2 adults I recommend to rent a cottage for 4 adults. There isn\'t much space for your luggage and a buggy. The sauna we had was usefull, because it wasn\'t very warm outside. It was very quite, but we stayed here in june, not the high season. This cottage was a whole end walking to the entrance, that was the only minor of this vacation, because was rainy. But it is good for the condition and a nice walk :) You can also rent a bicycle or a golfcart, but it\'s to expensive. The shop at the entrance has a lot of food, but we went to Carrefour in the city Laon. There is also a bakkery with delicious french bread. We didn\'t eat in the restaurants, we maked our own dinner at the cottage, because it was so cosy there. We went also to the aquapark. It\'s good, but I have seen better. It\'s not spectacular, but good for little childeren. From here we have visited Reims and Epernay. We have enjoyed our vacation here and we will come back, maybe with our family or friends!!
title: Beautifull cottage and environment
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Booked cottage nr 22 (VIP-style for 4 persons) for one week for a relaxing stay with my wife and 2 kids. Upon arrival I noticed our cottage was charming and well equipped, but obviously not cleaned thoroughly. So I asked for it to be cleaned (again?). And someone did, apparently. Not really a good job though. The refrigerator, for example, still was quite messy and the outdoors furniture was downright dirty. Luckily, it was close to the central building (the Dome, as they call it over there).Nevertheless, a great cottage. And the park itself was outstanding! The aquamundo (which is Centerparcish for the swimming pools) is fantastic! Great fun for children of all ages (and their parents). Many dining facilities on the grounds. Some nice play areas. A small beach aside the lake. Miniature golf, pony rides, archery stand, boating, adventure park, ... Many things to do on the Center Parcs premises.Chamouille and its surroundings are ... well ... extremely boring. If you plan to spend your entire holiday on the Center Parcs grounds, that\'s fine. Just don\'t expect many interesting cities nearby. Laon is worth a visit (20 minutes\' ride, good for about half a day), and Reims, which is a 60 minutes\' ride, is great for visiting the cathedral and some champagne houses.The restaurants on the premises were fine. One buffet restaurant which was about okay, an Italian that offered nice pizzas, and a grill restaurant which proved to be the better choice. There is also a pancake place, which is fine for pancakes but keep away from the \'galettes\', a local specialty. I still don\'t really buy that people actually like eating \'galettes campagnardes\'. Still get cold shivers remembering this. Eating one of those is probably the most exciting thing you can do in this area for miles around. Prices are very reasonable in these restaurants, and children under 4 dine free of charge. The supermarket in the Dome offers a wide range of products. It\'s probably best to visit a supermarket in Laon if you need to buy in bigtime, because the Center Parcs supermarket is quite expensive (they charge about 25% up to 40% more than in regular supermarkets). The staff (reception desk, restaurants, maintenance) were very nice.In sum: this is a great getaway if you want to spend some relaxing time with your family. But, be aware that Center Parcs is not the cheapest option.
title: Great, but expensive
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: To start with it took us ages to find our cottage after being given vague directions by the staff. On finding our cottage we were disappointed to see that the entrance was obscured by overgrown bushes. The inside was even worse, it was grubby to say the least.    The buffet restaurant was average, I found it hard to find anything I liked. There were only a few choices of dessert. The pizza restaurant had better food but the waiting time was ridiculous. I didn\'t bother to complain as I\'d been told on arrival that none of the staff spoke English.The supermarket was way overpriced but I suppose that\'s to be expected. Was told a blunt NO when I asked for a carrier bag, which I found annoying after spending lots of money there. I would suggest going to a supermarket in Laon instead.On the plus side the surrounding are great, there is lots to do for children and adults alike. My kids enjoyed riding the hired bikes.Just bear in mind if you don\'t speak French you may have problems here.
title: Grubby cottages, unhelpful staff
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Trying to escape the rain in England, I booked our 2 bed cottage (premium I think) on the Sunday and arrived there the following day.Our cottage (number 766) was clean and welcoming (after reading the reviews on here I was a bit concerned, but no need to have worried!). It had everything we needed, kitchen was well stocked, which was important as we chose to eat in most evenings.
