We had a large terrace overlooking a little lake and our daughter loved feeding the ducks and the family of coypous that lived near by.The Swimming area was a huge hit and we spent a couple of hours there every day, the second day alot of the slides were out of action which was disappointing but not a big deal, we still had fun.The bikes we hired were fine, and I would say a necessity as our cottage was a long way from the centre. Our only grumble was getting the Internet to work, we had 3 engineers out in the end, but we got there in the end.The supermarket is quite expensive, we used the huge Carrefour in Laon for our groceries, we also visited the medieval city of Laon one day and used the little cable car to get to the top, nice for an hour or so but not a huge amount to do there.All the staff we encountered could not have been nicer, they were all able to speak English, even though we made our best efforts to speak to them in their own language.All in all a fantastic break, we shall return!
title: Wonderful last minute break!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed in a 4pax vip lakeside cottage and the view was great. Cleanliness was very average and the towels were wet, shower was choked and tv was missing a few channels, but having read the reviews here, we kinda knew what to expect. On the upside, the aqua mundo and indoor playground was super and our 4yo loved it. The restaurants open a bit late so we bought a wk\'s groceries at the carrefour in laon before we checked in and mostly ate in. Generally a lot of things could be better, but our boy loved the aqua mundo and we got to sightsee and taste champagne \u2013 everyone was happy!
title: Great with kids.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We travelled here early June 2012, and the weather was very interchangeable during our 5 days on site.We arrived around midday on the Monday and were giving our cottage keys but could not gain access to it until 15:00 hrs. so decided to explore.We were 2 families - consisting of 4 adults and 3 children, and we had booked into Cottage 847 - a four bed cottage quite a way from the Aqua Mondo.  The cottage was lovely, very spacious and private with a stream trickling past at the end of the garden.  During our stay we saw many water voles - there was a family that lived nearby, and we also saw a family of ducks every morning.  All in all it was a lovely relaxing tranquil location.The on-site shop was very well stocked if somewhat expensive - we went to a local supermarket for the staples and then bought Pain & Croissants daily which worked out well.The travel from Calais took approx 2 hours 30 minutes and was very straight forward, and signposted as you got near the site.Overall we found this a very relaxing holiday and would defiantly return.
title: Lovely relaxing break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Recent mid-week stay during the Easterbreak. Weather, accommodation and location was fantastic! We didn\'t have high expectations for the accommodation, but were very impressed with the facilities and the cleanliness. A very cosy, friendly and inviting atmosphere.Having never been to Center Parcs we didn\'t realise you can only have your car at the cottage to unload on arrival and pack on departure and that the rest of the time, your car is parked away in the parking area. At first we weren\'t keen on this. But the car free zone was actually a very positive thing and gave the area a real holiday feel. We thoroughly enjoyed the long walks and bike rides. All the activites and the fresh air were exhausting and we had many early nights. We would reccommend paying the \u20ac155 to hire a golf buggy for your stay, then you might have more energy to have a nice glass of wine in front of your open fire place at the end of the day. We went to Laon one morning to visit the Catherdral and have a look around the medievil town. It was ok, bit boring and choice of cafe/restaurants were limited. The only negatives at Center Parcs was the restaurants/cafe. Food was extremely expensive (3 Crepes and 3 Oranganinas= \u20ac38!!??) Maybe we are just greedy but whenever we went to the restaurants in the parc we left hungry. Supermarket/bakery was good about 1-2euros/per item more expensive than a usual shop.We enjoy a good coffee and would definately reccommend that you bring your own.... A Grande (large) Cafe Creme was the size of an espresso and not very nice and also expensive \u20ac3.80.All in all we enjoyed the experience and would definately reccommend to our friends.
title: First time at Center Parcs and very impressed!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: First of all, as far as Center Parcs goes, this was fine... Didn\'t expect to much of the cleaning and came prepared with bleach and wipes. Which proved helpfull for the showers and toilets (in Holland we actually litterally call this type of cleaning "Cleaning with a French touch").But everything was there and in ok shape.Service: the FRENCH speak FRENCH... You know this going to France, but if you start a conversation in French, and try a little... usually they try and help you in English a bit, so just give it a go.Swimming pool was a lot of fun and yes, could use a fresh paint here and there.Balluba was thouroughly inspected and approved by my 4-year old. Offcourse, as any \'in parc\' supermarket, the prices there were over the top.Italian restaurant and Suzette\'s was fine, good and simple.All in all, good location, with a French \'touch\' ;-)
title: Start with a friendly Bonjour!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just returned from a`mid week break at Lac d\'Ailette. Very enjoyable stay in comfort villa. Lovely setting on lakeside and great sunsets across the lake in the evening. Our children really enjoyed the swimming complex, one of the best that we have stayed in with Center Parcs.The villa was a little worn but perfectly functional for our stay and all areas we clean and well maintained. Overall a great destination for a short break, about a three hour drive from Calais. We definitely stay again.
title: Half term break
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a week holiday at the end of October. We all adored this place, had a cot, high chair, even the stairgard on the top. One regret was the cleanliness of our cottage. Surely they do the job hard, but not long enough to check the corner and behind the sofa! My boys love going under the sofa, beds, and inside the cupboard, doing hide and seek, and end up covered with dust and all sorts of things! Skirting board and banisters must have never paid attention, covered in visible dust. I can clean myself happily, but hoover was functioning badly, something was stuck inside tube and bag must have been so full. I wanted to talk to the main reception, but always a long wait whenever I passed by. Given up. Bought a tin, needed a tin opener, but didn\'t realise it was broken.  There was a kettle, which was great, never had that in the other centre parc in France. So do check your store cabinet before you buy things! Shame there is no oven, but only a grill. Can\'t do a frozen pizza.  TV had a very bad signal, which you can\'t help it, but  most programmes, cut off so often, very disappointng.  Apart from that, pool is excellent, change room very clean and efficient, park is absolutly lovely. Great play areas.  Just wished for the on site laundrette, but we had to go to Laon, top of the old town. You can conbine the washing day with your sight seeing. But beawere the most shops are closed out of season.  We didn\'t do any paying activities they offer, but was ok with pool, outdoor play areas, and indoor play area. Children\'s indoor play area is good, but make sure you have lot\'s of 1euro coins to entertain your kids. ride and play only goes for 1 mins!
title: Very Pretty cottage, cleaning is not a British standard.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Have stayed here twice and booked again for this year. After staying at nearly all the UK ones in the past we find this Center Parcs far superior. We stayed in premium last time and a VIP before. Whilst I tend to agree the premiums do seem a little tired now, and in need of some deep cleaning and tlc, the VIP villa we stayed in was excellent. Staff are OK, typical French service I would say, activites are limited but it is only an hour from Disney Paris, Parc Asterix and is ideally located for visiting some of the other historical cities in the area. If you want an action packed week/weekend and intend to stay here all the time, then you may want to reconsider, but as a comfortable base with plenty of activities its ideal.
title: Dissapointed to see other bad reviews
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed at centerparc l\'aillette for two nights with a couple of friends. The parc and the cottage were very nice and very quiet. There were some minor problems with the cottage but ok. The service in the dome and all over the parc was terrible. There was a clear lack of personnel. Outside bar closed, vending machines not working. Fresh backery understaffed, 2 girls behind the counter were more busy with their computers than taking orders which resulted in 30 minutes waiting time just to get some bread. In the pancake restaurant we were told after we complained for waiting 30 minutes just to get our table cleaned and the menu to take it up with the management...After which we left. In the kids play room all tables dirty, same in the bowling bar below. Self service was the best way to get a drink within 15 minutes.In all nice cottage and surroundings, but unfriendly staff and understaffed parc.
title: nice accomodation, terrible service
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: There is not really a whole lot to tell:- Bungalows have nice views to the lake and a lot of space- The scenery is beautifulBut, and there are a lot of "buts" they don\'t even clean the place during your stay, not even if you stay 1 week, you have to do your own bed when you arrive after a long drive and worst of all the service is very bad. After half an hour you get the feeling that no one cares at all for the place or for the guests, it is really too bad to be true. Fortunately we had an employee rate from a friend and we were there just to try it out. Do not go here if you want a minimum of attention from the staff and clean rooms.Lastly, very beautiful scenery with the lake but if you plan on staying and eating be careful it has the worst food with the most outrageous prices I have ever eaten. Just rubbish.
title: Very poor service and just ok accomodation
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Firstly let me say that I would recommend this as a great "relaxed" activity break. The parc itself is set in beautiful surroundings, the lake albeit frozen in February looked spectacular with swans walking right across the middle.The rental bikes are of good quality and if you want it a little easier upgrade to a velo electrique!!We had a comfort cottage. Clean and most suitable. Accomodation is quite near the activity centres so walking isnt an issue either.The Aqua mundo is at least as good as UK CP\'s if not better.Travel time was around 2hr 30 mins from Calais.Would I return........yes and I would bear in mind a few points. Take a laptop with wired connection for in the cottage because there is no wifi anywhere on site. (remember to turn off mobile roaming on the Phone). You can also use laptop for internet tv or movies (only cnn world in english on tv)Only order the breakfast delivery for two of the four days (there\'s only so much baguette you can eat in one day!)Check restaurant times...sometimes they close at lunchtime!! and unlike UK CP people dont eat in the swimming area.Although it was half term in the UK it wasnt school holiday en france which probably counts for it being \u00a3300 cheaper!!!!
title: UK half-term trip
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed here 2 years ago and some of the same attractions still broken, lake side lighting lying on their sides along the path, other exhibits non functional. Water quality in the pools was variable, lots of fluff and hair in the water and some of the lifeguards are distracted by mobile phones...Food quality seemed OK but lacking in quantity, premium prices paid due to the captive audience, self catering better option to save money but bring your own food! Enjoyable stay, would have been better had the matress been devoid of the large hole in the middle of it; capable of supporting a colony of Hobbits.... Saying that an enjoyable stay for the children and the layout relaxing. lots of local wildlife.
title: Enjoyable but variable quality facilities
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed in a 3 bed apartment on the lake front & close to the centre. This was a good choice as the parc is a bit hilly & some chalets a little remote. Food really good though a little expensive as in all cparcs. Pool complex for us with 3 under 6 was fantastic with the kids allowed on everything as long as they went with an adult. No namby pamby h&s watching your every move. We also went to euro Disney from here. It was a bit of a trek but certainly doable.Also like the fact the parc had a man made beach so kids can play on a beach & swim in lake if they wanted.Good amenities & thing to do if you wanted. Good well maintained play parks & the loos next to the beach were the cleanest I\'ve ever been in in such a location.Down sides would be the cost of food - we went off park & within 10 miles found a supermarket.All in all this was a great place & we\'d certainly come back.
title: Great parc that is as good as the uk ones, though it\'s somewhat warmer outside!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: My wife and I along with our 2 young children stayed for a long weekend October 14 to 17.  The parc itself seems nice, the Water Park is excellent with not long waits for the water slides and activities, the Indoor and outdoor kids playground is excellent and the Bowling was fun.The cabin\'s are absolutley disgusting.  Dirty floors, dirty kitchen, matresses in the bedroom stink, pillow look 10 years old, duvets look older, dishes in the cuboard dirty, utensils dirty, TV did not work, the furniture in the living room looked like it came from the 1970\'s and hadn\'t been cleaned in years.  We were absolutley appauled at the site of this place.We ended up only staying 2 nights of the three.  Desperatley wanted to go home and clean our clothes and take a very long shower.
title: Water Park, Kids Playground Excellent - Cabin\'s Disgusting
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Last minute decision to stay at Lac D\'ailette Center parcs with family for 4 nights after a trip camping in Normandy. Consequently looking forward to a nice apartment ( was premium spec) and a hot shower. The setting looked great as we drove on in down the hill and after checking in to chalet no ** started to have a look around the apartment. Much to my surprise the chalet was very dirty and shabby. with no facilities like even a DVD player or working dishwasher. not really premium spec at all! there were black and white dog hairs all over the grimy carpets and tiny blood stains on one of the single beds in our neice & nephews room. Should have set the alarm bells ringing! A few drinks and tired kids off to bed and my sister in law goes in to check on her two kids as the room is up an adjacent stairwell to be greeted by them both covered in swarming bed bugs all over their faces and legs, feeding and biting! Both kids and adult traumatised beyond belief and immediately moved kids and all clothing out of the room. killed a few bugs which were full of blood and took photos and videos as they retreated into the wall panelling. A hideous  experience...  spent all night settling kids with the other kids in the other rooms, checking every single nook and cranny for more bugs and one adult slept on the sofa.  Next day we complained very angrily to the reception manager who after a degree of exasperated nonchalance agreed to move us to another chalet. Took dead bugs in a glass to reception...No upgrade, No help with luggage, no free attractions for truamatised kids so wasted a sleepless night and a half day of a 4 day break moving chalets to a slightly less dirty ( mossies splattered on walls etc etc) chalet. we asked for an extra nights accomodation which eventually was agreed but decided not to stay and longer as we\'d had enough. very very poor standards of hygiene, care and customer service... Beware! Pool and buffet great tho!   Family of 4 adults and 4 kids... Notts/Lincs UK
title: Nice pool... Shame about the bed bugs!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Stayed for a midweek. Review in 2 parts: the park, and the cottage.Cottage nr 194, Comfort-class, 6 persons, stayed with 4 adults, 2 kids + 1 baby.The park: no remarks. very nice environment, super swimming pool, nice outside of cottages, friendly and helpful staff, quite expensive prices in resto\'s and shop. Minigolf = 10 euro per adult... Roads in park can be very steep!!! Be trained if you want to go for bread in the morning, because the way back to cottage is a serious climb! Especially cottages in zone 0 and zone 1. Try to get lakeview. it\'s superb + no hills.The cottage:nice from the outside. very disappointing from the inside. Douche+toilet is clean, but floor, stairs, not. walls: full of stains and smears and prints (shoeprints against wall and ceiling!! mosquito-hunt?). Not enough sheets were there at arrival, beds were not made opposed to their explicit and personal promise. Dishwasher was broken (soap-box didnot open, so dishes not clean) shower-drain was clogged,... After a remark at the reception desk, it was always fixed, but you shouldnt run to them daily... Terrace chairs were not appealing to lay in, safety-fence for the kids on top of stairs was hanging out of the hinges, so it was not safe at all. No dish soap available to do the dishes.Conlusion: cottage needs definitely renovation.....
title: All OK, except INSIDE the cottage...
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We returned to Lac d\'Ailette this year having been there two years ago, and it was great again. I was a bit bothered that it had gone down hill since we were there last which was the year it opened, but it hasn\'t. There was a large group of us, 6 adults, and 7 kids in three houses. The only complaints I would have was that the pool was very busy over the weekend peroid, and I noticed the day we were leaving that 7 bus loads of kids arrived for a day trip which would also have resulted in long ques at the slides, However during the week it was great as there were very small ques. A number of the slides were closed for the first few days and one of the slides on the "Water Factory" never opened we don\'t know why.The houses we had were in the 700 area and all of them although not on the lake had water behind them which meant that the deck at the back of the house had a railing around it which is not what we wanted. If I was going again I would look for houses in the 100-200 numbers as this side of the park had alot more space around the houses. We stayed in a comfort house for one week and in a preimum house for the next 5 days (as this was all that was available) and I would have to say I couuld see no difference, there is a dishwasher in both houses and the kitchen furniture was proably a bit better but that was it, I certainly wouldn\'t opt for it again.We ate in the itialian resturant twice during our stay and the food was excellent but it was too expencive to be eating out every night, anyway we prefer to cook a dinner in the house for the kids. we did most of our shopping in the supermarket before arriving. They still have no laudrette on site which is a big drawback we had to go to the local town of Loan where there is a Launrette close to the Catherdral, I can\'t understand why they don;t give over a room somewhere on site to a few washing machines.
title: Our second visit, two years on
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having read a lot of the reviews we were also very worried. We need not have been so.Cottage was clean enough- not spotless took some flash wipes for finishing touches. I turned on the Jacuzzi \u2013 only to have a poor smell and there is no way I would have used it or let the kids. The downstairs loo had a smell of stagnant water every day \u2013 I\u2019m not sure if these are built in porter loos. We had a nice view and the above points didn\u2019t spoil our initial opinion.Location: We were in Zone 5 \u2013 for us this was the best area as it\u2019s close to beach, Skate Park and football pitch. The best location if you want to let your kids run free and you can keep an eye on them. The villas from 537  - which is a 4 bed VIP but there are 6 8 and 4 bed premiers there also-  have a view of the lake and the football pitch etc.  For me there is not much difference between a Premier and VIP.The whole place did not feel busy by any means. People kept themselves to themselves; there were some English there also.Food:  Now maybe we got a good a week, but we ate in the pancake restaurant every day after swimming and it was really good.We had the raclette service \u2013 a bit of advice \u2013 we ordered for three adults and two children \u2013 there was too much food. I would order half of what you think. you need  - two adults only would have been enough. We threw loads of ham etc away. Cost 59 euroWe ordered the take home chicken one day \u2013 enough for 5 and loads of roast potatoes- this was also good. Costs 14.90 euro.We ate dinner in the Marche du Monde Buffet- I wish we had done this from the start \u2013 food was good \u2013 the kids can go off and play- cost per adult 19.10 \u2013 all you can eat and for an extra 4.10 euro p/p wine and beer and soft drinks inclusive all night!! Considering a beer is approx 4.00 a really good deal.Pool- good quiet- not big queues when we were there. Enough slides.Bikes \u2013 this was great- you just go and get one- no queues nothing like the English need for organisation- but it worked and I think less queues because of their relaxed system.Supermarket \u2013 We didn\u2019t have enough room in the car for more shopping, but if you can stop off at the super market outside the village I would if you intend to eat in. But it\u2019s stocked enough for a basic meal. Nuggets etc \u2013 but we didn\u2019t do this.The bakery is good \u2013 we didn\u2019t use the delivery service, as we liked the cycle in the morning.The public toilets \u2013men\u2019s mainly- were dirty one day \u2013 someone had decided to let go all over the floor by all accounts!  But this could happen anywhere. One day flooded so don\u2019t use the loos inside the Aqua Mundo- but those in the changing room close by. Changing rooms tidy. To be fair any problems like the above were sorted out quickly.Staff-  some staff spoke better English than others- better than my French \u2013 one girl Stephanie was a bit annoying- my husband who is OK at French tried to order in French but she kept saying she didn\u2019t understand. All the other staff were really polite and helpful. Didn\u2019t feel the need to try to speak French but I like to practice once or twice a year and so we shared a few giggles with the staff.I hope that this review is factual enough to dispel any fears \u2013 like those I had before we went. Despite some minor negatives- were going to stay on for two more days- but my teenager had had enough by this time.This Center Parcs does not feel like a UK Center Parcs- so the kids felt they were getting a different holiday. Its not as commercial and more simplistic but well organised for activities, which you don\u2019t have to book in advance of travel. We did book the family bowling and racket package in advance however but the time slots you book when there, we almost always got the times we wanted. After spending the weekend in Euro Disney prior to this, a really relaxed break that we all enjoyed.
title: We were worried - but need not have been! We liked it.
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This place is a holiday compound with hundreds of cottages and loads of activity areas in a quiet and pleasant lakeside setting about 90 minutes from Paris. We arrived at 3pm checkin time and were dealt with efficiently (although we did speak French) - we didn\'t even have to leave the car. You can drive to your chalet to drop off bags, then put the car in the main car park at the entry for the rest of your stay.We were lucky to get a lovely cottage only 5 mins walk from the centre of the park (where the pool, restaurants, shop, playground, beach area, etc are). Depending on where you are though, you could be about 20-30mins walk away. You can rent bikes (with kids or infant seats, or kid\'s trailer) for a reasonable price (cheaper and quicker if prebooked online), or an electric buggy! If you plan to mainly stay in your cottage you won\'t need to, but if you make frequent trips back to the main area it could get tiresome without transport.You could easily spend a week here - the shop has everything (prices a bit higher than hypermarkets but not bad), there are 3 or 4 restaurants/cafes, and there are plenty of activities to do - see the website. The beach area is lovely but small enough and you can walk along the lakeside for a while. There\'s also a small hiking area.For kids, the place is very good. It has the best waterpark I\'ve ever seen - I\'m not sure why people have not talked about it more. It is massive! It\'s also covered by a giant plastic dome so even on rainy days you are fine. There is also an outdoor bit. The waterslides are the main attraction and are fantastic. There\'s a toddler pool, kids pool with small slides, and then a large main pool. This last one is a bit dangerous though as there is a current, so smaller kids will get swept out and it\'s not that well marked. The flow leads to the outdoor bit which is fine but it\'s strong. Some of the slides are really amazing, and there are also jacuzzis and deckchairs. You can easily spend hours here - your kids will love it.There is also a kids club which was fine for 2 hours; 3 playgrounds (2 small and 1 absolutely massive one), and you can go zorbing on the beach or rent pedalboats, amongst other things. There\'s a small farm which the kids appreciated, and you can ponyride.We ate in the crepe cafe which was nice but a bit pricy. The main restaurant has a buffet system and another an a la carte menu. There\'s a burger place too (with bouncy castle!). The bakery is lovely and we arranged morning delivery to our door - fantastic. We brought loads of food so didn\'t need to eat out. The cottages have small kitchens but there\'s a hob, microwave and big fridge/freezer. Pots and pans, cutlery etc is all there. You need to rent teatowels or bring your own. Same for bathroom towels. The houses are not cleaned during your stay unless you pay for it. You are also asked to clean the house before you leave, and take out bins and leave bedsheets outside - a pity considering the place is not really cheap. We got a cottage with our own sauna which was fantastic. They also have jacuzzi baths. There is internet access but it is expensive.My only real reservation is that you can get tired of being here after 3-4 days and you might consider a day trip. There are tours offered that you can join, or you can just hit the road yourself. The surrounding area has lots of World War memorials but not much else other than farmland. Laon (15 mins) has a hypermarket and a nice cathedral.Actually there is one important thing that the park really has to address - road safety. The roads are very narrow and one-way, although bikes ignore this. But you share the road with walkers, cyclists, electric buggies and fairly frequently cars. We once had to dive off the road as someone drove at us at 60kph. A 6 year old in an electric buggy almost ran us over too. On the bike with the kids on the back we were overtaken at close range by crazy teenage cyclists. It\'s just not that safe. They say that cars are not allowed at the cottages, but some people are clearly driving around all the time.Overall it\'s a great place for a week with a family. If you can drive you will save lots by bringing your own food, towels, bikes, helmets etc.
title: Great family getaway with amazing waterpark
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I was staying at Centre Parc during a Business Trip to France - I was there in total for 5 weeks from March - May 2011.When I first arrived, after having to fight with security to get through, they refused to give me my key as they said they didn\'t have a reservation, then suddenly after much shouting they found it - thank goodness I spoke French as no one there speaks English they let me in. Then refused to open the gate to enable me to drive to my chalet - another traipse back up the hill to tell them this.Finally I managed to get to the chalet which looked a little tired and I was disappointed - it clearly hadn\'t been cleaned very well since the last guests had left. The bathroom was dirty - toilet hadn\'t even been flushed, hair was left around the bath, the tap was hanging off the wall, the floor, well, I made the mistake of taking my shoes off and my feet were covered in muck.I thought things would get better, but sadly they didn\'t. Throughout the first week the chalet was hardly cleaned, towels were taken and never replaced (I had to go and find my own), someone took the bike out the front of my chalet and never returned it.When I returned for the second time - in another chalet it was more of the same. This time I arrived and the bed hadn\'t even been made up - the sheets were sitting on it in the plastic wrapping - no towels has been provided - again a dirty bathroom, and worst of all, I found someone else\'s pants still in the bathroom. The sofa cushions were all ripped and I even found old food down the back of it. Every surface you touched was caked with dust.The food wasn\'t much better, over price, over or under cooked, rude service, long waits.Never come here in business, it is a nightmare.
title: Perhaps one of the worst hotels I\'ve ever stayed at
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed here for a week in July as a large extended family group of 10 adults and 10 kids in a number of "Premium" cottages. We had a great week and would highly recommend the park, particularly for families with older kids and teens as there is just tonnes to do.I had been a bit worried having read some of the previous reviews but they didn\'t reflect our experience at all. Here\'s our thoughts on the key bits:Cottages - were perfectly clean on arrival and very comfortable. The bedrooms are a great size and the layout and style of the houses seems to help keep them cool without aircon. A few minor negatives - the equipment didn\'t seem to be the same in each house (1 had no toaster, 1 had no coffee machine & 1 had no kettle) but anything missing was replaced as soon as we contacted reception. Despite me emailing before arrival to confirm the number of towel packs required in each house we were short at least one in every house, but these were replaced within 10 mins of us notifying reception. A few of the cottages backed on to what were described as small lakes but essentially were pools of stagnant water, these weren\'t the most pleasant to sit next to and attracted a lot of insects so we didn\'t sit out the back much at all. These were fairly minor and the standard of accommodation compared to say caravan parks, which are similar prices, is vastly superior. A real positive as a large group was that we were on a quiet cross-street which, given the no cars policy, meant we were able to pull together tables and chairs and eat as a large group of 20 "street party" style, it worked great for the adults as we could let the kids play around us without worrying. This was one of the main advantages of having all the cottages in the same street, the kids were able to roam as they pleased. I would agree partially with one of the other reviewers though, the main roads weren\'t as safe as they should be given the no cars policy (which doesn\'t apply on the changeover days Monday & Friday, nor on the evenings before changeover day after 7pm) as the Centerparcs cleaning and security staff and the takeaway delivery staff all have vans which they do drive quite fast around the site. The golf buggies (often driven by 15 year olds!) are also far too fast, some speed bumps would definitely help. On the whole though the cross-streets and side streets were very quiet and very safe.Pool complex - brilliant for the kids, they just loved it, it seemed very clean when we were there, in fact one of the main things we noticed was that there permanently seemed to be at least 2 cleaners around the changing rooms and leading out to the pool, working very hard.The only real downside I can see to the Aqua Mundo is that you can\'t just wander up and sit down for a while watching the rest of your family in the pool or take a small baby in a buggy up to sit, its very much like going into a leisure centre with changing cubicles and lockers before you enter. There are plenty of chairs around the pool but it wouldn\'t be somewhere I would sit for any length of time. The kids adored all the slides, the lazy river, the toddler pool, the rain playzone, it was great.Also great was Baluba the indoor play area, very quite most evenings and always very clean. Plenty of slides, climbing frames and soft play equipment for all ages. The only real downside is the inevitable number of machines which you feed Euro tokens in to get some rubbish worth 20p BUT the kids are addicted to them!! Bike rental was great and we all enjoyed it, I haven\'t been on a bike in years but it is needed otherwise every trip to the pool, beach or restaurants would be a long hike. Think of getting one of the bikes with KiddieCart trailer if you\'ve small kids as they are great for bringing back shopping from the (reasonably stocked) supermarket onsite. The beach was lovely with large sort of beanbag cushions and little tables strewn around for relaxing on and there\'s lots of activities on it including dance classes, aerobics and the slightly insane kids foam party. The kids loved the little "farm" and the pony trekking was a great hit. The older kids also loved the forest canopy walk and low wire. The bouncy castle on the beach was good fun. There were 2 things I thought Centerparcs just didn\'t get right and was a bit disappointed in:1) They really don\'t make any effort whatsoever to cater for non-French people onsite. Non of the staff spoke anything other than French, the translations of activities and events into English was really badly done, safety instructions for the boat hire and pony trekking were only delivered in French and the kids disco featured not a word of any other language. I\'ve happily spent lots of time in other campsites, parks and hotels in France and I make the effort to speak French as much as I can but normally parks also make an effort to make it easier for visitors from abroad, generally with staff speaking more than one language (e.g. kids ents staff saying Bonjour, Hello, Hallo) . Lac d\'Ailette doesn\'t do this AT ALL so you\'d probably need to brush up on your French before going. 2) The waterfront area is really beautifully done, the frontage of all the shops and restaurants lovely but absolutely empty because they are far far too expensive, particularly in the current climate. \u20ac5 for a large beer, \u20ac3.90 for a kids icecream, \u20ac4 for a smoothie, it just all seemed extortionate. Can\'t understand why they don\'t lower the prices and the places would be packed. We ordered takeaway pizzas and these seemed better value. Centerparcs overall are great for families, we felt the price of our stay (at \u20ac1,000 for the 4 person premium villas) offered great value for money  and there\'s tonnes of stuff for everyone of all ages to enjoy. We had a ball of a week and would definitely do it again, we even had a quick look at which cottages we might prefer next time!
title: Great place for groups with kids of varying ages
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just got back from a week at Le Lac with 2 young children (4 and 3) and overall we were very impressed and had a great time. We had a prestige 2 bed villa which was lovely, v clean and with good facilities - although no oven which is something to bear in mind when taking food or buying it either on site or at the hypermarket. The weather was great and there is plenty to do with a fantastic water world with loads of slides and a wave machine and a nice soft play area (both of which are free). Aside from that there\'s a good beach and other bits and pieces for the kids to do. Some of the opening times were a tad odd but i guess we were off season being the first week of Sept for example the beach bar was only open on Sat and Sun. We ate out on the first night at the Italian and it was fairly poor (dodgy service and way too much salt and after a really small complaint / comment they gave us the entire meal and drinks for free which was unnecessary but a nice touch all the same.) The rest of the time we cooked our own meals having bought  food from either the shop on site which is pricey but not overly so, or the hypermarket near Laon. We ventured out to the surrounding villages which are OK and the first world war cemeteries which are obviously worth visiting. There are also quite a few walks / cycle tracks from the camp to the surrounding areas which are really nice and easy to navigate. All in all no real complaints, staff v pleasant, could probably have done with some more entertainment in the evening if that\'s your thing, and a laundrette (the closest is in Loan but the jacuzzi bath and some persil doesn\'t do a bad job!) the other point to note is that the golf buggies and cars can be a bit of a hazard / annoyance and  but none of this distracts from a great place to spend a week - especially with young kids and at a cheaper rate than CenterParcs in the UK.
title: Great place to spend a week with the kids
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed there for the second time and we are still very happy! The first time, we rented a VIP cottage with a view on the lake and this was simply great!! This time, we rented a Premium cottage and it was also very nice. The cottages are not so clean but this is not really something to complain about as all the rest was so nice.The parc is really beautiful, nice architecture, the lake, the nature, etc.You have everything you want in the parc and, as we stayed for a mid-week only, we didn\'t even leave the parc during our stay. The children had great moments in the swimming pool which is really great for all ages.Even adults can have fun. The playgrounds are very good as well.We didn\'t try any of the restaurants there as I saw comments that food wasn\'t so good and quite expensive for the quality.I would recomment this location for all families with children. You can have very nice moments in family there.
title: Very good stay with small children, very relaxing
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We stayed here in October half term for a midweek break, with our two children, not  very young but not teenagers yet, and this was our second visit to this particular center parcs. The first time we went was shortly after it opened and although we had a great time our villa was not as clean as it should have been so this time we went for a VIP villa in the hope it would be better - sadly not!! On arrival the last occupants food was still in the fridge, the toilets hadn\'t been flushed let alone cleaned, the sheets were dirty and the dishwasher was still running! There was someones else hairs and hair band in the bath and their wet bath mat, oh and if I am going to be really picky dust all over the tv! I didn\'t dare examine under the beds or look closely at the floor! After taking some pictures to help us explain we went to reception to complain and the lady was very charming, very apologetic and to be fair they came out and changed the sheets, cleaned the bathrooms and disposed of the leftover food, they also arranged for a fresh bread delivery every day which was very nice, as an apology. Although the villa was still not as clean as it could be for the sake of our family holiday we put it behind us and we did have a great time.  The setting is fabulous, the staff were friendly although yes a bit thin on the ground and we were able to book our activities when we wanted.  The pool was busy but we discovered that the best time to go was over lunchtime and we aways got lockers, showers were cold though! Usually managed to grab a couple of sun loungers too. Bikes were ok, my bike was the only one with a working light, but if we could have been bothered we could have gone back and swapped for ones that did work. Ate out at the Italian restaurant on first night, have to say that it wasn\'t great, got our drinks order wrong, food could have been better and very overpriced, service was terrible, so we just cooked after that, found a supermarket about 20 mins away and stocked up there, parc shop ok but expensive, but I think they always are! You may be surprised to hear we would go back, our boys just love it, I am always disappointed by the cleanliness of Center Parcs accomodation generally but the positives tend to outweigh the negatives, we have been to both english and french center parcs and I have to say that the french ones are not so rigid on the rules as the english ones and this works both ways, yes cars do seem to appear when they shouldn\'t but if you are out for 10 minutes more on your pedalo than you should be nobody seems very bothered, I think its just the french way!!
title: Standards not as good as they should be!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We returned from Center Parcs Le Lac d\u2019Ailette yesterday and I have to say that despite making the best of our week away & trying to look at everything in a positive light, our holiday was a very disappointing experience and something which I would never want to repeat.  I am not the sort of person to complain, but I am an avid user of Trip Advisor and feel I have to write an honest review based on our experience at Center Parcs Le Lac d\'Ailette.  We travelled with our four children aged between 1 and 14 years old and paid over \u00a32500 for a weeks stay during October half term including bike hire and towel hire in a premium cottage.On arrival, check-in was very speedy with our e-ticket. As we arrived before 3pm, we went to hire some bikes after leaving our car in the car park.  There was a choice of bikes and we were left to go and choose our own bikes.  There were quite a few bikes without chain guards, with flat tyres and with broken lights & I had to have a bike with no chain guard and no working light ,but we remained positive and cycled to find our cottage.  Upon arriving at our cottage, I am sorry to say that it was one disappointment after another.  Cottage should have been a 4 bedroom premium lakeside & an end cottage (we paid extra for this). The lake view was completely hidden by trees & bushes and we weren\'t actually on the edge of the lake, but again we looked at this in a positive light and admired the view of the lake which was lovely from one of the bedrooms upstairs. We weren\'t really what I would class as an end cottage as next door was very close, but not the end of the world.I hate having to write this but the cottage really was not clean at all.  It smelt of a combination of damp and dust & we soon all started coughing.  We opened windows and cleaned as best as we could which wasn\'t the best start to our holiday. Carpets were so dirty with so many stains on them that it was hard to tell what colour they were when new.  They were disgusting. As time passed we discovered a huge clump of hair in the shower (not ours), dirty and very torn bedding, our socks quickly became black from the dirty floors, kitchen and kitchen utensils were dirty & we kept finding hairs around the cottage which weren\'t ours. Our one year old then discovered a plug socket completely hanging out from the wall which was very dangerous.  She then was eating sweets on the sofa which weren\'t ours. Her cot was broken.  Sofa and chairs filthy & very stained. We had a lovely imprint of a shoe on the lounge wall with a squashed bug where someone had obviously swatted a bug with their shoe.  One of our heaters in the lounge didn\'t work.  Towels which had cost 7 Euros to hire were so small and thin it was unbelievable. We hung our coats up in the hallway and the coat hook fell off the wall. We discovered one of the dining chairs was completely broken so moved that to the side so no-one sat on it by mistake. The cottage itself looked new from the outside, but looked in need of a full refurbishment inside.  I don\'t know if we have just been very unlucky but our cottage really was filthy and I\u2019m not exaggerating. Anyway for our first evening we went to the Italian restaurant.  We were given a highchair for our one year old.   We put her in the highchair and when the waiter came to take our order he lent on the highchair and the highchair completely broke sending our baby tumbling through a hole in the highchair to the floor backwards.  The waiter tried to catch the falling wooden highchair which then fell on top of our baby who was laying screaming on the tiled floor.  It was awful and made me feel sick. I thought she would need a trip to hospital, but thankfully she was ok. The waiter apologised and we didn\'t blame him or Center Parcs.   I smiled, calmed my baby and still continued to remain positive about the rest of our holiday.  I ate my pizza with my baby on my lap as she wouldn\'t sit back in another highchair. The next day we went swimming.  It was packed!!  It was very difficult to find an empty changing room with people pushing and shoving but I still kept smiling. After finding an empty locker we put all our clothes in there, inserted our Euro and tried to lock it.  The locker didn\'t lock and our Euro was lost.  To cut a long story short many lockers didn\'t work.  We then couldn\'t find anywhere to sit in the swimming area so had to just leave our towels on the side.  It took half an hour to queue to get a drink in the pool area.  Only one member of staff was working. Changing room floors had many hairs on them.The sports hall, despite stating that it had trampolines, inflatables etc was completely empty when we went there. It looked like an empty aircraft hanger. No-one used it.We tried Mr Crocks fast food restaurant for lunch.  After waiting around 30 minutes to get served, again one member of staff serving, we finally received our order which was totally incorrect.  We took it back, waited and it was again incorrect so we returned it again.  I now had a screaming baby and toddler and didn\'t feel like I was on holiday.  We finally ended up with 6 burgers and one portion of chips between five of us.  We all wanted a burger and chips each so it wasn\'t a difficult order.  We gave up, ate what we could stomach and left. In the evening we went to the bowling bar.  Again only one member of staff trying to serve everyone & clear tables resulting in very slow service.  This same member of staff was also trying to fix the bowling lanes which kept going wrong.  We played a game of bowling & yes our lane too kept going wrong.  Looking back it was quite funny as none of us could find bowling shoes to fit so we all looked like clowns wearing these huge bowling shoes that didn\'t fit us. On a more serious note our one year old was crawling on the floor amongst small pieces of broken glass.  Luckily we noticed before she started picking the glass up and putting it in her mouth.The Baluba children\u2019s play area upstairs was large and good, although floor wasn\u2019t cleaned.  Our younger children loved it in there.  I tried to ignore the trail of blood which led to the toilets where someone had obviously cut themselves and walked to the toilets, however when the trail of blood was still there the next day, I felt the lack of cleanliness was unacceptable.  There was also a spilt drink on the floor which was there for at least two days.  I also noticed a toilet cleaner sign the wall chart to say she had checked and cleaned the toilets, when she hadn\u2019t even gone into the toilets to check them.For the rest of our holiday we cooked in the cottage.  We did try to get into the pancake restaurant one lunchtime, but were turned away after queuing for some time, as it was full.  There isn\'t an oven, just microwave and hob.  On site shop is very expensive and not well stocked.  We bought a pack of cards, watched DVD\'s which we had brought with us on our DVD player which we also brought with us from home and enjoyed quality family time together.  We laughed and had fun.We bought some eclairs in the on-site bakery, but my teenage daughter found a mass of hairs in the icing and none of us wanted to eat ours after that. I dread to think how much spending money we got through during our weeks stay.Also unlike the UK Center Parcs, (we have been to them 3 times) cars are not taken back to the car parks by many people and cars, vans and golf buggies are often driving around the roads.  My older children felt unsafe as some people drove far too fast and expected the cyclists to just get out of the way. It was dangerous.To sum up I know this review may sound unbelievable and I also realise that I must sound like a very hard to please, complaining type of person, but all I can do is promise you that this is the first time that I have felt strongly enough about something to complain and everything I have written is accurate and nothing is exaggerated.  And yes we have laughed, yes we have remained positive throughout, but if I won a holiday to return I wouldn\'t come.  I am very glad to be home.To sum up, in our opinion, the major issue here is lack of staff.  All staff try their best but they can only do so much.  I truly believe with more staff this Center Parcs could be lovely.  The setting and lake are beautiful.Hope this helps. I wish I could have written a more positive review, but I have to provide my honest opinion. Maybe we were just unlucky\u2026.Sharon
title: Not for us...dirty and understaffed
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Filthy dirty villas; filthy swimming pools; lack of any sort of service when our villas cards refused to work - we are still waiting for them to solve it. They gave us one key for 5 of us to share.We paid for an internet connection which on arrival we tried to activate - didnt work.Reception said they had never heard of it before nor seen it the documentation that we had with us.Electric jug didnt work.Microwave instructions were not for the model in the villa - and it wasnt just a microwave; it was an oven as well, so we had to somehow figure out how to use it. They had replaced the broken toaster but left the old one in the villa (just in case?)The discs used to pay for everything which cost a euro each - fine; funded a merry go round ride that went around 3x; and a car ride that went half way around the wee track. Each event took probably less than a minute and left a 3 yr old very frustrated and crying for more....of course!And on the Wednesday of a mid-week visit, 3 out of 5 of us were seriously ill. On returning home the doctor confirmed we had crypto, and we could not have been the only ones.The three who had gone swimming caught this horrid parasite and the 2 who didnt, which included the baby, did not (thank goodness)Numerous emails to the company in Holland.  Replied to an after visit survey - no response.So there it is.Stay away - keep your thousands in your pocket because it will be the worst thousand euros you will ever spend.
title: Cryptosporidium!!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We have been to 2 of the UK parcs and although enjoyed them (kids of course loved them) always felt a little disappointed by cleanliness and general standard of upkeep. After much pressure from the children to go to Center Parcs again we relented and looked at the French parcs.We settled on Lac D\'Ailette due to its relative newness, proximity to Calais (approx 2hrs) and generally positive comments on this site and we weren\'t disappointed. The lake location is great and having a cottage right on the lake side was excellent. The cottage itself was a 2 bed house which in our opinion was better than the traditional Center Parcs chalet/bungalow. The furniture was the usual Center Parcs quality but was clean and adequate (though the cheap foam mattresses on the beds weren\'t very comfy). We never cooked there, staying only for the weekend, but would imagine only having a hob and microwave would be very limiting.The parc itself felt new and was well maintained and clean. The brightly coloured houses were a welcome difference and although less woody than other parcs it was very pleasant. The Aqua Mundo was loved by all, the kids especially, and never felt too busy, queues for slides rarely being more than 10 people long. The Baluba indoor play area was huge and a particular hit with our 2 children who took every possible opportunity to go there and play. Again this was never very busy though the sunshine outside may have been the reason why,  it could have been quite different on rainy days.As with every Center Parcs additional activities to those above were expensive and we limited ourselves to minigolf, bowling and boat hire which in total came to over \u00a360 for the 4 of us - not too bad for a weekend. I could imagine however older children would want to do more and this in my opinion is where Center Parcs isn\'t great as it becomes so expensive, with nothing but the pool and play areas being free.The restaurants were OK, not cheap but not overly expensive and the food was of good quality. The childrens menus were limited however and would become tiresome very quickly. Service was good everywhere and you can get by only speaking English but you will find life easier if you can manage even a little French.In short, as the title says, it is still Center Parcs but newer and cleaner than our experiences in the UK. For us, living in Kent, a short train/ferry trip and a 2hr drive from Calais was simpler than the trek to Wiltshire / Suffolk / Nottinghamshire. We also combined this with a stay on a farm near Amiens booked through Un Lit au Pre (Featherdown Farms in the UK) which was fantastic and highly recommended for a bit of glamping (glamorous camping).
title: Just like the UK but better
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We totally agree with all the positive reviews. We had never been to a CPs before and were a little nervous about the disabled facilities. We were really pleased from the minute we arrived. All in all we can honestly say that wheelchair users are very well catered for in every possible way and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Positives: too many to mention - quality and comfort in a safe environment for kidsNegatives:  buying food on site is not good with the current exchange rate (1:1.1)Hints: Take some basics with you. milk, bread, tea bags, washing liquid etc. Laon (pronounced LOHH) has a Carrefour (huge supermarket) 10 minutes drive away and is well worth a visit to stock up on groceries.We are now looking at visiting other CPs to see how they compare with this top notch site.
title: Great Holiday for Disabled - Really relaxing and stress free
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Just returned from 2 weeks at this park after having visited a Center Parcs in Holland last year. Positives - Hired a 6 bed comfort villa for 4 which gave plenty of space although would be tight for 6 people. Limited storage for clothes especially if there were 6 of you.Facilities - good choice of activities for all ages, with segway and off road buggying (expect to get very dirty!) top of the choices.Surrounding area - Surrounding countryside is very scenic with plenty of historical sites in local area. Laon provides attractive walled city plus good sized supermarket offering more choice and much cheaper prices than camp supermarket.Staff - from previous postings we expected that we would be struggling with our limited French, however we found that most of the staff would try to use their limited English or at least try to provide a service by using mix of French & English. Service was generally good especially from the staff running the activities.Aquamundo - good size with variety of slides, rapids and pools.Restaurants - range of choices with food being good quality, buffet provided good quality food and all you can drink option. Negatives -Kitchen - tiny and provides very basic facilities for self catering with no oven. Microwave and hob provided with some utensils.Laundrette - none on site with nearest being in Laon.Games - For teenagers the choice is a little limited with a small selection of computer games, pool tables and table football, during the day not too much of an a issue but during the evening it was difficult to get on the tables. In summary the park looks attractive, is in a lovely setting and for those that like to explore has some interesting towns and sites within easy travelling. The site is set against a valley wall so the hills can be steep especially if your villa is away from the lake. Trains into Paris can be caught from Reims, c45 mins away, which gives access to Disney land for day out. We will definitely consider going back.
title: Great setting, good accomodation, good facilities
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having visited UK parks and one in Belguim  - this place was the best. The style of the villas were \'New England\' with either lake views or on several smaller lakes within the park. As with all centreparcs, expect nothing to be free apart from the \'aqua mondo\' - also expect sharp intakes of breath when told how much some of the \'activities\' are for a family of 4; Minigolf 22 euros. 1/2 boat hire 19 euros. We had \'kids eat free\' voucher so went to the buffet. This was 53 euros but that included unlimited drinks for the evening, so wasn\'t too bad.Highlights were a trip to Laon & Reims - the cathedrals are amazing - even my kids were in awe!!!On a nice night - get a beer, sit by the lake and watch the sun go down - very relaxing.Finally, we went in August - on pricing up the holiday, this place was 2/3 of the price of UK centreparcs for the same week - so get over there, try to speak the language and you won\'t regret it...
title: best so far....
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: like, I suspect,  other people I was a bit anxious about coming here due to the negativity of some previous reports. However, for us, it all turned out to be without foundation. In our opinion this knocks the socks off the British Centre Parcs. we stayed in a VIP Eden Villa (519) which provided a quiet waterside setting yet was close enough to everything the resort had to offer. It was so easy to book activities and check in and out was a breeze. remember, it\'s France and people speak French here !!! however the staff have a sufficient grasp of English to be helpful and fiendly. My schoolgirl French was tested when we needed to find a dentist after our little boy broke a tooth, but staff at reception were happy to make telephone calls on our behalf. The restaurants offered plenty of different dining options and the \'\'kids eat free\'\' offer was a good saving. The swimming complex is possibly the best of any of the Centre Parcs and we all spent many happy hours on the many slides and river rapids. Our villa had a DVD player which was great as all TV channels are in French apart from CNN. the kitchen is a little cramped and there is no oven, however thanks to other reports on trip adviser, we took our own wok and whipped up a quick spagetti bolognaise and chilli on a couple of days when we wanted to chill out rather than eat out. The cottage delivery service was good - if a little pricey. Overall we had a fabulous 7 days, a perfect mix of relaxation and activities and plenty of sunshine. Our little boy summed it up perfectly for us on our last day with the words "can we come here again - soon"
title: Ignore all the negativity of previous reports - it\'s fabulous
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: After reading some bad reviews I was a bit sceptic about the place. But just driving into the park I knew it would be a great holiday. The place is so beautiful. We had a cottage overlooking the water and island. The sounds of the birds all day and the constant wildlife passing our window was so nice!!! We even had a beaver coming up to our terras. It was lovely for the kids to feed the ducks every day. We stayed in the VIP cottage which was very nice, but to be honest I think any other cottage would have impressed me. There is so much to do that I only had 1 chance to use the sauna in the house. We had 1 night rain...and even that was vey cosy!!!The lovely beach was very nice for the kids.We hired some bikes for the week which cost us about 74 euro for the 5 of us.The Center Parcs shops and restaurants are very expensive, I paid 13 euro for 4 ice creams!!!!If you have small kids I would advice you to check if the terras has been gated as ours wasn\'t and we haven\'t been able to enjoy relaxing meals outside as our toddler was to excited about joining the ducks in the.We travelled from UK and from Calais straight to Laon, within 2 hours and at a cost of 13.80 euro road toll (single). The motor way is a pleasure as they are not congested.A highly recommended holiday for families!!!...oh yes, not much people working in Center Parcs speak  English.
title: Fantastic holiday with breathtaking nature!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Spent a week in that park with 4 children. They loved it! I have been to few others in England and didn\'t like it at all (that is what I qualify, upgraded camping camp) so as the kids like the concept I decided to try but in France. You still have to bring your pillow but I do not regret! We had a fabulous time! 1st the food was great (expecially when you have to compare it to the ones we have done in England where the food was awful). Supermarket very nice products, a boulangerie (thanks God!), pool was great. Farm for the kids. Activities very good, but coming from England I was excepted my kids to improve their French, no chance! They are all English people here ( don\'t even try to speak French, don\'t quite understand why they are here?? ) and German.  Other than that it was great and will go back.
title: Great holiday for family
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: This was my first experience of centre parcs firstly I\'ll start with the positives> lots of activities to keep kids busy - renting bikes, parks, beach etc> the lake side villa was nice > swimming was had plenty to do in it and it was even warm>it was very peaceful>felt a safe environment>good locationNegatives> villa was not clean - the porch was not clean either.> no oven in villa - had to microwave everything or use hob.> even though there was a no car policy the majority of the time - this was not followed lots of cars on roads which made it less save for cyclists. No one seemed to be enforcing no car policy.> the rental of golf buggies - I don\'t think was a good idea as they were just as bad as cars> no laundrettes > eating out in centre parcs was expensive 24 euro\'s per adult for buffet > some play parks were closedOverall I wouldn\'t return the location and activities were good but the villas were not cleaned properly before we arrived and the car rule seemed one rule for some and another for others.
title: Good for children but not clean and far too much traffic
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I really enjoyed this holiday at Center Parcs, France. It was a bit tricky to get to but we got there in the end. Firstly they won\'t let you in until late afternoon and then when your leaving you must be gone early morning, wasting two days you paid for. The activities though were great! I did the climbing adventure outside-pretty scary but was excellent! I also did paintballing, horse riding, cycling, crazy golf, power boating and of course our daily trip to the water park. The water park was brilliant! 15 slides to choose from, all extremely fun! There were excellent rapids, and the childrens area was amazing! The staff though couldn\'t speak english though which caused small problems. Our chalet was clean on the inside but had a filthy decking area with spider webs all over the place. We couldn\'t sit out at night because we were beside the lake and it attracted  a lot of flies. Overall an amazing holiday.
title: Great Family Holiday With Plenty To Do
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: I\'m french so get used to go in the French Centerparcs. It\'s my 3d park and it\'s the one I will never recommend. The others are old but you still have large rooms and living area. In this one even if you go for the luxurious chalet they have you will have a tiny chalet. Ok it\'s styllish (even if it\'s already old after 2 years), but to small.But I think the ;ain complain comes from the restaurants, it\'s really a nightmare!Never eat such a bad food ion the center parcs !!!! All the restaurants are horrible, none can be approved :(Even the restaurant du lac that seems to be the priciest one\'s is horrible, the food is not fresh and the taste is really fare away from the sweet phrases on the menu.As a conclusion it\'s really to expensive (1200 euros for 4 days) and the quality of the cotttage and food are really poor.PS: the priciest supermarket ever with poor choice of food...and internet at 20 euros but not a speed access :(
title: No value for money
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We had a great holiday, checkin was a breeze and the house we had was close to the main park. We were not near the lake but we didn\'t want to be as our kids are small. The beech and the lake are lovely and the water park is excellent with slides to suit all ages. It was our first time at a centre parcs and we will definitely be back. there are playgrounds dotted all around the site and they all had more than enough for our kids to enjoy. The kids loved the water park and they also had a fantastic time each evening in the indoor soft play area. The mini cars were a huge hit. We went bowling two evenings which was a great way to entertain the kids while we could enjoy a beer and a glass of wine. The houses were very clean and well equipped, the only complaint we had was there was no laundrette on the site.
title: A superb holiday,
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: The site was badly signposted when you arrived by car and we finally found it after asking localsOn arrival it was very difficult to determine where to check in for keys & parking etc...basically it was a scrum!! Instructions very poor,no parking at shalet,so be prepaired for a half a mile walk backAccommadation was simply unhygienic....large mould patches in bedrooms,living areas & entire shalet reeked of dampCooking utensils & kitchen/bathroom very dirty.In fact everything was filthy and mostly not workingAnother half mile jaunt to reception to discover 2 lines of unhappy guests!!Steer well clear unless you\'re on a stag & hen night and just want somewhere to crash.not for families with young kids
title: The worst trip ever!!
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: We booked this CP as a change to our normal dutch camp. Not cheap as the early booking discounts did not apply.We booked a VIP villa by the lake which has made up beds/towels, sauna and is generally a larger cottage. The cottage we had was very clean and the vaulted ceilngs in the lounge and main bedrooms certain gave you a feeling of extra space. The wrap round veranda and lake view was worth the extra as there was no overlooking issues. Towels and bedding were changed twice during our stay.We selected a cottage on the western edge of the lake which was about a 5 min cycle ride to the centre and was reasonably flat most of the way. Some cottages away from the lake are accessed via some steepish paths/roads so beware if you have any mobility problems.Checking in was very easy with the e ticket. We arrived at about 12.00 and went straight through check in but you could only get into the car park as there was no car access into the park until 3.00 but you can use all the facilities and the electronic keys to the cottages did not work until 3.00.We found the park itself very good, the aqua mondo was good with a good selection of flumes and a lazy river and rapids.We had read the reviews regarding the food so took our own for the week. We did have a pancake in Suzzettes and that was very good.Ther is a large hyper market in Laon and the cathedral and walled town is worth a day out.Overall we had a very enjoyable relaxing stay.
title: Enjoyable stay
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: In summary, the pool and kids facilites were great and the accommodation is new and clean. Go off-site to Laon to eat out and buy provisions. Pay the extra for lake-side to avoid the climb and enjoy the views. Don\'t go here for great weather. +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++We really enjoyed our stay in this Centre Parc. We have stayed in the other two (Hautes Bruyeres and Bois Francs) in France and found this as new and fresh ... the accommodation in the others has become very tired and dated. The pool was great, with the kid\'s play area the best to date. The flumes were a little tame, but great fun anyway.Despite the accommodation being terraced in blocks, they were well noise insulated ... we never heard any neighbours. Rooms were compact, but comfortable. Villa\'s are pretty and it\'s worth paying the extra for lake-side for the views if nothing else. If you have kids and are english-speaking, bring your DVD\'s, a travel DVD player and the appropriate SCART connection leads ... the kids will thank you.Disappointingly for me as a dedicated dinghy sailor, despite a decent-sized \'real\' lake, there were no dinghies to rent! This place is open a few years now, but still no decent sailing. The have \'windkarts\' which are like underpowered catamaran\'s (like a Dart 16 with a Pico sail!).A few downsides .... once you move away from the lakeside villas, it\'s very hilly and a struggle with kids. We booked a Premier lakeside early and it worth the extra few euro. The site has no launderette .... we were there for two weeks and the nearest one was in Laon - about 10 miles away.  Finally and a real issue for us ... we usually book 2 weeks in the same location as we\'re travelling so far ... but there\'s no change of linen/towels after a week ... this is really poor and the same in every Centreparcs in France.As with all Centre Parcs, if you buy from the supermarket on site, you\'re mad. Twice the price of the excellent LeClerc and Carrefour on the outskirts in Laon.This is the Champagne region and a trip to Reims should be celebrated with a few bottles. Laon is a very nice town with a range of good and reasonable restaurants. We walked it many times and really enjoyed it. Obviously this is in the North-East and so the weather can be overcast and warm rather than sunny and hot! Just be conscious of this.Paul Quinn, Dublin, Ireland
title: Best Centre Parc in France
price_range: $ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

review: Having enjoyed many stays at all the various England Centre Parcs sites, this year we did venture forth, and chose Lac D\'Ailette for our stay. This worked well on the back of a couple of days at Disneyland Paris, and had a one week stay from Friday 24th to Fri 31st July 2009.On the whole, we did enjoy our stay, and probably would return. Highlights for us include the lake vista and the swimming complex (aqua monda), Lowlights include the value/choice at the restaurants and parc market, and a general feeling that the site is understaffed for the price we had paid.OVERALL SITE - Position in France is good from weather perspective, we seemed to avoid most of the weather fronts which swept rain into England - just the occasional shower, and temperature around 24 degrees in the afternoons -  very pleasant, and one had to watch for sunburn especially in the midst of the day. Checkin worked well, and we found our villa promptly, was well prepared and ready to use. Someone arrived at the villa to check all ok - and fixed a cooker extractor cover for us quickly, and provided towels. Perhaps to be expected, but few English speaking guests or staff.  Main centre is very attractive  by the lakeside. Disappointingly, We found several of the public toilets to be smelly, dirty and several taps not working - empty soap dispensors - clearly not checked, cleaned and maintained as they should be The main toilet facilities which are in the top level of the centre appeared very "tired" - cracked walls, stained patches - did not appear very welcoming - this needs to be improved.VICINITY - We did enjoy a day trip to Laon, and also a bike ride to the Abbey at Vauclaire- both we would recommend to others, especially those who plan to be on site for a week. Info desk helped us in planning these trips, providing maps leaflets etc.VILLA LOCATION - We chose a lakeside 3bed villa. Marvelous lakeside view from patio, was a holiday highlight, with setting sun over opposite hills. Plenty of ducks etc to provide entertainment. Distance to main centre, at 15mins walk, was a little long (need bikes), but we were glad we were not "overlooked", or "up the hill" as others were. We would choose same villa again, but others may see this as too far from the centre.VILLA FACILITIES - Our villa was inside clean, lots of cobwebs on the lakeside patio which we brushed away, and all beds made up. We were please with the size, and layout of the villa - were 4 of us in a 3 bed cottage (kids each had own room). TV has choice of french channels (would have been nice to see one UK channel, even if only BBC world!). Kitchen area a little cramped, with microwave and dishwasher, but no oven! - no BBQ either. Villa would have seemed small if we had been party of six. RESTAURANTSWe enjoyed the Italian (visited twice) and Creperie - but found otherwise a very limited choice or value for money. Several offer a "Buffet choice" - actually the SAME dessert buffet choice for several  different restaurants. Would have been nice to see ability to order food in bowling bar area (e.g. as in Longleat or Elveden). Food generally expensive, even allowing for sterling/euro rate.  Service was mixed,  we got the impression the restaurants were understaffed - in one case we had to go to find the waiter, when one dessert had not appeared 20mins after the others. Service is automatically included in pricing, which does not give any discretion on how service (or lack of it) should be rewarded (or Not!) BIKES - compared to other UK Bike Parc sites, the facility appeared very much a "help yourself" approach, and it took me several attempts to find a bike which did not have something broken - and then I had to settle for one with a malfunctioning light. There appeared little manpower to assist in choosing bikes. Bikes do not have a chain guard, so after snagging some trousers, I was wearing shorts the rest of the week. I did like the integral bike locks - UK could adopt this approach, although this does tend to mean that Bikes are simply abandoned wherever people feel they can leave them - adherence to bike parks was not enforced, with often bikes left in the road.INTERNET - Free Wireless available in Bowling/Bar area, also wired to some villas (we did get this). For a weekly fee, we had cabled internet to the villa, but for some incomprehensible reason, the password is reset every day, so until each day you can get to the information desk (opens at 9am), to get a new daily password, there is no access to the internet. This became a daily nuisance having to queue up at the desk, just to be given a new password. Staff always very helpful when you got to the front of the queue, but what a waste of time, having paid up-front for a weeks access.BAKERY / PARC MARKET - Parc Market is relatively small, with limited and expensive choices. It also closes every lunchtime, so just when you want to go and buy something for lunch (eg pre-prepared sandwiches), it is closed. Bakery was good, very good selection of patisseries and breads, and opened at 07:30. Parc Market only opens at 09:00am. Limited space for packing bags once through the tills. Often queues at tills. Local supermarkets (if you have the energy to venture off-site) are vastly superior in choice and value.SPORTS HALL - Those expecting a "Jardin de Sports" will be disappointed - this is just a large box shaped warehouse, with courts arranged within - no frills, and very confusing markings. For example if you wanted to play badminton, one had to ignore red and white lines and concentrate on the black lines. Seemed empty most of the time. Somehow seems an underdeveloped facility. Again a "Help yourself" approach to this facility. Outdoor tennis was fine.LAKE FACILITIES - We enjoyed the electric boats, bit pricy, but good fun.
